Submit, heretic, and be consumed by the purifying flames!
Loudly announcing your arrival isn't always the optimal way to carry out an assassination.
It would be irreverent to worship the Bloody-handed God without sometimes getting blood on your own.
Loyal to the Phoenix King until death, High Elf Nobles pride themselves on their mastery of all manner of useful arts.
You are not part of the Great Plan; your life is forfeit.
Clan Eshin's black-clad assassins specialise in the deadly, secretive arts of stealth, murder, poison, and assassination.
More kill, maybe Gods see. Maybe Gods like. More kill! MORE!
This warrior can pick out a single enemy from among a seething mass of troops and place the one perfect shot that brings the target down.
Apparently, it is possible to spin assassination so it appears to be an honourable act.
A champion amongst his kind; to deal death is meat and drink to this one.
Loudly announcing your arrival isn't always the optimal way to carry out an assassination.
In the unlikely event that the target doesn't see him coming they can expect to be unceremoniously shivved to death.
The Banshee screams, in bitter remembrance of a life once led, as she deprives the target of theirs.

Truly Terrifying
Highly-skilled in the ignoble art of indiscriminate violence, this one is eager to demonstrate his talents at every given opportunity.
Better to be cruel just for the sake of it than hold insincere notions of kindness.
An existence without precision is worthless and scarcely preferable to a swift death.
It is often necessary to take a proactive role in ensuring that the Old Ones' prophecies come to fruition.
Clan Eshin's assassins scurry away swiftly and generally before the foe has been roused to their presence.
Blood! Slaughter! Blood!
Surviving on their wits alone, Waystalkers are equal parts taciturn, solitary and deadly. Their prey have little chance.
Highly-skilled in the noble art of controlled violence, this one is eager to demonstrate his talents at every given opportunity.
The rage of the Blood God is embodied by his gore-drenched countenance.
To warn this one of the enemy's numbers is to insult him deeply, which is a very dangerous thing to do!
Imbued with Dark Magic, Wight Kings unwillingly carry out the murderous instructions of their Unliving masters.

Evil must be turned from its nefarious course, by any means necessary.
The Old Ones' so-called mysticism is as nothing! Everything has been revealed; all are within my grasp and under my will.
To create the appearance - and substance - of a barrier where no physical obstruction exists requires a deep understanding of sorcery's many, hitherto-veiled secrets.
Those who are not part of the Great Plan must be prevented from interfering with its divine course.
Sorcery and science, when fused together, can deny the foe advantage in war.
His devious, beastly nature is sure to catch the fickle eye of Tzeentch, no?
A creature entirely lacking in compassion and mercy is an ideal candidate to prevent the foe from gaining ground.
Evil must be turned from its nefarious course, by any means necessary.
He embodies the Feathered Lord in all things. All are unwittingly bent to his twisted will.
I don't just throw a spanner in the works, but the wrench and the whole Taal-damned toolbox as well!
A thoroughly unprincipled, utterly immoral, devious, green-skinned little git; a prince among his kind.
A blood-curdling howl from way beyond the grave can stop an army dead in its tracks.
Diversionary
Puppeteer
Mind Over Mind
Empyrean Limiter
Technomancer
Tzeentchian Schemer
Living Barrier
Diversionary
Arch-Manipulator
Skilled Saboteur
Underhanded
Wall of Fear
Those who work against the Warrior-God cannot expect to receive his love, or clemency from his agents.
Ephemeral defences cannot protect the enemies of Unlife from its most committed adherents.
Merciless
Unrelenting
Don't make me come in there, heretics - get out here now and embrace the stake!
The many, secret names of Khaine can be wielded like weapons against bodies and walls alike.
When your command of magical lore is this strong, defensive walls are a mere inconvenience.
The secrets of the Old Ones may be ranged against inanimate objects as well as mortal flesh.
Walls are no obstacle to the Plague Priest's canker and blight.
The adoption of its robust oak aspect imbues the Branchwraith with the strength of the forest.
The Runes of Morgrim, son of Grimnir, when hammered onto an Anvil of Doom, will cause the pitiful urk defences to crumble.
Dig a bit 'ere, another bit dere, and den the 'ole lot falls down and da boyz swarm in and twat 'em.
Walls of timber or stone are of little use afore the scream of the Banshee - a sound so powerful it can damage even the mightiest defences.
Purifying Flames
Namesayer
Mind Over Matter
Applied Esoterics
Chemical Artillerist
Shape-Shifter
Runic Despoiler
Wall Weakener
Sonic Attacker
If you join with them you are aligning yourself with a foe most foul. Come, brothers, accept Sigmar's loving embrace.
The slightest scratch of the point and the foe's reinforcements will not stand - or even breathe - long enough to be a threat.
There are magic-users that will stand in the eye of a storm to bring vengeance to the enemy.
Come, align yourselves with the Great Plan and bathe in the Old Ones' inalienable will.
We call them La Souriscarle, these fever-rats, who brought the Mal Rouge - the Red Death - down upon us. We lost so much to them…
A Storm of Magic brews; let the enemy taste its might!
This one wields runes of such power that the enemy find prospective recruits literally cannot join their ranks.
Join those gits and I'll give yoo a right twattin'!
Come, join us instead - the shackles of disease and death shall be but a distant memory.

Powerful magic-users have mastered their art, so the Winds' bend to even the most subtle of requests.
For those without scruples, any means are justified to get what you want.
It is a rare occasion indeed when even the advanced magical learning of Ulthuan proves insufficient for the task at hand.
The Great Plan sometimes requires the knowledge of lesser races to serve its many-splintered design.
The most ingenious minds of the Under-Empire, forever in boundless pursuit of the darkest knowledge - wherever it may be found!
So in thrall to the Ruinous Powers is he; his very essence has been flayed and consumed in return for the darkest knowledge.
Sometimes, even the forest must take what it needs from the lesser races beyond its Waystone bounds.
Powerful magic-users have mastered their art, so the Winds' bend to even the most subtle of requests.
The Chaos Gods have bestowed their gifts; their twisted evil bubbles up from his very core.
Inspect the enemy weapons, find their weaknesses... and exploit them.
It's surprising what a touch of embarrassing hooting and arm-waving can achieve.
Vampires and their liche-servants are devious creatures; manipulative with many mortal servants in their thrall.

Mankind's most resourceful representatives know exactly how to hurt their adversaries.
Magic can cut and gash just like a blade - more so, in fact, should the mind lie undefended.
The weapons of the enchanter are spell and hex, to score foes' flesh and tear their minds.
Stand in the way of the Great Plan and you will get hurt.
The more intelligent among the Skaven race are able to restrain themselves from killing unless it is absolutely necessary.
The quest is never-ending. The blood is ALWAYS the prize.
The collective consciousness of the forest, unleashed to devastating effect.
Mankind's most resourceful representatives know exactly how to hurt their adversaries.
They see his fury, his rage, his dedication to the Ruinous cause and, fleetingly, the Chaos Gods are pleased.
Why do anything by halves? I'd rather kill the urks outright. Ahhh well, orders are orders…
This living conduit to Gork (and Mork) focuses the force of Waaagh! through the power of his mind.
Once forbidden knowledge is acquired, Necromancers and Vampires will jealously guard it from rivals' eyes.

There is a 0% chance of this unit gaining Instability when an Augment is applied to it.
Instability Chance||This is the chance that a unit will become unstable after being augmented. The more Augments already applied to a unit, the higher the risk of Instability.

[[col:red]]This unit is unstable![[/col]]||This unit can be recycled for [[img:icon_growth_juice]][[/img]]Growth Juice or augmented further, but each additional Augment will increase the level of Instability on the unit.
Flesh Laboratory||Grow monsters and apply upgrades to Clan Moulder’s units through mutation, surgery and other diabolical techniques.
Increasing a character's Authority with a particular God will make the associated units in their army easier to recruit, upgrade and maintain.

Auto-construct buildings||When checked, buildings will be automatically constructed at the end of your turn, should funds allow. The allocated budget can be set through the {{tr:treasury_header}} panel.\\n\\nRight-click to open the {{tr:treasury_header}} panel.
Auto-assign skill points||When checked, any skill points gained will be automatically assigned at the end of your turn.
Auto-resolve||Automatically resolve the battle if you have a clear advantage over the enemy. However, you will have a better chance at victory should you fight the battle manually.
Barrier health is depleted before unit health when taking damage. The barrier health will slowly replenish when not taking damage. Maximum barrier health is proportional to remaining unit health.

Fielding Legions of skeleton infantry, archers and chariots, in combination with monstrous animated constructs, the Tomb Kings overwhelm the foe with resilience and numbers. The Realm of Souls means that as more friendly units are destroyed, the Tomb Kings gain army-wide heals and eventually a powerful Ushabti summoned through the Realm of Souls system.

Focusing on hordes of gunpowder-armed zombie pirates, the forces of the Vampire Coast specialize in blocking their enemy with powerful monsters so they can blast them off the field with missile and artillery units. Led by powerful Vampire Lords with their own custom ‘Lore of the Deep’ spells.

Dark Elf armies are well-rounded, able to field armour-piercing missile units, line-breaking heavy cavalry, and elite infantry. As the Dark Elves kill more enemies, they will trigger Murderous Prowess – gaining powerful bonuses.

The armies of the High Elves field the most powerful Dragons and some of the most powerful magic-users. In addition, the rest of their roster is well rounded and of high quality. These elite units benefit from the Martial Prowess ability, providing bonuses to units which are at high strength.

Lizardmen hosts consist of strong melee units, some of the most powerful magic-users, and towering reptilian monsters. Their missile units are generally short-ranged and struggle versus armoured targets.
Endless waves of expendable infantry, supported by terror-causing monsters and hard-hitting war machines. Though generally fast moving, the Skaven do lack airborne and cavalry units.

Chaos Dwarf armies are highly flexible and wear many hats. A heavily-armoured, fire-resistant frontline is bolstered by a cheap caste of Labourers and Hobgoblin lackeys that serve as a bulwark for powerful gunpowder weaponry and long-range artillery trains. This flexibility is further augmented by powerful bound fire Daemons, flying monsters and even cavalry.

Cathay offers solid melee units and powerful missile units, which become stronger through harmony when placed near each other. Characters increase the effect of this harmony. Additionally, their spellcasters can support each other during spellcasting, increasing the power of their spells when fielding multiple Wizards.

Daemons of Chaos allow you to mix the forces of all the Chaos Gods. This makes the race versatile and unpredictable. Causing damage with your Lord generates glory, which rewards you with random army abilities in battles from the Reign of Chaos.

Khorne is a melee-focused race that excels at charging. It has no spellcasters, but Khornate Daemons are resistant to spells. Killing the enemy grants the Blood God’s favour, which can be used on army abilities.

Kislevite forces offer hardy hybrid infantry, swift cavalry and mighty War Bears; perfect for hammer and anvil tactics. Its units have the ability to find new courage when others would break, allowing the units to stand their ground against desperate odds.

Nurgle is a tough and slow melee race that excels at winning battles of attrition. Its units possess great health and reduce enemy melee damage through their passive abilities. Taking damage generates favour from Nurgle, which can be used to activate army abilities.

The Ogre Kingdoms offer a wide variety of monstrous units with bone-crushing charges and surprising mobility. Their infantry options are limited to weak and expendable Gnoblars. Captured enemies can be slaughtered to use army abilities.

Slaaneshi armies are very fast, excelling at flanking and piercing armour, but this comes at the cost of armour and health. Killing routing enemies grants favour from Slaanesh, which can be used to activate army abilities.

Tzeentch is a race that excels at spellcasting, missile firepower and flying units. Its units are protected by a magical barrier that absorbs damage and is replenished when not taking damage. Casting spells generates favour from Tzeentch that can be used on army abilities.

The light infantry and monster units of the Beastmen are masters of charging from ambush – able to close the gap quickly and overwhelm the enemy. However, with mediocre leadership and poor armour, Beastmen suffer in prolonged engagements, their Primal Fury ability only granting them bonuses when leadership is high.

The Woods Elves are an elite force of skirmishing archers, supported by specialist melee infantry units, fast-moving cavalry and stubborn Treemen. Though they field some of the finest archers, they are fragile, making engagements in melee costly.

Norsca is a faction of aggressive infantry, flexible monstrous infantry and colossal line-breaking Mammoths. Though lightly-armoured and vulnerable to missile fire, Norca has the tools to breach enemy lines and/or envelop the foe. The frenzied warriors of Norsca also have the Rage ability, meaning the longer they fight in melee the greater the bonuses they receive.

Bretonnia specialises in riding down their foes with powerful heavy cavalry. Supported by copious amounts of expendable peasant infantry and archers, these units buy time and space for the mounted Knights to charge, fall back and charge once more.

The Warriors of Chaos field rank upon rank of elite infantry, clad head to toe in plate armour. Pinning the foe in melee, they can then deliver brutal charges with their heavy cavalry and monstrous units.

The Dwarfs rely on steadfast, heavily-armoured infantry supported by powerful artillery and missile units. Completely lacking in cavalry, their only mobile units are the harassing Gyrocopter war machines. Though lacking access to spells, the Dwarfs are innately resistant to spell damage.

The Empire has access to a wide variety of units and employs this flexibility to out-fight their enemies on the field. Having somewhat mediocre unit quality, the Empire relies upon a combined-arms approach to win.

Greenskins field a roster of aggressive infantry, hard-hitting boar cavalry, and terror causing-monsters such as Arachnarok Spiders and Giants. Greenskins units engaged in melee generate points towards an almighty Waaagh!, a powerful, army-wide ability.

Powerful with spells and in melee, the Vampires are the core of this army and lead the legions of Undead skeletons and zombies, terrifying monsters and elite Vampiric cavalry. Completely lacking missile units, the Vampire Counts do, however, have access to powerful healing and summoning abilities to replace losses.

When checked, battles must be fought without the radar map or contextual tooltips. Orders will be unable to be issued whilst the battle is paused and the game speed may not be slowed.||The camera will be restricted to within 200 metres of any unit, and any enemy units more than 600 metres away will be hidden from sight.

An army's base campaign movement cannot be increased by more than 50%

Collect resources and combine them with Canopic Jars to craft items and Legions of Legend whilst learning from the dynasties of the past to awaken ancient Tomb Kings. Use incantations to bring the dead back to life should enough souls of their own be lost in battle.

Destroy, sack and raid to build a reputation at sea, whilst keeping commanders loyal by imparting riches and wealth to them. Gain Infamy and leech wealth from unsuspecting settlement owners where hideouts have been formed.
Consume Slaves for greater effects from buildings and instantly complete construction whilst utilising Black Arks at sea to replenish forces, recruit new units and bombard battles within range.
Gain Influence to recruit superior Lords, or manipulate diplomacy between factions. High Elves access improved Outposts and Allegiance point gain through alliances.

Protect the world from the forces of Chaos and aid in the enaction of the Great Plan by utilising the Geomantic Web to build a network of power across the worlds provinces to boost the effects of commandments. Enact powerful rites that give a variety of useful boons within your faction.

Establish Under Cities in any settlement, undermining your enemies progress, or hide in plain sight while growing your own empire. Maintain Food supplies to gain growth and other bonuses, and to avoid starvation penalties.

Build Outposts, Factories and Towers to create an interconnected Industrial economy, whilst claiming Seats of power within Zharr-Naggrund's political battlegrounds to gain powerful bonuses for your faction.
Balance both Yin and Yang to achieve Harmony, which will confer powerful effects across the provinces, whilst directing the Wu Xing Compass to defend Cathay from threats north of the Great Bastion.

Ascribe glory when capturing settlements to the four Chaos Gods to be granted boons in the form of Daemonic Gifts and units. These Gifts allow for the Daemon Prince to be customised in a multitude of unholy combinations.

Fight battles, raze settlements and claim Skull Piles to gather tribute to the Skull Throne. Settlements will spread automatically into the ruins left in your wake – or spend Skulls to occupy them immediately. Armies are strengthened by every battle, and can summon temporary reinforcements by razing.

Serve the Motherland by training formidable Frost Maidens and Ice Witches within the Ice Court, granting powerful traits. Some factions amass supporters for a majority rule, accruing Devotion to the Gods. Some embrace darker methods to protect the land, operating in shadow…
Concoct and spread plagues across the world or afflict your own assets. Nurglish settlements will grow by themselves over time and will eventually wither and die out.
Deploy camps to create a forward base, constructing buildings and recruiting units from them. Camps will provide Meat, along with fighting battles, which each Ogre army is sustained by.

Amass followers by raiding, sacking and looting settlements and use them to summon armies in corrupted areas. Compel enemy units to join your army during battles, and force whole factions into vassalage via Seductive Influence.
Collect Grimoires to hatch treacherous plots to manipulate the destiny of all beings through the Changing of the Ways, whilst teleporting armies around the world.

Ravage the world by raising Herdstones in settlements to create Blood-grounds, enhancing your warherd in the name of the Dark Gods. Winning battles earns Dread to spend on expanding unit and Hero capacities, recruiting Legendary Lords, or other upgrades.
Heal the world’s forests in return for powerful factionwide bonuses whilst using the network of ancient tree roots to avoid impassable terrain and travel vast distances between forests.

Raze settlements and build monoliths in their place to gain allegiance to the four Gods, bestowing potent gifts. Use the Monstrous Arcanum to hunt down beasts whilst strengthening the tribe by assimilating other conquered Norscans once defeated.

Perform Chivalrous acts to grant powerful boons and call upon the strength of the Green Knight. Follow a code of honor and pledge Lords and Heroes to partake in Troths and Vows manage the Peasant populations tenure between farms and armies to ensure the economy remains strong.

Establish Dark Fortresses to vassalise and recruit followers of Chaos to the warbands, upgrading them into more powerful units. God-aligned gifts can be purchased to strengthen your faction a variety of ways.
Grudges must be settled by any and all means necessary to keep order across the realms. Dwarf armies can use the underway to avoid impassable terrain and enemy forces.

Each faction acts as its own autonomous feudal state, some focusing on uniting the Elector Provinces through acts of Fealty and Imperial Authority, whilst others have their own agendas far from home, pursuing unique goals in service to The Empire.
Gain Reputation to call Waaaghs! colossal armies capable of steamrolling the world. Greenskin armies can use the Underway to avoid impassable terrain and enemy forces.

New units can be raised from among the dead; famous battle sites improve the quality and quantity of the troops available. The taint of Undeath can be spread within enemy territory, leading to Vampiric rebellions.
Rebellions

Corruption affects [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}}. Should corruption become too high, then the forces of [[img:icon_corruption_chs]][[/img]]Chaos, [[img:icon_corruption_vmp]][[/img]]Vampire Counts or [[img:icon_corruption_skv]][[/img]]Skaven will emerge in the province. A high level of corruption can cause armies to suffer [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]]attrition.

Corruption affects [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}}. The lower the level of corruption present in a province, the higher the [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}} bonus will be. [[img:icon_corruption_skv]][[/img]]Skaven corruption will spread over time after occupying settlements, resulting in a reduction in [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}}.

Corruption affects [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}}. The higher the level of [[img:icon_corruption_vmp]][[/img]]Vampiric corruption present in a province, the higher the [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}} bonus will be. A low level of Vampiric corruption or a high level of [[img:icon_corruption_chs]][[/img]]Chaos corruption can cause Undead armies to suffer [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]]attrition.

Each of Ulthuan's regions is of great importance to the High Elves, and to those protected by the Fortress Gates inside the inner ring of the island, even more so. The fight for control of the island has been a long-standing affair and key to almost every war the Asur have ever fought. Alarielle, unlike her predecessors, has taken a most active role in the defence of Ulthuan; now, more than ever, its denizens look to her for protection.

The most expendable warriors of antiquity may be summoned to your banner in uncountable numbers. Such a skeletal host would surely spell the end of those who march against you.\\n\\nLearn more about raising armies [[url:script_link_campaign_raising_forces]]here[[/url]].
Amass an Army
The Books of Nagash panel can be opened by clicking the Books of Nagash button.
The Books of Nagash panel shows the location of each Book of Nagash on the campaign map.\\n\\nDouble-click a book icon to zoom to its location.
The number of each unit type that may be recruited is shown on its recruitment card.\\n\\nConstruct more buildings that support unit recruitment to raise these limits.
No restriction is placed on the number of skeleton units that may be recruited, nor do they cost anything to recruit or maintain.
Over time, Tz'arkan will gain more control over Malus.\\n\\nTo regain control, Malus must drink the Elixir to keep the Daemon at bay.

The Possession bar shows how much influence Tz'arkan has over Malus.\\n\\nWhen the Possession bar is in the positive values, Tz'arkan's powers can be utilised by Malus at the expense of his campaign capabilities.\\n\\nWhen the Possession bar is in the negative values, Malus gains increased campaign capabilities but will be less effective in battle.
The Shadowy Dealings panel can be opened by clicking the Shadowy Dealings button.

The Shadowy Dealings panel shows which characters are eligible to take part in Eshin Missions.\\n\\nSome missions have a character rank requirement, and some can only be completed by Deathmaster Snikch himself.\\n\\nSelect which character you would like to complete an Eshin Mission from the list below.

The Shadowy Dealings panel shows which mission, target and character has been selected in the centre here.\\n\\nYou can select a target by Left-clicking on them on the campaign map.\\n\\nA target can be an enemy settlement or character, though not all missions require a target.
The Shadowy Dealings panel allows characters to complete Eshin Missions accross the campaign map instantaneously.\\n\\nYou can select which Eshin Mission to complete from the list below.

The Shadowy Dealings missions require Schemes in order to complete them. The number of schemes are displayed on the mission.\\n\\nThere is a Scheme capacity for how many can be stored. To increase this capacity complete the Vortex Missions displayed in the Eshin Missions section.\\n\\nSpent Schemes will replenish up to the capacity of one Scheme at a time every 5 turns.
Powerful rewards can be gained by completing missions given by Tz'arkan's Whispers.\\n\\nCompleting these missions will increase Tz'arkan's control over Malus.

A selected Augment's effects are displayed here.\\n\\nThe [[img:icon_mutagen]][[/img]]Mutagen cost of each Augment can be seen on the right-hand side of the Apply button.\\n\\nAugmented units will have a pie chart on their unit card and Unit Info panel which displays a tooltip listing all effects of applied Augments.

Within each Augments tab is a hex grid of upgrades you can apply to your units.\\n\\nThere are three tiers of Augments, with the top tier having the highest [[img:icon_mutagen]][[/img]]Mutagen cost to use. Common Augments (bottom tier with green symbols) have moderate effects but no downsides; Uncommon Augments (middle tier with blue symbols) are more powerful but come with negative side effects; Rare Augments (top tier with purple symbols) have very powerful effects and no negatives.\\n\\nThe bottom three Augments are unlocked from the beginning. The rest are unlocked for all units factionwide in an ascending sequence by using the connecting Augments beneath them in the hex grid.
The Flesh Laboratory is accessed via the button in the bottom right of the main campaign interface.

The Flesh Laboratory also contains the Growth Vat which consumes [[img:icon_growth_juice]][[/img]]Growth Juice to grow monsters.\\n\\nThe Growth Vat bar contains five pips, each representing a batch of one type of Clan Moulder monster. Once a pip is reached the batch can be released, which will include at least one unit of the batch’s monster type.\\n\\nThe resource used for Augments ([[img:icon_mutagen]][[/img]]Mutagen) is also gained when releasing Growth Vat batches, though the amount gained increases only slightly with each successive pip.\\n\\n[[img:icon_growth_juice]][[/img]]Growth Juice is earned passively, as well as by constructing buildings, fighting battles, and recycling units with [[img:icon_instability]][[/img]]Instability. The more [[img:icon_instability]][[/img]]Instabilities a unit has, the more [[img:icon_growth_juice]][[/img]]Growth Juice awarded from recycling it.

The three sections of the Flesh Laboratory allow you to apply Augmentations to infantry and monster units or upgrade the Laboratory itself.\\n\\nBy selecting either the Infantry Augments or Monster Augments tab, you can view and apply Augments to make units stronger in battle.

To apply Augments to a unit, you must first select its unit card from your army.\\n\\nInfantry Augments and Monster Augments can only be applied to infantry and monster units respectively. Characters cannot be augmented.\\n\\nAugmentation comes with the risk of giving units [[img:icon_instability]][[/img]]Instability. The more Augments applied to a unit, the greater the risk of additional Augments giving it [[img:icon_instability]][[/img]]Instabilities. The chance of developing [[img:icon_instability]][[/img]]Instabilities is displayed beneath each unit card.\\n\\nAny unit with [[img:icon_instability]][[/img]]Instabilities can be recycled in return for [[img:icon_growth_juice]][[/img]]Growth Juice via the rollout that appears when its unit card is selected.

The Flesh Laboratory offers single-use upgrades to grant permanent effects, as well as repeatable upgrades to grant additional [[img:icon_mutagen]][[/img]]Mutagen or temporary effects.\\n\\nThe top three upgrades are repeatable. Once one is used, all three will be locked for a short cooldown period.\\n\\nThe remaining nine are permanent upgrades separated into three tiers, each containing three upgrades.\\n\\nPermanent upgrades are unlocked by releasing Growth Vat batches, with higher tier upgrades towards the bottom requiring more batches to be released before they are unlocked.
You can upgrade the Flesh Laboratory by clicking the Laboratory tab.
The Rewards of Dread panel is accessed via the button in the bottom right of the main campaign interface.
[[img:icon_dread]][[/img]]Dread can be used to purchase several factionwide upgrades which can improve new hordes, increase character recruit ranks, and expand your army capacity.
These upgrades allow you to increase the starting level of all Herdstones raised in the future.\\n\\nOnce a Herdstone upgrade is purchased, any existing Herdstone can be upgraded for no cost.

Increasing the recruitment capacity of [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes allows them to be recruited up to the purchased capacity by any horde in the faction, as long as the horde contains the correct buildings to recruit them.

Banners, weapons, armour, enchanted items and arcane items can be purchased here. Unlike other Rewards of Ruin, ancillaries purchased in the Items tab cost [[img:icon_treasury]][[/img]]Favour instead of [[img:icon_dread]][[/img]]Dread.\\n\\nThese items are exclusive to the Rewards of Dread panel and multiples of the same item may be purchased.
The Items tab allows you to purchase special ancillaries exclusive to the Rewards of Dread.
Having other [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Legendary Lords join your faction costs [[img:icon_dread]][[/img]]Dread. If inactive when purchased, they are added to your Lord recruitment pool.
In the Lords & Heroes tab, you can increase [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero capacities and gain the services of other [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Legendary Lords of the Beastmen.

The number of [[img:icon_marks_of_ruination]][[/img]]Marks of Ruination collected and the units unlocked at various Ruination Levels can be tracked via the tooltips on the bar in the top left of the panel.\\n\\nTo the top right of the panel you can view your total [[img:icon_dread]][[/img]]Dread and [[img:icon_treasury]][[/img]]Favour.
There are four types of Rewards of Dread. These rewards can be viewed and purchased via their respective tabs.

Increasing the capacities of units costs [[img:icon_dread]][[/img]]Dread and are purchased via the button below each unit group or unit.\\n\\nEach time you use [[img:icon_dread]][[/img]]Dread to expand the capacity of a unit group or unit, the cost of expanding capacity further increases with subsequent purchases.

In the Units tab, various units can have their factionwide recruitment capacities increased.\\n\\nSome units are grouped together so that when purchased, the capacities of all units in the group are increased.\\n\\nUnits can be recruited up to the purchased capacity by any horde in the faction, as long as the horde contains the correct buildings to recruit them.
To increase the capacity of a unit group or unit, you must first gain enough [[img:icon_marks_of_ruination]][[/img]]Marks of Ruination to reach the required Ruination Level.
In the Upgrades tab you can upgrade various aspects of your Herdstones, hordes and characters.
The Hell-Forge offers the use of forgecraft to improve your armies.\\n\\nHere weapons and armour are forged and modified to increase unit capacities and provide unit enhancements.
The Armoury is where you increase unit capacity.\\n\\nHere you can forge additional standard-issue weapons and armour at the cost of [[img:icon_armaments]][[/img]]Armaments to support more units.
Unit capacity is shared between all units in a group.\\n\\nThe number displays how many of these units the Armoury can support, i.e. the group's unit capacity.
Increasing unit capacity requires forging additional weapons and armour for the [[img:icon_armaments]][[/img]]Armaments cost specified here, which increases with every use.

Each time weapons and armour are forged in a unit category, the associated bar fills up to indicate the category’s increased total capacity.\\n\\nIncreasing total capacity gradually unlocks forgecraft options in the Manufactory tab. These are shown on the bar's tooltips.
The Manufactory becomes accessible once you unlock forgecraft options in the Armoury tab.

The Manufactory is where you enhance entire categories of units.\\n\\nForgecraft options are applied to units for an upkeep of [[img:icon_armaments]][[/img]]Armaments that keep assembly lines running.
Selecting a category allows you to view the units recruited and the list of potential forgecraft options to the right.\\n\\nOnce options are chosen from the list, they appear below the category.

Unit categories can only have a limited number of forgecraft lines active from the list at once.\\n\\nEnhancements remain active as long as the [[img:icon_armaments]][[/img]]Armaments upkeep can be met to keep lines in production.

The [[img:icon_armaments]][[/img]]Armaments upkeep cost for a category’s forgecraft options is multiplied by the number of units you have across your armies in the category.\\n\\nThe total upkeep breakdown is specified beneath the unit cards.
[[img:icon_labour]][[/img]]Labour is received after battles or via Military Convoys.\\n\\nA portion of Labour is lost each turn based on your [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]Control levels.

Labour Actions can instantly boost your [[img:icon_treasury]][[/img]]Treasury, [[img:icon_conclave_influence]][[/img]]Conclave Influence or [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]Control at the cost of [[img:icon_labour]][[/img]]Labour.
When received, [[img:icon_labour]][[/img]]Labour is split evenly between all provinces that are accepting new intake.\\n\\nYou can set a province to accept new intake via this checkbox.

The Chaos Dwarf economy is managed across several different resources: [[img:icon_treasury]][[/img]]Treasury, [[img:icon_labour]][[/img]]Labour, [[img:icon_raw_materials]][[/img]]Raw Materials and [[img:icon_armaments]][[/img]]Armaments.

[[img:icon_raw_materials]][[/img]]Raw Materials are generated each turn from Outpost mine buildings.\\n\\nIf you have less [[img:icon_labour]][[/img]]Labour than [[img:icon_workload]][[/img]]Workload in a province, your Raw Materials output there will scale down accordingly.

You can relocate [[img:icon_labour]][[/img]]Labour at any point at the cost of [[img:icon_treasury]][[/img]]Treasury.\\n\\nRelocating Labour removes it from one province and distributes it evenly between all others marked for new intake.

Buildings under construction will display the Rush Construction button.\\n\\nRush Construction allows you to instantly complete construction at the cost of [[img:icon_labour]][[/img]]Labour.\\n\\nThe cost scales based on the number of turns remaining.
Building more mines increases your potential [[img:icon_raw_materials]][[/img]]Raw Materials output, but also increases your [[img:icon_workload]][[/img]]Workload requirement for that province.
The Labour Economy panel allows you to view and manage the [[img:icon_labour]][[/img]]Labour workforce across your provinces.
This checkbox allows you to specify whether or not a province will receive a share of any new [[img:icon_labour]][[/img]]Labour intake.
The Labour Actions buttons allow you to spend a province’s [[img:icon_labour]][[/img]]Labour to grant a variety of benefits.

The more [[img:icon_labour]][[/img]]Labour you have in a province, the lower your [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]Control per turn will be.\\n\\nHere you can track which provinces might be struggling to maintain [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]Control as [[img:icon_labour]][[/img]]Labour populations change.

[[img:icon_efficiency]][[/img]]Efficiency represents how much of a province’s [[img:icon_workload]][[/img]]Workload is being covered by its [[img:icon_labour]][[/img]]Labour.\\n\\nIf [[img:icon_efficiency]][[/img]]Efficiency drops below 100%, total [[img:icon_raw_materials]][[/img]]Raw Materials output in the province will drop accordingly.
This section allows you to move [[img:icon_labour]][[/img]]Labour between provinces.

Transporting [[img:icon_labour]][[/img]]Labour between provinces has a treasury cost based on the total number being moved.\\n\\nOnce [[img:icon_labour]][[/img]]Labour is distributed you can confirm or reset your changes here.

If you change your mind about which settlement type you want later on, you can mouse over the primary building chain to convert it. Doing so will revert the settlement to tier 1 and destroy all secondary buildings.

The primary purpose of a factory is to generate [[img:icon_armaments]][[/img]]Armaments  and [[img:icon_treasury]][[/img]]Treasury. You will need to maintain enough [[img:icon_raw_materials]][[/img]]Raw Materials income to support these buildings.
Towers are the focal point of the Chaos Dwarf empire. Constructing these will unlock the best recruitment and provide various global bonuses to increase your power.
You can increase the starting tier of towers by expending [[img:icon_conclave_influence]][[/img]]Conclave Influence.
When Chaos Dwarfs capture major settlements, they gain the option to rebuild the settlement as one of three different settlement types: Outposts, Factories or Towers.
When Chaos Dwarfs capture minor settlements, they gain the option to rebuild the settlement as one of two different settlement types: Outposts or Factories.

The primary purpose of an Outpost is to generate [[img:icon_raw_materials]][[/img]]Raw Materials from mines. [[img:icon_labour]][[/img]]Labour is required in a province in order to meet the [[img:icon_workload]][[/img]]Workload required by them.
This list will show you what other settlement types you already have constructed in the province.
The Tower of Zharr consists of Seats which can be claimed to gain powerful rewards for your faction. All playable Chaos Dwarf factions compete to claim them.
Hover over a Seat to see its reward; click on one to claim it.
Claiming a Seat costs [[img:icon_conclave_influence]][[/img]]Conclave Influence. The amount required is displayed on each Seat.
Seats are grouped in Districts. There are three types of District: Sorcery, Military and Industry.
When all of the Seats in a District are claimed, a District completion bonus is granted. This reward is detailed here.\\n\\nDistrict completion bonuses are shared by all Chaos Dwarf factions.
You can see all of the Tower of Zharr rewards you have accumulated here. Click the Seats or Districts buttons to display their effects once claimed.

The Tower of Zharr is organised into four tiers, with each advancing tier unlocking greater rewards. To navigate between tiers you can select them on the navigation pane or scroll up and down.\\n\\nNext we will look at a higher tier.
Seats on the higher tiers are locked at the beginning of the campaign. To claim these Seats, at least two Districts must be completed on the previous tier.
[[col:yellow]]When your faction claims Seats in any Sorcery District it benefits from an increase in Winds of Magic Power Reserve Capacity.[[/col]]
[[col:yellow]]When your faction claims Seats in any Industry District it benefits from a reduction in Construction costs.[[/col]]
[[col:yellow]]When your faction claims Seats in any Military District it benefits from a reduction in Upkeep costs.[[/col]]
\\n\\n[[col:magic]]This is a Trickster's Reward, so is permanent and will stack effects.[[/col]]
Scheme Rewards

The strength of the Geomantic Web affects the power of commandments issued across your territory.\\n\\nA settlement must be linked to another of equal or higher strength if it is to operate at its maximum potential strength.\\n\\nThe colour of the rings around settlements indicate the current strength of the Geomantic Web there. A pulsing ring indicates that a settlement is not operating at its maximum potential strength - upgrade the strength of the web in nearby settlements in this case.

The strength of the Geomantic Web is determined by the strongest link between a province capital and its nearest neighbour. It dictates the level of the commandment that can be applied across this province.||The Geomantic Web's links can be viewed by clicking on the dedicated button on the right-hand side of the campaign interface. Links can be strengthened by constructing the Geomantic Web building chain or via alliances.

[[img:bullet_bst_bloodgrounds]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Raise[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_bloodgrounds]]Herdstones[[/sl_link]] [[col:green]]to establish Blood-grounds where you can gather[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_marks_of_ruination]]Marks of Ruination[[/sl_link]][[col:green]] that multiply and strengthen your hordes.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_bestial_rage]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Fight and raid to maintain the[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_bestial_rage]]Bestial Rage[[/sl_link]] [[col:green]]of your forces, allowing the expansion of[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_hordes]]horde encampments[[/sl_link]].\\n\\n[[img:bullet_bst_dread]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Earn[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_dread]]Dread[[/sl_link]] [[col:green]]throughout your campaign to spend on upgrades for hordes and characters.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_use_beastpaths_stance]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Use the[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_beast_paths]]beast-paths[[/sl_link]] [[col:green]]stance to avoid obstacles on the campaign map.[[/col]]\\n\\nLearn more about the Beastmen [[url:script_link_campaign_beastmen]]here[[/url]].

[[img:icon_corruption_chs]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Win battles with Taurox to leave stackable “Rivers of Blood” effects in regions, spreading corruption and benefiting local Chaos forces.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_rampage]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Send Taurox into multiple successive battles to complete[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_rampage]]Rampages[[/sl_link]] [[col:green]]that provide unique rewards.[[/col]]\\n\\n

[[img:icon_chivalry]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Win battles and avoid unchivalrous actions to progress through[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_chivalry]]Chivalry[[/sl_link]] [[col:green]]levels and receive bonuses, including access to the[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_green_knight]]Green Knight[[/sl_link]].\\n\\n[[img:icon_ladys_blessing]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Achieve heroic victories to grant your armies the[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_blessing_lady]]Blessings of the Lady[[/sl_link]][[col:green]], protecting them against physical damage.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_vow_grail]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Complete challenges pledged by your characters towards[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_bretonnian_vows]]vows and troths[[/sl_link]] [[col:green]]to gain powerful rewards.[[/col]]\\n\\n [[img:bullet_brt_peasants]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Maintain balance in the use of[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_peasants]]peasants[[/sl_link]] [[col:green]]between armies and farms to avoid adverse economic effects.[[/col]]\\n\\nLearn more about Bretonnia [[url:script_link_campaign_bretonnia]]here[[/url]].

[[img:icon_confederation]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Eradicate enemies of fellow Bretonnian factions to be given the option to form errantry[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_confederation]]confederations[[/sl_link]].\\n\\n[[img:water_supplies]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Garrison your armies in settlements to provide them with[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_bretonnian_desert_thirst]]water supplies[[/sl_link]][[col:green]], granting them temporary immunity to desert[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_attrition]]attrition[[/sl_link]].\\n\\n

[[img:icon_yang]][[/img]][[img:icon_yin]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Maintain balance between the Yin and Yang alignments of buildings to achieve[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_harmony]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_harmony}}]]Harmony[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]and optimise province effects. Balance the Yin and Yang of units in battle to benefit them in combat.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_spell_transform]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Use your Legendary Lord’s ability to transform into Dragon form in battle to overwhelm your foes.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:bullet_cth_compass]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Use the[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_compass]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_compass}}]]Wu Xing Compass[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]to channel the Winds of Magic towards key locations and activate powerful factionwide effects.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_caravan_cargo]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Send trade caravans across the world via the[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_ivory_road]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_ivory_road}}]]Ivory Road[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]and navigate risks en route to reap great financial rewards.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_great_bastion]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Help defend and maintain the gates of the[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_great_bastion]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_great_bastion}}]]Great Bastion[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]where possible to minimise Chaos encroachment into Cathay.[[/col]]\\n\\nLearn more about Cathay [[url:script_link_campaign_cathay]]here[[/url]].

[[col:green]]It is the Jade Dragon’s duty to increase the Celestial Emperor’s influence in the world by fully harnessing the power of the[[/col]] [[img:bullet_cth_compass]][[/img]][[sl_link:campaign_compass]]Wu Xing Compass.[[/sl_link]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]Yuan Bo must activate four dormant directions unique to the Jade Court that point toward distant sites of great power. Constructing an Astromantic Relay at each site will[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_empowering_the_compass]]empower the compass[[/sl_link]] [[col:green]]to greatly strengthen Cathay’s dominion and bring Yuan Bo closer to [[/col]][[img:icon_victory_condition]][[/img]][[col:yellow]][[b]]campaign victory[[/b]][[/col]].\\n\\n[[col:green]]As Astromantic Relays are constructed the Jade Dragon must stay prepared for hostilities from those who seek to stop the redirection of the Winds of Magic. Successfully activating the four dormant directions will lead to the final incursion.[[/col]]\\n\\nLearn more about Cathay factions [[url:script_link_campaign_cathay]]here[[/url]].

[[img:icon_labour]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Fight battles and gather the necessary[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_labour]]Labour[[/sl_link]] [[col:green]]to maximise the efficiency of your[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_chd_economy]]Industrial Economy[[/sl_link]][[col:green]], in turn boosting your military strength.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_armaments]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Spend Armaments in the[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_hellforge]]Hell-Forge[[/sl_link]] [[col:green]]to increase unit capacities and strengths.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_conclave_influence]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Use Conclave Influence to claim powerful seats in the[[col:green]] [[sl_link:campaign_tower_of_zharr]]Tower of Zharr[[/sl_link]] [[col:green]]that can significantly strengthen your faction.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_convoys]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Dispatch[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_military_convoys]]Military Convoys[[/sl_link]] [[col:green]]to locations across the world and navigate risks en route to benefit your [[sl_link:campaign_chd_economy]]Industrial Economy[[/sl_link]].\\n\\nLearn more about Chaos Dwarfs [[url:script_link_campaign_chaos_dwarfs]]here[[/url]].

[[col:link]]The Hunt for Ariel[[/col]]\\nIn the Vortex Campaign, Throt seeks to find and consume Ariel, Queen of the Wood Elves. To do so, he must disrupt her ritual in order to draw her out. This can be done by capturing certain settlements. Each settlement captured will delay Ariel’s ritual and make the final battle to defeat her easier.\\n\\n[[url:script_link_campaign_flesh_lab]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Flesh Laboratory[[/tooltip]][[/url]]\\nThe Flesh Laboratory allows Clan Moulder to grow, mutate, splice and surgically alter monsters and minions to make them more dangerous on the battlefield. Troops can be upgraded with Augmentations with the use of [[img:icon_mutagen]][[/img]]Mutagen, which is collected whenever packs of monsters are claimed from the lab’s Growth Vat. To grow new units in the vat, Clan Moulder must first harvest [[img:icon_growth_juice]][[/img]]Growth Juice by fighting battles or recycling units that have become [[img:icon_instability]][[/img]]unstable due to Augmentation.\\n\\n[[url:script_link_campaign_skaven_underworld]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Skaven Under-Empire[[/tooltip]][[/url]]\\nThe Skaven can lurk beneath any settlement or ruin, growing their empire by either occupying regions or establishing [[img:icon_under_empire]][[/img]]Under-Cities beneath them. Left undetected for too long, their malevolent scheming can result in hordes of vermin rising up to [[img:icon_corruption_skv]][[/img]]corrupt the land or assault illustrious cities without warning.\\n\\n[[url:script_link_campaign_food]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Food[[/tooltip]][[/url]]\\nSkaven factions require a stockpile of [[img:icon_skaven_food]][[/img]]food, each army consuming an amount of [[img:icon_skaven_food]][[/img]]food per turn. [[img:icon_skaven_food]][[/img]]Food may be acquired through battles, by sacking settlements, and from certain buildings.\\n\\n[[url:script_link_campaign_corruption]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Skaven Corruption[[/tooltip]][[/url]]\\nThe Skaven spread [[img:icon_corruption_skv]][[/img]]corruption wherever they settle, lowering [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]control over time but giving additional uses of the [[url:script_link_campaign_the_menace_below]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_the_menace_below}}]]Menace Below[[/tooltip]][[/url]] army ability during battles fought within the local province.\\n\\nLearn more about the Skaven [[url:script_link_campaign_skaven]]here[[/url]].

[[img:bullet_dae_daemonic_gifts]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Garner the[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_daemonic_glory]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_daemonic_glory}}]]Daemonic Glory[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]of a Chaos God or the Undivided throughout your campaign to unlock their rewards and receive Daemonic Gifts to augment your Daemon Prince.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:bullet_dae_daemonic_progression]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Earn enough Daemonic Glory to[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_dedication]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_dedication}}]]dedicate[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]your Daemon Prince to a single path of Chaos and unlock the highest tier rewards.[[/col]]\\n\\nLearn more about Daemons of Chaos [[url:script_link_campaign_daemons_of_chaos]]here[[/url]].

[[img:icon_slaves]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Capture[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_slaves]]Slaves[[/sl_link]] [[col:green]]to receive greater bonuses from certain buildings and enable instant building construction. Use Diktats and sacrificial[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_rites]]rites[[/sl_link]] [[col:green]]to maintain slave population and gain additional effects.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:bullet_def_black_arks]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Perform the “Sacrifice to Mathlann” [[sl_link:campaign_rites]]rite[[/sl_link]] [[col:green]]to enable the summoning of[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_black_arks]]Black Arks[[/sl_link]] [[col:green]]and make use of their unequalled invasion support capabilities.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:sword_of_khaine]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Construct the Shrine of the Widowmaker at the Shrine of Khaine in Ulthuan to obtain the[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_sword_of_khaine]]Sword of Khaine[[/sl_link]][[col:green]], a supremely powerful but burdensome weapon.[[/col]]\\n\\nLearn more about Dark Elves [[url:script_link_campaign_dark_elves]]here[[/url]].

[[img:death_night]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Use[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_slaves]]slaves[[/sl_link]] [[col:green]]to periodically trigger a[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_death_night]]Death Night[[/sl_link]][[col:green]], rejuvenating Hellebron with powerful factionwide effects and spawning a[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_blood_voyage]]Blood Voyage[[/sl_link]] [[col:green]]to benefit your campaign.[[/col]]\\n\\n

[[img:icon_slaves]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Capture[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_slaves]]Slaves[[/sl_link]] [[col:green]]to receive greater bonuses from certain buildings and enable instant building construction. Use Diktats and sacrificial[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_rites]]rites[[/sl_link]] [[col:green]]to maintain slave population and gain additional effects.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:bullet_def_black_arks]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Occupy major ports to increase the number of[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_black_arks]]Black Arks[[/sl_link]] [[col:green]]you can recruit and make use of their unequalled invasion support capabilities.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_rite_effect]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Perform the “Sacrifice to Anath Raema”[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_rites]]rite[[/sl_link]] [[col:green]]to improve your naval capabilities and gain other powerful effects.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:sword_of_khaine]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Construct the Shrine of the Widowmaker at the Shrine of Khaine in Ulthuan to obtain the[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_sword_of_khaine]]Sword of Khaine[[/sl_link]][[col:green]], a supremely powerful but burdensome weapon.[[/col]]\\n\\nLearn more about Dark Elves [[url:script_link_campaign_dark_elves]]here[[/url]].

[[img:def_malus_possession_potion]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Use the elixir and keep[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_dark_elves_possession_tzarkan]]Tz’arkan’s possession[[/sl_link]] [[col:green]]low to maintain civic control, or succumb to his whispers of great rewards and use his Daemonic form in battle.[[/col]]\\n\\n

[[img:icon_corruption_sla]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Spread[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_corruption]]Slaanesh corruption[[/sl_link]] [[col:green]]wherever you settle to exert positive effects upon the[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_slaves]]slave[[/sl_link]] [[col:green]]population in your provinces.[[/col]]\\n\\n

[[img:icon_monster_pens]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Fight, raid and occupy settlements in certain climes and against certain races to capture instantly recruitable creatures for your[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_monster_pens]]Monster Pens.[[/sl_link]]\\n\\n

[[img:bullet_dwf_crafting]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Use[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_oathgold]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_oathgold}}]]Oathgold[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]earned throughout your campaign to craft powerful weapons and items in the[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_forging_magic_items]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_forging_magic_items}}]]Forge.[[/tooltip]][[/url]]\\n\\n[[img:bullet_dwf_grudges]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Complete missions to prevent[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_grudges]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_grudges}}]]grudges[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]from going unanswered for too long and avoid negative factionwide effects.\\n\\n[[img:bullet_dwf_underway]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Use the[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_underway]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_underway}}]]Underway[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]stance to avoid obstacles on the campaign map.[[/col]]\\n\\nLearn more about Dwarfs [[url:script_link_campaign_dwarfs]]here[[/url]].

[[img:bullet_dwf_grudges]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Recapture the settlement of Karak Eight Peaks to benefit from its unique landmark buildings and enable a Campaign Victory.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_hero]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Make use of Clan Angrund’s unique Ancestor[[/col]] [[sl:campaign_heroes]]Heroes[[/sl]] [[col:green]]to aid you on your campaign.[[/col]]\\n\\n

[[img:bullet_dwf_crafting]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Seek out special artefacts during your campaign to[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_forging_magic_items]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_forging_magic_items}}]]reforge[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]within the[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_artefact_vault]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_artefact_vault}}]]Artefact Vault[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]in return for unique rewards.[[/col]]\\n\\n

[[img:icon_prestige]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Use[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_imperial_authority]]Prestige[[/sl_link]] [[col:green]]earned throughout your campaign to dictate the outcome of political dilemmas and manipulate relationships between the Empire’s states.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:emp_imperial_authority]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Make choices that uphold your[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_imperial_authority]]Imperial Authority[[/sl_link]] [[col:green]]to maintain power and stability, while pandering to individual[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_summon_elector_counts]]Elector Counts[[/sl_link]] [[col:green]]to increase their Fealty and ultimately[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_confederation]]confederate[[/sl_link]] [[col:green]]the Empire.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:emp_elector_counts]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Wrest control of the Empire’s state capitals through intrigue or war to install your own Elector Counts and receive benefits such as Elector Count State Troops and other bonuses.[[/col]]\\n\\nLearn more about the Empire [[url:script_link_campaign_empire]]here[[/url]].

[[img:bullet_emp_mandate]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Fulfil the[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_emperors_mandate]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_emperors_mandate}}]]Emperor's Mandate[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]by expanding territory and earning Acclaim to gain access to better quality units from Imperial Supplies.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:emp_hostility]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Defend your colonies through times of increased[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_hostility]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_hostility}}]]Hostility[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]as you expand and make use of more frequent Imperial Supplies drops.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:bullet_emp_hunters]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Complete special objectives to recruit[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_wulfharts_hunters]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_wulfharts_hunters}}]]unique Heroes[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]to your cause.[[/col]]\\n\\nLearn more about the Empire [[url:script_link_campaign_empire]]here[[/url]].

[[img:icon_books_of_nagash]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Seek out the eight[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_books_of_nagash]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_books_of_nagash}}]]Books of Nagash[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]to increase Volkmar’s Righteous Zeal, granting him unique rewards as books are collected and sealed away from wrongdoers.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_hero]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Recruit high-ranked Witch Hunters and Warrior Priests as standard to help vanquish the world’s abominations.[[/col]]\\n\\nLearn more about the Empire [[url:script_link_campaign_empire]]here[[/url]].

[[img:icon_waaagh]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Smash through enemies and settlements and increase your tribe’s Reputation level to receive factionwide bonuses and unlock the[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_waaagh]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_waaagh}}]]Call to Waaagh![[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]button.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_waaagh]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Use the[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_waaagh]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_waaagh}}]]Call to Waaagh![[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]button to temporarily swell your unit numbers and target a settlement as the Waaagh!’s prize to raze or occupy in return for rewards.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_scrap]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Spend[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_salvage]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_salvage}}]]Scrap[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]collected after battles and razing settlements on unit equipment upgrades and technologies.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:bullet_dwf_underway]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Use the[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_underway]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_underway}}]]Underway[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]stance to avoid obstacles on the campaign map.[[/col]]\\n\\nLearn more about Greenskins [[url:script_link_campaign_greenskins]]here[[/url]].

[[img:icon_grom]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Collect ingredients for[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_groms_cauldron]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_groms_cauldron}}]]Grom's Cauldron[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]throughout your campaign and cook powerful recipes to benefit your tribe.[[/col]]\\n\\n
[[img:bullet_grn_karak]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Recapture the settlement of Karak Eight Peaks to enable Orc recruitment and access to its unique landmark buildings.[[/col]]\\n\\n

[[img:icon_influence]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Earn[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_influence]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_influence}}]]Influence[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]throughout your campaign to use for political events and to recruit Lords and Heroes.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_influence]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Manipulate other factions’ diplomatic relationships by exerting your Influence over them in[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_intrigue_at_the_court]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_intrigue_at_the_court}}]]Court[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]to steer world affairs.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_outpost]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Establish[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_outposts]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_outposts}}]]outposts[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]in allies’ lands to garner further Influence through[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_espionage]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_espionage}}]]espionage.[[/tooltip]][[/url]]\\n\\nLearn more about High Elves [[url:script_link_campaign_high_elves]]here[[/url]].

[[img:icon_alarielle_defender]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Ensure that Ulthuan’s regions stay under High Elf control to fulfil Avelorn’s role as its[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_defender_of_ulthuan]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_defender_of_ulthuan}}]]sacred defender[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]and prevent negative factionwide effects.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_alarielle_torment]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Prevent Chaos corruption seeping into Avelorn’s lands to reduce penalties suffered by Alarielle and her regions due to[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_mortal_worlds_torment]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_mortal_worlds_torment}}]]torment.[[/tooltip]][[/url]]\\n\\n[[img:power_of_nature]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Take Alarielle into owned provinces to exert the[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_power_of_nature]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_power_of_nature}}]]Power of Nature[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]over her surroundings and spread powerful regional effects.[[/col]]\\n\\n

[[img:assassination_targets]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Eliminate[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_marked_for_death]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_marked_for_death}}]]marked[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]individuals throughout your campaign to gain significant[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_influence]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_influence}}]]Influence[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]rewards and other benefits.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_stalking_stance]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Attack any enemy army in default army [[url:script_link_campaign_stances]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_stances}}]]stance[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]to have a chance to ambush them, increasing your chances of victory.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_effect_campaign_movement]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Use the Shadow Realms stance to avoid obstacles on the campaign map without the risk of ambush.[[/col]]\\n\\n

[[img:unit_capacity]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Recruit highly-trained Mistwalker units from Yvresse’s unique military buildings to aid you in your military efforts.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_warden_supplies]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Gather Warden’s Supplies throughout the campaign to restore[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_athel_tamarha]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_athel_tamarha}}]]Athel Tamarha[[/tooltip]][[/url]], [[col:green]]where you can boost your Mistwalker ranks and gain other bonuses.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:yvresse_defence_level_increase]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Collect Ladrielle’s Blessings as you expand Athel Tamarha and Tor Yvresse to restore the Mists of Yvresse, benefiting Ulthuan’s armies fighting on home soil.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:wardens_cage]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Capture enemy Lords and Heroes in battle using the “Warden’s Cage” ability to imprison them in Athel Tamarha, where actions against them can earn further supplies and boons.[[/col]]\\n\\n

[[img:icon_dragon_taming]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Seek out unique[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_dragon_taming]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_dragon_taming}}]]Dragons[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]throughout your campaign and choose to draw upon their knowledge and power, or tame them in battle and have them join your cause.[[/col]]\\n\\n

[[img:bullet_kho_skulls]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Harvest[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_skulls]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_skulls}}]]Skulls[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]throughout your campaign to expand and advance your faction, or to send to the Skull Throne in return for powerful temporary effects.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_army]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Send your forces into multiple successive battles to progress through[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_bloodletting]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_bloodletting}}]]Bloodletting[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]levels and accumulate bonuses.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_corruption_kho]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Raze conquered settlements to summon temporary Daemonic armies. Spread[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_drawn_to_destruction]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_drawn_to_destruction}}]]destruction[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]in partially-owned provinces for a chance to occupy them automatically.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_unholy_manifestation]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Ensure the spread of Khorne corruption to aid His participation in the[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_the_great_game]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_the_great_game}}]]Great Game[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]and unlock[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_unholy_manifestations]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_unholy_manifestations}}]]Unholy Manifestations[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]that can greatly benefit your armies.[[/col]]\\n\\nLearn more about Khorne [[url:script_link_campaign_khorne]]here[[/url]].

[[img:icon_devotion]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Battle against the forces of Chaos and construct religious buildings to accumulate[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_devotion]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_devotion}}]]Devotion[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]and invoke the Kislevite gods for powerful temporary effects.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_supporters]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Use Invocations of the[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_motherland]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_motherland}}]]Motherland[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]to gather Supporters in favour of your faction and receive factionwide bonuses.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:bullet_ksl_the_ice_court]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Train formidable Frost Maidens and Ice Witches in the[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_ice_court]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_ice_court}}]]Ice Court[[/tooltip]][[/url]][[col:green]], granting them powerful traits before they become recruitable characters.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:bullet_ksl_atamans]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Appoint[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_atamans]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_atamans}}]]Atamans[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]to govern your provinces and provide bonuses to the territories they oversee.[[/col]]\\n\\nLearn more about Kislev [[url:script_link_campaign_kislev]]here[[/url]].

[[col:green]]Mother Ostankya must obtain six forbidden[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_hexes]]Hexes[[/sl_link]] [[col:green]]to unleash upon the world, each guarded by those intent on keeping these powers away from her.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]Claiming the first five Hexes uncovers the sixth and most terrible Hex, the ultimate punishment for Kislev’s enemies: [[i]]The Malediction of Ruin[[/i]]. Successfully performing this final Hex leads to[[/col]] [[img:icon_victory_condition]][[col:yellow]][[b]]campaign victory[[/b]].[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]Hexes reveal themselves as Mother Ostankya uses [[img:icon_spirit_essence]][[/img]]Spirit Essence gathered from winning battles, purging corruption and occupying Magical Forests, in turn powering her[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_witchs_hut]]Witch’s Hut[[/sl_link]] [[col:green]]Incantations and the Hexes themselves.[[/col]]\\n\\nLearn more about Kislev factions [[url:script_link_campaign_kislev]]here[[/url]].

[[img:icon_slann_mage_priest]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Progress through the campaign to unlock the devastatingly powerful Hero[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_lord_kroak]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_lord_kroak}}]]Lord Kroak[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]and wield his settlement-crumbling powers.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:bullet_lzd_geomantic_web]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Construct[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_geomantic_web]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_geomantic_web}}]]Geomantic Web[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]buildings across your provinces to reinforce its power and boost the effects of commandments.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:bullet_lzd_spawning]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Complete[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_blessed_spawnings]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_blessed_spawnings}}]]Blessed Spawnings[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]missions to periodically recruit formidable units.[[/col]]\\n\\nLearn more about Lizardmen [[url:script_link_campaign_lizardmen]]here[[/url]].

[[img:icon_slann_mage_priest]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Begin the campaign with the devastatingly powerful Hero[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_lord_kroak]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_lord_kroak}}]]Lord Kroak[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]and wield his settlement-crumbling powers.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:bullet_lzd_geomantic_web]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Construct[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_geomantic_web]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_geomantic_web}}]]Geomantic Web[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]buildings across your provinces to reinforce its power and boost the effects of commandments.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:bullet_lzd_spawning]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Complete[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_blessed_spawnings]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_blessed_spawnings}}]]Blessed Spawnings[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]missions to periodically recruit formidable units.[[/col]]\\n\\nLearn more about Lizardmen [[url:script_link_campaign_lizardmen]]here[[/url]].

[[img:bullet_lzd_horde]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Expand Nakai’s special[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_hordes]]horde[[/sl_link]] [[col:green]]army to unlock units that can be recruited by any of his hordes via the[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_jungle_nexus]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_jungle_nexus}}]]Jungle Nexus.[[/tooltip]][[/url]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_lzd_nakai_temple_green]][[/img]][[img:icon_lzd_nakai_temple_blue]][[/img]][[img:icon_lzd_nakai_temple_red]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Conquer settlements across the world to dedicate to the Old Ones by constructing[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_defence_great_plan]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_defence_great_plan}}]]temples[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]in return for their Favour and rewards.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_lzd_nakai_favour]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Use earned Favour to unlock special units offered in the[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_defence_great_plan]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_defence_great_plan}}]]Temples of the Old Ones[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]and for the research of powerful technologies.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_slann_mage_priest]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Progress through the campaign to unlock the devastatingly powerful Hero[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_lord_kroak]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_lord_kroak}}]]Lord Kroak[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]and wield his settlement-crumbling powers.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:bullet_lzd_spawning]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Complete[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_blessed_spawnings]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_blessed_spawnings}}]]Blessed Spawnings[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]missions to periodically recruit formidable units.[[/col]]\\n\\nLearn more about Lizardmen [[url:script_link_campaign_lizardmen]]here[[/url]].

[[img:bullet_lzd_threat_map]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Respond to Oxyotl’s[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_oxyotl_visions]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_oxyotl_visions}}]]Visions of the Old Ones[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]and teleport to mission locations to pre-emptively push back the tide of Chaos encroaching upon the world.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:sanctum_gem]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Earn Sanctum Gems from successful missions to unlock[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_silent_sanctums]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_silent_sanctums}}]]Silent Sanctums[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]], where you can construct special outpost buildings such as the one at the Godless Crater to benefit Oxyotl’s local forces.[[/col]]\\n\\n

[[img:icon_sotek_captives]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Win battles to accumulate offerings to use as[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_sacrifice_to_sotek]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_sacrifice_to_sotek}}]]Sacrifices to Sotek[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]in return for strengthening your cohorts and other factionwide benefits.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_prophecy_of_sotek]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Fulfil the conditions of the Prophecy of Sotek to instigate all-out war between all Lizardmen and Skaven and unlock higher-tier sacrifice rewards.[[/col]]\\n\\n

[[img:icon_rite_effect]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Perform the[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_rites]]Rite of Tzunki[[/sl_link]] [[col:green]]to extend the movement range of all Lords and Heroes.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_terradon_mount]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Recruit Skink Chiefs and Priests who come equipped with Terradon mounts by default.[[/col]]\\n\\n

[[img:bullet_nor_gods]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Raze settlements and raise monoliths in their place to gradually pledge[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_gods]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_gods}}]]Allegiance to the Gods[[/tooltip]][[/url]][[col:green]], who will each grant factionwide gifts in lieu of the others.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:bullet_nor_monsters]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Hunt down creatures listed in the[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_monsters]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_monsters}}]]Monstrous Arcanum[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]and defeat them in battle in return for unique and powerful trophies.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_nor_outpost]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Conquer special locations across the world to develop into fully-fledged Norscan strongholds that enable powerful technologies.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_confederation]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Defeat the faction leaders of rival Norscan tribes to be given the option to form tribal[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_confederation]]confederations.[[/sl_link]]\\n\\nLearn more about Norsca [[url:script_link_campaign_norsca]]here[[/url]].

[[img:icon_infections]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Use Infections accumulated throughout the game to concoct[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_plagues_of_nurgle]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_plagues_of_nurgle}}]]Plagues[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]that can be spread throughout the world for a variety of favourable effects, in turn earning more Infections.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:bullet_nur_cyclical_buildings]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Observe the organic cycles of[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_cyclical_buildings]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_cyclical_buildings}}]]Nurglish building chains[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]to optimise recruitment and building effects.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_growth]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Use Plagues and other means to spread Nurgle’s corruption, promoting growth within your provinces.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_unholy_manifestation]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Ensure the spread of Nurgle corruption to aid His participation in the[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_the_great_game]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_the_great_game}}]]Great Game[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]and unlock[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_unholy_manifestations]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_unholy_manifestations}}]]Unholy Manifestations[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]that can greatly benefit your plagues and unit numbers.[[/col]]\\n\\nLearn more about Nurgle [[url:script_link_campaign_nurgle]]here[[/url]].

[[img:bullet_ogr_camps]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Use your armies to set up[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_ogre_camps]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_ogre_camps}}]]Ogre Camps[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]anywhere in the world to benefit from high-tier buildings and other advantages over sedentary settlements.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_ogr_meat]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Ensure each army has a sufficient[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_meat]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_meat}}]]Meat[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]supply during the campaign to prevent attrition from cannibalism. Send surpluses to the Great Maw in return for temporary army bonuses.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:bullet_ogr_big_names]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Complete challenges with eligible characters to grant them[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_big_names]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_big_names}}]]Big Names[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]which come with various bonuses and abilities.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_ogr_contracts]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Accept[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_contracts]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_contracts}}]]Contracts[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]issued by other factions for military action against targeted characters and settlements in return for rewards and improved diplomatic relations with Contract issuers.[[/col]]\\n\\nLearn more about the Ogre Kingdoms [[url:script_link_campaign_ogre_kingdoms]]here[[/url]].

[[url:script_link_campaign_forge_of_daith]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Forge of Daith[[/tooltip]][[/url]]\\nThe Sisters of Twilight have access to unique items and armaments crafted in the [[img:icon_forge_of_daith]][[/img]]Forge of Daith. Lord Daith, most celebrated of Elven smiths, uses his legendary smithing skills to forge and upgrade special equipment for them as favours in return for their successes in battle.
