Daith can indulge Naestra’s obsession with perfectly honing her equipment by permanently upgrading them for her, or accept Arahan’s ardent insistence to carry powerfully reforged equipment into battle, albeit with temporary effects.\\n\\n[[url:script_link_campaign_worldroots]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]The Worldroots & Magical Forests[[/tooltip]][[/url]]\\nThe Oak of Ages’ life-giving Worldroots have seeded a number of Magical Forests across the world, but over time interlopers and neglect have caused them to wither. By performing various actions such as securing the [[img:heathland_pacified]][[/img]][[img:heathland_hostile]][[/img]][[img:heathland_neutral]][[/img]]Heathland regions that border them, the Wood Elves can increase the [[img:forest_health]][[/img]]health of Magical Forests and perform Rituals of Rebirth there, thus permanently restoring their connection to the Worldroots.\\n\\nAll Wood Elf armies can use the [[img:icon_use_beastpaths_stance]][[/img]]Worldroots stance to travel short distances beneath otherwise impassable terrain. Doing so is not without risk, however, as they can be intercepted by armies above and brought to battle, even by races that cannot use the Worldroots themselves.\\n\\n[[url:script_link_campaign_worldroots]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]The Deeproots[[/tooltip]][[/url]]\\nThe Deeproots connect all Magical Forests of the world, allowing the Wood Elves to instantaneously travel between different continents with ease. They can be accessed from within any Magical Forest region regardless of ownership, but once an army traverses them it will be some time before another journey can be made.\\n\\n[[url:script_link_campaign_oak_of_ages]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Oak of Ages[[/tooltip]][[/url]]\\nAll Worldroots lead back to the Oak of Ages. By securing Athel Loren’s borders and healing other Magical Forests, the Wood Elves can rejuvenate the Worldroots’ life-giving powers. The ultimate goal of the Wood Elves’ Mortal Empires campaign is to complete the Ritual of Rebirth in Athel Loren and defend the Oak.\\n\\n[[url:script_link_campaign_elven_council]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Offices[[/tooltip]][[/url]]\\nA variety of benefits may be gained by appointing [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords to positions of Office.\\n\\nLearn more about the Wood Elves [[url:script_link_campaign_wood_elves]]here[[/url]].

[[img:icon_under_empire]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Establish unseen[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_skaven_underworld]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_skaven_underworld}}]]Under-Cities[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]beneath settlements you defeat and secretly expand them to aid your malevolent schemes and spread Skaven corruption.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_skaven_food]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Keep your faction’s[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_food]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_food}}]]food[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]supplies at high levels throughout your campaign to gain factionwide bonuses and avoid debilitating effects.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_corruption_skv]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Spread Skaven corruption over extended periods wherever you settle to infest areas with[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_the_menace_below]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_the_menace_below}}]]summonable Clanrats[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]and make provinces difficult to inhabit.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:bullet_skv_underway]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Use the[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_underway]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_underway}}]]Underway[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]stance to avoid obstacles on the campaign map.[[/col]]\\n\\nLearn more about the Skaven [[url:script_link_campaign_skaven]]here[[/url]].

[[img:skv_snikch_schemes]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Use Schemes that become available during the campaign to carry out unfailing actions of espionage, sabotage and death as part of Clan Eshin’s[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_skaven_shadowy_dealings]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_skaven_shadowy_dealings}}]]Shadowy Dealings.[[/tooltip]][[/url]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_shadowy_dealings]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Take on Contracts issued by backstabbing Skaven clans to act against their rivals for rewards and positive effects while heeding the diplomatic consequences.[[/col]]\\n\\n

[[img:icon_warp_fuel]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Acquire Warp-fuel canisters throughout your campaign to spend on new-fangled upgrades to Skryre war technologies in the[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_forbidden_workshop]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_forbidden_workshop}}]]Forbidden Workshop[[/tooltip]][[/url]][[col:green]], including Doomrockets.[[/col]][[/col]]\\n\\n

[[img:icon_plague]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Make use of the[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_rites]]Rite of Pestilence[[/sl_link]] [[col:green]]and spread Pestilens’ highly contagious[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_plagues]]plagues[[/sl_link]] [[col:green]]to benefit their forces and settlements and debilitate their enemies.[[/col]]\\n\\n

[[img:icon_growth_juice]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Accumulate Growth Juice throughout your campaign to claim units and monsters from the Growth Vat along with Mutagen byproduct for the[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_flesh_lab]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_flesh_lab}}]]Flesh Laboratory.[[/tooltip]][[/url]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_mutagen]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Use Mutagen to augment individual units in your armies, while taking heed of instability effects that may degrade them or shorten their life span.[[/col]]\\n\\n

[[img:icon_devotees]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Gather[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_devotees]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_devotees}}]]Devotees[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]throughout your campaign to spend on[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_pleasurable_acts]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_pleasurable_acts}}]]Pleasurable Acts[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]that benefit your home regions, or proliferate[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_chaos_cults]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_chaos_cults}}]]cults[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]to debilitate foreign lands and earn more followers.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_disciple_army]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Take your forces into areas of sufficient Slaanesh corruption and raise[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_disciple_armies]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_disciple_armies}}]]Disciple Armies[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]to support your invasions.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_gift_of_slaanesh]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Defeat enemies and perform successful Hero actions to give enemy characters[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_gifts_of_slaanesh]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_gifts_of_slaanesh}}]]Gifts of Slaanesh[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]that impose negative effects upon them and can earn you more Devotees.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_seductive_influence]][[/img]] [[url:script_link_campaign_seduction]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_seduction}}]]Seduce[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]enemy units before battles to have them join your side for the battle durations.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_seductive_influence]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Interact with human, Elf, or Beastmen factions in various ways to build up[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_seductive_influence]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_seductive_influence}}]]Seductive Influence[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]over them which can eventually lead to vassalisation.[[/col]]\\n\\nLearn more about Slaanesh [[url:script_link_campaign_slaanesh]]here[[/url]].

[[url:script_link_campaign_defence_great_plan]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Temples of the Old Ones[[/tooltip]][[/url]]\\nThe success of the Old Ones’ Great Plan hangs in the balance! Defeat foreign invaders and reclaim the Lizardmen’s ancient lost cities, installing the [[img:bullet_lzd_spawnings_of_the_ancients]][[/img]]Defenders of the Great Plan as their rightful owners. The Defenders will maintain the temple-cities gifted to them.\\n\\nDevoting yourself to an [[img:icon_lzd_nakai_temple_green]][[/img]][[img:icon_lzd_nakai_temple_blue]][[/img]][[img:icon_lzd_nakai_temple_red]][[/img]]Old One by constructing [[img:icon_lzd_nakai_temple]][[/img]]temples in their name will please them immeasurably, providing a raft of rewards and earning [[img:icon_lzd_nakai_favour]][[/img]]Favour which can then be used to unlock powerful units and technologies.\\n\\n[[url:script_link_campaign_jungle_nexus]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Jungle Nexus[[/tooltip]][[/url]]\\nNakai resides at the centre of the [[img:bullet_lzd_horde]][[/img]]jungle nexus and has the ability to recruit units directly from the global recruitment pool, to which he has personal access. Developing Nakai's recruitment buildings will enable other hordes in his faction to share in their progress.\\n\\n[[url:script_link_campaign_warmblood_invaders]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Warmblood Invaders[[/tooltip]][[/url]]\\nOver the centuries, many have attempted to pillage Lustria’s temple-cities for their great wealth. If the Great Plan is to remain intact and on-target, the warm-blooded invaders lurking in the jungles must be tracked and dealt with extreme prejudice and brutal force!\\n\\nLearn more about the Lizardmen [[url:script_link_campaign_lizardmen]]here[[/url]].

[[img:icon_books_of_nagash]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Seek out the eight[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_books_of_nagash]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_books_of_nagash}}]]Books of Nagash[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]by occupying the settlements and defeating the characters that harbour them to gain great powers.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_jars]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Use[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_canopic_jars]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_canopic_jars}}]]Canopic Jars[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]gathered throughout your campaign along with money and resources to craft powerful items and awaken[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_regiments_of_renown]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_regiments_of_renown}}]]Regiments of Renown[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]in the[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_mortuary_cult]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_mortuary_cult}}]]Mortuary Cult.[[/tooltip]][[/url]]\\n\\n[[img:unit_capacity]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Construct military buildings to recruit units without financial cost or upkeep via their[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_day_of_awakening]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_day_of_awakening}}]]Day of Awakening[[/tooltip]][[/url]][[col:green]], increasing recruitment capacities with each building constructed.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:bullet_tmb_dynasty]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Research[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_dynasties]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_dynasties}}]]dynastic technologies[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]to unlock powerful Lords and increase the number of Heroes that you can field.[[/col]]\\n\\nLearn more about Tomb Kings [[url:script_link_campaign_tomb_kings]]here[[/url]].

[[img:icon_books_of_nagash]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Seek out the eight[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_books_of_nagash]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_books_of_nagash}}]]Books of Nagash[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]by occupying the settlements and defeating the characters that harbour them to gain great powers.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_jars]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Use[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_canopic_jars]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_canopic_jars}}]Canopic Jars[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]gathered throughout your campaign along with money and resources to craft powerful items and awaken[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_regiments_of_renown]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_regiments_of_renown}}]]Regiments of Renown[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]in the[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_mortuary_cult]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_mortuary_cult}}]]Mortuary Cult.[[/tooltip]][[/url]]\\n\\n[[img:unit_capacity]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Construct military buildings to recruit units without financial cost or upkeep via their[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_day_of_awakening]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_day_of_awakening}}]]Day of Awakening[[/tooltip]][[/url]][[col:green]], increasing recruitment capacities with each building constructed.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:bullet_tmb_dynasty]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Research[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_dynasties]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_dynasties}}]]dynastic technologies[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]to unlock powerful Lords and increase the number of Heroes that you can field.[[/col]]\\n\\nLearn more about Tomb Kings [[url:script_link_campaign_tomb_kings]]here[[/url]].

[[img:icon_grimoires]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Gather[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_grimoires]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_grimoires}}]]Grimoires[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]throughout your campaign to unlock arcane knowledge via technologies and manipulate reality with the[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_changing_of_the_ways]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_changing_of_the_ways}}]]Changing of the Ways.[[/tooltip]][[/url]][[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_teleport]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Use the[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_teleport_stance]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_teleport_stance}}]]Teleport[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]stance to instantly move between locations on the campaign map and launch attacks without the risk of ambush.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_unholy_manifestation]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Ensure the spread of Tzeentch corruption to aid His participation in the[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_the_great_game]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_the_great_game}}]]Great Game[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]and unlock[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_unholy_manifestations]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_unholy_manifestations}}]]Unholy Manifestations[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]that can produce powerful effects.[[/col]]\\n\\nLearn more about Tzeentch [[url:script_link_campaign_tzeentch]]here[[/url]].

[[col:green]]The Changeling thrives on sowing discord by enacting devious[[/col]] [[img:icon_schemes_changeling]][[/img]][[sl_link:campaign_schemes]]Schemes[[/sl_link]] [[col:green]]across the world’s Theatres of War.\\n\\nEach theatre’s [[i]]Minor Schemes[[/i]] set the stage for its [[i]]Grand Scheme[[/i]] – a chaotic culmination of mischief unravelled against the theatre’s main power.\\n\\nThe Changeling must sufficiently destabilise the world via Schemes in order to perform the most audacious prank of all: [[i]]The Ultimate Scheme[[/i]]. Completing this masterstroke will earn the Deceivers their[[/col]] [[img:icon_victory_condition]][[/img]][[col:yellow]][[b]]campaign victory![[/b]][[/col]]\\n\\nLearn more about Tzeentch factions [[url:script_link_campaign_tzeentch]]here[[/url]].

[[img:icon_pirate_crew]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Use your faction leader’s access to[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_ship_building]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_ship_building}}]]shipbuilding[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]to upgrade their ship’s features, unlocking units and providing bonuses for the ship and crew.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_infamy]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Increase your[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_infamy]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_infamy}}]]Infamy[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]rank throughout the campaign and attain possession of the[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_sea_shanties]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_sea_shanties}}]]Lost Sea Shanty[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]verses to wield in battle, drawing the attention of surpassed rivals.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_cove]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Win battles at port settlements and establish[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_pirate_coves]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_pirate_coves}}]]Pirate Coves[[/tooltip]][[/url]][[col:green]], increasing your Infamy and providing income or other benefits.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_treasure_map]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Seek out riches hinted at by[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_treasure_maps]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_treasure_maps}}]]Treasure Maps[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]or defeat rival pirates to obtain individual[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_pieces_of_eight]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_pieces_of_eight}}]]Pieces of Eight[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]and the[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_regiments_of_renown]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_regiments_of_renown}}]]Regiments of Renown[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]bound to them.[[/col]]\\n\\nLearn more about the Vampire Coast [[url:script_link_campaign_vampire_coast]]here[[/url]].

[[img:icon_pirate_crew]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Use your faction leader’s access to[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_ship_building]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_ship_building}}]]shipbuilding[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]to upgrade their ship’s features, unlocking units and providing bonuses for the ship and crew.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_infamy]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Increase your[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_infamy]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_infamy}}]]Infamy[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]rank throughout the campaign and attain possession of the[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_sea_shanties]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_sea_shanties}}]]Lost Sea Shanty[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]verses to wield in battle, drawing the attention of surpassed rivals.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_cove]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Win battles at port settlements and establish[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_pirate_coves]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_pirate_coves}}]]Pirate Coves[[/tooltip]][[/url]][[col:green]], increasing your Infamy and providing income or other benefits.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_treasure_map]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Seek out riches hinted at by[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_treasure_maps]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_treasure_maps}}]]Treasure Maps[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]or defeat rival pirates to obtain individual[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_pieces_of_eight]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_pieces_of_eight}}]]Pieces of Eight[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]and the[[/col]] [[sl:campaign_regiments_of_renown]]Regiments of Renown[[/sl]] [[col:green]]bound to them.[[/col]]\\n\\nLearn more about the Vampire Coast [[url:script_link_campaign_vampire_coast]]here[[/url]].

[[img:icon_books_of_nagash]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Seek out the[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_books_of_nagash]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_books_of_nagash}}]]Books of Nagash[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]by occupying the settlements and defeating the characters that harbour them to gain great powers. Amplify their powers by constructing the Malevolent Museum at Castle Drakenhof.[[/col]]\\n\\n

[[img:icon_blood_kiss]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Assassinate enemy Lords and faction leaders or fell them in battle to collect[[/col]] [[sl_tooltip:campaign_blood_kiss]]Blood Kisses[[/sl_tooltip]] [[col:green]]for the awakening of powerful [[url:script_link_campaign_bloodlines]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_bloodlines}}]]Bloodline[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]Lords.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:bullet_vmp_dead]][[/img]] [[url:script_link_campaign_raising_dead]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_raising_dead}}]]Raise the dead[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]from your Lords’ localities to instantly recruit units without training time and quickly muster large armies.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_corruption_vmp]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Spread[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_vampiric_corruption]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_vampiric_corruption}}]]Vampiric corruption[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]across the land to disable attrition for Undead armies and blight the living as you increase the chances of Undead uprisings.[[/col]]\\n\\nLearn more about the Vampire Counts [[url:script_link_campaign_vampires]]here[[/url]].

[[img:bullet_vmp_love]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Ensure Vlad and Isabella fight in the same army to give them improved prowess in battle.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_hero]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Construct the Mausoleum of the Mad Count at Castle Drakenhof for early recruitment of higher-ranked Vampire Heroes.[[/col]]\\n\\n

[[img:icon_chaos_gifts]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Collect the[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_souls_resource]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_souls_resource}}]]Souls[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]of mortal factions throughout your campaign for sacrifice to the Dark Gods in return for factionwide boons granted by[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_chaos_gifts]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_chaos_gifts}}]]Gifts of Chaos.[[/tooltip]][[/url]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_dark_fortress]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Erect[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_dark_fortress]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_dark_fortress}}]]Dark Fortresses[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]across the north and vassalise the local tribes as you conquer[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_norscan_homelands]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_norscan_homelands}}]]Norscan Homeland[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]capitals to establish your centres of power.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_warband]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Instantly muster[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_warbands]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_warbands}}]]Warband[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]units into your armies from your Lords’ localities to quickly build your military might.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_warband]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Upgrade units into more powerful forms while devoting them to your chosen god to grant them[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_dark_authority]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_dark_authority}}]]Dark Authority[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]army bonuses.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_character]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Ascend characters through[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_path_to_glory]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_path_to_glory}}]]Paths to Glory[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]to devote them to specific Gods and progress Lords towards eventual Daemonhood.[[/col]]

\\n\\n[[img:icon_seductive_influence]][[/img]] [[url:script_link_campaign_seduction]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_seduction}}]]Seduce[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]enemy units before battles to have them join your side for the battle durations.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_seductive_influence]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Interact with human, Elf, or Beastmen factions in various ways to build up[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_seductive_influence]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_seductive_influence}}]]Seductive Influence[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]over them which can eventually lead to vassalisation.[[/col]]

\\n\\n[[img:icon_infections]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Use Infections accumulated throughout the game to concoct[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_plagues_of_nurgle]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_plagues_of_nurgle}}]]Plagues[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]that can be spread throughout the world for a variety of favourable effects, in turn earning more Infections.[[/col]]

\\n\\n[[img:icon_army]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Send your forces into multiple successive battles to progress through[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_bloodletting]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_bloodletting}}]]Bloodletting[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]levels and accumulate bonuses.[[/col]]

\\n\\n[[img:bullet_tze_changing_of_the_ways]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Manipulate reality with the[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_changing_of_the_ways]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_changing_of_the_ways}}]]Changing of the Ways[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]to perform unique actions against enemies on the campaign map.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_teleport]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Use the[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_teleport_stance]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_teleport_stance}}]]Teleport[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]stance to instantly move between locations on the campaign map and launch attacks without the risk of ambush.[[/col]]

[[img:forest_health]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Pacify regions bordering the world’s[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_worldroots]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_worldroots}}]]Magical Forests[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]through razing, occupation, and alliance to improve their health, eventually leading to Rituals of Rebirth with lasting rewards.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_hero]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Gain control of the supremely powerful Hero[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_ariel]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_ariel}}]]Ariel[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]following your first Ritual of Rebirth and wield her devastating powers.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:bullet_wef_worldroots]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Traverse the Deeproots sparingly to instantly travel vast distances between Magical Forests or use the Worldroots stance to avoid obstacles over shorter distances.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_amber]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Use[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_amber]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_amber}}]]Amber[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]rewarded from Rituals of Rebirth to unlock powerful technologies.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_victory_condition]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Complete the Ritual of Rebirth at the[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_oak_of_ages]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_oak_of_ages}}]]Oak of Ages[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]in Athel Loren to enable Campaign Victory.[[/col]]\\n\\nLearn more about the Wood Elves [[url:script_link_campaign_wood_elves]]here[[/url]].

[[url:script_link_campaign_amber]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Amber[[/tooltip]][[/url]]\\nThe Wood Elves gain [[img:icon_food]][[/img]]Amber from quests, and from each settlement they or their allies hold. [[img:icon_food]][[/img]]Amber may be spent on certain buildings, technologies, units, or on rejuvenating the Oak of Ages at the heart of Athel Loren.

[[url:script_link_campaign_elven_council]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Elven Council[[/tooltip]][[/url]]\\nA variety of benefits may be gained by appointing [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords to the Elven Council.

[[img:bullet_wef_units_monstrous]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Recruit[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_elf_glamouring]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_elf_glamouring}}]]glamoured[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]Wood Elf units while benefiting from stronger Tree Spirit Lords, Heroes and units that can be assigned[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_forest_spirits_animals]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_forest_spirits_animals}}]]Aspects[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]to grant them combat bonuses.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_lord]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Instantly recruit[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_forest_spirits_animals]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_forest_spirits_animals}}]]Wild Spirits[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]and fauna of the forest from your Lords’ localities to muster armies quickly.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:forest_health]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Pacify regions bordering the world’s[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_worldroots]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_worldroots}}]]Magical Forests[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]through razing, occupation, and alliance to improve their health, eventually leading to Rituals of Rebirth with lasting rewards.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:bullet_wef_worldroots]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Traverse the Deeproots sparingly to instantly travel vast distances between Magical Forests or use the Worldroots stance to avoid obstacles over shorter distances.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_amber]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Use[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_amber]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_amber}}]]Amber[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]rewarded from Rituals of Rebirth to unlock powerful technologies.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_victory_condition]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Complete the Ritual of Rebirth at the[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_oak_of_ages]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_oak_of_ages}}]]Oak of Ages[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]in Athel Loren to enable Campaign Victory.[[/col]]\\n\\nLearn more about the Wood Elves [[url:script_link_campaign_wood_elves]]here[[/url]].

[[url:script_link_campaign_gathering_of_the_ancients]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Gathering of the Ancients[[/tooltip]][[/url]]\\nA variety of benefits may be gained by appointing Treemen [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords to the Gathering of the Ancients.

[[url:script_link_campaign_oak_of_ages]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_how_to_play_title}}]]Oak of Ages[[/tooltip]][[/url]]\\nAt the heart of Athel Loren stands the Oak of Ages, which the Wood Elves must fully rejuvenate in order to achieve victory.

[[img:icon_forge_of_daith]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Win battles to receive special magical items gifted from the[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_forge_of_daith]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_forge_of_daith}}]]Forge of Daith[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]that can be permanently upgraded or temporarily boosted for the Sisters' use in battle.[[/col]]\\n\\n
The Army Abilities panel is shown on the right side of the screen when army abilities are available for use.
Supply locations within a settlement are each linked to multiple build locations where [[sl:battle_constructed_defences]]constructed defences[[/sl]] can be built.
Place the cursor over a supply location to see what build locations it is linked to.
drag
hold
on enemy
roll

[[img:icon_supplies]][[/img]][[sl:battle_supplies]]Supplies[[/sl]] may be used by the defender in a [[sl:battle_major_siege_battles]]major siege battle[[/sl]] or [[sl:battle_minor_settlement_battles]]minor settlement battle[[/sl]] to construct defences.
Defences may be constructed at build locations throughout a settlement.
Each build location is linked to a nearby supply-point [[sl:battle_capture_locations]]capture location[[/sl]].
Defences may be constructed during the fighting in response to the progress of the battle.

The defender in a [[sl:battle_major_siege_battles]]major siege battle[[/sl]] or [[sl:battle_minor_settlement_battles]]minor settlement battle[[/sl]] may use [[img:icon_supplies]][[/img]][[sl:battle_supplies]]Supplies[[/sl]] to construct defences at build locations throughout the settlement.
Should the defender lose control of the capture location, they will no longer be able to build defences linked to it. Any constructed defences will also be destroyed.
[[sl:battle_units]]Units[[/sl]] may be arranged for the coming fight during the deployment phase of the battle.
Once deployment is completed the battle begins.

There are a variety of more advanced methods for issuing instructions to selected [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] once [[sl:battle_unit_movement]]basic manoeuvring[[/sl]] is learned. Use the cursor keys to nudge [[sl:battle_unit_selection]]selected[[/sl]] units into position, for example.
The advisor appears from time to time to offer his assistance to the player. The level of advice can be reduced or minimised through the game options.

An ambush battle is fought when one [[sl:battle_armies]]army[[/sl]] surprises another on the campaign map. The defender starts the battle surrounded by the attacker, with no chance to [[sl:battle_deployment]]deploy[[/sl]].
[[sl:battle_battle_game]]Battles[[/sl]] are contested by armies, each of which is made up of many troop [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]]. The player commands an army when taking part in a battle.

Each [[sl:battle_units]]unit[[/sl]] in [[sl:battle_battle_game]]battle[[/sl]] bears an amount of armour which protects them from physical damage inflicted by [[sl:battle_infantry]]melee[[/sl]] or [[sl:battle_missile_units]]missile[[/sl]] attacks during [[sl:battle_melee_combat]]combat[[/sl]].

[[sl:battle_armies]]Armies[[/sl]] may occasionally enter battle with army-wide abilities that are not tied to the [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:battle_the_general]]Lord[[/sl]] or to an individual [[sl:battle_units]]unit[[/sl]]. If available, army abilities may be browsed and activated from the [[sl_tooltip:battle_army_abilities_panel]]Army Abilities panel[[/sl_tooltip]].
The Army Abilities panel is only shown when army abilities are available.

Artillery [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]], such as cannons and catapults, can fire projectiles at the enemy over long distances. They are most useful against bunched [[sl:battle_infantry]]infantry[[/sl]] formations, [[sl:battle_monsters]]monsters[[/sl]], and the [[sl:battle_walls]]walls[[/sl]] of fortified cities.

Battles are fought between [[sl:battle_armies]]armies[[/sl]] to conquer or defend territory. Battles are won by killing or routing all enemy [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]], or by capturing the enemy settlement during a [[sl:battle_major_siege_battles]]major siege battle[[/sl]].

The battle interface is made up of many separate elements such as the [[sl_tooltip:battle_army_panel]]Army panel[[/sl_tooltip]] and its [[sl:battle_unit_cards]]Unit cards[[/sl]], the [[sl_tooltip:battle_radar_map]]radar map[[/sl_tooltip]], the [[sl:battle_winds_of_magic]]Winds of Magic[[/sl]] panel and the [[sl_tooltip:battle_unit_portrait_panel]]Unit Portrait panel[[/sl_tooltip]].
Khorne, the Chaos God of Blood and the Lord of Murder, exalts in endless slaughter. His blessings will be visited on those who shed blood in His name.
The Blood for the Blood God meter is only shown when playing a Khornate faction.
Move the camera in battle with the W, A, S and D keys. Orient the camera by holding the middle mouse button, and change the camera height with the scroll wheel.
Place the cursor over a victory or supply location icon to see more information about it.

Defensive features of a [[sl:battle_major_siege_battles]]major siege battle[[/sl]] or [[sl:battle_minor_settlement_battles]]minor settlement battle[[/sl]] such as [[sl:battle_gates]]gates[[/sl]], [[sl:battle_towers]]towers[[/sl]] and [[sl:battle_constructed_defences]]constructed defences[[/sl]] are all linked to capture locations. Whoever holds a capture location controls the features linked to it.
{{tr:hp_battle_constructed_defences_add_01}} {{tr:hp_battle_constructed_defences_add_02}}
{{tr:hp_battle_deployment_add_01}} {{tr:hp_battle_deployment_add_02}}
Members of the Cathayan imperial household are beings of tremendous power. They may transform from human to Dragon form (and back again) during combat, gaining different advantages when in each form.
The Drop Siege Equipment button is shown at the bottom of the screen when a unit that is carrying siege equipment is selected.
While the accuracy of a zombie firing a gun remains questionable, the damage caused by the pirate gunners of the Vampire Coast is increased while their ammunition level remains high.

Tzeentch, the Chaos God of Magic and Change, is drawn to those who wield magic in his name. He exalts in sorcery, and His benevolence will be visited upon those who crush the foe with incantations and [[sl:battle_spells]]spells[[/sl]].
The Eye of Tzeentch meter is only shown when playing a Tzeentchian faction.

Fire-at-Will is a [[sl:battle_unit_abilities]]unit ability[[/sl]] shared by all [[sl:battle_missile_units]]missile units[[/sl]]. When firing-at-will, [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] select their own targets to shoot at unless told otherwise.
{{tr:hp_battle_title_fire_at_will_link}}
[[sl:battle_units]]Units[[/sl]] fight most effectively against an enemy in front of them. {{tr:hp_battle_leadership_flanking_01}}
Some [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] fly high over the [[sl:battle_terrain]]terrain[[/sl]], either attacking at range or descending to engage the enemy in hand-to-hand fighting.
Multiple [[sl:battle_unit_selection]]selected units[[/sl]] may be assigned into a preset formation, in which they automatically take up positions in a specific arrangement.
The Formations button is shown at the bottom of the screen on the battle interface, and becomes active when more than one unit is selected.
Settlement gates are points of entry to a fortified city. They are key weak points that may be attacked in a [[sl:battle_major_siege_battles]]major siege battle[[/sl]].
The Group button is shown at the bottom of the screen on the battle interface, and becomes active when any unit is selected.

A selection of [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] may be grouped by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:battle_group_button]]Group button[[/sl_tooltip]] so that they may be easily re-selected in future. Grouped units are arranged together under a tab on the [[sl_tooltip:battle_army_panel]]Army panel[[/sl_tooltip]].
The Guard button is shown at the bottom of the screen on the battle interface, and becomes active when any unit that can guard is selected.
The Cathayans embrace of Harmony extends even to their martial practices. When complementary Cathayan [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] are close to one another, their combat performance is improved.

Infantry [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] are dense formations of men armed with [[sl:battle_melee_combat]]hand-to-hand weapons[[/sl]]. Massed ranks of infantry are the mainstay of most [[sl:battle_armies]]army[[/sl]] compositions.
{{tr:hp_battle_leadership_add_01}} {{tr:hp_battle_leadership_flanking_02}}
The sorcery of Tzeentch offers protection to His followers. All daemons that fight for the Raven God in battle are shielded from attack by magical barriers.

Major siege battles are fought over [[sl:battle_walls]]walled[[/sl]] cities. The attacker can capture the city by either [[sl:battle_leadership]]routing[[/sl]] all defending [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] or by capturing and holding one or more [[sl:battle_victory_locations]]victory locations[[/sl]].

As with other elements within the Celestial Empire, the Sorcerers of Cathay work best when they work together. Cathayan Sorcerers gain power with each additional magic-user who joins their [[sl:battle_armies]]army[[/sl]].

The outcome of any combat between [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] rests on many factors. The number of soldiers involved, their quality, size, [[sl:battle_vigour]]vigour[[/sl]], [[sl:battle_leadership]]leadership level[[/sl]], relative positioning and more are all factors in determining the result of any engagement.
The Melee Mode button is shown at the bottom of the screen on the battle interface, and becomes active when any unit that can toggle melee mode is selected.
{{tr:hp_battle_minor_settlement_battles_add_01}} {{tr:hp_battle_minor_settlement_battles_add_02}}
Missile [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] are best employed in battle to stand back from the action and fire projectiles at the enemy.
Monsters and giants are huge, powerful creatures that inspire terror into their enemies. They are best used for scattering and disrupting formations of enemy [[sl:battle_infantry]]infantry[[/sl]].
Mounted [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] are able to move quickly across [[sl:battle_terrain]]terrain[[/sl]], either in support of allied troops or to strike at the enemy where they are weakest.

Dark Elves perform worship to Khaine, the god of murder, through the shedding of blood in [[sl:battle_battle_game]]battle[[/sl]]. A Dark Elf [[sl:battle_armies]]army[[/sl]] will receive favour in the form of increased combat performance should they kill enough enemies during battle.

Nurgle, the Chaos God of Disease and the Lord of Pestilence, is also the God of Death by Rebirth. His benevolence is most keenly felt by those in need of His healing powers in [[sl:battle_battle_game]]battle[[/sl]].
The Plague Lord's Blessings meter is only shown when playing a Nurglish faction.

[[sl:battle_units]]Units[[/sl]] that are [[sl:battle_leadership]]routing[[/sl]] from the battlefield may rally and begin responding to orders again once they have retreated a safe distance from the enemy.
Certain Lizardmen [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] may rampage when they take too much damage in battle. Rampaging units will continue to fight but will no longer respond to orders.

As Tomb Kings warriors die on the battlefield, their spirits enter the Realm of Souls. As the Realm of Souls fills past certain thresholds, the [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] that remain will regenerate for short periods.

The Daemons of Chaos exalt in the subjugation of their enemies in battle. Glory is earned when a Daemon Prince lord or their Herald Lord followers inflict damage on enemy [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]].
Glory is only earned in battle by Daemon Prince lords, or their Herald lord followers.

Additional [[sl:battle_armies]]armies[[/sl]] drawn into a battle on the campaign map appear as reinforcements. Reinforcing armies appear at the edge of the battlefield [[sl:battle_terrain]]terrain[[/sl]] during the fighting.

Slaanesh, the Chaos God of Pleasure and the Lord of Excess, delights in new playthings. His favour will fall upon those who kill in His name, for a portion of those who fall can be revived so they truly know the meaning of pain…
The Sensuous Seductions meter is only shown when playing a Slaaneshi faction.
The attacker in a [[sl:battle_major_siege_battles]]major siege battle[[/sl]] may use rams and siege towers to destroy or overcome the settlement fortifications.
{{tr:hp_battle_title_skirmishing_link}}

Some [[sl:battle_missile_units]]missile units[[/sl]] can skirmish, whereby they automatically retreat when the enemy get too close. The skirmish ability may be toggled on a selected [[sl:battle_units]]unit[[/sl]] with the [[sl_tooltip:battle_skirmish_button]]Skirmish button[[/sl_tooltip]].

[[sl:battle_wizards]]Wizards[[/sl]] may cast powerful spells to turn the tide of battle. Available spells are shown on the [[sl_tooltip:battle_winds_of_magic_panel]]Winds of Magic panel[[/sl_tooltip]] when a Wizard unit is selected.

Such is the power of the [[sl:battle_winds_of_magic]]Winds of Magic[[/sl]] within the Realm of Chaos that Storms of Magic may sometimes occur. [[sl:battle_battle_game]]Battles[[/sl]] fought within them are subject to extreme levels of magic.

The defender in a [[sl:battle_major_siege_battles]]major siege battle[[/sl]] or [[sl:battle_minor_settlement_battles]]minor settlement battle[[/sl]] will earn [[img:icon_supplies]][[/img]]Supplies from any supply-point [[sl:battle_capture_locations]]capture locations[[/sl]] they hold. [[img:icon_supplies]][[/img]]Supplies may be spent on [[sl:battle_constructed_defences]]constructing defences[[/sl]].
Survival Battles may be fought at key points in a campaign. Key locations on the battlefield must be claimed, and multiple waves of enemy troops defeated, before victory can be claimed.
The Tactical Map provides a birds-eye view of the entire battlefield at once. Press the TAB key to toggle it on and off.

Terrain features on the battlefield can play a decisive role in any battle. Hills, mountains, forests and rivers can be used to [[sl:battle_visibility]]conceal troops[[/sl]] or funnel an enemy’s advance.
Each [[sl:battle_armies]]army[[/sl]] is led by a [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord in battle, who leads and encourages the troops with many unique [[sl:battle_unit_abilities]]abilities[[/sl]].
If a time limit applies in the current battle it will be shown at the top of the battle interface.
The defences of a fortified city will usually include fortified towers that can shoot missiles at attackers within their range of fire.
Most [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] have abilities that modify the unit’s behaviour or improve its capabilities for a short time. These can be activated or deactivated as the situation demands.

Each [[sl:battle_units]]unit[[/sl]] in the player’s army is represented on the [[sl:battle_battle_interface]]battle interface[[/sl]] by a Unit card. These are shown on the [[sl_tooltip:battle_army_panel]]Army panel[[/sl_tooltip]].

The Unit Details panel shows detailed information about the selected [[sl:battle_units]]unit’s[[/sl]] fighting strength. It can be toggled on and off with the [[sl_tooltip:battle_unit_details_button]]Unit Details button[[/sl_tooltip]] on the [[sl_tooltip:battle_unit_portrait_panel]]Unit Portrait panel[[/sl_tooltip]].
{{tr:hp_battle_unit_movement_add_01}} {{tr:hp_battle_unit_movement_add_05}}

A [[sl:battle_units]]unit[[/sl]] may be selected by either left-clicking it on the battlefield or by left-clicking on the associated [[sl:battle_unit_cards]]Unit card[[/sl]] on the [[sl_tooltip:battle_army_panel]]Army panel[[/sl_tooltip]]. Units must be selected before they can be issued with [[sl:battle_unit_movement]]orders[[/sl]].

A [[sl:battle_units]]unit’s[[/sl]] type broadly defines its capabilities, strengths and weaknesses. [[sl:battle_mounted_units]]Mounted units[[/sl]], for example, are generally swift but vulnerable against [[sl:battle_weapon_types]]spear weapons[[/sl]].
{{tr:hp_battle_units_add_01}} Each unit is independently controllable and represented on the [[sl:battle_battle_interface]]battle interface[[/sl]] by a [[sl:battle_unit_cards]]Unit card[[/sl]].

The Major Victory location and Key Building location found at the heart of a fortified city may be captured by the attacker in a [[sl:battle_major_siege_battles]]major siege battle[[/sl]] to gain [[sl_tooltip:battle_victory_tickets]]victory tickets[[/sl_tooltip]]. {{tr:hp_battle_victory_locations_add_04}}
The [[img:icon_victory_tickets]][[/img]]Victory Tickets currently held by the attacker are indicated on the progress bar at the top of the battle interface.

Soldiers tire as they [[sl:battle_unit_movement]]run[[/sl]] and fight, meaning that they cannot engage in combat as effectively. The vigour level of a [[sl:battle_units]]unit[[/sl]] is shown on its tooltip.

Hills and other [[sl:battle_terrain]]terrain[[/sl]] features that block line-of-sight can be used to conceal [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] from the enemy. An [[sl:battle_armies]]army[[/sl]] must have line-of-sight to an enemy in order for it to be visible.
Fortified settlements are surrounded by walls, on which the defender may position [[sl:battle_units]]troops[[/sl]] to resist the attacker.

[[sl:battle_infantry]]Infantry[[/sl]], [[sl:battle_mounted_units]]mounted units[[/sl]] and other types of [[sl:battle_units]]unit[[/sl]] may bear different types of weapon in battle, each type being suited to different purposes.

The Winds of Magic provide [[sl:battle_wizards]]spellcasters[[/sl]] with their source of power. The available magic is depleted when a [[sl:battle_spells]]spell[[/sl]] is cast, but recharges slowly over time.

Magic-wielding Wizard [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] may tap into the [[sl:battle_winds_of_magic]]Winds of Magic[[/sl]] to cast powerful [[sl:battle_spells]]spells[[/sl]]. These spells can be used to empower allies or to sow destruction amongst the caster’s enemies.
Large, powerful units like [[sl:battle_monsters]]monsters[[/sl]] and giants are particularly effective against settlement gates.
The [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]]leadership level of a [[sl:battle_units]]unit[[/sl]] is a measure of its will to continue fighting.
The [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]]leadership level of a unit is affected by several factors, such as casualties taken and being attacked in the flank.
A unit will take more casualties and its [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]][[sl:battle_leadership]]leadership level[[/sl]] will suffer when attacked in the flank or the rear.
If the [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]]leadership level of a unit drops too low then the troops will rout from the battlefield and stop responding to orders.
Learn more about Magic Barriers [[url:script_link_battle_magic_barriers]]here[[/url]].
Most [[sl:battle_infantry]]infantry[[/sl]] units can scale walls using ladders.
Minor settlement battles are fought over smaller settlements that lack fortified [[sl:battle_walls]]walls[[/sl]].
The attacker can win the battle and capture the settlement by defeating all defending [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]].

The defender should seek to stop the attacker from gaining control of any [[sl:battle_victory_locations]]victory locations[[/sl]] - particularly the Major Victory Location, which grants its holder a large number of [[img:icon_victory_tickets]][[/img]][[sl_tooltip:battle_victory_tickets]]Victory Tickets[[/sl_tooltip]] over time.
Damage caused to the city in battle will be reflected on the campaign map afterwards.
Hold shift when right-clicking to enqueue a waypoint, or hold shift and drag a path for units with the right mouse button.
Advice history can be navigated using the [[sl_tooltip:battle_advice_history_buttons]]back and forwards button[[/sl_tooltip]] on the Advisor panel.
The defending army is surprised on the march, and starts the battle in an unfavourable position on the battlefield.
Orders are given to units in an army, not individual soldiers.
The armour level of a [[sl:battle_unit_selection]]selected unit[[/sl]] and the strength of any shield that they bear is indicated on the [[sl:battle_unit_details_panel]]Unit Details panel[[/sl]].
The costs, effects and cooldowns of an army ability may be viewed by placing the cursor over an army ability button.
Artillery units move slowly, and their crews are vulnerable if engaged in hand-to-hand fighting.
Armies may [[sl:battle_deployment]]deploy[[/sl]] their troops prior to battle, unless they have been [[sl:battle_ambush_battles]]ambushed[[/sl]].
The [[sl_tooltip:battle_balance_of_power]]balance of power indicator[[/sl_tooltip]] shows the current relative strengths of allied versus enemy forces.

When playing as a Khornate faction, a [[sl_tooltip:battle_blood_for_the_blood_god_meter]]progress meter[[/sl_tooltip]] on the [[sl:battle_battle_interface]]battle interface[[/sl]] builds as kills are made. Kills made by either side in a [[sl:battle_battle_game]]battle[[/sl]] count towards the total.
The camera may also be rotated with the Q and E keys, and the camera height may be adjusted with Z and X.

[[sl:battle_gates]]Gates[[/sl]] and [[sl:battle_towers]]towers[[/sl]] in a fortified city are each linked to a nearby capture location. Should the attacker capture a capture location linked to a gate or tower then they will gain use of it.
{{tr:hp_battle_constructed_defences_add_03}} {{tr:hp_battle_constructed_defences_add_06}}
Units can be placed anywhere within their deployment area. They are immediately repositioned when moved.

Cathayan Legendary Lords may be transformed from human to Dragon form by using the Transformation of the Dragon [[sl:battle_unit_abilities]]unit ability[[/sl]], shown around the [[sl:battle_unit_details_panel]]Unit Details panel[[/sl]] when the Lord's [[sl:battle_units]]unit[[/sl]] is selected.

The Extra Powder [[sl:battle_unit_abilities]]unit ability[[/sl]] increases the damage of [[sl:battle_missile_units]]missile units[[/sl]] in a Vampire Coast [[sl:battle_armies]]army[[/sl]] while their ammunition level is above 80% of its starting value.

When playing as a Tzeentchian faction, a [[sl_tooltip:battle_eye_of_tzeentch_meter]]progress meter[[/sl_tooltip]] on the [[sl:battle_battle_interface]]battle interface[[/sl]] builds as [[sl:battle_spells]]spells[[/sl]] are cast by Tzeentchian forces.
Toggle fire-at-will on a selected unit with the [[sl_tooltip:battle_fire_at_will_button]]Fire-at-Will button[[/sl_tooltip]].
A unit will suffer a sudden drop to its [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]]leadership level if charged in the flank or rear. If the shock is great enough the unit may break and rout.
Like [[sl:battle_mounted_units]]mounted units[[/sl]], flying units can be rapidly deployed to strike at a vulnerable target or reinforce a weak point in the [[sl:battle_armies]]army[[/sl]].
Available formations may be browsed by clicking on the [[sl_tooltip:battle_formations_button]]Formations button[[/sl_tooltip]] when multiple units are selected.
Gates present key points of weakness that may be assaulted with [[sl:battle_siege_weapons]]battering rams[[/sl]], [[sl:battle_artillery]]artillery[[/sl]], or melee units.
A unit group may be selected by clicking the tab shown on the Army panel, or by pressing the number key shown on the tab.

All Cathayan units except [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:battle_the_general]]Lords[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes are aligned to either Yin or Yang. A unit’s alignment is displayed on its [[sl:battle_unit_cards]]Unit card[[/sl]].

Infantry units are often heavily armed and may be [[sl:battle_armour]]armoured[[/sl]], but are generally slow and vulnerable to being outranged by [[sl:battle_missile_units]]missile units[[/sl]] or outmanoeuvred by [[sl:battle_mounted_units]]mounted units[[/sl]].
The [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]]leadership state of a unit is shown on its tooltip.

Damage taken by a Tzeentchian [[sl:battle_units]]unit[[/sl]] in battle will be first applied to its magical barrier. Once the strength of the barrier is depleted, the unit itself will begin to take damage.
The fortifications that surround the city must be overcome by the attacker if they are to gain victory.
The magical effects of a Cathayan Sorcerers’ [[sl:battle_spells]]spells[[/sl]] are increased for each additional magic-user present in an army.

The [[sl:battle_unit_details_panel]]Unit Details panel[[/sl]] shows information about the performance and attributes of any [[sl:battle_unit_selection]]selected unit[[/sl]]. Toggle the [[sl_tooltip:battle_unit_details_button]]Unit Details button[[/sl_tooltip]] on and either left-click or place the mouse cursor over a unit to view details about it.
The defender may win by either defeating all attacking units or holding them off until the [[sl_tooltip:battle_time_limit]]time limit[[/sl_tooltip]] expires.
Missile units will automatically fire at foes within their arc of fire if Fire-at-Will is active. Their arc of fire is displayed when selected or when the cursor is over it.
Monsters and giants can also be used to attack the [[sl:battle_gates]]gates[[/sl]] in a [[sl:battle_major_siege_battles]]major siege battle[[/sl]].
Mounted troops are highly [[sl:battle_unit_movement]]manoeuvrable[[/sl]], but generally more expensive and fewer in number than [[sl:battle_infantry]]infantry[[/sl]].
A visual effect is shown on a Dark Elf army that is experiencing murderous prowess.

When playing as a Nurglish faction, a [[sl_tooltip:battle_plague_lords_blessings_meter]]progress meter[[/sl_tooltip]] on the [[sl:battle_battle_interface]]battle interface[[/sl]] builds as damage is taken by Nurglish units during conflict.

A unit will not rally if there is no [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:battle_the_general]]Lord[[/sl]] still present in the [[sl:battle_armies]]army[[/sl]], or if its [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]]leadership state becomes shattered.
Control over rampaging units may be restored after a short time if their fury subsides.
The Realm of Souls bar is displayed at the top of the battle interface when playing as a Tomb Kings faction.

A [[sl_tooltip:battle_reign_of_chaos_meter]]glory meter[[/sl_tooltip]] on the battle interface builds as Daemons of Chaos lords deal damage to their enemies. More glory is earned when the damage is dealt to strong enemy units.
Reinforcements may take time to appear, during which the army being reinforced is at risk of being defeated in detail.

When playing as a Slaaneshi faction, a [[sl_tooltip:battle_sensuous_seductions_meter]]progress meter[[/sl_tooltip]] on the [[sl:battle_battle_interface]]battle interface[[/sl]] builds as kills are made by the forces of Slaanesh.
Siege weapons are manned by attacking [[sl:battle_infantry]]infantry[[/sl]]. {{tr:hp_battle_siege_weapons_add_02}}
Activate the Skirmish ability to have missile units try to automatically manage a safe distance to the enemy.
Left-click a spell button and then left-click the target to cast a spell.
Magical reserves never deplete during a battle fought within a Storm of Magic, allowing [[sl:battle_spells]]spells[[/sl]] to be cast with impunity.

Each supply location held by the defender earns them an amount of [[img:icon_supplies]][[/img]]Supplies over time. The more supply locations the defender holds, the greater their income of [[img:icon_supplies]][[/img]]Supplies during the battle.
The attacking player must clear successive key locations of enemies during a Survival Battle.
The positions of all known enemy and allied [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] are shown on the tactical map.
Most [[sl:battle_unit_types]]troop-types[[/sl]] can be hidden in forests.

[[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords provide a variety of bonuses for the [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] they command. These can be improved by spending skill points on the [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord in campaign.
Towers will aid the defenders in a [[sl:battle_major_siege_battles]]major siege battle[[/sl]] by automatically firing on the attackers as they approach.
[[sl:battle_skirmishing]]Skirmishing[[/sl]] and [[sl:battle_fire_at_will]]fire-at-will[[/sl]] are common examples of unit abilities.
The number of soldiers remaining in a unit, the unit’s experience level and its remaining ammunition, if any, are indicated on its Unit card.

With the [[sl_tooltip:battle_unit_details_button]]Unit Details button[[/sl_tooltip]] toggled on, either left-click or place the mouse cursor over a unit to view details about it. With one unit selected, the mouse cursor may be placed over another to show the differences between them.
{{tr:hp_battle_unit_movement_add_02}} This also displays more information about visible units on their banners.
Left-click away from a unit to deselect any selected units.
[[sl:battle_infantry]]Infantry[[/sl]] units are generally slow, but heavily armed and [[sl:battle_armour]]armoured[[/sl]].
One or more units may be [[sl:battle_unit_selection]]selected[[/sl]] at any time. [[sl:battle_unit_movement]]Movement orders[[/sl]] are issued to all selected units.
Victory locations behave much like [[sl:battle_capture_locations]]capture locations[[/sl]], and are captured and defended in the same manner.
Troops recover vigour slowly over time if allowed to stand still.
Enemy units are also not visible beyond a maximum range, even if there is line of sight.
During a [[sl:battle_major_siege_battles]]major siege battle[[/sl]] the attacker must either:
Swords, axes and maces are general-purpose melee weapons, being particularly effective against spearmen.
The magic currently available to the player’s [[sl:battle_armies]]army[[/sl]] is indicated in the centre of the [[sl_tooltip:battle_winds_of_magic_panel]]Winds of Magic panel[[/sl_tooltip]].
Wizards are often also the [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:battle_the_general]]Lord[[/sl]] of the [[sl:battle_armies]]army[[/sl]], or a [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero from the campaign map.
Hold CTRL when right-clicking and dragging out a formation to walk units into their specified positions. This is useful when concealing units in forested [[sl:battle_terrain]]terrain[[/sl]].
Advice history can be reset on the game options so that previously-seen advice will be shown again.
Each unit in the player’s army is represented by a [[sl:battle_unit_cards]]Unit card[[/sl]]. These are shown on the [[sl_tooltip:battle_army_panel]]Army panel[[/sl_tooltip]].
Heavily-armoured units are ideal for sending in to situations where lots of physical damage is expected.
Artillery units generally have very limited ammunition.
If the battle is fought at a settlement then the victor gains control of it on the campaign map.
Press P to pause the battle or ESC to get to the game menu.
Blood for the Blood God [[sl:battle_army_abilities]]army abilities[[/sl]] become active when the meter exceeds certain marked levels.
The camera behaviour can be adjusted by selecting a different camera mode from the game options.
{{tr:hp_battle_capture_locations_add_01}} {{tr:hp_battle_capture_locations_add_02}}
Different types of defences such as towers and barricades may be constructed in different build locations. As the defender, left-click on a build location and select an option to begin construction.
The attacker deploys before the defender. The defender may view the attacker’s arrangement during their own deployment.
In Dragon form, a Cathayan Legendary Lord has greater mobility and power in combat; in human form, they can more greatly amplify [[sl:battle_harmony]]Harmony[[/sl]].
The ammunition level of a unit may be increased by the unique abilities of the Gunnery Wight [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero.
The Eye of Tzeentch [[sl:battle_army_abilities]]army abilities[[/sl]] become active when the meter exceeds certain marked levels.
Turn fire-at-will off to conserve ammunition, or to prevent casualties being inflicted on allied troops fighting nearby.
Arrange [[sl:battle_infantry]]infantry[[/sl]] units in a line so that each covers the flank of the next.
Flying units can engage each other in hand-to-hand fighting without descending onto the terrain.
Units assigned into a formation are automatically placed into a [[sl:battle_grouping]]group[[/sl]].
{{tr:hp_battle_gates_add_01}} Once a gate is destroyed it can no longer prevent the attacker from entering the city.
A unit group may be locked by selecting the group and pressing CTRL+G. Locked groups keep their relative formation when moving.
Nearby [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord and [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero characters can amplify the effects of Battle Harmony.

Infantry are strong against enemies in front of them but are vulnerable when attacked in the [[sl:battle_flanking]]flank[[/sl]] or rear. Infantry often fight in a battle line, with each unit protecting the flank of the next.
A unit’s banner flashes and then turns white when it wavers and routs.
The strength of a unit's magic barrier is indicated on the HUD in battle, and on each [[sl:battle_unit_cards]]Unit card[[/sl]] when playing a Tzeentchian faction.

The attacker may use [[sl:battle_siege_weapons]]siege weapons[[/sl]], [[sl:battle_artillery]]artillery[[/sl]], or [[sl:battle_monsters]]monsters[[/sl]] to attack the fortified [[sl:battle_walls]]walls[[/sl]], [[sl:battle_gates]]gates[[/sl]] and [[sl:battle_towers]]towers[[/sl]].

[[sl:battle_armour]]Armour[[/sl]] worn by units in battle will automatically deflect an amount of physical damage inflicted by [[sl:battle_infantry]]melee[[/sl]] or [[sl:battle_missile_units]]missile[[/sl]] attacks.
{{tr:hp_battle_point_8_major_siege_battles}}

Some missile units fire with a high trajectory so they shoot over other units at their target. However, crossbows and rifles fire with a flat trajectory, requiring an elevated position to fire above friendly units. Missile units will not fire if they cannot hit their target.
The size of monsters and giants makes them vulnerable to attacks by [[sl:battle_missile_units]]missile[[/sl]] weapons and [[sl:battle_weapon_types]]spears[[/sl]].

A mounted charge can impart a big [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]][[sl:battle_leadership]]leadership[[/sl]] shock to an enemy, particularly if delivered to the [[sl:battle_flanking]]flank[[/sl]] or rear of an enemy unit.
Plague Lord's Blessings [[sl:battle_army_abilities]]army abilities[[/sl]] become active when the meter exceeds certain marked levels.

[[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords with the rally [[sl:battle_unit_abilities]]unit ability[[/sl]] may use it to raise the [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]]leadership of routing units close-by, so that they may return to the action.
The bar will fill as the player's army takes casualties.
Reign of Chaos [[sl:battle_army_abilities]]army abilities[[/sl]] become active when the meter exceeds certain marked levels.
Sensuous Seduction [[sl:battle_army_abilities]]army abilities[[/sl]] become active when the meter exceeds certain marked levels.

The defenders may attack and destroy approaching siege equipment with [[sl:battle_missile_units]]missile units[[/sl]] or [[sl:battle_artillery]]artillery[[/sl]]. [[sl:battle_towers]]Towers[[/sl]] may also be instructed to target approaching equipment.
Skirmishing units may be run down if [[sl:battle_vigour]]fatigued[[/sl]], trapped by [[sl:battle_terrain]]terrain[[/sl]] features, or chased down by [[sl:battle_mounted_units]]faster units[[/sl]].

Many spells may be overcast by left-clicking on the spell button a second time before casting. An overcast spell has a greater effect, but also a chance of being miscast and dealing damage to the caster.
A random Lore of Magic will become ascendant at the beginning of a Storm of Magic battle, granting significant bonuses to all [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] present.
The defender owns all supply locations in the settlement at the start of the battle.

After each key location is cleared of enemies, the attacking player can expect a large counterattack. There will be a short period to construct defences at each key location before the counterattack begins.
Enemy units that are not [[sl:battle_visibility]]visible[[/sl]] on the battlefield will not be shown on the tactical map.
Units with the high ground enjoy a significant advantage when fighting on sloped terrain.

The [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord's unit provides a [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]][[sl:battle_leadership]]leadership[[/sl]] boost to nearby troops. The area of this effect is shown as a blue circle around a [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord unit when the cursor is placed over them.
Each tower is linked to a nearby [[sl:battle_capture_locations]]capture location[[/sl]]. Ownership of the capture location confers ownership of the tower.
The Melee ability may be activated for missile units to force them to only engage the enemy hand-to-hand.
The tooltip on a Unit card displays more information about the status of the unit.

Tooltips on the various statistics and effects shown describe their meaning and consequences in more detail. See the page on [[sl:battle_melee_combat]]melee combat[[/sl]] for more information about the meaning of the various statistics and effects.
{{tr:hp_battle_unit_movement_add_03}} {{tr:hp_battle_unit_movement_add_04}}
Select multiple [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] by left-clicking and dragging a box across the [[sl:battle_terrain]]terrain[[/sl]].
Missile units are usually lightly [[sl:battle_armour]]armoured[[/sl]] and vulnerable to attack by mounted troops.
More [[sl:battle_advanced_controls]]advanced control-methods[[/sl]] are also available to manoeuvre selected units.

[[sl_tooltip:battle_capture_location_icons]]Victory and supply location icons[[/sl_tooltip]] are shown at the top of the [[sl:battle_battle_interface]]battle interface[[/sl]] when playing a siege battle, where applicable.
An [[sl:battle_armies]]army[[/sl]] that has been force-marched on the campaign map will be tired if brought to battle.
Seek to control high ground to get an overview of the battlefield [[sl:battle_terrain]]terrain[[/sl]].
Scale the walls using ladders or [[sl:battle_siege_weapons]]siege towers[[/sl]].
Spears are most effective against larger targets like mounted units, and can be braced to negate a charge.
The tooltip on this indicator shows the recharge speed.
The spells available to a Wizard are shown on the [[sl_tooltip:battle_winds_of_magic_panel]]Winds of Magic panel[[/sl_tooltip]] when the wizard is [[sl:battle_unit_selection]]selected[[/sl]].
Hold ALT, and left-click and drag on a selection on the [[sl:battle_terrain]]terrain[[/sl]] to move units in formation.
One or more armies fight on each side in a battle.
Armour offers no protection against [[sl:battle_spells]]magical attacks[[/sl]], and can be circumvented by armour-piercing damage.
The [[sl:battle_fire_at_will]]fire-at-will[[/sl]] [[sl:battle_unit_abilities]]unit ability[[/sl]] can be deactivated to prevent an artillery unit wasting its ammunition on undesired targets.
The strength of a defeated army is greatly reduced after a battle, affecting the controlling faction’s ability to continue the war.

The Radar Map shows the position of allied and enemy [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] at a glance, while the [[sl:battle_tactical_map]]Tactical Map[[/sl]] shows a more in-depth overview of the battlefield.
Technologies may be researched in campaign to gain access to more Blood for the Blood God army abilities.
Camera controls and other key mappings may be reconfigured from the game options.
As long as a supply location is held by the defender it generates [[img:icon_supplies]][[/img]][[sl:battle_supplies]]Supplies[[/sl]], which the defender can put towards constructing defences.
{{tr:hp_battle_constructed_defences_add_04}} Construction during [[sl:battle_deployment]]deployment[[/sl]] is completed immediately, but takes some time if started in battle.
Vanguard [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] are not constrained during deployment phase as other units are, and may be positioned outside of their army’s deployment zone for the start of battle.
The Extra Powder effect may be seen on the [[sl:battle_unit_details_panel]]Unit Details panel[[/sl]] when an affected missile unit is selected.
Technologies may be researched in campaign to gain access to more Eye of Tzeentch army abilities.
Flying units are most vulnerable to attack from [[sl:battle_missile_units]]missile units[[/sl]] that can shoot at them while airborne, and from [[sl:battle_spells]]spells[[/sl]].
Ungroup the units to break the formation.

Gates will open for whoever controls them. The attacker may capture a gate by gaining control of the linked [[sl:battle_capture_locations]]capture location[[/sl]], which will be close by inside the city walls.
A group of units may be assigned into a [[sl:battle_formations]]formation[[/sl]] by clicking the formations button.

[[sl:battle_formations]]Formations[[/sl]] which place Yin and Yang units close to one another will benefit from Battle Harmony effects. Battle Harmony effects make Cathayan armies stronger when kept in formation, but weaker when drawn out of position.

Infantry troops can carry a variety of [[sl:battle_weapon_types]]weapon types[[/sl]] such as swords, spears, and axes. Infantry with the anti-large attribute are suited to take down large units like cavalry and [[sl:battle_monsters]]monsters[[/sl]], but will not fare well against other infantry.
{{tr:hp_battle_leadership_add_02}} Units can be demoralised by allies routing, meaning that a [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]]leadership failure can propagate across an [[sl:battle_armies]]army[[/sl]].
The strength of a magic barrier recovers slowly over time when the unit it protects is not under attack.
{{tr:hp_battle_major_siege_battles_add_01}} Select an infantry unit and right-click a wall piece to issue this order when attacking a city.

Weapon or missile strength represents the damage the soldiers in a unit do with each strike that lands on an enemy. Weapon strength is split between base damage, which may be reduced by [[sl:battle_armour]]armour[[/sl]], and armour-piercing damage which is always applied.
{{tr:hp_battle_point_9_major_siege_battles}}

Missile units are usually lightly [[sl:battle_armour]]armoured[[/sl]] and weak in [[sl:battle_melee_combat]]melee[[/sl]]. [[sl:battle_skirmishing]]Skirmish mode[[/sl]] may be activated on a missile unit to allow it to automatically retreat from an advancing foe.
Mounted troops are useful for quickly picking off weak or isolated units.
Technologies may be researched in campaign to gain access to more Plague Lord's Blessings army abilities.
The rally ability is best used when the routing units are safe from immediate danger.
Once the bar is filled entirely, powerful Ushabti units will be available for summoning through the use of an [[sl:battle_army_abilities]]army ability[[/sl]].
Technologies may be researched in campaign to gain access to more Sensuous Seduction army abilities.
Battering rams are best employed against fortified [[sl:battle_gates]]gates[[/sl]].
Wind and breath spells can be directed by holding the left mouse button and dragging.

Spells cast by either side fill a Magical Charge bar on the Storm of Magic [[sl:battle_army_abilities]]army ability[[/sl]] slot. Once filled, a Cataclysm Spell associated with the currently ascendant Lore becomes available.
Only the defender in a siege battle may earn [[img:icon_supplies]][[/img]]Supplies or construct defences, but the attacker may capture Supply locations to deny their benefits to the defender.
An enemy greater Daemon must be defeated before a Survival Battle is won.
Units may be [[sl:battle_unit_selection]]selected[[/sl]] and given [[sl:battle_unit_movement]]orders[[/sl]] on the tactical map.
Steep slopes are impassable, and may be used to cover the [[sl:battle_flanking]]flank[[/sl]] of an [[sl:battle_armies]]army[[/sl]].
Army [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]]leadership will suffer greatly if the [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord dies or is routed.
When controlled, the missile fire of a tower may be directed by left-clicking the icon above the tower and right-clicking the desired target.
Other abilities unique to that unit are shown on the Unit Portrait panel.
A Unit card will flash red when the unit it represents comes under attack, and will turn grey when that unit is [[sl:battle_leadership]]routing[[/sl]].
Use the R key to toggle units between running and walking. Use the Halt button or the Backspace key to order selected units to halt.
Hold shift or CTRL when left-clicking a unit or Unit card to add it to the current selection.
[[sl:battle_monsters]]Monsters[[/sl]] are tough but vulnerable against spear and missile troops.
Banners are displayed above units on the battlefield and indicate the unit’s [[sl:battle_unit_types]]type[[/sl]], strength and allegiance.
{{tr:hp_battle_victory_locations_add_02}} {{tr:hp_battle_victory_locations_add_03}}
[[sl:battle_flying_units]]Flying units[[/sl]] can be used to gain line-of-sight to the enemy.
Breach the walls with [[sl:battle_artillery]]artillery[[/sl]] or [[sl:battle_monsters]]monstrous units[[/sl]] that can break walls.
Detailed information about the combat strengths of a selected unit can be found on the [[sl:battle_unit_details_panel]]Unit Details panel[[/sl]].
The total available magic is indicated by the [[sl_tooltip:battle_power_reserve_bar]]power reserve bar[[/sl_tooltip]] on the Winds of Magic panel.
Wizards are usually vulnerable to physical attack.
Units in Guard mode won’t pursue a fleeing enemy. Guard mode can be activated by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:battle_guard_button]]Guard button[[/sl_tooltip]].
An army is always led by a [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:battle_the_general]]Lord[[/sl]].

Armoured units are still susceptible to armour-piercing weapon damage, which armour does not block. A unit’s weapon strength is split between base damage and armour-piercing; when one unit strikes another the base damage will be reduced by armour, while the armour-piercing damage is not.
If a battle features a [[sl_tooltip:battle_time_limit]]time limit[[/sl_tooltip]] and it expires, the defenders win.
The battle can be sped up or slowed down with the [[sl_tooltip:battle_time_controls]]time controls[[/sl_tooltip]].
Press the Delete key with a unit selected to move the camera into first-person mode.
[[sl:battle_victory_locations]]Victory locations[[/sl]] behave like capture locations but can determine control of the entire settlement.
The defender has no chance to deploy during an [[sl:battle_ambush_battles]]ambush battle[[/sl]].
Certain [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:battle_the_general]]Lords[[/sl]] and [[sl:battle_wizards]]Wizards[[/sl]] can gain mounts that can fly.
A selected group of units may be ungrouped by clicking the Group button again.
Some hybrid infantry units can also carry missile weapons in addition to their melee weapons. These units may be instructed to attack hand-to-hand by holding ALT when right-clicking the enemy.
Once away from danger, routing units may [[sl:battle_rallying]]rally[[/sl]] of their own accord and start responding to orders again.

The attacker may take [[sl:battle_capture_locations]]capture locations[[/sl]] to gain control of gates and towers, and to deny the use of [[sl:battle_constructed_defences]]constructed defences[[/sl]] to the defender.
Some missiles can also do explosive damage, which affects nearby units.

Selected missile units may be put into Melee mode by clicking the Melee Mode button, forcing them to engage in hand-to-hand combat only. Missile units may also be instructed to fight in melee by holding ALT when issuing an attack order.
Mounted troops are vulnerable against [[sl:battle_weapon_types]]spear weapons[[/sl]] or in prolonged engagements.
Siege Towers may be used by the attacker to gain access over the top of the [[sl:battle_walls]]walls[[/sl]].
Some Wizards may be switched between different spell lores by clicking the buttons on the [[sl_tooltip:battle_lore_panel]]Lore panel[[/sl_tooltip]].
Cataclysm Spells are extremely powerful and become available to all armies involved in a battle for a short time.
The tactical map is not available when playing on Legendary difficulty.
Hills and other terrain features can obscure visibility, allowing units to hide from their enemy’s line of sight.
{{tr:hp_battle_towers_add_01}} Attackers may also destroy towers with [[sl:battle_artillery]]artillery[[/sl]].

Other information indicated on a Unit card includes whether the subject unit is [[sl:battle_unit_movement]]moving[[/sl]], firing [[sl:battle_missile_units]]missile weapons[[/sl]], or being fired upon.
Units may be [[sl:battle_grouping]]grouped[[/sl]] by pressing G to allow easy re-selection.
[[sl:battle_flying_units]]Flying units[[/sl]] are fast but vulnerable against missiles.
Unit behaviour is influenced by [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]][[sl:battle_leadership]]leadership[[/sl]] and [[sl:battle_vigour]]vigour[[/sl]] levels.

{{tr:hp_battle_victory_locations_add_01}} If the defender holds the Key Building location they gain a small income in [[img:icon_supplies]][[/img]][[sl:battle_supplies]]Supplies[[/sl]], whereas an attacker which captures it gains a small income in [[img:icon_victory_tickets]][[/img]][[sl_tooltip:battle_victory_tickets]]Victory Tickets[[/sl_tooltip]].
Most units can hide in forests, even within line of sight.
Circumvent the walls by attacking the [[sl:battle_gates]]gates[[/sl]].
The amount of magic available at the start of battle varies, and may be gambled upon a single time.
Multiple selected units may be [[sl:battle_grouping]]grouped[[/sl]] by pressing G, and placed in [[sl:battle_formations]]formations[[/sl]].
An army may be [[sl:battle_reinforcements]]reinforced[[/sl]] by additional units or armies coming onto the battlefield during the fighting.
The tooltip of the Weapon Strength bar on the [[sl:battle_unit_details_panel]]Unit Details panel[[/sl]] shows details of how that [[sl:battle_units]]unit[[/sl]] applies its attack damage.
The [[sl:battle_advisor]]advisor[[/sl]] appears from time to time to offer information to the player.
The [[sl:battle_unit_details_panel]]Unit Details panel[[/sl]] can be toggled on and off to show detailed information about the unit that's selected.
Double-left-click on a [[sl:battle_unit_cards]]Unit card[[/sl]] to zoom the camera to the associated unit.
{{tr:hp_battle_point_2_victory_locations}}

Attacking infantry may pick up and use [[sl:battle_siege_weapons]]siege weapons[[/sl]] during a [[sl:battle_major_siege_battles]]major siege battle[[/sl]] to attack the enemy [[sl:battle_walls]]walls[[/sl]].
Vampiric units do not rout but begin to crumble instead, while Daemonic units do not rout but become unstable. In each case, the unit continues to fight but takes damage over time.

The attacker may capture [[sl:battle_victory_locations]]victory locations[[/sl]] to gain [[img:icon_victory_tickets]][[/img]][[sl_tooltip:battle_victory_tickets]]Victory Tickets[[/sl_tooltip]]. The attacker will win the battle if enough [[img:icon_victory_tickets]][[/img]]Victory Tickets are gained.
Soldiers fighting hand-to-hand will sometimes miss their attacks. The chance of a strike missing its target depends on the attack and defence of the [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] involved.
The tooltip on each spell button shows more information about that spell.
