Once the Cataclysm Spell timer reaches zero, or both sides use the Cataclysm Spell, the Magical Charge bar empties and a new Lore of Magic becomes ascendant.
Double-left-click on a Unit card to zoom the [[sl:battle_camera_controls]]camera[[/sl]] to the associated unit.
[[sl:battle_wizards]]Wizards[[/sl]] are powerful but vulnerable against physical attack.
Some units have [[sl:battle_unit_abilities]]abilities[[/sl]] that can be used to turn the tide of battle.
The Key Building location is of less importance to defend, but the attacker may still gain enough [[img:icon_victory_tickets]][[/img]]Victory Tickets to win by capturing it.
Walls are vulnerable to Ogre [[sl:battle_armies]]armies[[/sl]] as their [[sl:battle_infantry]]infantry units[[/sl]] are strong enough to break walls.

Many units do not deal any armour-piercing damage. Some units are specialised in dealing armour-piercing damage, however, making them an ideal choice to engage armoured foes in [[sl:battle_melee_combat]]combat[[/sl]].

The attacker may begin the capturing process by clearing the defenders out of a capture location and positioning a [[sl:battle_units]]unit[[/sl]] within it. Summoned units and units that can [[sl:battle_flying_units]]fly[[/sl]] are not able to capture locations.
The defender may station units on the walls to defend them, and may direct the fire of [[sl:battle_towers]]wall towers[[/sl]] against the enemy.

Units with high melee attack have a greater chance to land their strikes, while units with high melee defence have a greater chance to dodge incoming melee attacks. Melee defence does not protect against missiles or magic attacks.
Walls may also be damaged by the attacker before the battle by using hero actions in campaign.
Some units bear shields, which have a chance to block small missiles received from the front. Shields have no effect against melee strikes, magic, or attacks from the side or rear.
The capture process takes a short time. A capture location is taken once the defender’s flag is run down the central flagpole and the attacker’s flag is run up.
The defender can win by either defeating all attacking [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] or holding them off until the [[sl_tooltip:battle_time_limit]]time limit[[/sl_tooltip]] expires.

Units will charge the final distance when running to engage the enemy. Charging awards a bonus to melee attack and damage. The charge bonus for the selected unit is indicated on the [[sl:battle_unit_details_panel]]Unit Details panel[[/sl]].
The capture process may be interrupted by the defender counter-attacking. The defender may also retake a capture location.

Supply-point [[sl:battle_capture_locations]]capture locations[[/sl]] grant [[img:icon_supplies]][[/img]][[sl:battle_supplies]]Supplies[[/sl]] to the defender if held by them. [[img:icon_supplies]][[/img]]Supplies can be spent on [[sl:battle_constructed_defences]]constructing defences[[/sl]] in build locations within the settlement.
If the defender loses a supply location to the attacker, any constructed defences linked to it will be destroyed.
These build locations are each linked back to a Supply-point capture location, which must be held for defences to be constructed.

Siege weapons are manned by attacking [[sl:battle_infantry]]infantry[[/sl]], and may be attacked and destroyed by defenders with [[sl:battle_missile_units]]missile units[[/sl]] or [[sl:battle_artillery]]artillery[[/sl]].
Units may be instructed to drop any equipment they are manning, in which case it can then be picked up by other attacking [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]].

Sensuous Seductions army abilities are only available to Slaaneshi factions

Storm of Magic Battles

This is shown at the top of the screen on the battle interface.

[[sl_tooltip:battle_unit_abilities_link]]Unit Abilities[[/sl_tooltip]]
Unit Abilities for a selected unit are shown at the bottom of the screen on the battle interface.

{{tr:hp_battle_point_5_unit_cards}}

[[sl_tooltip:battle_winds_of_magic_link]]Winds of Magic[[/sl_tooltip]]
The Winds of Magic panel is shown at the bottom of the screen on the battle interface.
Wizards
The attacker may capture a tower by gaining control of its [[sl:battle_capture_locations]]capture location[[/sl]], and then turn its fire against the defender.
Right-click a position on the battlefield [[sl:battle_terrain]]terrain[[/sl]] to order a selected [[sl:battle_units]]unit[[/sl]] to move there.
Hold down the Spacebar to view unit movement destinations.
Right-click on the [[sl:battle_terrain]]terrain[[/sl]] and drag out a formation to move [[sl:battle_unit_selection]]selected units[[/sl]] to precise positions.
Drag from left to right to ensure that [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] are facing forwards.
Right-click on an enemy unit to order a [[sl:battle_unit_selection]]selected[[/sl]] unit to attack.
[[sl:battle_armies]]Armies[[/sl]] on the battlefield are made up of units of many individual troops.
Each fortified city also contains a Key Building location which, if held by the defender, grants a boost to their [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] within the fortifications.

Each fortified city contains a Major Victory Location which grants a large income in [[img:icon_victory_tickets]][[/img]][[sl_tooltip:battle_victory_tickets]]Victory Tickets[[/sl_tooltip]] to the attacker if captured.
The defender should strive to prevent the attacker from capturing this location at all costs.
The attacker will win the battle if they gain enough victory tickets.
An attacker which captures the Key Building location will gain a small income in [[img:icon_victory_tickets]][[/img]][[sl_tooltip:battle_victory_tickets]]Victory Tickets[[/sl_tooltip]].
Learn more about allegiance [[url:script_link_campaign_allegiance]]here[[/url]].

[[sl:campaign_factions]]Factions[[/sl]] with closely-aligned goals may choose to form a [[img:icon_defensive_alliance]][[/img]]defensive or military [[img:icon_military_alliance]][[/img]]alliance through [[sl:campaign_diplomacy]]diplomacy[[/sl]].
Each party in a [[img:icon_defensive_alliance]][[/img]]defensive alliance agrees to join a war if the other is attacked.
Each party in a [[img:icon_military_alliance]][[/img]]military alliance agrees to join wars that the other starts.
Learn more about alliances [[url:script_link_campaign_alliances]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about ambushes [[url:script_link_campaign_ambushes]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about Atamans [[url:script_link_campaign_atamans]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about banners [[url:script_link_campaign_banners_and_marks]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about Big Names [[url:script_link_campaign_big_names]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about Bloodletting [[url:script_link_campaign_bloodletting]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about buildings [[url:script_link_campaign_buildings]]here[[/url]] and settlements [[url:script_link_campaign_settlements]]here[[/url]].

Changing of the Ways actions can be viewed and instigated on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_changing_of_the_ways_panel]]Changing of the Ways panel[[/sl_tooltip]] when playing a Tzeentchian [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]].
Learn more about Changing of the Ways [[url:script_link_campaign_changing_of_the_ways]]here[[/url]].

[[sl:campaign_war]]War[[/sl]] is automatically declared whenever the forces of [[sl:campaign_khorne]]Khorne[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_nurgle]]Nurgle[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_tzeentch]]Tzeentch[[/sl]] or the [[sl:campaign_daemons_of_chaos]]Daemons of Chaos[[/sl]] encounter non-Chaos races, and peace agreements cannot be brokered.

The servants of [[sl:campaign_slaanesh]]Slaanesh[[/sl]] do not automatically declare war, and have some ability to manipulate non-Chaos races through [[sl:campaign_diplomacy]]diplomacy[[/sl]] by using [[sl:campaign_seductive_influence]]Seductive Influence[[/sl]].
Learn more about Chaos Cults [[url:script_link_campaign_chaos_cults]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about Gifts of Chaos [[url:script_link_campaign_chaos_gifts]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about Chaos [[url:script_link_campaign_chaos]]here[[/url]].
[[sl:campaign_characters]]Characters[[/sl]] gain a new skill point each time they increase in rank.

Mounts that can be ridden in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]] are available for some characters via skills. By mounting up, important [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Hero[[/sl]] characters become much more mobile in battle.
Learn more about character skills [[url:script_link_campaign_character_skills]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about the Wu Xing Compass [[url:script_link_campaign_compass]]here[[/url]].
Confederation is more likely to be agreed between two factions if mutual relations are very good.
Learn more about confederation [[url:script_link_campaign_confederation]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about Cyclical Buildings [[url:script_link_campaign_cyclical_buildings]]here[[/url]].

Some Daemonic Gifts will change the appearance of the Daemon Prince [[sl:campaign_lords]]Lord[[/sl]]. Once unlocked, body alterations can be equipped on the [[sl:campaign_character_details_panel]]Character Details panel[[/sl]].
Current Daemonic Glory levels are shown and Gifts may be claimed on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_daemonic_glory_panel]]Daemonic Glory panel[[/sl_tooltip]].
[[sl_tooltip:campaign_daemonic_gifts]]Daemonic Gifts[[/sl_tooltip]] are unlocked as Daemonic Glory is earned with each Chaos God.
Learn more about Daemonic Glory [[url:script_link_campaign_daemonic_glory]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about Dark Authority [[url:script_link_campaign_dark_authority]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about Dark Fortresses and Chaos Altars [[url:script_link_campaign_dark_fortress]]here[[/url]].
The advice history buttons are shown on the Advisor panel.
The advisor appears from time to time to offer assistance to the player. The level of advice can be reduced or minimised through the game options.
The Advisor button can be found in the top-left of the screen on the user interface.

[[img:icon_allegiance]][[/img]]Allegiance is built up between [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] that maintain long-running [[img:icon_military_alliance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_alliances]]alliances[[/sl]] as a measure of their mutual support. With sufficient [[img:icon_allegiance]][[/img]]allegiance, a faction may call on its ally to offer [[sl:campaign_war_coordination]]targeted military assistance[[/sl]].

{{tr:hp_campaign_alliances_add_01}} [[img:icon_military_alliance]][[/img]]Allied factions commit at least to defending one another from foreign attack, and may optionally go to [[sl:campaign_war]]war[[/sl]] together.
The Allied Recruitment panel may be opened from the Army panel when a controlled army is selected. It becomes available only once an outpost has been constructed.

Amanar is an ancient sea monster with the strength to decimate entire [[img:icon_transport_fleet]][[/img]]fleets and [[img:icon_port]][[/img]]ports when it strikes. Those whose lives are bound to the sea must be especially wary of the creature’s attack.

[[img:icon_amber]][[/img]]Amber is obtained each time the [[sl:campaign_wood_elves]]Wood Elves[[/sl]] complete a Ritual of Rebirth to heal a forest and when they win their final battle in any campaign. It can be offered to the spirits of the Ancients in return for their power via the research of certain [[sl:campaign_technology]]technologies[[/sl]].

An [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] may lie in wait for its enemies by entering [[img:icon_ambush_stance]][[/img]]Ambush [[sl:campaign_stances]]stance[[/sl]], in which it will remain hidden to enemy armies until they wander into the trap.
[[sl:campaign_factions]]Factions[[/sl]] may raise military forces to attack enemy armies or [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]], or to defend territory at home.

[[sl:campaign_armies]]Armies[[/sl]] can move over lakes and [[sl:campaign_sea]]seas[[/sl]] but take time to construct and dismantle their [[img:icon_transport_fleet]][[/img]]fleets as they transition between the land and the water.

An [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] or [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Hero[[/sl]] may be selected by left-clicking and then moved by right-clicking. If the destination is further than the army can move in one [[sl:campaign_turns]]turn[[/sl]] then the movement will happen over multiple turns.
The Army panel appears when an [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] is selected, and shows [[sl:campaign_unit_cards]]Unit Cards[[/sl]] and other information relating to that army.

Asrai Lookouts are minor [[sl:campaign_wood_elves]]Wood Elf[[/sl]] [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]]. Wood Elves may create Asrai Lookouts across the entire [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] by capturing non-forest settlements from rival [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] where [[sl:campaign_elven_halls]]Elven Halls[[/sl]] cannot be built.

[[sl:campaign_lizardmen]]Lizardmen[[/sl]] armies may adopt [[img:icon_astromancy_stance]][[/img]]Astromancy [[sl:campaign_stances]]stance[[/sl]] to allow them to sense their surroundings more effectively. A Lizardmen [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] in [[img:icon_astromancy_stance]][[/img]]Astromancy stance is much harder to surprise or evade.

Atamans are governors appointed to oversee territory on behalf of [[sl:campaign_kislev]]Kislev’s[[/sl]] rulers. They confer benefits where they are assigned to [[sl:campaign_income]]income[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_public_order]]control[[/sl]], [[img:icon_growth]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_growth]]growth[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_corruption]]corruption[[/sl]].
The Atamans button is displayed on the main campaign interface when playing a Kislev faction.
The Atamans panel can be opened from the main campaign interface when playing a Kislev faction.

Hostile [[sl:campaign_terrain_types]]terrain types[[/sl]] such as snowy wastes, deep ocean, deserts and swamps will cause [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]]attritional casualties in any [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] that moves through them.
The Auto-Resolve button is shown on the Pre-Battle screen prior to battle.
[[sl:campaign_battles]]Battles[[/sl]] involving the player can be auto-resolved so that the game automatically determines their outcome.
The balance of power between the two sides contesting the battle is indicated on the Pre-Battle panel.

A [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] will feel the effects of bankruptcy should it run out of {{tr:icon_money}}[[sl:campaign_money]]{{tr:hp_campaign_money_term}}[[/sl]]. [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_public_order]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term_sentence_start}}[[/sl]] will suffer greatly, and unpaid troops will desert their [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]].

[[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] may gain banners from victory in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]]. These may be granted to [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]] that the [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord commands to improve their capabilities in battle.

An [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] may attack foreign armies or [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]], leading to [[sl:campaign_war]]war[[/sl]] between the [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] involved. Instruct a selected army to attack a target by right-clicking on it.

Beast-paths permeate the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] and can be used by [[sl:campaign_beastmen]]Beastmen[[/sl]] to navigate through otherwise-impassable [[sl:campaign_terrain_types]]terrain[[/sl]].

Savage hybrids of human and animal, the primal, Beastmen strike out from deep within the dark forests of the Old World. They strive to reduce the civilised [[sl:campaign_races]]races[[/sl]] to madness and Ruin.

[[img:icon_bestial_rage]][[/img]]Bestial Rage is a measure of the [[sl:campaign_beastmen]]Beastmen's[[/sl]] fervour for battle, enabling them to attract more followers and [[img:icon_growth]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_horde_growth]]grow[[/sl]] to expand the [[sl:campaign_hordes]]horde[[/sl]]. As a Beastmen army [[img:icon_raiding_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_raiding]]raids[[/sl]], its Bestial Rage increases to grant other useful benefits.

Certain Ogre [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Heroes[[/sl]] can earn Big Names by performing various feats that impress their fellow [[sl:campaign_ogre_kingdoms]]Ogres[[/sl]]. A Big Name, once adopted, confers various bonuses related to the chosen title.

Black Arks are great floating fortresses of war, torn from the earth by the mighty magic of the [[sl:campaign_dark_elves]]Dark Elves[[/sl]]. They terrorise the [[sl:campaign_sea]]seas[[/sl]], roaming in support of the [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] of the Dark Elves on land.

The spawning pools of the [[sl:campaign_lizardmen]]Lizardmen[[/sl]] will occasionally bring forth an especially gifted set of warriors. By completing a [[sl:campaign_missions]]mission[[/sl]], a Lizardmen [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] will be able to [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]recruit[[/sl]] these blessed spawnings, who have superior abilities to those of their ordinary counterparts.
The Blessed Spawnings button is only shown when such a spawning is available.
The Blessings of the Lady provide protection in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]] for [[sl:campaign_bretonnia]]Bretonnians[[/sl]] who have shown heroism through their previous actions.
[[img:icon_blood_kiss]][[/img]]Blood Kisses can also be obtained via [[img:icon_vassal]][[/img]]vassalising factions.

An autonomous host – a Blood Voyage – will appear when a [[sl:campaign_death_night]]Death Night[[/sl]] is initiated by the [[sl:campaign_dark_elves]]Dark Elf[[/sl]] Crone Hellebron. Once incited, it will descend upon the enemies of Har Ganeth in a murderous fury.

Blood-grounds are the hunting grounds of the [[sl:campaign_beastmen]]Beastmen[[/sl]] created whenever a Herdstone is raised in a conquered settlement. Causing Devastation within a Blood-ground enables a tribe to increase its standing with the Dark Gods by earning [[img:icon_marks_of_ruination]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_marks_of_ruination]]Marks of Ruination[[/sl]] to advance their campaign.

By continually defeating enemies and avoiding extended periods of inactivity, Khornate [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] can receive the [[sl:campaign_khorne]]Blood God’s[[/sl]] blessings in return for their relentless slaughter.

Ancient and terrible power still courses through the Bloodlines of the Midnight Aristocracy. Through the time-worn practice of the [[img:icon_blood_kiss]][[/img]][[sl_tooltip:campaign_blood_kiss]]Blood Kiss[[/sl_tooltip]] that power may yet be awakened.
Unlock and upgrade Bloodlines through the Bloodline panel.
The nine accursed Books of Nagash are the most powerful source of Necromantic magic in the world, sought after by certain factions to use for their own purposes.
Details about a Book of Nagash may be viewed by selecting it on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_books_of_nagash_panel]]Books of Nagash panel[[/sl_tooltip]].

For many generations, the dukes of Bretonnia have defended their lands from evil. The king calls an Errantry War whenever the lands of Bretonnia are threatened, bringing the dukes and their Knights together to drive out the invaders in the Lady’s [[sl:campaign_blessing_lady]]blessed[[/sl]] name.

The [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] of the Repanse de Lyonesse [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] can delay the cloying thirst brought on by the scorching desert sun by taking on [[img:water_supplies]][[/img]]supplies from their [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] before venturing into the desert.

A [[sl:campaign_bretonnia]]Bretonnian[[/sl]] Knight’s way of life is built on a code of honour, under which solemn Knightly Vows are taken in service to their King and the Lady. By completing various pledges, characters can progress towards ultimately finding the Grail and attaining the Lady’s blessings.
The Building Browser may be opened from the Province Overview panel or Building panel, and shows a list of all buildings that may be built in the selected province or horde army.

The Building panel shows [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]] within a selected [[sl:campaign_hordes]]horde army[[/sl]], along with information about the [[sl:campaign_horde_growth]]growth[[/sl]] within and {{tr:icon_income}}income generated by that horde.
Tabs on the Army panel allow the display to be switched between units and buildings when a controlled horde army is selected.

[[sl:campaign_buildings]]Buildings[[/sl]] in a [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]] are constructed in slots. New slots are unlocked in a settlement when the primary settlement building is upgraded.
With a horde army selected, click the Building tab on the Army panel to show the Building panel.

Buildings may be constructed within a [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]] by the [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] that controls it to boost its production capabilities or defences. Building construction and repair options may be browsed on the [[sl:campaign_province_overview_panel]]Province Overview panel[[/sl]].
{{tr:hp_campaign_point_1_campaign_controls}} {{tr:hp_campaign_point_2_campaign_controls}}

Strategic moves are played out in the campaign game. [[sl:campaign_factions]]Factions[[/sl]] wage [[sl:campaign_war]]war[[/sl]] and make [[img:icon_military_alliance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_alliances]]alliances[[/sl]] in an effort to capture [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] territory from one another.
The campaign map is the [[sl:campaign_campaign_game]]game[[/sl]] theatre in which [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] are raised, commanded, and destroyed.

[[img:icon_jars]][[/img]]Canopic Jars are used by [[sl:campaign_tomb_kings]]Tomb Kings[[/sl]] to preserve the entrails of the deceased. They may be gathered after victory in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]], and are primarily used by the [[sl:campaign_mortuary_cult]]Mortuary Cult[[/sl]] to craft magic [[sl:campaign_character_details]]items[[/sl]] and awaken [[sl:campaign_regiments_of_renown]]Regiments of Renown[[/sl]].

Far to the east of the Old World lies the Empire of the Celestial Dragon. While scarcely known to its counterparts in the west, its power and wealth places Grand Cathay amongst the greatest realms of men.

The followers of [[sl:campaign_tzeentch]]Tzeentch[[/sl]], the master manipulator, may at times alter the structure of reality itself to better suit His aims. Such Changing of the Ways can alter the fate of nations.
The Changing of the Ways panel lists Changing of the Ways actions when playing a Tzeentch faction.

The Gods of Chaos glory in destruction and carnage. Their followers wage brutal [[sl:campaign_war]]war[[/sl]] in their name, slaughtering in service to the Ruinous Powers. The mortal [[sl:campaign_races]]races[[/sl]] must be ever-vigilant against threats of both Chaos invasion from abroad, and [[img:icon_corruption_chs]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_chaos_corruption]]Chaos corruption[[/sl]] from within.

The [[sl:campaign_beastmen]]Beastmen[[/sl]] and the [[sl:campaign_warriors_of_chaos]]Warriors of Chaos[[/sl]] erect Artefacts of worship to the [[sl:campaign_chaos]]Ruinous Powers[[/sl]] in [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] that they [[sl:campaign_razing]]raze[[/sl]]. These spread [[img:icon_corruption_chs]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_chaos_corruption]]Chaos corruption[[/sl]] to nearby settlements.

The followers of [[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]] spread various forms of [[sl:campaign_corruption]]corruption[[/sl]] wherever they infiltrate, [[img:icon_raiding_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_raiding]]raid[[/sl]] and conquer. This corruption subverts the weak and despoils the land, making it unsuitable for those not aligned with the Ruinous Powers.

The feeble minds of mortals are easily corrupted by the whispers of Daemonkind. Chaos Cults may spontaneously form in [[sl:campaign_provinces]]provinces[[/sl]] where [[sl:campaign_chaos_corruption]]Chaos corruption[[/sl]] has taken hold, allowing servants of [[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]] to infiltrate further and construct hidden cult [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]].

The Chaos Dwarfs ruthlessly excavate, manufacture and stockpile, ever seeking ways to increase their power and dominion by exploiting everyone and everything they encounter to achieve their goals, no matter the cost.

The [[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos Gods[[/sl]] offer powerful gifts to their [[sl:campaign_warriors_of_chaos]]Warriors of Chaos[[/sl]] champions, empowering them in return for the mortal [[img:icon_souls_resource]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_souls_resource]]Souls[[/sl]] sacrificed in their name.

The [[sl:campaign_realm_of_chaos]]Realm of Chaos[[/sl]] is separate from the physical world. Ordinarily unreachable to mortals, rifts opened by the roars of the God-Bear [[sl:campaign_ursun]]Ursun[[/sl]] now allow some passage through.
Chapter objectives are issued in the campaign as the player's faction grows, and can be seen on the Objectives panel.
Any available skill points for a selected character are shown on both the Character Info panel and the Character Details panel.

[[sl:campaign_characters]]Characters[[/sl]] gain [[sl:campaign_character_skills]]rank and skills[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_magic_items]]magic items[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_banners_and_marks]]banners[[/sl]], [[sl_tooltip:campaign_followers]]followers[[/sl_tooltip]], and develop [[sl_tooltip:campaign_character_traits]]traits[[/sl_tooltip]] as they perform successful actions. A character's progress can be reviewed on the [[sl:campaign_character_details_panel]]Character Details panel[[/sl]].
The Character Details button is shown on the Character Info panel when a controlled character is selected.

The Character Details panel can be opened from the [[sl:campaign_character_info_panel]]Character Info panel[[/sl]], and shows [[sl:campaign_character_details]]character details[[/sl]] such as [[sl:campaign_character_skills]]rank & skills[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_banners_and_marks]]banners[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_magic_items]]magic items[[/sl]] and [[sl_tooltip:campaign_character_traits]]traits[[/sl_tooltip]].
The Abilities section lists abilities and spells that the selected character is able to use in battle.
The Character Stats section lists essential combat stats for the selected character in battle.
The Details button on the Character Details panel can be clicked to show character information such as traits, items, followers and banners.
The Details, Traits & Effects section lists essential information about the selected character, their traits, and the effects active on them in campaign and battle.
The Quests button on the Character Details panel can be clicked to show quests for the selected character.
The Skills button on the Character Details panel can be clicked to show learned and available skills.

The Character Info panel appears in the bottom-left of the screen when a [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lord[[/sl]] or [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Hero[[/sl]] is selected on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]]. It shows the portrait of the selected [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero or [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lord[[/sl]], their remaining [[sl_tooltip:campaign_movement_range]]movement range[[/sl_tooltip]] and other information.

[[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Heroes[[/sl]] increase in rank and gain skill points over time as they perform actions on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]]. Skill points can be spent unlocking new skills for them.
A character's traits are shown on the Character Details panel.

[[sl:campaign_factions]]Factions[[/sl]] are defended by [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Hero[[/sl]] characters. Each character has its own attributes that can benefit or sometimes hinder the faction.

[[sl:campaign_chaos_dwarfs]]Chaos Dwarfs[[/sl]] have a powerful Industrial Economy that requires careful management of [[img:icon_labour]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_labour]]Labour[[/sl]], [[img:icon_workload]][[/img]]Workloads, [[img:icon_raw_materials]][[/img]]Raw Materials extraction and [[img:icon_armaments]][[/img]]Armaments assembly lines. If a single cog fails, their entire industrial machine may falter.

Acts of [[img:icon_chivalry]][[/img]]Chivalry exemplify the Knightly Order for [[sl:campaign_bretonnia]]Bretonnian factions[[/sl]]. Great benefits are bestowed upon those who follow the Grail Companions' code.

A commandment may be issued by a [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] in a [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]] it controls completely. Commandments provide powerful bonuses, and may be issued from the [[sl:campaign_province_info_panel]]Province Info panel[[/sl]].

The Wu Xing Compass is a powerful [[sl:campaign_cathay]]Cathayan[[/sl]] artefact that can redirect the [[sl:campaign_winds_of_magic]]Winds of Magic[[/sl]], deflecting them towards key locations in Cathay for different benefits.
The Compass panel can be opened by clicking the Wu Xing Compass button on the main campaign interface when playing a Cathay faction.
Every region a Chaos Dwarf factions owns generate Conclave Influence each turn, Tower settlements and Temple of Hashut buildings generate additional Conclave Influence.

Conclave Influence can be spent to claim powerful rewards in the Tower of Zharr. Conclave Influence is gained through expanding your territory, and by raising towers and temples in the name of the Dark Father; Hashut. For each Region your Faction controls, and for each Tower or Temple of Hashut building you construct, you will gain a small amount of Conclave Influence every turn.

[[sl:campaign_factions]]Factions[[/sl]] of the same [[sl:campaign_races]]race[[/sl]] may choose to [[img:icon_confederation]][[/img]]confederate into one faction if conditions between them are right. [[img:icon_confederation]][[/img]]Confederation can be agreed via [[sl:campaign_diplomacy]]diplomacy[[/sl]].
[[sl:campaign_ogre_kingdoms]]Ogre[[/sl]] factions may be offered Contracts from time to time by other powers that wish to direct some blunt military force against their enemies.
The Contracts panel can be opened by clicking the Contracts button on the main campaign interface when playing an Ogre Kingdoms faction. The button is inactive if no contracts are active.

Corruption is a measure of [[img:icon_corruption_chs]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]], [[img:icon_corruption_vmp]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_vampires]]Vampiric[[/sl]], [[img:icon_corruption_skv]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_skaven]]Skaven[[/sl]], [[img:icon_corruption_kho]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_khorne]]Khorne[[/sl]], [[img:icon_corruption_nur]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_nurgle]]Nurgle[[/sl]], [[img:icon_corruption_sla]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_slaanesh]]Slaanesh[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_corruption_tze]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_tzeentch]]Tzeentch[[/sl]] influence in a [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]], and is shown on the [[sl:campaign_province_info_panel]]Province Info panel[[/sl]]. Excessive corruption in a province can lead to [[sl:campaign_public_order]]unrest[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_attrition]]attrition[[/sl]], and eventually an uprising if left unchecked.

Some [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]] available to [[sl:campaign_nurgle]]Nurglish[[/sl]] factions progress through an organic growth-and-decay Lifecycle. Once constructed, they continue to develop by themselves if conditions are right.
Daemonic Gifts are listed on the Daemonic Glory panel.

[[sl:campaign_daemons_of_chaos]]Daemons of Chaos[[/sl]] seek power and glory through the favour of the [[sl:campaign_chaos]]Ruinous Powers[[/sl]]. By their deeds they may earn favour with each of the four Chaos Gods, gaining potent new customisations and abilities as they do so.
The Daemonic Glory panel can be opened from the main campaign interface when playing a Daemon Prince faction.

Daemon Princes are mortal champions of [[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]], risen to Daemonhood by the Ruinous Powers. They may specialise their appearance and abilities by seeking the glory of the Chaos Gods they serve.

[[sl:campaign_warriors_of_chaos]]Warriors of Chaos[[/sl]] [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Heroes[[/sl]] exert Dark Authority over their [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] based on their allegiance to one (or none, if Undivided) of the four Chaos Gods, benefiting their marked (or Undivided) units.

The [[img:icon_loyalty]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_loyalty]]loyalty[[/sl]] demonstrated by the [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] of the [[sl:campaign_dark_elves]]Dark Elves[[/sl]] towards their masters varies as circumstances change. Their treachery must be kept in check to prevent them rebelling and forming a new [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]].

Millennia have passed since the Dark Elves, or Druchii in the Elven tongue, violently split from the [[sl:campaign_high_elves]]High Elves[[/sl]]. Banished from Ulthuan, the spiteful and wicked Dark Elves plot the demise of their former brethren from Naggaroth, their home continent. They have been ruled throughout their long history by Malekith, the Witch King.

[[sl:campaign_warriors_of_chaos]]Warriors of Chaos[[/sl]] can construct [[img:icon_dark_fortress]][[/img]]Dark Fortresses, sprawling Chaos [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] which they use as centres of power to exert their Ruinous influence. Some [[img:icon_dark_fortress]][[/img]]Dark Fortresses are also [[sl:campaign_norscan_homelands]]Norscan Homeland[[/sl]] capitals, allowing the [[sl:campaign_vassalage]]vassalisation[[/sl]] of entire Norscan tribes when occupied.

[[sl:campaign_tomb_kings]]Tomb Kings[[/sl]] factions awaken units they wish to field in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]], and do not need to pay [[img:icon_money]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_money]]money[[/sl]] for their [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]recruitment[[/sl]] or upkeep. The number of [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]] of each type that may be fielded is determined by constructed military [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]].

To retain her youth and power the [[sl:campaign_dark_elves]]Dark Elf[[/sl]] Crone Hellebron must scour the lands of her enemies, enslaving and using them for sport during ‘Death Night', a festival of murder which renews Hellebron and Har Ganeth’s power.
Only Har Ganeth and its ruler, Crone Hellebron, may initiate a Death Night.

A [[sl:campaign_daemons_of_chaos]]Daemon Prince[[/sl]] that gains sufficient [[sl:campaign_daemonic_glory]]Daemonic Glory[[/sl]] with any of the [[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]] pantheon may choose to Dedicate themselves, gaining substantial new powers and permanently aligning their fate with their chosen deity.

Above all other factions of [[sl:campaign_high_elves]]High Elves[[/sl]], Avelorn is responsible for safeguarding Ulthuan against evil. It will suffer penalties should any territory on Ulthuan fall into enemy hands.
Only Avelorn and its ruler, Alarielle, receive bonuses or penalties for the safeguarding of Ulthuan.

The temptations of [[sl:campaign_slaanesh]]Slaanesh[[/sl]] attracts Devotees from far and wide to His service. Devotees are used for the raising of [[sl:campaign_disciple_armies]]Disciple Armies[[/sl]], for the proliferation of Slaaneshi [[sl:campaign_chaos_cults]]Chaos Cults[[/sl]], and for other purposes.
A breakdown of Devotees income may be viewed by placing the mouse cursor over the Devotees counter at the top of the campaign interface.

Devotion to the Motherland is built by [[sl:campaign_kislev]]Kislevite[[/sl]] factions as they perform acts that strengthen their kingdom. Once gained, Devotion may be used to perform [[sl:campaign_motherland]]Invocations of the Motherland[[/sl]] and gain [[img:icon_supporters]][[/img]][[sl_tooltip:campaign_supporters_track]]Supporters[[/sl_tooltip]].
The level of Devotion is shown at the top of the main campaign interface when playing a Kislev faction.
Place the mouse cursor over the Devotion icon to see a breakdown of Devotion sources.

[[sl:campaign_factions]]Factions[[/sl]] may engage in diplomacy with one another. Diplomatic actions include declarations of [[sl:campaign_war]]war[[/sl]] and peace, [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_trade]]trade[[/sl]] agreements, [[img:icon_military_alliance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_alliances]]alliances[[/sl]] and more.
Attitude icons on the Diplomacy screen and elsewhere indicate one faction's standing towards another. The cursor tooltip on each icon gives more information about the relationship.
The Diplomacy button is shown next to the End Turn button on the campaign interface.
The Diplomacy screen shows either a list of factions or details of the diplomatic agreement currently being proposed.

[[sl:campaign_diplomacy]]Diplomacy[[/sl]] is conducted on the Diplomacy screen, which may be opened at any time by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_diplomacy_button]]Diplomacy button[[/sl_tooltip]] on the user interface.

The [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] of [[sl:campaign_slaanesh]]Slaanesh[[/sl]] may be able to raise military support from amongst the [[sl:campaign_devotees]]Devotees[[/sl]] of the Dark Prince when campaigning in territory where [[sl:campaign_chaos_corruption]]Slaanesh Corruption[[/sl]] has taken hold.
Those that serve [[sl:campaign_khorne]]Khorne[[/sl]] thrive on slaughter and devastation. {{tr:hp_campaign_drawn_to_destruction_add_01}}

[[sl:campaign_beastmen]]Beastmen[[/sl]] can invoke the [[sl:campaign_chaos]]Dark Gods[[/sl]] to empower their [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] in more targeted ways through use of [[img:icon_dread]][[/img]]Dread. Primarily received from winning [[sl:campaign_battles]]battles[[/sl]], Dread can be used for a variety of upgrades such as increasing the recruitment capacity of units and summoning other [[img:icon_lord]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Legendary Lords[[/sl]] of the Beastmen.

The Great Drill of Hashut is a piece of diabolical machinery whose operation is the [[sl:campaign_chaos_dwarfs]]Chaos Dwarfs’[[/sl]] main objective in the Realm of Chaos campaign, allowing them to dig deep enough to gather a rare and coveted source of arcane strength – the Blood of Hashut.

The campaign interface features drop-down lists that summarise information such as controlled [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]]. These lists are viewed by clicking the various list buttons.
The Dwarfs are an ancient [[sl:campaign_races]]race[[/sl]] of stout, hardened warriors. Led by their kings, they march through the mountains to settle old scores.

[[sl:campaign_tomb_kings]]Tomb Kings[[/sl]] may align themselves with their ancient ancestors by researching dynastic [[sl:campaign_technology]]technologies[[/sl]] on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_dynasties_panel]]Dynasties panel[[/sl_tooltip]]. In doing so, they may unlock the ability to recruit more [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Heroes[[/sl]].
The Dynasties panel may be opened by clicking the Dynasties button on the campaign interface.

[[sl:campaign_wood_elves]]Wood Elf[[/sl]] factions can appoint [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] of sufficient [[sl:campaign_character_details]]character rank[[/sl]] to positions of Office to confer bonuses on them.

Elven Halls are major [[sl:campaign_wood_elves]]Wood Elf[[/sl]] [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] found within the forest of Athel Loren and other Magical Forests around the world. They contain many more [[sl:campaign_building_slots]]building slots[[/sl]] than [[sl:campaign_asrai_lookouts]]Asrai Lookouts[[/sl]].

The Empire is the largest domain of man within the Old World, defended against the various evils that face it by the discipline and bravery of its [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]]. The [[sl:campaign_settlements]]burghs and cities[[/sl]] of the Empire stand as beacons of civilisation in a savage world.

The Emperor intends to expand the [[sl:campaign_empire]]Empire's[[/sl]] borders and establish colonies throughout the world. Dispatched with only limited supplies, the Huntsmarshal's Expedition have been entrusted with this mandate and are scouring the jungles of Lustria for their many great riches.

The lands beyond the [[sl:campaign_empire]]Empire[[/sl]] are a hostile place. Imperial Expedition forces that win offensive [[sl:campaign_battles]]battles[[/sl]] and harass local inhabitants will suffer increased levels of [[img:emp_hostility]][[/img]]Hostility, but will gain standing with the Emperor and increase the rate at which [[img:emp_imperial_supply]][[/img]]Imperial Supplies reach the expedition.

The Empire is known for its [[img:emp_elector_counts]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_summon_elector_counts]]Elector Counts[[/sl]] and internal politics that leave it in a permanent state of unrest and constant [[sl:campaign_war]]war[[/sl]]. However, increasing [[img:emp_prestige]][[/img]]Prestige and ultimately [[img:emp_imperial_authority]][[/img]]Imperial Authority will help bring stability to the Empire.

By managing their relationships with the [[img:emp_elector_counts]][[/img]]Elector Counts, [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] of the [[sl:campaign_empire]]Empire[[/sl]] may bring it under one rule through peaceful confederation or civil war. [[sl:campaign_confederation]]Confederation[[/sl]] within the Empire brings rewards including powerful effects, State Troops [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]], and the Electors' unique Runefang swords.
Scattered across the world are some of the finest hunters to ever have lived. Players of the Huntsmarshal's Expedition can seek to track them down and acquire their services.

As the Administrator of the Realm, Yuan Bo is able to harness the full potential of the [[sl:campaign_compass]]Wu Xing Compass[[/sl]] by unlocking four unique and powerful compass directions, allowing the Jade Court to provide great boons for all [[sl:campaign_cathay]]Cathay[[/sl]].

The [[sl:campaign_sea]]oceans[[/sl]] sometimes throw up chance encounters, such as wrecked vessels or shifting islands. [[sl:campaign_armies_at_sea]]Armies at sea[[/sl]], close to such encounters, may be able to extract plunder from them.
The End Turn button is displayed in the bottom-right of the campaign interface.

[[sl:campaign_high_elves]]High Elves[[/sl]] use canny political manoeuvering and extensive spy networks to manage their allies. High Elf [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] get more [[sl:campaign_allegiance]]allegiance points[[/sl]] and have improved allied [[sl:campaign_outposts]]outposts[[/sl]] that generate [[img:icon_influence]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_influence]]influence[[/sl]].
The Events list may be viewed by clicking the Events button on the campaign interface.

Herald [[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]], despite their own undeniable power, exist merely to augur the coming of Exalted Greater Daemons to the armies of the [[sl:campaign_chaos]]Ruinous Powers[[/sl]]. These fearsome Daemons are the most powerful of all servants of Chaos.
There are many interface panels that may be used by the player to help manage their [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]]. Explore them by clicking the various buttons on the user interface.

[[sl:campaign_factions]]Factions[[/sl]] must not ignore civic management if they are to avoid ruin. {{tr:icon_income}}Income must be balanced against expenditure and controlled territory must be [[sl:campaign_province_management]]managed effectively[[/sl]] if victory is to be achieved.
The Faction Summary button is shown in the top-right of the campaign interface.
The Records tab is displayed on the Faction Summary screen, and shows a browsable history of the player's progress.

The Faction Summary screen shows information and statistics about the player’s [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]], along with a historical record of important events that have happened in the [[sl:campaign_campaign_game]]game[[/sl]] so far.
The Statistics tab is shown on the Faction Summary screen, and shows statistics relating to the player's faction.
The Summary tab is shown on the Faction Summary screen, and gives an overview of the player's faction.

Factions are tribes, peoples or nations on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] that control [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]], amass [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] and make [[sl:campaign_war]]war[[/sl]] with one another. The player takes command of a faction when playing the [[sl:campaign_campaign_game]]campaign game[[/sl]].
The Known Factions list may be viewed by clicking the Known Factions button on the campaign interface.

[[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] within a pirate faction of the [[sl:campaign_vampire_coast]]Vampire Coast[[/sl]] can be assigned to a position of Fleet Office once they have achieved a sufficient character [[sl:campaign_character_skills]]rank[[/sl]], granting them a senior role within the grand fleet. Positions of office confer bonuses on the Lords that occupy them, as well as improving their [[img:icon_loyalty]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_loyalty]]loyalty[[/sl]].

Unexplored areas on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] are obscured by the fog of war. The fog of war may be lifted by sending an [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] or [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Hero[[/sl]] to explore in that direction.
The followers associated with a [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord or [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero may be viewed or transferred on the Character Info panel while that character is selected.

[[sl:campaign_skaven]]Skaven[[/sl]] factions rely on the availability of a stockpile of [[img:icon_skaven_food]][[/img]]food. While bonuses are received when [[img:icon_skaven_food]][[/img]]food is plentiful, penalties are suffered when [[img:icon_skaven_food]][[/img]]food is scarce.
The [[img:icon_skaven_food]][[/img]]Food bar is shown at the top of the screen when playing as a Skaven faction.
The Lords & Heroes list may be viewed by clicking the Lords & Heroes button on the campaign interface.

The Forge of Souls, where slain Daemons are reborn as Soul-Grinders, lies deep within the [[sl:campaign_realm_of_chaos]]Realm of Chaos[[/sl]]. It is currently the prison of [[sl:campaign_ursun]]Ursun[[/sl]], the God-Bear of the [[sl:campaign_kislev]]Kislev[[/sl]] people.

By using their stockpiles of [[sl:campaign_resources]]resources[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_oathgold]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_oathgold]]Oathgold[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_dwarfs]]Dwarf[[/sl]] factions may forge powerful magic [[sl:campaign_character_details]]items[[/sl]].
The number of items currently available for forging is shown next to The Forge button.

[[sl:campaign_provinces]]Province[[/sl]] capitals provide formidable fortifications which make them harder to attack and more resistant to [[sl:campaign_siege_warfare]]sieges[[/sl]] than regular [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]].

[[sl:campaign_buildings]]Buildings[[/sl]] within a [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]] may provide [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]] to a garrison army that automatically defends the settlement from attack.
The garrison details button is shown on the Province Overview panel when a settlement is selected.

Ancient Treemen [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] of the [[sl:campaign_wood_elves]]Wood Elves[[/sl]] may be appointed to the Gathering of the Ancients once seats there become available. Positions at the Gathering confer bonuses on the [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords that occupy them.

[[sl:campaign_settlements]]Settlements[[/sl]] of the [[sl:campaign_lizardmen]]Lizardmen[[/sl]] are linked by a network of power known as the Geomantic Web, an unseen matrix of energy which crosses the entire world. By increasing the power of the Geomantic Web in a [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]], a Lizardmen [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] can increase the potency of any [[sl:campaign_commandments]]commandments[[/sl]] issued there.
The Geomantic Web button is only shown when playing as a Lizardmen faction.

Those who encounter the champions of [[sl:campaign_slaanesh]]Slaanesh[[/sl]] and live are often unknowingly bewitched by the experience. A Gift of Slaanesh is a debilitating mark upon those who escape the Dark Prince’s clutches.
The Global Item pool is shown on the Details tab of the Character Details panel.
The global recruitment pool shows units that can be recruited globally.
[[sl:campaign_norsca]]Norscan[[/sl]] tribal leaders may pledge their devotion to a [[sl:campaign_chaos]]Dark God[[/sl]] to gain their favour and be granted Ruinous gifts.

The powerful adventuring duo of Gotrek and Felix may be recruited from various 'establishments' throughout the Old World to help tell new tales of legend or allow the Slayer achieve his greatly-desired glorious death.

Since time immemorial has the Great Bastion separated the lands of [[sl:campaign_cathay]]Cathay[[/sl]] from the Chaos Wastes beyond. Cathayan defenders are concentrated at three fortress gates along the constructed barricade to prevent [[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]] from entering the Celestial Empire.
The tooltip on the Great Bastion Threat meter lists the status of each fortress gate settlement.

The [[img:icon_green_knight]][[/img]]Green Knight is a powerful [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero who emerges for [[sl:campaign_bretonnia]]Bretonnian factions[[/sl]] in their hour of greatest need. The [[img:icon_green_knight]][[/img]]Green Knight excels in the ways of [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]], but only appears for a limited period of [[sl:campaign_turns]]time[[/sl]].

Orcs and Goblins band together on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] and are collectively referred to as Greenskins. Greenskins live for nothing but violence, and can be incited into a near-unstoppable [[sl:campaign_waaagh]]Waaagh![[/sl]] if sufficiently roused.

Grom the Paunch is known for having the biggest appetite of all [[sl:campaign_greenskins]]Goblinkind[[/sl]]. His special cauldron enables him to combine ingredients into recipes that not only satisfy his constant need to eat, but also imbue him and the rest of the Broken Axe tribe with a myriad of powerful effects in both campaign and [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]].

Although unruly and disorganised, the [[sl:campaign_greenskins]]Greenskins[[/sl]] are resourceful enough not to waste [[img:icon_scrap]][[/img]]Scrap materials left in the wake of their [[sl:campaign_battles]]battles[[/sl]]. They use them to fashion a hodgepodge of armour, weapons and equipment.

Followers of the [[sl:campaign_tzeentch]]Raven God[[/sl]] are consumed by a hunt for ancient and lapsed knowledge. Grimoires of forgotten learning, when unearthed, are highly prized by acolytes of Tzeentch.
A breakdown of Grimoires income may be viewed by placing the mouse cursor over the Grimoires counter at the top of the campaign interface.

The [[img:icon_growth]][[/img]]growth of a [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]] is a measure of the expansion of its population. [[img:icon_growth]][[/img]]Growth leads to [[img:icon_pop_surplus]][[/img]]population surplus, which can be spent on upgrading the [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] within the province.

The [[img:icon_growth]][[/img]]growth of a [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]] is a measure of the expansion of its population. [[img:icon_growth]][[/img]]Growth leads to [[img:icon_pop_surplus]][[/img]]Kindreds, which can be spent on upgrading buildings within the province.

[[sl:campaign_dwarfs]]Dwarf[[/sl]] factions keep a list of grudges against enemies that have wronged them, seeking to avenge past grievances such as the loss of their kin and their Holds lest they live in grumbling discontent.
The Grudges bar appears when playing as any Dwarf faction and can also be viewed in the Great Book of Grudges.
The Great Book of Grudges is accessible when playing as any Dwarf faction.

[[sl:campaign_cathay]]Cathayan[[/sl]] factions can choose to maintain stability between the forces of [[img:icon_yin]][[/img]]Yin and [[img:icon_yang]][[/img]]Yang, or focus on either opposed principle. Both balance and imbalance have their own rewards.
Place the mouse cursor over each leaf of the lotus indicator to see the effect of harmony being that level.

The [[sl:campaign_chaos_dwarfs]]Chaos Dwarfs[[/sl]] are experts at combining smithing with Daemonic infusion. Feeding their assembly lines of [[img:icon_armaments]][[/img]]Armaments into the Hell-Forge, they equip new troops and modify their weapons, armour and war machines to enhance them with different effects.
The Help Pages button can be found in the top-left of the screen.

[[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Heroes[[/sl]] can perform actions to serve their [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]], either in support of a controlled [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] or [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]], or to strike at an enemy army, settlement or [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero.
The Deploy Hero button is shown when a controlled [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero is selected.
The Recruit Hero button is displayed on the Province Overview panel when a controlled settlement is selected.
The tab buttons showing available types of [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes are shown along the top of the Recruit Hero panel.

{{tr:hp_campaign_heroes_add_04}} [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes may also be added to an [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]], in which case they will fight as a powerful single-person [[sl:campaign_units]]unit[[/sl]] in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]].

The six forbidden Hexes are dark slivers of magic scattered across the world, which can inflict uniquely powerful effects upon their unfortunate targets. In hushed tones, their power is sought after in secret by the Daughters of the Forest.

The noble High Elves, or Asur as they call themselves, are among the most ancient and powerful of all [[sl:campaign_races]]races[[/sl]]. From their mist-shrouded home continent of Ulthuan, they defend the world from the encroaching evils that threaten it.

Eltharion the Grim coordinates the defence of Tor Yvresse from the ruins of Athel Tamarha, gradually repairing and upgrading the grand mountainside keep using [[img:icon_warden_supplies]][[/img]]Warden’s Supplies as he restores the power of the protective [[img:mist_of_yvresse]][[/img]]Mists of Yvresse.

Imrik is one of the very few who can wake the Dragons in times of need. As he travels outside of Ulthuan, he is on a constant search for those mighty Drake allies who still roam the world, to seek their power or bring them under Caledor’s banner.

The [[img:icon_growth]][[/img]]growth of a [[sl:campaign_hordes]]horde[[/sl]] is a measure of the expansion of its population. [[img:icon_growth]][[/img]]Growth of a horde leads to the accumulation of [[img:icon_pop_surplus]][[/img]]population surplus, which can be spent on [[sl:campaign_raising_forces]]raising additional hordes[[/sl]] or upgrading [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]].

The [[img:icon_growth]][[/img]]growth of a [[img:icon_pirate_crew]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_hordes]]pirate crew[[/sl]] is a measure of its expanding population. [[img:icon_pirate_crew]][[/img]]Pirate crew [[img:icon_growth]][[/img]]growth leads to [[img:icon_pop_surplus]][[/img]]population surplus, which can be used to upgrade ship [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]].

Certain [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] roam the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] as hordes. Horde factions do not inhabit [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]], instead carrying their infrastructure with their [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]].

Frost Maiden [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Heroes[[/sl]] and Ice Witch [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] of [[sl:campaign_kislev]]Kislev[[/sl]] gain their mastery over the [[sl:campaign_winds_of_magic]]Winds of Magic[[/sl]] by completing trials within the Ice Court. Only after extensive training is completed may such formidable spellcasters be recruited into service.
The Ice Court button is displayed on the main campaign interface when playing a Kislev faction.
The Ice Court panel can be opened from the main campaign interface when playing a Kislev faction.

[[sl:campaign_tax]]{{tr:hp_campaign_tax_term_sentence_start}}[[/sl]] from controlled territory, [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_trade]]trade[[/sl]] income, and [[sl:campaign_money]]{{tr:hp_campaign_money_term}}[[/sl]] from other sources such as [[sl:campaign_hordes]]horde buildings[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_raiding_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_raiding]]raiding[[/sl]] are added together to reach a [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction’s[[/sl]] total {{tr:icon_income}}income. This is shown on the {{tr:icon_treasury}}[[sl:campaign_treasury_panel]]Treasury panel[[/sl]].
The {{tr:icon_income}}income per-turn is shown on the Treasury panel, and also at the top of the screen on the campaign interface.

The Undead [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] of the [[sl:campaign_vampire_coast]]Vampire Coast[[/sl]] compete with one another through their deeds to gain [[img:icon_infamy]][[/img]]Infamy. The most infamous pirates may seize [[img:icon_shanty]][[/img]]verses of the [[sl:campaign_sea_shanties]]Lost Sea Shanty[[/sl]].
A breakdown of Infections income may be viewed by placing the mouse cursor over the Infections icons at the top of the campaign interface and on the Plague Cauldron panel.

[[sl:campaign_high_elves]]High Elf[[/sl]] society is hierarchical in nature, and courtiers watch for any opportunity to gain in status at the expense of their peers. The [[img:icon_influence]][[/img]]influence of a High Elf [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] grows as events fall in their favour, and this [[img:icon_influence]][[/img]]influence may later be spent on [[sl:campaign_intrigue_at_the_court]]court intrigues[[/sl]] and on recruiting [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Heroes[[/sl]].

Intervention [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] may be hired by [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] to interfere with [[sl:campaign_rituals]]rituals[[/sl]] being conducted by their rivals. They are composed of mercenaries and fanatics dedicated to capturing or destroying the ritual sites.
The Interventions button becomes active when a rival faction is enacting a ritual.

[[sl:campaign_high_elves]]High Elves[[/sl]] can spend their [[img:icon_influence]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_influence]]influence[[/sl]] on Intrigues at the Court – whispered deals in the halls of power that pull strings to improve or worsen the [[sl:campaign_diplomacy]]diplomatic relations[[/sl]] between [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]].
Only factions already discovered are listed on the Intrigue at the Court panel.

Island and Black Ark battles allow for combat at sea instead of auto-resolving. Both battle types play like land battles, with Black Arks giving the defender a slight height advantage in their deployment zone over the attacker.

Convoys of protected Caravans may be sent from [[sl:campaign_cathay]]Cathay[[/sl]] along the perilous Ivory Road to the west. Caravans that safely reach their destination can earn significant profit for the Celestial Empire.
The Ivory Road panel can be opened by clicking the Ivory Road button on the main campaign interface when playing a Cathay faction.

Khorne is the [[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]] God of war, hatred, and rage. Followers of the Blood God – whether Daemonic, mortal, or otherwise – are gifted with immense powers in combat and war, forged by a life of constant battle and martial challenge.

At the northern edges of the realms of man stand the people of Kislev. Their steadfastness against both the unforgiving climate and the constant threat of [[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]] invasion are ample proof of their hardy and warlike nature.

[[img:icon_labour]][[/img]]Labour is the backbone of the [[sl:campaign_chaos_dwarfs]]Chaos Dwarfs’[[/sl]] [[sl:campaign_chd_economy]]Industrial Economy[[/sl]]; a commodity of battle captives and traded Labourers used and managed provincially to facilitate efficiency, rapid expansion and ultimately, the arming of the Chaos Dwarf war machine.

Deep within the jungles of Lustria may be found the Lizardmen. Multiple species make up this ancient and cold-blooded [[sl:campaign_races]]race[[/sl]] – the agile Skinks, the monstrous Kroxigor, the warlike Saurus, and the contemplative Slann, who lead the Lizardmen with their matchless wisdom and command over the [[sl:campaign_winds_of_magic]]Winds of Magic[[/sl]].

The Old Ones watch over the [[sl:campaign_lizardmen]]Lizardmen[[/sl]], preparing for the Great Plan. For the plan to come to fruition, temples must be built to one of the great Old Ones within captured [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]].

Nakai resides at the centre of the jungle nexus and the spawning pools under his control. Any military progress that his [[sl:campaign_hordes]]horde[[/sl]] makes can be shared with all other hordes in the [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]].

A First Generation Slaan, Lord Kroak is a supremely powerful Legendary [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Hero[[/sl]] able to inflict massive damage on [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] through his [[sl:campaign_hero_actions]]Hero actions[[/sl]], as well as unleashing devastating attacks on the battlefield when summoned by any [[sl:campaign_lizardmen]]Lizardmen faction[[/sl]].

The ancient [[sl:campaign_lizardmen]]Lizardmen's[[/sl]] prophecies speak of the return to Lustria of the Serpent-God Sotek. The Cult of Sotek [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] intend to see this prophecy fulfilled through [[img:icon_sotek_captives]][[/img]]Sacrificial Offerings and, of course, wiping the Skaven from their jungles. With each Sacrifice to Sotek, rewards of varying quality are given to Tehenhauin and his cohorts of Red Crested Skinks.
Unlock sacrifices and pay tribute to Sotek through the Sacrifice to Sotek panel.

Invaders from the Old World wish to steal the [[sl:campaign_lizardmen]]Lizardmen's[[/sl]] riches and establish their own colonies in the New World. It is Nakai's sacred duty to see that this doesn't happen – he must track down and defeat these warm-blooded invaders.
The local recruitment pool shows units that can be recruited from the local province.

[[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord [[sl:campaign_characters]]characters[[/sl]] within a [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] can be appointed to the command of an [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]]. Each army on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] is commanded by and contains one [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord.

[[img:icon_loyalty]][[/img]]Loyalty is a measure of the willingness of a [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lord[[/sl]] of the [[sl:campaign_dark_elves]]Dark Elves[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_skaven]]Skaven[[/sl]] or [[sl:campaign_vampire_coast]]Vampire Coast[[/sl]] to follow the leader of his or her [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]]. Should a Lord’s loyalty reach 0 they will rebel, taking their [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] with them to form a new faction.

{{tr:hp_campaign_magic_items_add_01}} Once equipped by a [[sl:campaign_lords]]Lord[[/sl]] or [[sl:campaign_heroes]]Hero[[/sl]], these magical items can grant their bearer a wide range of effects and bonuses.

Amongst [[sl:campaign_high_elves]]High Elves[[/sl]], the rulers of Nagarythe place a singular importance on striking at the opposition's nobility. Bonuses will be earned by Nagarythe when those enemy [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] marked for death are killed in battle or campaign.
The Marked for Death buttons are shown on the user interface when playing as Nagarythe.

[[img:icon_marks_of_ruination]][[/img]]Marks of Ruination are the tokens of recognition that [[sl:campaign_beastmen]]Beastmen[[/sl]] receive from the [[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos Gods[[/sl]], symbolising their status amongst all Children of Chaos. They are collected as a result of the slaughter and destruction wrought throughout a [[sl:campaign_bloodgrounds]]Blood-ground[[/sl]], increasing the Beastmen's Ruination Level to enable campaign progression and rewards.
The Jade Court has the power to enact decisive acts of governance through Matters of State, which can be used to influence a variety of targets on the campaign map.

[[sl:campaign_ogre_kingdoms]]Ogres[[/sl]] march and fight on their stomachs. Every Ogre [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] carries a store of Meat when out on campaign, for hungry Ogres will quickly turn on each other for sustenance should food supplies run out.

Military Convoys can be sent from the [[sl:campaign_chaos_dwarfs]]Chaos Dwarfs'[[/sl]] lands to travel along the many trade routes that span the world. Convoys that successfully reach their destination can trade in commodities that benefit the Chaos Dwarfs’ [[sl:campaign_chd_economy]]Industrial Economy[[/sl]].
Missions may be issued from time to time to guide the progress of a player [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]]. They are optional to complete.
{{tr:hp_campaign_money_term_description_redir}}

The Beastlord Rakarth is the greatest Beastmaster to have ever scourged the world. As he battles across the continents, he and his [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] can capture a variety of wild beasts and monsters which they can control to fight on their behalf.

The Monstrous Arcanum is a tome of the most savage and horrifying creatures in the world. It may be consulted by the tribal leaders of [[sl:campaign_norsca]]Norsca[[/sl]] who wish to go on Monster Hunts.

The spread of [[img:icon_corruption_chs]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_corruption]]corruption[[/sl]] affects the [[sl:campaign_high_elves]]High Elves[[/sl]] of Avelorn more keenly than any other [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]].

By using their stockpiles of {{tr:icon_money}}[[sl:campaign_money]]money[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_resources]]resources[[/sl]], and [[img:icon_jars]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_canopic_jars]]Canopic Jars[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_tomb_kings]]Tomb Kings[[/sl]] factions may craft powerful magic [[sl:campaign_character_details]]items[[/sl]] or awaken [[sl:campaign_regiments_of_renown]]Regiments of Renown[[/sl]] through the Mortuary Cult.
The Mortuary Cult button is on the campaign interface next to the End Turn button.
The list of items available through the Mortuary Cult may be filtered by clicking the buttons at the top of the Mortuary Cult panel.

The Orthodoxy and the Ice Court [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] vie with one another for supremacy over the [[sl:campaign_kislev]]Kislev[[/sl]] Motherland. [[sl:campaign_devotion]]Devotion[[/sl]] is used to perform Invocations on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_motherland_panel]]Motherland panel[[/sl_tooltip]], affording each the opportunity to gain [[img:icon_supporters]][[/img]][[sl_tooltip:campaign_supporters_track]]Supporters[[/sl_tooltip]] in their struggle against their rival.
The Motherland panel can be opened from the top of the campaign interface when playing as a Kislev faction.
The proportion of an character's movement range left this turn is shown on the Character Info panel.

A [[img:icon_non-aggression_pact]][[/img]]non-aggression pact may be agreed between two [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] via [[sl:campaign_diplomacy]]diplomacy[[/sl]] as a statement of mutual trust. It is usually the first step in building relations towards [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_trade]]trade[[/sl]] and, eventually, an [[img:icon_military_alliance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_alliances]]alliance[[/sl]].

The Norscans are a [[sl:campaign_races]]race[[/sl]] of tough and warlike men, shaped both by the harsh conditions of the north and living dangerously close to the Chaos Wastes. They worship the forces of the [[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]] Gods – personified as the Hound, the Crow, the Serpent and the Eagle – raising dark shrines and making bloody offerings to the Ruinous Powers.

As they erect [[img:icon_dark_fortress]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_dark_fortress]]Dark Fortresses[[/sl]] across the Norscan Homelands, the [[sl:campaign_warriors_of_chaos]]Warriors of Chaos[[/sl]] can [[img:icon_vassal]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_vassalage]]vassalise[[/sl]] the local tribes through the conquest of their Homeland Capitals, forcefully gaining their unwavering loyalty.

Grandfather Nurgle is the [[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]] God of disease, decay, and death. As they march to war, His followers gleefully spread his foetid message, along with the crippling and virulent diseases He concocts to any unfortunate enough to stand against them.
The Oak of Ages lies at the heart of the forest of Athel Loren, and is the foundation tree of the realm of the [[sl:campaign_wood_elves]]Wood Elves[[/sl]].

[[img:icon_oathgold]][[/img]]Oathgold is a precious ore gathered by the [[sl:campaign_dwarfs]]Dwarfs[[/sl]] to bind the Winds of Magic, used primarily to [[sl:campaign_forging_magic_items]]forge[[/sl]] magic [[sl:campaign_character_details]]items[[/sl]].
The Objectives button is shown next to the End Turn button on the campaign interface.
The Chapter Missions tab shows chapter missions on the Objectives panel.
The Victory Conditions tab shows victory conditions on the Objectives panel.
The Offer to the Great Maw panel can be opened from the Army panel after a controlled Ogre army is selected.

A [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lord[[/sl]] may be promoted into a position of Office once they have achieved a sufficient [[sl:campaign_character_details]]character rank[[/sl]]. Positions of Office confer bonuses on the [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords that occupy them.
The Offices button is shown on the campaign interface when playing as the Empire.

[[sl:campaign_ogre_kingdoms]]Ogres[[/sl]] are renowned for their nomadic ways and fireside revelry. By constructing a Camp, Ogre [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] can provide benefits and support to their local [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]], even deep inside enemy territory.

The Ogres, a monstrous race of nasty, brutish thugs, see other races as little more than meat to feed their ravenous bellies or to be cast into the Great Maw. Led by their Tyrant overlords, the Ogres wage war from their tribal bases deep within the Mountains of Mourn.

[[sl:campaign_factions]]Factions[[/sl]] may construct outposts within the fortified [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] of their [[img:icon_military_alliance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_alliances]]military allies[[/sl]] or [[img:icon_vassal]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_vassalage]]vassals[[/sl]]. Once constructed by a faction, an outpost enables [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]recruitment[[/sl]] from amongst their allies available [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]].

All followers of [[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]] have a shared goal – to seek power and ascension by any means necessary, even at the risk of damnation. Thusly [[sl:campaign_warriors_of_chaos]]Warriors of Chaos[[/sl]] [[sl:campaign_characters]]characters[[/sl]] can follow a Path to Glory to progress into new and more powerful forms with Daemonhood as the ultimate reward.

Peasants are used by [[sl:campaign_bretonnia]]Bretonnian factions[[/sl]] either as lance-fodder to be sacrificed in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]] or for working the fields to provide {{tr:icon_income}}[[sl:campaign_income]]income[[/sl]].
The number of recruited peasants is shown at the top of the screen.

Pieces of Eight are cursed trinkets that have so completely twisted and altered the minds of those that first found them that their fate is now tied to the coins. By securing one of the Pieces of Eight, the services of the warriors bound to them may be secured also.

[[img:icon_cove]][[/img]]Pirate Coves can be established in [[img:icon_port]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_ports]]ports[[/sl]] by factions of the [[sl:campaign_vampire_coast]]Vampire Coast[[/sl]] should they defeat the occupiers in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]] or by [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_hero_actions]]Hero actions[[/sl]]. [[img:icon_cove]][[/img]]Pirate Coves provide the pirate faction with {{tr:icon_income}}[[sl:campaign_income]]income[[/sl]] and other benefits despite the original occupant retaining control of the [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]].
A controlled character or settlement must be selected before the Plague Cauldron panel can be opened, when playing as a Nurgle faction.
The tooltip of each recipe shows the Symptoms that must be unlocked before the recipe becomes available.

Through their pestilent scheming, the [[sl:campaign_skaven]]Skaven[[/sl]] are able to spread virulent diseases amongst their enemies. [[sl:campaign_armies]]Armies[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] can both fall victim to [[img:icon_plague]][[/img]]plagues, and once infection has set in they can expect a heavy [[sl:campaign_attrition]]death toll[[/sl]].

Just like the Plague Lord himself, followers of [[sl:campaign_nurgle]]Nurgle[[/sl]] cannot resist combining and recombining strains of disease, contaminating their own bodies with the intention of infecting everyone with whom they come into contact.

The followers of [[sl:campaign_slaanesh]]Slaanesh[[/sl]] are infamous for their debauched revelry. Such events, held in and around the palaces of the Dark Prince, can generate a number of beneficial effects over time.
Only the followers of Slaanesh may perform Pleasurable Acts.

[[img:icon_port]][[/img]]Ports are [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] that adjoin the [[sl:campaign_sea]]sea[[/sl]]. [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_trade]]Trade[[/sl]] routes may be established from a [[img:icon_port]][[/img]]port across the water to distant shores.

Malus is bound to the Daemon Tz’arkan, manifesting as a powerful Daemonic form in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]] when he is fully possessed. Tz’arkan’s influence can be thwarted by regularly taking [[img:def_malus_possession_potion]][[/img]]elixirs to suppress his ever-advancing possession, but succumbing to his [[img:def_malus_tzarkan_whispers]][[/img]]whispers of carnage can bring great rewards at the cost of Malus’ sanity.

A number of options are available to the victor after [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]], such as killing any prisoners taken or looting a captured [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]]. These are presented on the [[sl:campaign_post_battle_panel]]Post-Battle panel[[/sl]].

A number of options are available to the victor after [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]], such as killing or releasing prisoners. These are presented on the [[sl:campaign_post_battle_panel]]Post-Battle panel[[/sl]].
A number of options are available to the victor after capture of a [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]]. These are presented on the [[sl:campaign_post_battle_panel]]Post-Battle panel[[/sl]].

The Post-Battle panel appears after a [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]] has been fought, and presents [[sl:campaign_post_battle_options]]options[[/sl]] for what to do with the spoils if victory was achieved.
Alarielle, the High Elf champion of the Earth-Goddess, radiates life magic, which invigorates the lands through which she travels. When she crosses controlled territory it will receive bonuses.
Engagement options such as whether to attack or withdraw appear immediately prior to [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]] on the [[sl:campaign_pre_battle_panel]]Pre-Battle panel[[/sl]].

The Pre-Battle panel appears immediately prior to a [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]] engagement and provides [[sl:campaign_pre_battle_options]]options[[/sl]] and information about the strengths and setup of the [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] involved.
Only the followers of Slaanesh can directly proliferate cults.

The Province Info panel appears alongside the [[sl:campaign_province_overview_panel]]Province Overview panel[[/sl]] when a [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]] is selected, and displays information about the state of the [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]] and its population.

A [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]] must be managed by the [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] or factions that control it to remain productive, and to prevent it from degenerating into [[sl:campaign_revolts]]rebellion[[/sl]].

The Province Overview panel appears when a [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]] is selected, and shows the setup of [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]] and settlements within the selected [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]].

{{tr:hp_campaign_provinces_add_1}} Control of a province can be split between multiple [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]], each [[sl:campaign_province_management]]ruling[[/sl]] over the settlements they hold.
The Provinces list may be viewed by clicking the Provinces button on the campaign interface.
{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term_description_redir}}
Inspect the tooltip of the {{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}} bar to see the bonuses and penalties applied for each threshold of {{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}}.
Place the mouse cursor over the {{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}} icon on the Province Info panel to see a list of contributing factors.

Certain [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Legendary Lords[[/sl]] may go on quests, which are made available as the  [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord increases in [[sl:campaign_character_skills]]rank[[/sl]]. A [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Legendary Lord can win powerful [[sl:campaign_character_details]]items[[/sl]] by completing a quest.

Each race featured in the [[sl:campaign_campaign_game]]game[[/sl]], such as the [[sl:campaign_greenskins]]Greenskins[[/sl]] or the [[sl:campaign_dwarfs]]Dwarfs[[/sl]], carries certain racial traits which grant [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] of that race unique abilities or inabilities.

An [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] may raid enemy territory by entering [[img:icon_raiding_stance]][[/img]]Raiding [[sl:campaign_stances]]stance[[/sl]]. [[img:icon_raiding_stance]][[/img]]Raiding brings in {{tr:icon_money}}[[sl:campaign_money]]{{tr:hp_campaign_money_term}}[[/sl]] and has detrimental effects on the target being [[img:icon_raiding_stance]][[/img]]raided.
The Raise Dead button is shown on the Army panel when a controlled Vampire army is selected.
The Recruit Lord button is displayed on the Province Overview panel when a settlement is selected.
New armies can be raised and [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords appointed to lead them on the Recruit Lord panel.

In addition to [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]recruiting units[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_vampires]]Vampire factions[[/sl]] may also raise the dead to fight for their cause, allowing them to build [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] more swiftly than other [[sl:campaign_races]]races[[/sl]].
