Entirely new [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] may be raised from the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_raise_forces_panel]]Recruit Lord panel[[/sl_tooltip]] to allow [[sl:campaign_war]]wars[[/sl]] to be fought on multiple fronts. A [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lord[[/sl]] must be appointed to lead the new military force.

Taurox the Brass Bull is a roaring, snorting engine of destruction who is rewarded by the [[sl:campaign_chaos]]Dark Gods[[/sl]] for winning successive [[sl:campaign_battles]]battles[[/sl]] quickly. By continually fighting and sustaining his [[img:icon_momentum]][[/img]]Momentum, the [[sl:campaign_beastmen]]Beastmen[[/sl]] [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord earns [[img:icon_rampage]][[/img]]Rampage Marks and receives gifts for his relentless slaughter.

Raw Materials are gathered when Labour is present in a province that has Mines buildings. The amount of Raw Materials harvested depends on the Labour to Workload ratio, if a province has less Labour than required Workload it will produce less Raw Materials.\\n\\nRaw Materials are required to construct several types of buildings, including Factory and Tower settlement chains. Raw Materials can also be used in special Factory buildings, Refinery and Assembly Line, these buildings consume Raw Materials and produce either Treasury or Armaments.

A [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] may choose to raze a [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]] after defeating its defenders in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]]. Razing a settlement burns it to the ground and leaves it abandoned.

The Realm of [[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]] is a domain of pure magic that sits outside of the physical universe. From their bases within, the Gods of [[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]] plan their assaults against the mortal world.
Black Arks may only be recruited from coastal settlements.

[[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Heroes[[/sl]] can be recruited from the Recruit Hero panel, which can be opened from the [[sl:campaign_province_overview_panel]]Province Overview panel[[/sl]] by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_hero_recruitment_button]]Recruit Hero button[[/sl_tooltip]].
The number of units that can be recruited in a turn from each pool is indicated on the Recruitment panel.

Regiments of Renown are elite versions of standard [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]], with improved combat performance and abilities. Regiments of Renown become available to the player’s [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] when a [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lord[[/sl]] reaches a certain [[sl:campaign_character_details]]character rank[[/sl]] or when special requirements are fulfilled.

Single [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] can be offered or requested as part of a [[sl:campaign_diplomacy]]diplomatic deal[[/sl]]. Such deals are particularly useful for acquiring desired territory without waging [[sl:campaign_war]]war[[/sl]], or for sealing peace treaties.

[[img:icon_military_alliance]][[/img]]Allied [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] may reinforce one another in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]] if they are close on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]]. An attack on one of them will mean the other being drawn into the battle in support.

Natural resources are to be found across the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]]. Ownership of the nearby [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]] grants access to the resource, bringing in extra {{tr:icon_income}}[[sl:campaign_trade]]trade income[[/sl]] to the controlling [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]].
{{tr:hp_campaign_description_revolts_redir}}

A rebellion will occur in a [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]] if [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_public_order]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}}[[/sl]] there gets too low. A rebellion [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] will appear and, if left to gather strength, may attack nearby [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]].

An incursion will occur in a [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]] if [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_public_order]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}}[[/sl]] gets too low there. An incursion [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] will appear and, if left to gather strength, may attack nearby [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]].

Certain [[sl:campaign_races]]races[[/sl]] may perform powerful rites that grant them strong bonuses and unique abilities on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]]. Rites cost significant amounts of {{tr:icon_money}}[[sl:campaign_money]]{{tr:hp_campaign_money_term}}[[/sl]] or [[img:icon_slaves]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_slaves]]slaves[[/sl]] to perform.
The rites button is only shown for races that can use rites.
Each rite must be unlocked before it may be used. The unlock criteria for a locked rite is shown on the panel.
Ritual buttons are shown in sequence along the Rituals bar.

Ritual currency contains the knowledge and power required to conduct [[sl:campaign_rituals]]rituals[[/sl]]. [[sl:campaign_factions]]Factions[[/sl]] require a certain amount of ritual currency to begin casting a ritual on the [[sl:campaign_great_vortex]]Great Vortex[[/sl]].

Certain [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] around the Eye of the Vortex [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] are rich in [[sl:campaign_ritual_currency]]ritual currency[[/sl]]. Construction of a specific [[sl:campaign_buildings]]building[[/sl]] within the settlement will earn the controlling [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] a steady stream of ritual currency revenue.
The icon for each rival progresses slowly to the right as that faction earns ritual currency.

Rituals are the means by which [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] can influence the [[sl:campaign_great_vortex]]Great Vortex[[/sl]] within the Eye of the Vortex campaign. In order to begin a ritual, a faction must first accumulate sufficient [[sl:campaign_ritual_currency]]ritual currency[[/sl]].

Progress towards the next [[sl:campaign_rituals]]ritual[[/sl]], as well as the progress of rival [[sl:campaign_races]]races[[/sl]], is shown on the Rituals bar. The bar fills as [[sl:campaign_ritual_currency]]ritual currency[[/sl]] is earned, indicating progression in the race to control the [[sl:campaign_great_vortex]]Great Vortex[[/sl]].

Rogue [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] are warbands of desperate outlaws, often made up of unusual combinations of troops. They appear from time to time, and will eventually seek to establish a home on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] by colonising a [[sl:campaign_ruins]]ruin[[/sl]] or assaulting an occupied [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]].

Legends tell of mighty pirate [[img:icon_transport_fleet]][[/img]]fleets that terrorise the Great Ocean raiding [[img:icon_port]][[/img]]ports and shipping routes for anything of worth. These are Rogue Pirates: hardened veterans of the sea who visit death and ruination on those they plunder.

The weathered remnants of [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] long abandoned may be found the length and breadth of the campaign map. Yet in times of war they rarely stay untouched for long; hidden treasures and the possibility for territorial expansion draw many to their remains.
The [[sl:campaign_campaign_game]]game[[/sl]] will automatically save each turn, and can be saved manually during the turn unless playing on Legendary difficulty.
As Tzeentch's Trickster, the Changeling revels in sowing disorder across the world via his methodical Schemes. The Schemes panel is a hub for tracking all mischievous activity across a campaign.

Bodies of water on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] may be crossed by [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] on ships, and by sea [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_trade]]trade[[/sl]] routes. Unique threats abound in the Great Ocean, such as [[sl:campaign_rogue_pirates]]Rogue Pirates[[/sl]].

Sea Lanes are markers at [[sl:campaign_sea]]sea[[/sl]] that can be entered to allow quicker travel between two points. Any [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lord[[/sl]] or [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Hero[[/sl]] can use a Sea Lane, but they won't be available while transiting the lane.
Seafarers through the ages have sung songs of great potency to empower their gun crews and boarders in battle. The most powerful of these is also the most elusive: the Lost Sea Shanty.
The Seduce Units button is shown on the Pre-Battle panel when playing as a Slaaneshi faction.

Such is the allure of the [[sl:campaign_slaanesh]]Dark Prince[[/sl]] that Slaaneshi [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] may be able to entice enemy [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]] to switch sides prior to [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]]. Seduced units will fight against their former allies for the duration of the engagement.

[[sl:campaign_slaanesh]]Slaanesh[[/sl]] exerts a Seductive Influence over amoral men, Elves, and Beastmen [[sl:campaign_races]]races[[/sl]]. By working to increase this influence, the followers of the Dark Prince of [[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]] may eventually be able to force such [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] into [[img:icon_vassal]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_vassalage]]vassalage[[/sl]].

The settlement bar appears below each settlement on the campaign map. Icons on the bar indicate important information about the settlement. Place the mouse cursor over the bar of occupied settlements to see more information about them.

[[sl:campaign_factions]]Factions[[/sl]] may expand and capture any [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]] on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]]. However, no [[sl:campaign_races]]race[[/sl]] will thrive everywhere, each having a set of specific climate preferences. Settlements of an unsuitable climate type will [[sl:campaign_growth]]grow[[/sl]] more slowly, if occupied, and suffer a variety of other penalties.

[[sl:campaign_factions]]Factions[[/sl]] of a particular [[sl:campaign_races]]race[[/sl]] are restricted as to what types of [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]] they may [[sl:campaign_post_battle_options]]occupy[[/sl]].

Settlements are cities or [[img:icon_port]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_ports]]ports[[/sl]] on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] from which [[sl:campaign_provinces]]provinces[[/sl]] are defended and controlled. Ownership of a settlement grants ownership of the territory around it.

Of all the great [[sl:campaign_skaven]]Skaven[[/sl]] clans, Eshin perform acts of stealth and subterfuge like no other. [[img:skv_snikch_schemes]][[/img]]Schemes that naturally develop over the course of the [[sl:campaign_campaign_game]]campaign[[/sl]] are used by Clan Eshin to send [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Heroes[[/sl]] to perform a host of instantly-successful actions upon [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_characters]]characters[[/sl]] or [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] in return for rewards.

Shipbuilding allows the pirate [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] of the [[sl:campaign_vampire_coast]]Vampire Coast[[/sl]] to upgrade their vessels away from [[img:icon_port]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_ports]]port[[/sl]]. Improvements may be made to weaponry, deck-strength and crew, even whilst far from home.

The Siege panel is displayed when a [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]] is placed under [[sl:campaign_siege_warfare]]siege[[/sl]]. It shows siege options and, if the settlement is [[sl:campaign_fortifications]]fortified[[/sl]], allows [[sl:campaign_siege_weapons]]siege weapons[[/sl]] to be built prior to [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]].

An [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] may lay siege to an enemy [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]] over many [[sl:campaign_turns]]turns[[/sl]]. The defenders of a besieged settlement must sally forth or seek outside help to avoid starvation and defeat.

Siege weapons may be constructed during a [[sl:campaign_siege_warfare]]siege[[/sl]] on the [[sl:campaign_siege_panel]]Siege panel[[/sl]]. They provide a method of attack against the [[sl:campaign_fortifications]]settlement fortifications[[/sl]], allowing the walls to be breached and the [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]] to be taken.

The verminous Skaven are a [[sl:campaign_races]]race[[/sl]] of malevolent and self-serving ratmen. From their [[sl:campaign_skaven_underworld]]Under-Empire cities[[/sl]], they fight tooth and claw against the other races – and each other – to further their personal standing within the Skaven hierarchy and to serve their diabolical god, the Horned Rat.

[[img:icon_corruption_skv]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_skaven]]Skaven[[/sl]] corruption is spread wherever the Skaven settle. As they naturally befoul anywhere they linger, [[img:icon_corruption_skv]][[/img]]Skaven [[sl:campaign_corruption]]corruption[[/sl]] causes settled [[sl:campaign_provinces]]provinces[[/sl]] to become less hospitable over [[sl:campaign_turns]]time[[/sl]], even for Skaven.

The [[sl:campaign_skaven]]Skaven[[/sl]] Clan Moulder have risen to infamy by mastering the art of breeding, mutating and surgically splicing monstrous fighting beasts. The Flesh Laboratory is where Throt operates on subjects to create more powerful troops to lead into [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]], in addition to developing bloodthirsty monsters in the Growth Vat to bolster his ranks.

The [[sl:campaign_skaven]]Skaven[[/sl]] Clan Skryre are known for their diabolical technological experiments, carried out in workshops beneath Skavenblight. The Forbidden Workshop is where Ikit Claw conducts his own personal experiments, upgrading Skryre’s Weapons Teams, Doomwheels and Doom-Flayers, and assembling [[img:icon_doomrocket]][[/img]]Doomrockets so powerful they can devastate enemy [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] with their lethal strength.
Unlock unit upgrades and Doom-Rockets through the Forbidden Workshop panel.

Skaven are treacherous by nature and [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] of this [[sl:campaign_races]]race[[/sl]] exhibit varying [[img:icon_loyalty]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_loyalty]]loyalty[[/sl]] to their masters. The loyalty of Skaven [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords must be kept in check to prevent them rebelling and forming a new [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]].

The [[sl:campaign_skaven]]Skaven[[/sl]] can establish their bases of operation in any [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]], including those owned by other [[sl:campaign_races]]races[[/sl]], by constructing [[img:icon_under_empire]][[/img]]Under-Cities directly beneath them. Skaven settlements and [[img:icon_under_empire]][[/img]]Under-Cities are part of the vast subterranean network known as the Under-Empire.
The benefits of sending skulls to the Skull Throne may be seen on the tooltip of the Skull Throne button when playing as a Khorne faction.

Skulls are gathered as trophies by followers of [[sl:campaign_khorne]]Khorne[[/sl]] from [[sl:campaign_battles]]battles[[/sl]] in which they fight directly, and from Skull Piles left in the aftermath of other engagements. Skulls are necessary for Khornate [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] to occupy [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]], construct [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]], and research [[sl:campaign_technology]]technologies[[/sl]].
A breakdown of Skulls income may be viewed by placing the mouse cursor over the Skulls counter at the top of the campaign interface.

The followers of the Dark Prince Slaanesh are invariably sadistic, decadent, amoral killers. Their hedonistic pursuit of gratification fuels the Dark Prince they worship, for He is the [[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]] God of pleasure, gluttony, and excess.

[[sl:campaign_dark_elves]]Dark Elves[[/sl]] terrorise their enemies and bolster their economies by capturing [[img:icon_slaves]][[/img]]slaves in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]]. Those unfortunate enough to be taken captive by the Dark Elves know their fate is to be worked to death fulfilling many exhausting and degrading tasks across the Druchii empire.
The Slaves buttons are only shown when playing as a Dark Elf faction.

[[sl:campaign_warriors_of_chaos]]Warriors of Chaos[[/sl]] factions collect the [[img:icon_souls_resource]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_souls_resource]]Souls[[/sl]] of mortals who they defeat. In turn, they can sacrifice them to their gods in return for powerful [[img:icon_chaos_gifts]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_chaos_gifts]]Gifts of Chaos[[/sl]] or ascend characters through [[sl:campaign_path_to_glory]]Paths to Glory[[/sl]].

[[sl:campaign_armies]]Armies[[/sl]] can modify their [[sl:campaign_army_movement]]movement[[/sl]], behaviour and abilities by adopting stances. [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]Recruitment[[/sl]], [[img:icon_ambush_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_ambushes]]ambushing[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_raiding_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_raiding]]raiding[[/sl]] are examples of behaviours facilitated by stances.
The stances rollout is shown on the Character Info panel when a controlled army is selected.
The Strategic Overview can be used to see a top-level view of the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]]. Zoom the camera out to toggle the Strategic Overview.
The Toggle Strategic Overview button is shown in the top-right corner of the campaign interface.
The layer buttons allow different layers to be shown on the Strategic Overview.
Only the followers of Slaanesh can summon Disciple Armies.
The Supporters track on the Motherland panel shows the relative progress of the Ice Court and the Orthodoxy factions in gaining [[img:icon_supporters]][[/img]]Supporters for their cause.

The Sword of Khaine is a blade of ancient and terrible power. To its bearer it grants prodigious strength in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]], yet stewardship of the sword can lead to civil unrest over time.
The effect of adding any symptom to a Plague of Nurgle is shown on its icon tooltip.
{{tr:hp_campaign_tax_term_description_redir}}

[[sl:campaign_factions]]Factions[[/sl]] can research technologies over time. Technologies are researched on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_technology_panel]]Technology panel[[/sl_tooltip]] and bring a variety of civic and military benefits.
The Technologies button is shown next to the End Turn button on the campaign interface.

The [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] of [[sl:campaign_tzeentch]]Tzeentch[[/sl]] can use Teleport [[sl:campaign_stances]]stance[[/sl]] to instantly reposition themselves to a nearby location on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]], potentially launching surprise attacks as they do so.

The type of terrain varies across a [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] and can affect [[sl:campaign_army_movement]]army movement[[/sl]]. Sufficiently hostile environments can cause [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_attrition]]attritional[[/sl]] casualties in armies trying to move through them.

Since the dawn of time, an unseen struggle for supremacy has been fought between the Gods of [[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]]. One of the Gods may fleetingly prevail, or two might face off in a feud, but the Great Game never truly ends.

The Menace Below is an army ability which allows [[sl:campaign_skaven]]Skaven[[/sl]] factions to summon a [[sl:campaign_units]]unit[[/sl]] of Clanrats anywhere on the battlefield during a [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]].

The Artefact Vault is where the Master Runelord Thorek Ironbrow reforges recovered parts of ancient Artefacts in his efforts to help return the [[sl:campaign_dwarfs]]Dwarfs[[/sl]] to their former glory.

The Tomb Kings are the undying rulers of the desolate, wind-swept deserts of Nehekhara. Rising from their sarcophagi, their mummified forms possess the same thirst for conquest in Undeath that drove them in life.

[[sl:campaign_chaos_dwarfs]]Chaos Dwarf[[/sl]] Sorcerer Lords vie for power and domination by competing for Seats on the Conclave of Evil, located in the Tower of Zharr. Seats enable powerful rewards for controlling factions as they seek preeminence in the eyes of Hashut, but also benefit all Chaos Dwarfs when entire Districts of Seats are controlled.

[[sl:campaign_factions]]Factions[[/sl]] may agree to trade with one another through [[sl:campaign_diplomacy]]diplomacy[[/sl]]. A [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]]trade agreement between two factions brings in additional {{tr:icon_money}}[[sl:campaign_money]]{{tr:hp_campaign_money_term}}[[/sl]] for both.

[[img:icon_treasure_map]][[/img]] Maps that lead to buried treasure are highly prized amongst the pirate [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] of the [[sl:campaign_vampire_coast]]Vampire Coast[[/sl]]. Great riches may be discovered by those who can solve the riddle of the maps.
This panel contains all the collected treasure maps.
The {{tr:icon_treasury}}treasury value is displayed at the top of the screen on the campaign interface.
The {{tr:hp_campaign_description_treasury_button_term}} is shown next to the treasury value on the campaign interface.
Treasury button
Favour Summary button
Favour Summary button
Favour Summary button
Favour Summary button
Favour Summary button
Favour Summary button
Dark Magic Summary button

Information about [[sl:campaign_tax]]{{tr:hp_campaign_tax_term}}[[/sl]] and other sources of {{tr:icon_income}}[[sl:campaign_income]]income[[/sl]], as well as expenditure, [[sl:campaign_resources]]resources[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_trade]]trade[[/sl]] agreements can be viewed on the {{tr:icon_treasury}}{{tr:hp_campaign_treasury_panel_term}}.
The details tab on the {{tr:hp_campaign_treasury_panel_term}} shows detailed information about {{tr:hp_campaign_money_term}} earned and spent by the player's faction.
The summary tab on the {{tr:hp_campaign_treasury_panel_term}} shows an overview of financial information for the player's faction.

The trade tab on the {{tr:hp_campaign_treasury_panel_term}} shows information about available resources and [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]]trading partners and {{tr:icon_income}}income for the player's faction.
The available {{tr:icon_treasury}}Favour is displayed at the top of the screen on the campaign interface.
The available {{tr:icon_treasury}}Favour is displayed at the top of the screen on the campaign interface.
The available {{tr:icon_treasury}}Favour is displayed at the top of the screen on the campaign interface.
The available {{tr:icon_treasury}}Favour is displayed at the top of the screen on the campaign interface.
The available {{tr:icon_treasury}}Favour is displayed at the top of the screen on the campaign interface.
The available {{tr:icon_treasury}}Favour is displayed at the top of the screen on the campaign interface.
The available {{tr:icon_treasury}}Dark Magic is displayed at the top of the screen on the campaign interface.
[[sl:campaign_norsca]]Norscan[[/sl]] warriors respect the language of violence above all. Norscan tribal leaders may seek to gain control of other tribes through [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]].

The Changeling's Deceivers work covertly to develop their economy – rather than occupying [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] directly, they secretly establish [[img:icon_trickster_cult]][[/img]]Trickster Cults within other factions’ settlements, choosing to symbiotically reap benefits or parasitically siphon the spoils of the area.
Time on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] is advanced in turns. Click the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_end_turn_button]]End Turn button[[/sl_tooltip]] to end the turn and move the game on.

Tzeentch, the Changer of Ways, also known as the Raven God, is the [[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]] God of magic, flux, and trickery. His servants share his delight of conspiracy and manipulation, and conquer in His name with cunning, sorcery, and deceit.

The [[img:icon_tunnelling_stance]][[/img]]Underway permeates the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] and can be used by certain [[sl:campaign_races]]races[[/sl]] to navigate under otherwise-impassable [[sl:campaign_terrain_types]]terrain[[/sl]].

The Gods of [[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]] draw strength from worship performed in the physical world. Followers of [[sl:campaign_khorne]]Khorne[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_nurgle]]Nurgle[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_slaanesh]]Slaanesh[[/sl]] or [[sl:campaign_tzeentch]]Tzeentch[[/sl]] may call on this power to enact Unholy Manifestations - Daemonic spells of prodigious power.

The Unholy Manifestations panel can be opened from the main campaign interface when playing a [[sl:campaign_khorne]]Khorne[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_nurgle]]Nurgle[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_slaanesh]]Slaanesh[[/sl]] or [[sl:campaign_tzeentch]]Tzeentch[[/sl]] faction.

[[sl:campaign_units]]Units[[/sl]] within [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] are represented on the user interface as Unit Cards. Each card displays essential information about the unit it represents.

[[sl:campaign_armies]]Armies[[/sl]] belonging to the same faction may exchange [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]], in order to better redistribute their forces. Select a controllable army and right-click on another to exchange units between them.
The Unit Exchange panel appears when a controlled army is sent to exchange units with another controlled army.

[[sl:campaign_units]]Units[[/sl]] gain experience as they fight [[sl:campaign_battles]]battles[[/sl]]. More experienced units have higher [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]]leadership and fight more effectively.

The Unit Info panel appears to the left of the screen when the cursor is hovered over a [[sl:campaign_unit_cards]]Unit Card[[/sl]] and shows vital information about the subject [[sl:campaign_units]]unit[[/sl]].
[[sl:campaign_units]]Units[[/sl]] may be merged or disbanded from the rollout that appears when a [[sl:campaign_unit_cards]]Unit Card[[/sl]] is clicked.

An [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] may recruit new [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]] to swell its ranks. Recruitment takes [[sl:campaign_turns]]time[[/sl]] and costs [[sl:campaign_money]]{{tr:hp_campaign_money_term}}[[/sl]], and the recruiting army must remain stationary while training is completed.
The Recruit Units button is shown on the Army panel when a controlled army is selected.

The Unit Recruitment panel is opened by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_unit_recruitment_button]]Recruit Units button[[/sl_tooltip]] on the [[sl:campaign_army_panel]]Army panel[[/sl]], and shows recruitment options for the selected [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]].

The strength of damaged [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]] will [[img:icon_replenishment]][[/img]]replenish over [[sl:campaign_turns]]time[[/sl]] when in home or [[sl:campaign_alliances]]allied[[/sl]] territory.

The type of each [[sl:campaign_units]]unit[[/sl]], which indicates its general form and usage, is shown on its [[sl:campaign_unit_cards]]Unit Card[[/sl]]. Examples of unit types include infantry and artillery.

[[sl:campaign_armies]]Armies[[/sl]] are subdivided into units of many individual soldiers. Units are represented by [[sl:campaign_unit_cards]]Unit Cards[[/sl]] on the [[sl:campaign_army_panel]]Army panel[[/sl]] and elsewhere on the campaign interface.

Ursun, the [[sl:campaign_kislev]]Kislevite[[/sl]] Bear-God, has been wounded and is held captive within the [[sl:campaign_forge_of_souls]]Forge of Souls[[/sl]], deep within the [[sl:campaign_realm_of_chaos]]Realm of Chaos[[/sl]]. Various powers, both mortal and Daemonic, seek to reclaiming his essence.

Pirates, both living and dead, are the deadly scourge of the high seas, and woe betide any who sight their black sails upon the horizon. By raiding and pillaging across the Great Ocean they compete with one another for [[img:icon_infamy]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_infamy]]Infamy[[/sl]].

The Midnight Aristocracy have long struck terror into the hearts of the mortal [[sl:campaign_races]]races[[/sl]]. From their lairs deep in Sylvania, the Vampire Counts strike out against the living with their massed [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] of the eager dead.

[[img:icon_corruption_vmp]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_vampires]]Vampiric factions[[/sl]] spread [[img:icon_corruption_vmp]][[/img]]vampiric [[sl:campaign_corruption]]corruption[[/sl]] where they settle. This [[img:icon_corruption_vmp]][[/img]]corruption blights the land, making it suitable for undead creatures and unsuitable for the living.

Each [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lord[[/sl]] of the [[sl:campaign_vampire_coast]]Vampire Coast[[/sl]] exhibits a primary [[sl:campaign_character_traits]]trait[[/sl]] to which their [[img:icon_loyalty]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_loyalty]]loyalty[[/sl]] is inherently linked. Actions linked to the Lord’s trait must be performed or his or her loyalty will suffer.

[[sl:campaign_factions]]Factions[[/sl]] of certain [[sl:campaign_races]]races[[/sl]] may demand that another faction becomes its [[img:icon_vassal]][[/img]]vassal through [[sl:campaign_diplomacy]]diplomacy[[/sl]]. A vassal faction is bound to its master and must follow it diplomatically.

Each player [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] has its own victory conditions which, if achieved, will win them the [[sl:campaign_campaign_game]]game[[/sl]]. Victory conditions can be viewed on the [[sl:campaign_missions]]Objectives panel[[/sl]].

A [[sl:campaign_greenskins]]Greenskin[[/sl]] Warboss whose [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] gains sufficient [[img:icon_waaagh]][[/img]]Reputation from their belligerent exploits will be able to make a Call to Waaagh!, temporarily gaining additional mobs for each of their [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] to help [[sl:campaign_razing]]raze[[/sl]] or occupy a targeted rival’s capital.

[[sl:campaign_factions]]Factions[[/sl]] may wage war on one another in order to capture territory and achieve military dominance. War can be declared via [[sl:campaign_diplomacy]]diplomacy[[/sl]] or by attacking an enemy [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] or [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]].

[[img:icon_military_alliance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_alliances]]Allies[[/sl]], or factions with [[sl:campaign_vassalage]]vassals[[/sl]] may choose to co-ordinate their war efforts against their common enemies. Targets to attack or defend may be assigned, [[sl:campaign_outposts]]outposts[[/sl]] in allied territory may be constructed, or control of entire allied [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] requested.
The presence of an ally mission is indicated on the Diplomacy button the main campaign interface.
The War Co-ordination button is shown on the Diplomacy screen if an allied faction is selected.
Only one outpost may be constructed for each ally. An outpost may be moved once constructed.
The War Co-ordination panel is only available when an allied faction is selected on the Diplomacy screen.
The Request Army tab will be inaccessible if no suitable allied armies are available for recruitment.
Targets may be assigned by clicking the Select Target button and then left-clicking an army or settlement on the map.

[[sl:campaign_warriors_of_chaos]]Warriors of Chaos[[/sl]] muster their armies instantly from the local area, while their [[img:icon_warband]][[/img]]Warbands allow them to transform recruits into more powerful forms or devote them to specific Chaos Gods to align them with their Lord’s [[sl:campaign_dark_authority]]Dark Authority[[/sl]].

The Warriors of Chaos seek nothing but to sow destruction amongst the mortal [[sl:campaign_races]]races[[/sl]] in service to their [[sl:campaign_chaos]]Dark Gods[[/sl]]. Their vast [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] march south from the frozen wastes to slaughter and destroy.

The Winds of Magic blow across the land, providing a source of magical power to those that can wield it. As [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] move through [[sl:campaign_provinces]]provinces[[/sl]] containing favourable winds they can harness and store this power for use by their spellcasting units in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]].

The [[sl:campaign_tzeentch]]Raven God’s[[/sl]] command of sorcery grants his acolytes power over the [[sl:campaign_winds_of_magic]]Winds of Magic[[/sl]] themselves. By altering the strength of the Winds, Tzeentchian [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] can influence the ability of enemy forces to charge their Power Reserves.
The Winds of Magic Manipulation panel can be opened from the main campaign interface when playing a Tzeentch faction.
The Winds of Magic power reserve bar is shown on the Army panel when an army containing a spellcaster is selected.

Striking out from the shadowy forests of [[sl:campaign_kislev]]Kislev[[/sl]], the Daughters of the Forest convene in the Witch’s Hut to harness the magic of special relics, allowing Mother Ostankya to conjure powers that can bless the worthy or curse her foes.

The reclusive Asrai are a [[sl:campaign_races]]race[[/sl]] of Elves that long ago separated from their kin in order to live as one with nature. Striking out from their forest home of Athel Loren, the Wood Elves see themselves as guardians and healers of the natural world.

Ariel is the Queen of the [[sl:campaign_wood_elves]]Wood Elves[[/sl]], a supremely powerful Legendary [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Hero[[/sl]] who aides her kin heal the forests of the world.

Drycha has deep-rooted distrust of [[sl:campaign_wood_elves]]Wood Elves[[/sl]], only making use of them on her terms. The Wargrove of Woe does not recruit normal Elves except those that have been put under a [[img:icon_glamoured]][[/img]]Glamouring spell to make them believe that they fight for their Queen Ariel, which results in them having modified combat stats.

In addition to [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]recruiting units[[/sl]], Drycha’s Wargrove of Woe may also summon spirits and beasts of the forest to fight for their cause, allowing them to build [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] more swiftly than other factions.

The [[sl:campaign_wood_elves]]Wood Elf[[/sl]] Sisters of Twilight have a unique relationship with Lord Daith, the legendary blind master smith of Athel Loren. In the [[img:icon_forge_of_daith]][[/img]]Forge of Daith he crafts special equipment for them, which can either be refined to gradually and permanently upgrade them as preferred by Naestra, or reforged to grant powerful temporary effects as demanded by Arahan.

The Worldroots reach out across the continents from beneath Athel Loren’s Oak of Ages, bringing life to the Magical Forests of the world. It is the duty of the [[sl:campaign_wood_elves]]Wood Elves[[/sl]] to increase the [[img:forest_health]][[/img]]health of these Magical Forests, healing them by securing their borders and performing Rituals of Rebirth.
Worldroots permeate the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] and can be used by the Wood Elves to navigate through otherwise-impassable [[sl:campaign_terrain_types]]terrain[[/sl]].
[[sl:campaign_armies]]Armies[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] exert zones of control around them, through which an enemy army cannot pass except to attack the owner.
Learn more about Devotees [[url:script_link_campaign_devotees]]here[[/url]].
Once gained, Devotion may be used to perform [[sl:campaign_motherland]]Invocations of the Motherland[[/sl]].
Learn more about Devotion [[url:script_link_campaign_devotion]]here[[/url]].
Factions must encounter one another on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] before diplomacy becomes available between them.
Learn more about diplomacy [[url:script_link_campaign_diplomacy]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about Disciple Armies [[url:script_link_campaign_disciple_armies]]here[[/url]].

Over time, Khornate [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] will automatically take control of [[sl:campaign_ruins]]ruined settlements[[/sl]] in [[sl:campaign_provinces]]provinces[[/sl]] they partially control.
Learn more about Khorne factions being drawn to destruction [[url:script_link_campaign_drawn_to_destruction]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about factions [[url:script_link_campaign_factions]]here[[/url]].
This is the amount of [[img:icon_amber]][[/img]]Amber required to construct this building, as well as any previous buildings in the chain.
In order to research this technology, this amount will be deducted from your total supply of [[img:icon_amber]][[/img]]Amber.
Amber consumption
In order to recruit this unit, this amount will be deducted from your total supply of [[img:icon_amber]][[/img]]Amber.
Food
Amber
Chivalry
The Forge of Souls must be reached by any who wish to confront Ursun's captor and free the God-Bear.
Learn more about Gifts of Slaanesh [[url:script_link_campaign_gifts_of_slaanesh]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about the Great Bastion [[url:script_link_campaign_great_bastion]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about Grimoires [[url:script_link_campaign_grimoires]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about Harmony [[url:script_link_campaign_harmony]]here[[/url]].

[[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes are recruited on the [[sl:campaign_recruit_hero_panel]]Hero Recruitment Panel[[/sl]], which is accessible when a [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]] or [[sl:campaign_hordes]]horde army[[/sl]] is selected.
Multiple types of [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero may be available for recruitment, each with different strengths and abilities.
Learn more about [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes [[url:script_link_campaign_heroes]]here[[/url]].

[[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Heroes[[/sl]] are versatile independent agents that can perform [[sl:campaign_hero_actions]]actions[[/sl]] against hostile targets on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]].

A selected [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero can be instructed to [[sl:campaign_hero_actions]]act[[/sl]] against an enemy [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]] or [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero by right-clicking that target.
Learn more about [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes [[url:script_link_campaign_heroes]]here[[/url]].

With a [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero selected, right-click a controlled [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] to embed it. Outside of fighting battles, [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes will perform some useful function such as scouting or training the troops when they join an [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]].
Candidates may be sent to the Ice Court for training on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_ice_court_panel]]Ice Court panel[[/sl_tooltip]] when playing as a Kislevite [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]].
Learn more about the Ice Court [[url:script_link_campaign_ice_court]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about the Ivory Road [[url:script_link_campaign_ivory_road]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about Khorne [[url:script_link_campaign_khorne]]here[[/url]].
Enchanted weapons, armour, and talismans can be collected through the course of a [[sl:campaign_campaign_game]]campaign[[/sl]].
Items may be viewed, equipped and fused on the [[sl:campaign_character_details_panel]]Character Details panel[[/sl]].
Learn more about magic items [[url:script_link_campaign_magic_items]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about Meat [[url:script_link_campaign_meat]]here[[/url]].
money

Each [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] maintains a central {{tr:icon_treasury}}treasury. The current {{tr:icon_treasury}}[[sl_tooltip:campaign_treasury]]treasury value[[/sl_tooltip]] and overall {{tr:icon_income}}[[sl:campaign_income]]income[[/sl]] per [[sl:campaign_turns]]turn[[/sl]] are shown at the top of the screen on the campaign interface.

[[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]] [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] use {{tr:icon_money}}Favour as currency. The available {{tr:icon_treasury}}Favour and overall {{tr:icon_income}}[[sl:campaign_income]]income per-turn[[/sl]] are shown at the top of the screen on the campaign interface.

[[sl:campaign_vampires]]Vampire[[/sl]] [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] use {{tr:icon_money}}Dark Magic as currency. The available {{tr:icon_treasury}}Dark Magic and overall {{tr:icon_income}}[[sl:campaign_income]]income per-turn[[/sl]] are shown at the top of the screen on the campaign interface.
Money
Favour
Dark Magic
Favour
Dark Magic
Invocations, while active, grant each Kislev faction the opportunity to gain [[img:icon_supporters]][[/img]][[sl_tooltip:campaign_supporters_track]]Supporters[[/sl_tooltip]].
Learn more about Invocations of the Motherland [[url:script_link_campaign_motherland]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about non-aggression pacts [[url:script_link_campaign_non_aggression_pacts]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about Norscan Homelands [[url:script_link_campaign_norscan_homelands]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about Nurgle [[url:script_link_campaign_nurgle]]here[[/url]].
Ogre Camps are the only opportunity for Ogres to construct top-tier [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]], as they are unavailable in Ogre [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]].
Learn more about Ogre Camps [[url:script_link_campaign_ogre_camps]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about outposts [[url:script_link_campaign_outposts]]here[[/url]].

From time to time Oxyotl receives visions of future atrocities committed by the thralls of Chaos believed to be sent to him by the Old Ones themselves. This powerful gift of foresight allows him to instantly traverse the world and launch timely interventions to thwart the Chaos Gods’ machinations.
Visions of the Old Ones appear as timed missions that can be viewed in the panel accessed via the button in the bottom right corner of the main campaign interface.

Using the Visions of the Old Ones map, Oxyotl can instantly travel to mission locations to prevent events occurring ahead of time, but can only traverse the map in this way once per turn when in territory owned by factions he is not at war with.
Any Ghosts of Pahuax force can complete Chaos-thwarting missions, but only Oxyotl’s army can use the Visions of the Old Ones map to traverse the world.

Successfully completing a Visions of the Old Ones mission grants various bonuses including [[img:sanctum_gem]][[/img]]Sanctum Gems (used to unlock [[sl:campaign_silent_sanctums]]Silent Sanctums[[/sl]]), [[sl:campaign_blessed_spawnings]]Blessed Spawnings[[/sl]] and Diplomatic Relations with Lizardmen.
Failure to complete Visions of the Old Ones missions in time will come with consequences, generally hastening or strengthening Chaos’ presence in the world.
Visions of the Old Ones
Learn more about Path to Glory [[url:script_link_campaign_path_to_glory]]here[[/url]].
Nurglish factions can create plagues on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_plague_cauldron_panel]]Plague Cauldron panel[[/sl_tooltip]].
Learn more about Plagues of Nurgle [[url:script_link_campaign_plagues_of_nurgle]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about Pleasurable Acts [[url:script_link_campaign_pleasurable_acts]]here[[/url]].

The Ice Court and the Great Orthodoxy [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] vie with one another to gain [[img:icon_supporters]][[/img]][[sl_tooltip:campaign_supporters_track]]Supporters[[/sl_tooltip]] amongst the political classes of [[sl:campaign_kislev]]Kislev[[/sl]].

The forces of Slaanesh have the [[sl:campaign_post_battle_options]]post-battle option[[/sl]] of subjugating human or Elvish factions into [[img:icon_vassal]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_vassalage]]vassalage[[/sl]] instead of destroying when they capture their last [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]].

When fully completing a progression bar in any of the research tabs, a unique [[sl:campaign_regiments_of_renown]]Regiment of Renown[[/sl]] will be unlocked and become available for recruitment from the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_regiments_of_renown_panel]]Regiments of Renown panel[[/sl_tooltip]].
[[sl:campaign_greenskins]]Greenskins[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_dwarfs]]Dwarfs[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_skaven]]Skaven[[/sl]] may use [[sl:campaign_underway]]the Underway[[/sl]] to the same effect.

[[img:icon_supporters]][[/img]]Supporters gained by the Great Orthodoxy or the Ice Court advances them along the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_supporters_track]]Supporters track[[/sl_tooltip]]. Rewards on the Supporters track are claimed by the first of the two competing [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] to reach them. They cannot be later claimed by the opponent.

Slaaneshi factions may also be able to liberate destroyed human and Elvish factions when they capture [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] that destroyed faction once owned. The liberated faction is resurrected and re-established as a [[img:icon_vassal]][[/img]]vassal that owns the captured settlement.

Many races have access to [[img:icon_encamp_stance]][[/img]]Encamp stance, which amongst other effects grants the army the ability to [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]recruit[[/sl]] from the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_global_recruitment_pool]]global recruitment pool[[/sl_tooltip]] when in foreign territory.

Should the player, playing one of the two competing factions, gain the full support of the people first, they will have the opportunity to [[sl:campaign_confederation]]confederate[[/sl]] their opponent.
[[sl:campaign_hordes]]Horde[[/sl]] armies may only construct new [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]] when in [[img:icon_encamp_stance]][[/img]]Encamp stance.
Should a non-player opponent gain the full support of the people first, the opportunity to confederate will be lost.

Races that make heavy use of [[sl:campaign_winds_of_magic]]magic[[/sl]] commonly have access to Channelling stance, which allows the army to increase its magic reserves at the cost of some manoeuvrability.
[[sl:campaign_devotion]]Devotion[[/sl]] or [[sl:campaign_money]]money[[/sl]] can be spent on the Motherland panel to sabotage the opponent, setting them back on the Supporters track.
The advisor can be dismissed or recalled at any time by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_advisor_button]]advisor button[[/sl_tooltip]] on the campaign interface.

Allegiance points are shown on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_war_coordination_panel]]War Coordination panel[[/sl_tooltip]], which may be accessed on the [[sl:campaign_diplomacy_screen]]Diplomacy screen[[/sl]] when any ally or [[img:icon_vassal]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_vassalage]]vassal[[/sl]] is selected.
[[img:icon_military_alliance]][[/img]]Alliance proposals are sent and received on the [[sl:campaign_diplomacy_screen]]Diplomacy screen[[/sl]].

Amanar will attack coastal regions and sea regions indiscriminately without warning, leaving [[img:icon_port]][[/img]]port settlements devastated and causing [[img:icon_transport_fleet]][[/img]]fleets to suffer [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_attrition]]attritional[[/sl]] casualties wherever it ascends.
Only Wood Elf factions collect [[img:icon_amber]][[/img]]Amber.

If an [[img:icon_ambush_stance]][[/img]]ambush is successfully sprung then an ambush [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]] will be fought, in which the attacker will be at a great positional advantage.
An army may be selected by left-clicking. A selected army can be instructed to move or attack by right-clicking the destination or target.
An army on land may be [[sl:campaign_army_movement]]moved[[/sl]] onto the sea by selecting it and right-clicking the destination.

The distance a [[sl:campaign_characters]]character[[/sl]] can move in a turn is displayed on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] when selected. It can be affected by [[sl:campaign_terrain_types]]terrain type[[/sl]] and by army [[sl:campaign_stances]]stance[[/sl]].

Each [[sl:campaign_units]]unit[[/sl]] in a selected army is represented on the Army panel by a unit card. Units in the process of being [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]recruited[[/sl]] are also shown.
Unlike [[sl:campaign_elven_halls]]Elven Halls[[/sl]], Asrai Lookouts provide only one [[sl:campaign_building_slots]]building slot[[/sl]].

A selected Lizardmen army may be switched into [[img:icon_astromancy_stance]][[/img]]Astromancy stance using the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_stances_rollout]]Stances rollout[[/sl_tooltip]] on the [[sl:campaign_character_info_panel]]Character Info panel[[/sl]].

Atamans may be assigned on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_atamans_panel]]Atamans panel[[/sl_tooltip]] when playing as a Kislevite faction. Only one Ataman can be assigned for every two [[sl:campaign_provinces]]provinces[[/sl]] owned.
Any [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]]attritional effects present in an area on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] can be seen on the tooltip shown when the cursor is held there.

A battle may be auto-resolved by selecting the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_autoresolve_button]]auto-resolve option[[/sl_tooltip]] on the [[sl:campaign_pre_battle_panel]]Pre-Battle panel[[/sl]]. An indication of the likely outcome is shown on the panel.

A faction with an empty {{tr:icon_treasury}}treasury and a negative {{tr:icon_income}}income is considered bankrupt. The {{tr:icon_treasury}}treasury value and {{tr:icon_income}}[[sl:campaign_income]]income per-turn[[/sl]] are shown on the campaign interface.
Any banners that randomly drop after victory in battle are shown on the [[sl:campaign_post_battle_panel]]Post-Battle panel[[/sl]].
An army under attack may be able to decline and withdraw if there is room to retreat. Each army may only withdraw once during the [[sl:campaign_turns]]end-turn sequence[[/sl]].
A Beastmen [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] can move through beast-paths by activating the [[img:icon_use_beastpaths_stance]][[/img]]Use Beast-Paths [[sl:campaign_stances]]stance[[/sl]].

Beastmen [[sl:campaign_hordes]]hordes[[/sl]] cannot inhabit conquered [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]]. Instead, they erect Herdstones in the ruins to establish [[sl:campaign_bloodgrounds]]Blood-grounds[[/sl]].

[[img:icon_bestial_rage]][[/img]]Bestial Rage is the primary means for Beastmen hordes to increase their growth. It is boosted by fighting battles and using the [[img:icon_raiding_stance]][[/img]]Raiding [[sl:campaign_stances]]stance[[/sl]].

Big Names are available to Ogre Legendary [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords, Tyrant [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords and Hunter [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes. Some Big Names only appear as choices for certain [[sl:campaign_characters]]character[[/sl]] types.

A Black Ark can be made available for recruitment by performing the Sacrifice to Mathlann [[sl:campaign_rites]]rite[[/sl]] or occupying a major [[img:icon_port]][[/img]]port when playing as Lokhir Fellheart.
A special mission is issued when a blessing spawning event occurs. {{tr:hp_campaign_point_2_blessed_spawnings}}
The Blessings of the Lady grant a damage resistance bonus to the [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] upon which the blessing is bestowed.

The Har Ganeth [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] will be rewarded with {{tr:icon_money}}[[sl:campaign_money]]{{tr:hp_campaign_money_term}}[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_slaves]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_slaves]]slaves[[/sl]] proportional to the carnage inflicted by the Blood Voyage [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]].
A Blood-ground is created whenever the Beastmen raise a Herdstone in a defeated settlement, offering them limited but powerful building options.
The Bloodletting level of a selected [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] is shown on the [[sl:campaign_character_info_panel]]Character Info panel[[/sl]] when playing a Khornate faction.

[[img:icon_blood_kiss]][[/img]]Blood Kisses are shown at the top of the campaign interface when playing a [[sl:campaign_vampires]]Vampire Counts[[/sl]] faction. They may be earned through the killing of important enemy [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]].
Collected Books of Nagash may be viewed in the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_books_of_nagash_link]]Books of Nagash panel[[/sl_tooltip]] located at the top of the main campaign interface.

[[img:icon_chivalry]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_chivalry]]Chivalry levels[[/sl]] for Bretonnian [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] are increased by victories in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]], and are affected by honourable and dishonourable acts. Greater levels of [[img:icon_chivalry]][[/img]]Chivalry lead to greater faction-wide bonuses.

Bretonnian armies far from home are susceptible to desert [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_attrition]]attrition[[/sl]] which depletes their [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]] when moving through such [[sl:campaign_terrain_types]]terrain[[/sl]].

Bretonnian [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] and Paladin [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]heroes[[/sl]] can gain three Knightly Vows by choosing a pledge and completing the task it sets. Prophetess [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]heroes can gain three Troths of the Lady through similar pledges.

The Building panel can be viewed by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_building_panel_tab]]Building panel tab[[/sl_tooltip]] on the [[sl:campaign_army_panel]]Army panel[[/sl]] when a horde [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] is selected.

[[img:icon_growth]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_growth]]Growth[[/sl]] causes [[img:icon_pop_surplus]][[/img]]population surplus to accumulate in a [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]]. [[img:icon_growth]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_growth]]Growth[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_pop_surplus]][[/img]]population surplus values are shown on the [[sl:campaign_province_info_panel]]Province Info panel[[/sl]] when a controlled settlement in the province is selected.

Buildings cost [[sl:campaign_turns]]time[[/sl]] and {{tr:icon_money}}[[sl:campaign_money]]{{tr:hp_campaign_money_term}}[[/sl]] to build, but grant a variety of benefits when completed which are shown on their icon tooltips.
Move the camera with the W, A, S and D keys, or by holding the middle mouse button and dragging.
Basic controls for the player are listed [[sl:campaign_campaign_controls]]here[[/sl]].

Territory on the map is divided into [[sl:campaign_provinces]]provinces[[/sl]], each containing several [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]]. Control of the settlements grants control of the portion of the province that surrounds it.

[[img:icon_jars]][[/img]]Canopic Jars may sometimes be obtained from [[sl:campaign_missions]]missions[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_quests]]quests[[/sl]], and are also produced in small quantities by certain [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]].
Cathayan rulers must maintain [[sl:campaign_harmony]]Harmony[[/sl]] by balancing levels of Yin and Yang across their [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]].

{{tr:hp_campaign_changing_of_the_ways_add_01}} Actions can be targeted at rival factions to gain information, change [[sl:campaign_diplomacy]]diplomatic relationships[[/sl]], or influence them in other ways.

The primary followers of the Chaos gods [[sl:campaign_khorne]]Khorne[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_nurgle]]Nurgle[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_slaanesh]]Slaanesh[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_tzeentch]]Tzeentch[[/sl]] wage war on the mortal races from their domains deep within the [[sl:campaign_realm_of_chaos]]Realms of Chaos[[/sl]].
Artefacts, such as Chaos Rifts or Herdstones, may be destroyed by other [[sl:campaign_races]]races[[/sl]] if they recolonise the [[sl:campaign_ruins]]ruined settlement[[/sl]].

The dedicated followers of the four gods of Chaos – [[sl:campaign_khorne]]Khorne[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_nurgle]]Nurgle[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_slaanesh]]Slaanesh[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_tzeentch]]Tzeentch[[/sl]] – spread variants of corruption specific to their chosen deity. The spreading of each variant benefits the related God in [[sl:campaign_the_great_game]]the Great Game[[/sl]].

Chaos Cults have a chance to automatically appear in any foreign province with high levels of [[sl:campaign_khorne]]Khorne[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_nurgle]]Nurgle[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_slaanesh]]Slaanesh[[/sl]] or [[sl:campaign_tzeentch]]Tzeentch[[/sl]] Corruption.

Chaos Dwarf factions have access to unique resources that drive their [[sl:campaign_chd_economy]]Industrial Economy[[/sl]] and military might.\\n\\n[[img:icon_labour]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_labour]]Labour[[/sl]] is required in provinces to mine Raw Materials and can be spent on quickly constructing buildings or to gain bonuses via provincial Labour Actions.\\n\\n[[img:icon_raw_materials]][[/img]]Raw Materials are spent on constructing buildings and manufacturing Armaments in Factory settlements.\\n\\n[[img:icon_armaments]][[/img]]Armaments are spent on constructing Advanced Military buildings and enhancing armies via the [[sl:campaign_hellforge]]Hell-Forge[[/sl]].

[[img:icon_souls_resource]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_souls_resource]]Souls[[/sl]] can be sacrificed by Warriors of Chaos [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] for rewards such as factionwide boons and Daemonic [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]] in the [[img:icon_chaos_gifts]][[/img]]Gifts of Chaos panel, accessed from the main campaign interface.
Ursun, the [[sl:campaign_kislev]]Kislevite[[/sl]] God-Bear is trapped and wounded in the Forge of Souls. Grieviously injured, he [[sl:campaign_turns]]periodically[[/sl]] howls with pain.

The details of a selected character may be viewed on the [[sl:campaign_character_details_panel]]Character Details panel[[/sl]], which may be opened by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_character_details_button]]Character Details button[[/sl_tooltip]] on the [[sl:campaign_character_info_panel]]Character Info panel[[/sl]].

[[sl_tooltip:campaign_character_details_panel_character_stats]]Character Stats[[/sl_tooltip]] which indicate the selected [[sl:campaign_characters]]character's[[/sl]] essential performance in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]] are listed on the Character Details panel. Inspect the tooltip of each stat to find out more about it.
Click the Character Details button on the Character Info panel to open the [[sl:campaign_character_details_panel]]Character Details panel[[/sl]].

{{tr:hp_campaign_character_skills_add_01}} The character's current rank, and an indication of whether any skill points are unspent, is shown on the Skills button on the [[sl:campaign_character_info_panel]]Character Info panel[[/sl]].
The [[sl:campaign_character_details_panel]]Character Details panel[[/sl]] shows [[sl:campaign_character_details]]detailed information[[/sl]] about a specific character.

[[img:icon_labour]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_labour]]Labour[[/sl]] is required to mine [[img:icon_raw_materials]][[/img]]Raw Materials and can be spent on instantly constructing buildings. It is primarily gained from battles and is distributed to all provinces opted in to accepting new Labour on the [[sl:campaign_province_info_panel]]Province Info panel[[/sl]] where it is tracked with other Industrial Economy factors.

The current level of [[img:icon_chivalry]][[/img]]Chivalry is [[sl_tooltip:campaign_chivalry_link]]shown on the campaign interface[[/sl_tooltip]] when playing a Bretonnian [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]].

Commandments are issued on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_commandments_rollout]]commandments rollout[[/sl_tooltip]], which is shown when a controlled [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]] is selected. The tooltips on the various commandment buttons show the bonuses that they apply.
When playing as a Cathayan [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]], the Compass can be viewed and its direction changed on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_compass_panel]]Compass panel[[/sl_tooltip]].
[[img:icon_confederation]][[/img]]Confederation combines the two factions into one, and cannot be reversed.

Every few [[sl:campaign_turns]]turns[[/sl]] when playing as an Ogre [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] a number of Contracts are issued at once. These may be browsed and accepted on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_contracts_panel]]Contracts panel[[/sl_tooltip]].
If the proportion of any one type of corruption exceeds 50% in a province then the effects of that corruption will begin to apply.
As they develop, Cyclical [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]recruitment[[/sl]] buildings continuously increase the caps of the summonable [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]] they provide.

A Daemon Prince may gain glory with an individual God of Chaos by dedicating victories in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]] to them, by constructing certain [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]], and through [[sl:campaign_missions]]mission[[/sl]] rewards.

As with other daemonic servants of the Ruinous Powers, except the followers of [[sl:campaign_slaanesh]]Slaanesh[[/sl]], war is automatically declared whenever the Daemons of Chaos encounter a [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] of a non-Chaos [[sl:campaign_races]]race[[/sl]] on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]].

An army's Dark Authority levels and effects are viewed above the [[sl:campaign_character_info_panel]]Character Info panel[[/sl]] and can be affected by the [[sl:campaign_character_skills]]skills[[/sl]], [[sl_tooltip:campaign_character_traits]]traits[[/sl_tooltip]], and ancillaries of its [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lord[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Heroes[[/sl]].

The [[img:icon_loyalty]][[/img]]loyalty of a [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord can be increased by [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]recruiting units[[/sl]] to their [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]], by gifting them items and by completing [[sl:campaign_missions]]missions[[/sl]].
Dark Elves capture [[img:icon_slaves]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_slaves]]Slaves[[/sl]] in battle, who are put to work fulfilling many degrading and exhausting duties across the Druchii empire.
[[img:icon_dark_fortress]][[/img]]Dark Fortresses are special major [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] constructed in specific regions in Norsca, the Chaos Wastes, and other key locations.
The number of units of each type that may be fielded is shown on its card on the [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment_panel]]Recruitment panel[[/sl]].

A Death Night can be initiated by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_death_night_button]]Death Night button[[/sl_tooltip]] on the campaign interface. This becomes active when a sufficient number of sacrificial [[img:icon_slaves]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_slaves]]slaves[[/sl]] have been acquired.

A Dedication can be made on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_daemonic_glory_panel]]Daemonic Glory panel[[/sl_tooltip]] when playing as a Daemon Prince [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] when sufficient Daemonic Glory is attained.
Ulthuan, the island home of the [[sl:campaign_high_elves]]High Elves[[/sl]], is divided by a ring of mountains between outer and inner [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]].
Only Slaaneshi factions collect Devotees, who can be tracked via the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_devotees_counter]]counter[[/sl_tooltip]] and tooltip at the top of the main campaign interface.
Place the mouse cursor over the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_devotion_icon]]Devotion icon[[/sl_tooltip]] on the main campaign interface to see a breakdown of the sources of Devotion.
{{tr:hp_campaign_diplomacy_add_01}} Diplomatic actions are received or can be proposed on the [[sl:campaign_diplomacy_screen]]Diplomacy screen[[/sl]].
Information about the player’s [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] is shown on the left panel on the Diplomacy screen.

A Disciple Army is summoned from an existing Slaaneshi military force, at a cost in [[sl:campaign_devotees]]Devotees[[/sl]]. When playing as Slaanesh, select an army and click the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_summon_disciple_army_button]]Summon Disciple Army button[[/sl_tooltip]] on the [[sl:campaign_army_panel]]Army panel[[/sl]] to perform a summon.

The chance of a Khornate faction automatically gaining control of a ruined [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]] in their province is increased if they own more than one settlement in the province. The chance is lower for a [[sl:campaign_fortifications]]fortified[[/sl]] province capital than for an unfortified minor settlement.
[[img:icon_dread]][[/img]]Dread is spent in the Rewards of Dread panel accessed via the button in the bottom right corner of the main campaign interface when playing a Beastmen faction.
Readying the Drill
The [[sl_tooltip:campaign_events_list]]Events list[[/sl_tooltip]] shows important notifications about your [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] or the wider world.
Dwarf [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] maintain a record of grievances in their Book of [[sl:campaign_grudges]]Grudges[[/sl]].

Each Tomb King dynasty researched will increase the number of [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords the faction may [[sl:campaign_raising_forces]]recruit[[/sl]], and the number of [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] it may field, by one.
Positions of Office may be assigned on the Offices panel, which is opened by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_offices_button]]Offices button[[/sl_tooltip]] on the user interface.
An Elven Hall is invariably the only settlement found within the [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]] that contains it.
The Empire is fractured into multiple [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] at the start of the [[sl:campaign_campaign_game]]campaign game[[/sl]].
As the Huntsmarshal's Expedition makes progress, increasingly better reinforcements are sent to aid them from the homeland.
The [[img:emp_hostility]][[/img]]Hostility bar can be viewed at the top of the campaign interface when playing as the Huntsmarshal's Expedition [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]].
[[img:emp_imperial_authority]][[/img]]Imperial Authority and [[img:emp_prestige]][[/img]]Prestige can be viewed at the top of the campaign interface when playing as the Empire.

An Elector’s faith in the Empire is measured by his [[img:emp_fealty]][[/img]]Fealty, which can be viewed on the [[img:emp_elector_counts]][[/img]]Elector Counts panel via the button in the bottom right-hand corner of the campaign interface.

The [[img:bullet_emp_hunters]][[/img]]Wulfhart's Hunters panel can be accessed from the lower-right section of the campaign interface when playing the Huntsmarshal's Expedition [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]].
Only the Jade Court faction have access to the four dormant directions of the Wu Xing Compass, which can be unlocked in any order as part of their campaign victory conditions.
Encounters at sea appear as wrecked ships or magical islands in ocean areas.

The additional Influence that High Elves gain from their outposts affords them a greater capacity to manipulate other factions’ [[sl:campaign_diplomacy]]diplomatic relations[[/sl]] through the [[sl:campaign_intrigue_at_the_court]]Court[[/sl]].

Herald Lords and Exalted Greater Daemons are only available to [[sl:campaign_khorne]]Khornate[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_nurgle]]Nurglish[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_slaanesh]]Slaaneshi[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_tzeentch]]Tzeentchian[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_daemons_of_chaos]]Daemons of Chaos[[/sl]] factions.

Buttons to open the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_technology_panel]]Technology panel[[/sl_tooltip]], {{tr:icon_treasury}}[[sl:campaign_treasury_panel]]Treasury panel[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_diplomacy_screen]]Diplomacy screen[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_missions]]Objectives panel[[/sl]] and more are shown next to the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_end_turn_button]]End Turn button[[/sl_tooltip]].

The {{tr:icon_treasury}}[[sl:campaign_treasury_panel]]Treasury panel[[/sl]] shows information about [[sl:campaign_tax]]{{tr:hp_campaign_tax_term}}[[/sl]], [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_trade]]trade[[/sl]], and {{tr:icon_money}}[[sl:campaign_money]]{{tr:hp_campaign_money_term}}[[/sl]] for the player's faction.
The Faction Summary screen can be displayed by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_faction_summary_button]]Faction Summary button[[/sl_tooltip]] on the campaign interface.

A faction is served by [[sl:campaign_characters]]characters[[/sl]] such as [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Heroes[[/sl]].
Fleet Offices may be awarded on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_fleet_office_panel]]Offices panel[[/sl_tooltip]].

The fog of war is lifted over an area of land when its central [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]] is captured, or if controlled by a [[img:icon_military_alliance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_alliances]]military ally[[/sl]].
Current [[img:icon_skaven_food]][[/img]]food levels are shown on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_food_bar]]Food bar[[/sl_tooltip]] when playing as a Skaven [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]].
{{tr:hp_campaign_forge_of_souls_add_01}} This journey is difficult, however, for mortal souls are required to illuminate the path to the Forge.
Items can be made on The Forge panel, which can be opened by clicking [[sl_tooltip:campaign_forging_magic_items_button]]The Forge button[[/sl_tooltip]] on the campaign interface.
Province capitals feature fortification [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]] that may be upgraded to improve the settlement defences.

The garrison army a settlement provides can be seen on the [[sl:campaign_province_overview_panel]]Province Overview panel[[/sl]], by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_garrison_details_button]]Garrison Details button[[/sl_tooltip]].
The Gathering of the Ancients may be browsed on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_gathering_of_the_ancients_panel]]Offices screen[[/sl_tooltip]].

The Geomantic Web may be viewed by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_geomantic_web_button]]Geomantic Web button[[/sl_tooltip]] on the campaign interface when playing as a Lizardmen faction. In this view, the colour of each Geomantic Web link and node indicates its operating power.

A Gift of Slaanesh can be received by any [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lord[[/sl]] who loses a [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]] against a Slaaneshi [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]], or any victim of a successful Slaaneshi [[sl:campaign_hero_actions]]Hero action[[/sl]].

Norscan players may gain [[img:icon_allegiance]][[/img]]allegiance by [[sl:campaign_razing]]razing settlements[[/sl]] in the name of one of the four Gods or by completing [[sl:campaign_monsters]]Monster Hunts[[/sl]].
Gotrek and Felix can be recruited by any faction of the [[sl:campaign_empire]]Empire[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_bretonnia]]Bretonnia[[/sl]] or [[sl:campaign_dwarfs]]Dwarfs[[/sl]].

Cathayan [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] must maintain and defend the Snake Gate, the Dragon Gate, and Turtle Gate [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] to prevent Chaos from entering their lands.

The [[img:icon_green_knight]][[/img]]Green Knight may be summoned by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_green_knight_link]]Legendary Knight button[[/sl_tooltip]] on the campaign interface when playing as a Bretonnian [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]].

Greenskin tribes earn [[img:icon_waaagh]][[/img]]Reputation from fighting [[sl:campaign_battles]]battles[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_razing]]razing[[/sl]] settlements which can eventually lead to a [[sl:campaign_waaagh]]Waaagh![[/sl]].
Grom’s Cauldron can be accessed from the main campaign interface when playing as the Broken Axe [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]].
[[img:icon_scrap]][[/img]]Scrap is automatically picked up after battles and when razing settlements when playing as any Greenskin faction.
Grimoires can be tracked via the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_grimoires_counter]]counter[[/sl_tooltip]] and tooltip at the top of the main campaign interface when playing a Tzeentchian faction.
[[img:icon_growth]][[/img]]Growth and [[img:icon_pop_surplus]][[/img]]population surplus can be seen on the [[sl:campaign_province_info_panel]]Province Info panel[[/sl]].

Grudges appear as [[sl:campaign_missions]]missions[[/sl]] in the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_grudges_button]]Great Book of Grudges[[/sl_tooltip]] which is accessed via the button in the bottom right of the main campaign interface.
Cathayan [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] receive campaign bonuses depending on the balance between the levels of Yin and Yang in their [[sl:campaign_provinces]]provinces[[/sl]].

The Hell-Forge is accessed via the dedicated button on the main campaign interface. It is split into the Armoury tab, which allows the increase of unit capacities, and the Manufactory tab, which can be used to enhance entire categories of units.
With a [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero selected, right-click the desired target to move the [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero there and show a range of options.

[[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes can move independently of armies, and can freely move into enemy territory. [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes cannot be attacked by enemy armies, only by enemy [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes.

Hexes are powerful magical actions that Mother Ostankya can perform to target [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] and regions with different effects to benefit her campaign.

High Elf factions all nominally serve the Phoenix King, the ruler of all Asur, and can gain [[img:icon_influence]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_influence]]influence[[/sl]] in his court by completing certain actions.
Athel Tamarha can be accessed from the main campaign interface when playing as Yvresse.
Dragon encounters occur from time to time throughout the campaign in the form of a Dragon Marker that appears on the map when playing as the Knights of Caledor.
Horde growth and [[img:icon_pop_surplus]][[/img]]population surplus can be seen on the [[sl:campaign_building_panel]]Building panel[[/sl]].

Horde [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]] reside with their armies. Available building options for a selected Horde army may be seen on the [[sl:campaign_building_panel]]Building panel[[/sl]], viewable by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_building_panel_tab]]Building tab[[/sl_tooltip]] on the [[sl:campaign_army_panel]]Army panel[[/sl]].
{{tr:hp_campaign_ice_court_add_01}} The initiation of training carries a [[sl:campaign_money]]financial cost[[/sl]].
The {{tr:icon_treasury}}Treasury panel also shows expenditure from sources such as [[sl:campaign_units]]unit[[/sl]] upkeep and [[sl:campaign_buildings]]building[[/sl]] construction.

Pirates of the Vampire Coast gain [[img:icon_infamy]][[/img]]Infamy by winning battles, claiming settlements, and establishing [[img:icon_cove]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_pirate_coves]]Pirate Coves[[/sl]].

High Elf factions earn [[img:icon_influence]][[/img]]influence from events, [[sl:campaign_outposts]]outposts[[/sl]], and [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_hero_actions]]Hero actions[[/sl]] of their Nobles. The current amount is shown at the top of the main campaign interface.

Intervention armies may be hired by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_interventions_button]]Interventions button[[/sl_tooltip]] on the [[sl:campaign_rituals_bar]]Rituals bar[[/sl]] while a rival [[sl:campaign_races]]race[[/sl]] is conducting a [[sl:campaign_rituals]]ritual[[/sl]].

Intrigues are initiated on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_intrigue_at_the_court_panel]]Intrigue at the Court panel[[/sl_tooltip]], which is opened by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_intrigue_at_the_court_button]]Intrigue at the Court button[[/sl_tooltip]] on the campaign interface.
Resolve the conflict in a classic-style land battle.
When playing as a [[sl:campaign_cathay]]Cathayan[[/sl]] faction, Ivory Road routes and Caravan progress may be viewed on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_ivory_road_panel]]Ivory Road panel[[/sl_tooltip]].

As with other Chaos Daemons except the followers of [[sl:campaign_slaanesh]]Slaanesh[[/sl]], war is automatically declared whenever the forces of Khorne encounter a faction of a non-Chaos [[sl:campaign_races]]race[[/sl]] on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]].
Because of their hardy and survivalist nature, Kislevite [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]] tend to be versatile and fulfil multiple roles in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]].

[[img:icon_labour]][[/img]]Labour is received from battles, [[sl:campaign_military_convoys]]Military Convoys[[/sl]], and [[img:icon_raiding_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_raiding]]raiding[[/sl]]. When received, it is evenly distributed to every province accepting new Labour.
The [[sl:campaign_lizardmen]]Lizardmen[[/sl]] maintain the [[sl:campaign_geomantic_web]]Geomantic Web[[/sl]], an unseen network of magical energy that spans the world.

When a temple is built, [[img:icon_lzd_nakai_favour]][[/img]]Favour and alignment to an [[img:icon_lzd_nakai_temple_green]][[/img]][[img:icon_lzd_nakai_temple_blue]][[/img]][[img:icon_lzd_nakai_temple_red]][[/img]]Old One will be granted to unlock rewards, powerful [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_technology]]technologies[[/sl]], increasing the strength of the Spirit of the Jungle.

When [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]] are developed in Nakai's horde [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] that unlock [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]] for recruitment, those unlocked units will go into the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_global_recruitment_pool]]global recruitment pool[[/sl_tooltip]].

Lord Kroak will be automatically summoned after completing his unique [[sl:campaign_quests]]quest chain[[/sl]], which will become available during the course of the campaign for each playable Lizardman [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Legendary Lord[[/sl]].

Playing as the Cult of Sotek faction, [[img:icon_sotek_captives]][[/img]]Sacrificial Offerings can be acquired by winning [[sl:campaign_battles]]battles[[/sl]] and selecting “Mark for Sacrifice” from the [[sl:campaign_post_battle_options]]post-battle options[[/sl]], or by successfully completing [[sl:campaign_missions]]missions[[/sl]].
The warm-blooded invaders can be viewed at the top of the campaign interface when playing as Nakai.

A new army may be [[sl:campaign_raising_forces]]raised[[/sl]], and a [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord appointed to lead it, on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_raise_forces_panel]]Recruit Lord panel[[/sl_tooltip]].

[[sl:campaign_dark_elf_loyalty]]Dark Elf loyalty[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_skaven_loyalty]]Skaven loyalty[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_vampiric_loyalty]]Vampire loyalty[[/sl]] are all influenced by different factors.

Magic items may be received after victory in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]] or as a [[sl:campaign_quests]]quest[[/sl]] reward. Items are equipped by the receiving [[sl:campaign_characters]]character[[/sl]] unless they already have an item equipped in the relevant slot. In this case the item goes in to the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_global_item_pool]]Global Item pool[[/sl_tooltip]].
At the start of the campaign, a set of three neutral or enemy [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords are selected as targets when playing as Nagarythe.

The total number of [[img:icon_marks_of_ruination]][[/img]]Marks of Ruination collected and the resulting Ruination Level can be viewed via the tooltips on the bar at the top of the main campaign interface when playing a Beastmen [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]].

Matters of State actions are performed by using the energies of [[img:icon_mos_steel]][[/img]]Steel and [[img:icon_mos_stone]][[/img]]Stone which are never lost, only transferred between one another in the form of tokens.

The current Meat stores of a selected Ogre army is shown on the [[sl:campaign_character_info_panel]]Character Info panel[[/sl]]. The tooltip of this icon may be inspected to see a breakdown of income and outgoings.
Military Convoys can be dispatched by selecting or recruiting a Convoy Master in the Military Convoys panel, accessed via the button in the bottom right of the main campaign interface.
