A list of active missions and [[sl:campaign_victory_conditions]]campaign victory conditions[[/sl]] may be seen on the Objectives panel, which can be opened by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_objectives_button]]Objectives button[[/sl_tooltip]] on the campaign interface.

A faction can earn {{tr:icon_money}}{{tr:hp_campaign_money_term}} through [[sl:campaign_tax]]{{tr:hp_campaign_tax_term}}[[/sl]], [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_trade]]trade[[/sl]], and certain military activities such as [[img:icon_raiding_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_raiding]]raiding[[/sl]] and looting.

[[sl:campaign_units]]Units[[/sl]] captured for the [[img:icon_monster_pens]][[/img]]Monster Pens can be instantly recruited into any [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] via the dedicated button on the [[sl:campaign_army_panel]]Army panel[[/sl]]. The number of monsters available at any one time is limited.
Norscan [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] may make monster hunts available through the research of [[sl:campaign_technology]]technologies[[/sl]].

As [[img:icon_corruption_chs]][[/img]]Chaos corruption increases, Alarielle will suffer from reduced [[sl:campaign_winds_of_magic]]Winds of Magic[[/sl]] and her faction will suffer penalties to [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_public_order]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}}[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_growth]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_growth]]growth[[/sl]].

Items may be crafted on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_mortuary_cult_panel]]Mortuary Cult panel[[/sl_tooltip]], which can be opened by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_mortuary_cult_button]]Mortuary Cult button[[/sl_tooltip]] on the campaign interface.
{{tr:hp_campaign_motherland_add_01}} The method of gaining [[img:icon_supporters]][[/img]]Supporters is different for each invocation:
[[img:icon_non-aggression_pact]][[/img]]Non-aggression pacts can be proposed and agreed on the [[sl:campaign_diplomacy_screen]]Diplomacy screen[[/sl]].
Killing Norscan faction leaders in battle will force their [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] to [[img:icon_confederation]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_confederation]]confederate[[/sl]].

Norscan Homelands are indicated by the associated tribe’s faction icon on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_settlement_bars]]Settlement bars[[/sl_tooltip]], with Homeland Capitals denoted by the icon’s tooltip.

As with other Chaos Daemons except the followers of [[sl:campaign_slaanesh]]Slaanesh[[/sl]], war is automatically declared whenever the forces of Nurgle encounter a [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] of a non-Chaos [[sl:campaign_races]]race[[/sl]] on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]].
The full rejuvenation of the Oak is one of the [[sl:campaign_victory_conditions]]victory conditions[[/sl]] for Wood Elf [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]].
The current stockpile of [[img:icon_oathgold]][[/img]]Oathgold is shown at the top of the main campaign interface.
Offices may be awarded on the Offices panel, which is opened by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_offices_button]]Offices button[[/sl_tooltip]] on the user interface.

A [[sl:campaign_technology]]technology[[/sl]] must be researched before any Ogre Camps can be built. The total number of Ogre Camps that can be deployed at once can be increased by researching further technologies.

Ogre [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] consume and carry a supply of [[sl:campaign_meat]]Meat[[/sl]], which they must maintain to avoid suffering [[sl:campaign_attrition]]attrition[[/sl]] from cannibalism.

Outposts are constructed on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_war_coordination_outpost_tab]]Outpost tab[[/sl_tooltip]] of the [[sl:campaign_war_coordination]]War Co-ordination panel[[/sl]], which is opened from the [[sl:campaign_diplomacy_screen]]Diplomacy screen[[/sl]]. Outposts take [[sl:campaign_turns]]time[[/sl]] and cost [[sl:campaign_money]]money[[/sl]] to build. They may be moved or demolished once constructed.

[[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Heroes[[/sl]] can become more powerful beings by being granted Marks of Chaos via the Path to Glory tab of their [[sl:campaign_character_details_panel]]Character Details panel[[/sl]].

The number of [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]recruited[[/sl]] peasant [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]] is [[sl_tooltip:campaign_peasants_link]]shown on the campaign interface[[/sl_tooltip]] when playing as a Bretonnian [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]].
Each Piece of Eight is connected to a unique [[sl:campaign_regiments_of_renown]]Regiment of Renown[[/sl]].

A [[img:icon_cove]][[/img]]Pirate Cove can be established in any foreign [[img:icon_port]][[/img]]port after winning a battle there or via [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_hero_actions]]Hero actions[[/sl]].
[[img:icon_plague]][[/img]]Plagues are generated by a Skaven faction performing the [[sl:campaign_rites]]rite[[/sl]] of the Pestilent Scheme.
{{tr:hp_campaign_plagues_of_nurgle_add_01}} New plagues are created from a base plague.

Pleasurable Acts can be initiated on the [[sl:campaign_province_info_panel]]Province Info panel[[/sl]] when a controlled [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]] is selected. The tooltip on each [[sl_tooltip:campaign_pleasurable_acts_buttons]]act button[[/sl_tooltip]] shows the costs and benefits associated with that act. Each Pleasurable Act costs [[sl:campaign_devotees]]Devotees[[/sl]] to perform.
Coastal settlements contain special [[img:icon_port]][[/img]]port [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]] that provide facilities for sea [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]]trade.
Possession increases naturally over time but is slowed whenever Malus is garrisoned within a [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]].
More options are available if the winners and losers are of the same [[sl:campaign_races]]race[[/sl]].
If the battle was won then the tooltip on each choice button gives information about the choice and its consequences.

If Alarielle begins her turn in a friendly province, bonuses are applied to [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_public_order]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}}[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_corruption_untainted]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_corruption]]corruption[[/sl]] is reduced for several turns.
Examine the tooltip on each engagement button to view more information about that option.

The forces panels display known forces including [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_unit_cards]]Unit Cards[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_reinforcements]]reinforcements[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_banners_and_marks]]banners[[/sl]] and army effects.

Information about [[sl:campaign_growth]]growth[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_tax]]{{tr:hp_campaign_tax_term}}[[/sl]] or [[img:icon_slaves]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_slaves]]slaves[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_public_order]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}}[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_corruption]]corruption[[/sl]] are displayed on the Province Info panel.
Detailed information about a province can be found on the [[sl:campaign_province_info_panel]]Province Info panel[[/sl]].
Information about owned settlements is displayed in full.
{{tr:hp_campaign_provinces_add_3}} More information about a province is shown on the [[sl:campaign_province_info_panel]]Province Info panel[[/sl]].

Various factors can improve [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}}, such as certain [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]] and the stationing of [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] in the province [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]].
Available quests and the rank at which they become available are shown on the skills tab of the [[sl:campaign_character_details_panel]]Character Details panel[[/sl]].
Factions of a particular race receive a bonus to [[sl:campaign_diplomacy]]diplomatic[[/sl]] relations and therefore tend to stick together.
[[img:icon_raiding_stance]][[/img]]Raiding enemy territory causes [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]unhappiness in the targeted [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]].
Raise the dead into a selected army by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_raise_dead_button]]Raise Dead button[[/sl_tooltip]] on the campaign interface.
Click the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_raise_forces_button]]Recruit Lord button[[/sl_tooltip]] with a controlled [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]] selected to open the Recruit Lord panel.
The progress of a Rampage is tracked on the Rampage bar, accessed via the button at the top of the main campaign interface when playing as the Slaughterhorn Tribe.
No faction will own a settlement after it’s been razed.

[[sl:campaign_ursun]]Ursun[[/sl]], the injured [[sl:campaign_kislev]]Kislevite[[/sl]] God-Bear is being held within the [[sl:campaign_forge_of_souls]]Forge of Souls[[/sl]]. Various interested [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] must march to [[sl:campaign_war]]war[[/sl]] in an effort to recover him for their own purposes.
[[sl_tooltip:campaign_hero_recruitment_panel_tab_buttons]]Tab buttons[[/sl_tooltip]] at the top of the panel show lists of [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes that can be recruited.
Regiments of Renown can be recruited into a selected [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] from the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_regiments_of_renown_panel]]Regiments of Renown panel[[/sl_tooltip]].
Settlements may be offered or requested by selecting the Trade Settlement option when constructing a deal on the [[sl:campaign_diplomacy_screen]]Diplomacy screen[[/sl]].
Hover the mouse cursor over an army on the campaign map to see which nearby forces it supports. An arrow is drawn where reinforcement would occur.
The presence of a resource in a settlement is indicated by an icon on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_settlement_bars]]Settlement bar[[/sl_tooltip]].
A rebellion occurs if the [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}} in a province drops to -100.
An incursion occurs if [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}} in a province drops to -100.

Rites may be browsed and initiated from the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_rites_panel]]Rites panel[[/sl_tooltip]], which is opened by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_rites_button]]Rites button[[/sl_tooltip]] on the campaign interface.
Currency requirements for a ritual are shown on the cursor tooltips of the ritual button on the [[sl:campaign_rituals_bar]]Rituals bar[[/sl]].
Ritual resource sites are indicated by a glowing icon on the settlement's [[sl_tooltip:campaign_settlement_bars]]Settlement bar[[/sl_tooltip]].

A ritual may be initiated by clicking the corresponding button on the [[sl:campaign_rituals_bar]]Rituals bar[[/sl]]. Once initiated, a ritual takes several [[sl:campaign_turns]]turns[[/sl]] to complete.
The mouse cursor tooltip on the Rituals bar shows the amount of ritual currency accrued, as well as details concerning sources of ritual currency income.
Rogue armies typically appear in sparsely-populated terrain.
Rogue Pirate fleets often employ troops from many different [[sl:campaign_races]]races[[/sl]], making them a challenge to defeat in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]].
Settlements become ruins when [[sl:campaign_razing]]razed[[/sl]] by an attacking force after a [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]].
Previously-saved games can be loaded from the game options, either on the main menu or from within a campaign.
The [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] is divided into several Theatres of War within the panel, with each one containing one Grand Scheme and multiple minor ones.
[[sl:campaign_armies_at_sea]]Armies at sea[[/sl]] are slow and highly vulnerable to attack. Battles fought at sea will be contested on islands.

Sea Lanes take two [[sl:campaign_turns]]turns[[/sl]] to navigate for most, but the skilled navigators of certain seafaring [[sl:campaign_races]]races[[/sl]] only require a single turn to traverse a Sea Lane.

The Lost Sea Shanty is separated into three [[img:icon_shanty]][[/img]]verses, each carried by a different pirate [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lord[[/sl]]. The current holder of each [[img:icon_shanty]][[/img]]verse is shown on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_infamy_link]]Infamy list[[/sl_tooltip]].

{{tr:hp_campaign_seduction_add_01}} Select an enemy unit and click the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_seduce_units_button]]Seduce Units button[[/sl_tooltip]] to seduce when playing a Slaaneshi [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]].
{{tr:hp_campaign_seductive_influence_add_02}} Interactions which increase Seductive Influence include:
Climate type is indicated on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_settlement_bars]]settlement bar[[/sl_tooltip]] that appears below each settlement on the campaign map.
[[sl:campaign_dwarfs]]Dwarfs[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_greenskins]]Greenskins[[/sl]] may occupy the holds found in the mountains and Badlands.
[[sl:campaign_buildings]]Buildings[[/sl]] may be constructed within a settlement to boost its production or defences.

[[img:skv_snikch_schemes]][[/img]]Schemes are required to conduct Shadowy Dealings actions and are acquired naturally over time. Each action requires a number of [[img:skv_snikch_schemes]][[/img]]Schemes to be available, with increasing numbers needed for the more daring and lethal tasks.

Shipbuilding is only available to [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Legendary Lords[[/sl]] of the Vampire Coast and Legendary Pirates found in the [[sl:campaign_technology]]Technology tree[[/sl]].
Small settlements without fortifications may be directly attacked or encircled in an attempt to starve the enemy out.
The defenders of a settlement under siege will eventually starve and surrender unless they sally or are relieved by a [[sl:campaign_reinforcements]]reinforcing army[[/sl]].
Different siege weapons are used to attack different parts of the settlement defences during [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]].

Skaven [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] [[img:icon_stalking_stance]][[/img]]stalk their enemies by default, giving them a chance to [[img:icon_ambush_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_ambushes]]ambush[[/sl]] even when attacking normally.
Corruption in a province is shown on the [[sl:campaign_province_info_panel]]Province Info panel[[/sl]].

The Flesh Laboratory is accessed via the button in the bottom right of the main campaign interface. [[sl:campaign_unit_cards]]Unit cards[[/sl]] can be selected directly from Throt’s [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] to upgrade infantry and monsters with various Augments via the respective tabs.
The Forbidden Workshop can be accessed from the main campaign interface when playing as the Clan Skryre [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]].

The [[img:icon_loyalty]][[/img]]loyalty of a [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord can be increased by [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]recruiting units[[/sl]] to their [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]], by gifting them items and by completing [[sl:campaign_missions]]missions[[/sl]].

Standard Skaven settlements are not ordinarily visible to other [[sl:campaign_races]]races[[/sl]], appearing instead as uninhabited [[sl:campaign_ruins]]ruins[[/sl]]. Skaven factions can always see each other’s settlements, but [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] of other races will not discover the Skaven threat within a ruin until they attempt to colonise there.
Skulls can be tracked via the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_skulls_counter]]counter[[/sl_tooltip]] and tooltip at the top of the main campaign interface when playing a Khornate faction.

Unlike other [[sl:campaign_races]]races[[/sl]] of Chaos Daemons, the servants of Slaanesh don't automatically declare war on non-Chaos [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] they encounter. Additionally, they may use their [[sl:campaign_seductive_influence]]seductive influence[[/sl]] to gain [[sl:campaign_diplomacy]]diplomatic[[/sl]] leverage over humans and elves that they meet.
The total number of [[img:icon_slaves]][[/img]]slaves, population changes and a breakdown of sources are shown via the figures and tooltip at the top of the main campaign interface.

[[img:icon_souls_resource]][[/img]]Souls are acquired by winning battles and razing settlements against all factions except [[sl:campaign_khorne]]Khorne[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_slaanesh]]Slaanesh[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_tzeentch]]Tzeentch[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_nurgle]]Nurgle[[/sl]], or [[sl:campaign_daemons_of_chaos]]Daemons of Chaos[[/sl]], whose [[img:icon_souls_resource]][[/img]]Souls have already been claimed.
Many stances are only available to armies of certain [[sl:campaign_races]]races[[/sl]].
The Strategic Overview shows a wider world-view, and may be used to assist with [[sl:campaign_faction_management]]faction management[[/sl]].

Only [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords of the [[sl:campaign_high_elves]]High Elves[[/sl]], the [[sl:campaign_dark_elves]]Dark Elves[[/sl]], or the [[sl:campaign_wood_elves]]Wood Elves[[/sl]] may construct the Shrine of the Widowmaker building at the Shrine of Khaine, from which the Sword of Khaine is acquired.

Taxed {{tr:icon_income}}income is mainly generated by economic [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_port]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_ports]]ports[[/sl]]. The tax {{tr:icon_income}}income a building generates is shown when the cursor is placed over its icon on the [[sl:campaign_province_overview_panel]]Province Overview panel[[/sl]].

{{tr:icon_income}}Income to extort is mainly generated by economic [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_port]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_ports]]ports[[/sl]]. The {{tr:icon_income}}income a building generates is shown when the cursor is placed over its icon on the [[sl:campaign_province_overview_panel]]Province Overview panel[[/sl]].
Left-click a technology on the panel to begin research towards it. Only one technology may be researched at a time.
Teleport stance is only available once its associated [[sl:campaign_technology]]technology[[/sl]] has been researched. REMOVED
Rivers, mountains and dense forests restrict movement across the campaign map.
Chaos [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] may advance the cause of their chosen God by spreading [[sl:campaign_chaos_corruption]]Chaos corruption[[/sl]] across the mortal world.

Additional uses of the ability can also be purchased on the [[sl:campaign_pre_battle_panel]]pre-battle panel[[/sl]] for most battles by expending [[img:icon_skaven_food]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_food]]food[[/sl]].
The Artefact Vault is part of the [[sl:campaign_forging_magic_items]]Forge[[/sl]] and can only be accessed when playing as Ironbrow’s Expedition.

The [[sl:campaign_mortuary_cult]]Mortuary Cult[[/sl]] may be used by the Tomb Kings to craft magic [[sl:campaign_character_details]]items[[/sl]] and unlock [[sl:campaign_regiments_of_renown]]Regiments of Renown[[/sl]].

The Seats of the Tower of Zharr can be viewed via the button on the main campaign interface. Claiming Seats requires [[img:icon_conclave_influence]][[/img]]Conclave Influence, which is gained through expanding territory and raising towers and temples.

[[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]]Trade agreements are generally only signed between factions where relations are good. [[img:icon_non-aggression_pact]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_non_aggression_pacts]]Non-aggression pacts[[/sl]] may be agreed or diplomatic gifts may be given to improve relations to a level where trade is feasible.
Treasure Maps may be gained from victory in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]] or from [[sl:campaign_encounters_at_sea]]Encounters at Sea[[/sl]].
The {{tr:hp_campaign_treasury_panel_term}} is opened by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_treasury_button]]{{tr:hp_campaign_description_treasury_button_term}}[[/sl_tooltip]] on the user interface.

As the leader of a Norscan [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]], killing other Norscan faction leaders in battle will force their [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] to [[img:icon_confederation]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_confederation]]confederate[[/sl]].

[[img:icon_trickster_cult]][[/img]]Trickster Cults co-exist with their host settlements via Trickster Cult buildings, which the Deceivers can establish [[sl:campaign_post_battle_options]]post-battle[[/sl]] or via [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_hero_actions]]Hero actions[[/sl]].

Once the turn is ended, other [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] will then get the ability to move their [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]recruit units[[/sl]] and perform other actions.

As with other Chaos Daemons except the followers of [[sl:campaign_slaanesh]]Slaanesh[[/sl]], war is automatically declared whenever the forces of Tzeentch encounter a [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] of a non-Chaos [[sl:campaign_races]]race[[/sl]] on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]].
Only [[sl:campaign_dwarfs]]Dwarfs[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_greenskins]]Greenskins[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_skaven]]Skaven[[/sl]] can move using the Underway.
Unholy Manifestations may be viewed and enacted from the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_unholy_manifestations_panel]]Unholy Manifestations panel[[/sl_tooltip]].
Select an army to show the [[sl:campaign_army_panel]]Army panel[[/sl]], on which Unit Cards are displayed.
The selected army will move to the target if the two are not close enough to exchange units.
The experience level of a unit is shown in chevrons on its [[sl:campaign_unit_cards]]Unit Card[[/sl]].
Left-click on a Unit Card on the [[sl:campaign_army_panel]]Army panel[[/sl]] to pin the unit's information on the Unit Info panel.
Similar units that have suffered casualties in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]] may be merged together by selecting both Unit Cards and clicking the merge option.
Unit Recruitment is performed from the [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment_panel]]Recruitment panel[[/sl]], which is opened from the [[sl:campaign_army_panel]]Army panel[[/sl]].

The [[sl_tooltip:campaign_local_recruitment_pool]]local[[/sl_tooltip]] and [[sl_tooltip:campaign_global_recruitment_pool]]global[[/sl_tooltip]] recruitment options display [[sl:campaign_unit_cards]]Unit Cards[[/sl]] representing [[sl:campaign_unit_types]]unit types[[/sl]] that may recruited by the selected army.
Active [[img:icon_replenishment]][[/img]]replenishment effects are indicated on the [[sl:campaign_unit_cards]]Unit cards[[/sl]] of a selected [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]].
Infantry units are tightly-packed bodies of soldiers that fight hand-to-hand.

Units cost [[sl:campaign_money]]{{tr:hp_campaign_money_term}}[[/sl]] to [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]recruit[[/sl]], and also require a further payment [[sl:campaign_turns]]per-turn[[/sl]] for upkeep.
As Ursun lays dying within the Forge of Souls, his roars of pain cause [[sl:campaign_chaos_rifts]]rifts[[/sl]] to open between the corporeal world and the Realm of Chaos.
The most infamous pirates may seize [[img:icon_shanty]][[/img]]verses of the [[sl:campaign_sea_shanties]]Lost Sea Shanty[[/sl]].

Vampires spread [[img:icon_corruption_vmp]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_vampiric_corruption]]Vampiric corruption[[/sl]] wherever they settle. Vampires will suffer [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_attrition]]attritional casualties[[/sl]] when moving through land areas not afflicted by Vampiric corruption.
Corruption in a [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]] is shown on the [[sl:campaign_province_info_panel]]Province Info panel[[/sl]].

The primary trait of a [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord of the Vampire Coast can be seen on the Details tab of the [[sl:campaign_character_details_panel]]Character Details panel[[/sl]]. The tooltip on the trait indicates actions that will increase that [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord’s [[img:icon_loyalty]][[/img]]loyalty.

[[sl:campaign_vampires]]Vampiric[[/sl]] factions and [[sl:campaign_warriors_of_chaos]]the Warriors of Chaos[[/sl]] may take [[img:icon_vassal]][[/img]]vassals. [[sl:campaign_slaanesh]]Slaaneshi[[/sl]] factions may also vassalise human or Elvish factions that they have enticed through [[sl:campaign_seductive_influence]]Seductive Influence[[/sl]].
There are a number of different victory types which are shown on the Objectives panel.

A Call to Waaagh! can be made in any Greenskin campaign once enough [[img:icon_waaagh]][[/img]]Reputation is gained from fighting [[sl:campaign_battles]]battles[[/sl]] and razing [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]].
A declaration of war on a faction may also result in war with that faction’s [[img:icon_military_alliance]][[/img]]allies.

War co-ordination requests cost [[img:icon_allegiance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_allegiance]]allegiance[[/sl]] when made between allies. [[sl:campaign_factions]]Factions[[/sl]] with [[img:icon_vassal]][[/img]]vassal states may assign war co-ordination requests to those states for free.

Warband Recruitment in each [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]] is affected by [[sl:campaign_settlement_climates]]climate[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_corruption]]corruption[[/sl]], and [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]]. Unit availability is previewed via the tooltip on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_settlement_bars]]Settlement bar[[/sl_tooltip]] icon.

War is automatically declared whenever the Warriors of Chaos encounter a [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] of a non-Chaos [[sl:campaign_races]]race[[/sl]] on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]].
The Winds of Magic blow at varying strengths across different provinces, increasing or depleting the power reserves of armies stationed there.

The Winds of Magic may be altered on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_winds_of_magic_manipulation_panel]]Winds of Magic Manipulation panel[[/sl_tooltip]]. Only the strength of the Winds of Magic in controlled [[sl:campaign_provinces]]provinces[[/sl]] may be manipulated.

Incantations are created within the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_witchs_hut_panel]]Witch's Hut panel[[/sl_tooltip]] to prepare Blessings and Curses for units in battles, benefitting the Daughters’ armies and weakening their enemies respectively.
Wood Elves may expand anywhere on the campaign map by capturing enemy [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] and constructing [[sl:campaign_asrai_lookouts]]Asrai Lookouts[[/sl]].
Ariel appears to aid all Wood Elf campaigns, except when playing as Drycha’s Wargrove of Woe.

Glamoured Elves are [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]recruited[[/sl]] normally from the appropriate recruitment [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]] with reduced combat stats but increased leadership.
Drycha players may summon spirits or beasts into a selected army by clicking the Wild Spirits & Beasts button at the bottom of the campaign interface.

Each time the Sisters win a [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]], Lord Daith grants them one Favour which can be used to receive gifts chosen from the [[img:icon_forge_of_daith]][[/img]]Forge of Daith panel.
The location and [[img:forest_health]][[/img]]health of the world’s Magical Forests can be viewed via the Worldroots button located in the bottom right corner of the main campaign interface.
A Wood Elf [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] can move through Worldroots by activating the Use Worldroots [[sl:campaign_stances]]stance[[/sl]].
Zones of control can be seen by placing the mouse cursor over an army or settlement.
Advice history can be navigated using the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_advice_history_buttons]]back and forwards buttons[[/sl_tooltip]] on the Advisor panel.

[[img:icon_allegiance]][[/img]]Allegiance is earned slowly over [[sl:campaign_turns]]time[[/sl]] while an [[img:icon_military_alliance]][[/img]]alliance is maintained. It may also be earned by completing certain [[sl:campaign_missions]]missions[[/sl]] that are issued when both factions have a mutual [[sl:campaign_war]]enemy[[/sl]].

Significant [[sl_tooltip:campaign_diplomacy_attitude_icons]]diplomatic standing[[/sl_tooltip]] must be built up between two factions before an [[img:icon_military_alliance]][[/img]]alliance proposal is likely to succeed. Such standing may be improved by agreeing and sticking to [[img:icon_non-aggression_pact]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_non_aggression_pacts]]non-aggression pacts[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_trade]]trade[[/sl]] agreements, and via diplomatic gifts.

The Undead [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] of the [[sl:campaign_vampire_coast]]Vampire Coast[[/sl]] are hell-bent on controlling the creature. They compete with one another to secure the Star-metal Harpoon, the only weapon that can kill the monster.
The amount of [[img:icon_amber]][[/img]]Amber currently held is shown at the top of the screen on the campaign interface when playing as Wood Elves.
An army in [[img:icon_ambush_stance]][[/img]]ambush stance cannot move or [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]recruit troops[[/sl]] without leaving the stance.

Armies that fight one another on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] will meet in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]]. The strength of an army is indicated on its banner shown in campaign.
An army switching between land and sea will not be able to move further on that [[sl:campaign_turns]]turn[[/sl]], unless they move through a [[img:icon_port]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_ports]]port[[/sl]].

Certain actions, such as changing stance or [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_hero_actions]]Hero actions[[/sl]], consume or require a portion of the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_movement_range]]movement range[[/sl_tooltip]] of the selected army or [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero.
The [[sl_tooltip:campaign_unit_recruitment_button]]Recruit Units button[[/sl_tooltip]] opens the [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment_panel]]Unit Recruitment panel[[/sl]] if recruitment is available.
An Asrai Lookout settlement is founded whenever a [[sl:campaign_wood_elves]]Wood Elf[[/sl]] faction captures and occupies a [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]] that sits outside of a forest.

[[img:icon_ambush_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_ambushes]]Ambushes[[/sl]] are much less effective against a [[sl:campaign_lizardmen]]Lizardmen[[/sl]] army in [[img:icon_astromancy_stance]][[/img]]Astromancy stance.

When an Ataman position becomes available, a choice of four candidates displays on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_atamans_panel]]Atamans panel[[/sl_tooltip]]. Left-click on a candidate to select them, and then left-click on a province to assign them to the post.

[[sl:campaign_vampires]]Vampiric[[/sl]] armies will suffer [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]]attritional casualties when moving through areas not affected by [[img:icon_corruption_vmp]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_vampiric_corruption]]vampiric corruption[[/sl]], and vice-versa.
[[sl:campaign_quests]]quest[[/sl]] battles and some other important battles cannot be auto-resolved.

When bankruptcy threatens, restore a positive {{tr:icon_income}}income by [[sl:campaign_unit_merging_and_disbanding]]disbanding units[[/sl]], establishing [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_trade]]trade[[/sl]], [[img:icon_raiding_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_raiding]]raiding[[/sl]] enemy territory or [[sl:campaign_post_battle_options]]sacking[[/sl]] captured enemy [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]].

A banner may be assigned to a unit on the [[sl:campaign_pre_battle_panel]]Pre-Battle panel[[/sl]]and Post-Battle panel by dragging the banner icon on to that unit's [[sl:campaign_unit_cards]]Unit card[[/sl]], or removed by left-clicking it.
Any nearby forces [[img:icon_military_alliance]][[/img]]allied to the attacker or defender may appear in the battle as [[sl:campaign_reinforcements]]reinforcements[[/sl]].
An army using a beast-path will disappear from its original location and reappear at its destination.

By [[sl:campaign_razing]]razing[[/sl]] settlements within their Blood-grounds, Beastmen [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] can gain powerful rewards. Blood-ground [[sl:campaign_ruins]]ruins[[/sl]] cannot be resettled until the local Herdstone is destroyed.

The [[img:icon_bestial_rage]][[/img]]Bestial Rage of a selected army is shown on the [[sl:campaign_character_info_panel]]Character Info panel[[/sl]] in the bottom left corner of the main campaign interface.

The Big Names list can be accessed via the [[sl:campaign_character_details_panel]]Character Details panel[[/sl]] when playing an Ogre Kingdoms [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]]. It shows an assortment of titles, along with details of their effects and unlock requirements.

Once available, a Black Ark may be recruited by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_recruit_black_ark_button]]Recruit Black Ark button[[/sl_tooltip]], which appears on the [[sl:campaign_province_overview_panel]]Province Overview Panel[[/sl]] when a controlled [[img:icon_port]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_ports]]port[[/sl]] is selected.

Once the mission is completed, the blessed units can be [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]recruited[[/sl]] immediately by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_blessed_spawnings_button]]Blessed Spawnings button[[/sl_tooltip]] on the [[sl:campaign_army_panel]]Army panel[[/sl]].
Bretonnian armies earn blessings by winning heroic victories in battle. Blessings are lost when the army retreats from battle in any way.

The initiation of a new Death Night will result in the disbandment of any existing Blood Voyage army. The strength of a new Blood Voyage army is proportional to that of Hellebron's [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] at the time.

Regions surrounding a Herdstone are included in a Blood-ground based on their distance and adjacency to it. Selecting any settlement will activate a red map overlay to show you the limits of the Blood-ground created from placing a Herdstone there.
Winning successive [[sl:campaign_battles]]battles[[/sl]] fills sections of the Bloodletting bar, each one conferring stronger bonuses as more and more victories are attained.

Once earned, [[img:icon_blood_kiss]][[/img]]Blood Kisses may be spent on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_bloodlines_panel]]Bloodlines panel[[/sl_tooltip]] to awaken a Bloodline. Doing so unlocks a powerful ancient [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord for recruitment from the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_raise_forces_panel]]Recruit Lord panel[[/sl_tooltip]].

Books may be held at certain [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]], by [[sl:campaign_rogue_armies]]rogue armies[[/sl]], or in other locations, conferring powerful bonuses on factions who acquire them.

Bretonnian factions may draft [[sl:campaign_peasants]]peasants[[/sl]] from the land into their [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]]. Drafting peasants will provide more [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]] to fight in battles, but may cause {{tr:icon_income}}[[sl:campaign_income]]income[[/sl]] to suffer.
Chevaliers de Lyonesse forces are granted temporary immunity from desert [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]]attrition after entering their settlements and taking on water supplies.

Vows, Troths and the pledges required to gain them can be seen on the Vows tab on the [[sl:campaign_character_details_panel]]Character Details panel[[/sl]]. The tooltip on each pledge button outlines the requirements to fulfil the Vow or Troth.
Buildings available for construction can be seen by placing the mouse cursor over existing building icons.
[[img:icon_pop_surplus]][[/img]]Population surplus can be spent on upgrading the primary settlement building, which is always found in the first slot of a settlement.
[[img:icon_pop_surplus]][[/img]]Kindreds can be spent on upgrading non-military buildings.
Existing buildings may be upgraded to other buildings of the same type, or entirely new buildings may be constructed in empty [[sl:campaign_building_slots]]slots[[/sl]] within a settlement.

Select [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]], [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Heroes[[/sl]], or [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] by left-clicking. Order selected armies to [[sl:campaign_army_movement]]move[[/sl]] or attack by right-clicking the destination or target.

Factions control [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] which grant control over the [[sl:campaign_provinces]]provinces[[/sl]] that surround them. Factions recruit [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]] into [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] which are used to defend their own possessions and conquer their enemies.

Maps feature a variety of different types of [[sl:campaign_terrain_types]]terrain[[/sl]], some of which are dangerous and may inflict [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_attrition]]attritional casualties[[/sl]] on passing armies.
[[img:icon_jars]][[/img]]Canopic Jars may also be consumed to enact [[sl:campaign_rites]]rites[[/sl]] and to replenish [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]] after a battle.

Cathayan factions may use the [[sl:campaign_compass]]Wu Xing Compass[[/sl]] to direct the [[sl:campaign_winds_of_magic]]Winds of Magic[[/sl]] to gain beneficial effects, such as strengthening the [[sl:campaign_great_bastion]]Great Bastion[[/sl]].

Changing of the Ways actions cost [[sl:campaign_grimoires]]Grimoires[[/sl]] or (when playing as Vilitch) Souls to perform. Some actions may require specific [[sl:campaign_technology]]technologies[[/sl]] to be researched before they are available.

The [[sl:campaign_daemons_of_chaos]]Daemons of Chaos[[/sl]] are led by a Daemon Prince, a once-mortal champion of Chaos. As a Daemon Prince serves each God of Chaos they earn [[sl:campaign_daemonic_glory]]Daemonic Glory[[/sl]] which allows their abilities and appearance to be customised.
Chaos Artefacts will cease to spread [[img:icon_corruption_chs]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_corruption]]corruption[[/sl]] after some [[sl:campaign_turns]]time[[/sl]] has passed.
[[sl:campaign_chaos_cults]]Chaos Cults[[/sl]] may spontaneously form in areas where variants of Khorne, Nurgle, Slaanesh or Tzeentch corruption are high.
Cult buildings may be constructed on the [[sl:campaign_province_overview_panel]]Province Overview panel[[/sl]] when an infiltrated [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]] is selected.
[[sl:campaign_military_convoys]]Military Convoys[[/sl]] can be sent to distant settlements to import and export the Chaos Dwarfs’ unique resources and garner profits.

[[img:icon_chaos_gifts]][[/img]]Gifts of Chaos require a number of [[img:icon_souls_resource]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_souls_resource]]Souls[[/sl]] to be sacrificed upfront, with additional upkeep to keep them active. If the Souls upkeep cannot be fulfilled, all effects will be lost.

His roars have whipped the [[sl:campaign_winds_of_magic]]Winds of Magic[[/sl]] that separate the Realm of Chaos from the corporeal world into a maelstrom, ensuring even Daemons lurking in the material plane are stranded.
As a character increases in rank they are awarded skill points, which can be spent on improving and learning [[sl:campaign_character_skills]]skills[[/sl]].
The character's abilities in combat, as well as the spells they can use, are listed in the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_character_details_panel_abilities]]Abilities section[[/sl_tooltip]].
Available [[sl:campaign_character_skills]]skill[[/sl]] points are shown on the Character Info panel.

A character’s skills can be browsed, and new skills selected, on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_character_details_panel_skills_button]]Skills tab[[/sl_tooltip]] of the [[sl:campaign_character_details_panel]]Character Details panel[[/sl]]. Skill points may also be reset from here.

Characters gain followers, [[sl_tooltip:campaign_character_traits]]traits[[/sl_tooltip]], [[sl:campaign_magic_items]]magic items[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_character_skills]]rank and skills[[/sl]] over time as they perform actions.

[[img:icon_workload]][[/img]]Workload will increase in a province each time a mine is constructed. To extract 100% of the [[img:icon_raw_materials]][[/img]]Raw Materials available, [[img:icon_labour]][[/img]]Labour must be maintained to meet the Workload amount. If a province’s Workload requirements are not met, output will scale down accordingly.

Bretonnian factions earn [[img:icon_chivalry]][[/img]]Chivalry through certain actions in campaign, such as winning [[sl:campaign_battles]]battles[[/sl]], and may be lost through unchivalrous actions such as [[sl:campaign_post_battle_options]]sacking[[/sl]] or [[sl:campaign_razing]]razing[[/sl]] human [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]].
When issued, a commandment won’t apply its bonus until the [[sl:campaign_turns]]turn[[/sl]] is ended.
Redirecting the Compass grants certain effects specific to the new direction of the Winds of Magic. These effects grow the longer the compass remains in a particular orientation.
{{tr:hp_campaign_confederation_add_01}} [[sl:campaign_greenskins]]Greenskin[[/sl]] factions are more likely to [[img:icon_confederation]][[/img]]confederate if one is much stronger than the other.
Accepting one Contract discards the others. Contracts can only be accepted on the turn they are issued.

Factions can use [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Heroes[[/sl]], construct certain [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]], or deploy [[img:icon_general]][[/sl]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] with certain [[sl:campaign_character_skills]]skills[[/sl]] or [[sl_tooltip:campaign_followers]]followers[[/sl_tooltip]], to modify corruption in their provinces to their own taste.
Once a cyclical building reaches its final stage, it returns to its base level and the Lifecycle begins again.

[[sl:campaign_settlements]]Settlements[[/sl]], when captured by a Daemon Prince, may be dedicated to a particular Chaos God. Buildings, effects, and bonuses associated with that settlement will then be aligned to that God.

Daemon Princes may earn [[sl:campaign_daemonic_glory]]Daemonic Glory[[/sl]] with the four Gods of Chaos and unlock [[sl_tooltip:campaign_daemonic_gifts]]Daemonic Gifts[[/sl_tooltip]] which augment their abilities or change their appearance.
Units marked to a specific Chaos God will gain positive effects if their army has high Dark Authority for that god. Similarly, Undivided units benefit from high Undivided Dark Authority.

The [[img:icon_loyalty]][[/img]]loyalty of a [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord is also increased through [[sl:campaign_diplomacy]]diplomatic actions[[/sl]] with amicable factions and by ensuring that the faction leader is of a higher [[sl:campaign_character_skills]]rank[[/sl]] than them.

Dark Elf factions can use [[img:icon_slaves]][[/img]]Slaves to boost Infrastructure buildings, instantly construct buildings, perform provincial Diktats, or sacrifice in [[sl:campaign_rites]]Rites[[/sl]] to provide powerful bonuses.
Chaos Altars are minor Chaos [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] built everywhere else that provide only one [[sl:campaign_building_slots]]building slot[[/sl]].
Tomb Kings [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] may construct more military buildings to increase the number of units that may be fielded.
Initiating a Death Night fills the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_death_night_bar]]Death Night bar[[/sl_tooltip]] to its maximum level. The level of the Death Night bar drops as turns pass.
A Dedication to a particular Chaos deity may not be undone, and Daemonic Glory will no longer be awarded by the other Chaos Gods.
Avelorn will suffer minor penalties should any settlement in the outer ring of Ulthuan be captured by a non-High Elf [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]].

Supplies of willing Devotees are produced by [[sl:campaign_chaos_cults]]Slaaneshi Cults[[/sl]] and by [[sl:campaign_gifts_of_slaanesh]]Gifts of Slaanesh[[/sl]]. Less-than-willing Devotees may also be captured by [[sl:campaign_raiding]]raiding[[/sl]] enemy territory or in the aftermath of [[sl:campaign_battles]]battles[[/sl]].

Devotion may be gained through [[sl:campaign_hero_actions]]Hero actions[[/sl]], by either Frost Maiden [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Heroes[[/sl]] when playing as the Ice Court [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]], or by Patriarch [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes when playing as the Orthodoxy. Devotion is also gained by fighting the armies of [[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]], from [[sl:campaign_post_battle_options]]Post-Battle options[[/sl]] and from other sources such as [[sl:campaign_missions]]missions[[/sl]]. It may also be generated by religious [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]].
Some diplomatic actions are unilateral, such as a declaration of war or cancellation of an [[img:icon_military_alliance]][[/img]]alliance, while others must be agreed on by both parties.
If no second faction has been selected, the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_diplomacy_centre_panel]]central panel[[/sl_tooltip]] shows a list of known factions.

The summoning army must be in a [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]] that features a certain amount of [[sl:campaign_chaos_corruption]]Slaanesh corruption[[/sl]] for the ability to summon a Disciple Army to be available. The ability also has a cooldown which prevents its reuse for a number of [[sl:campaign_turns]]turns[[/sl]].

Khorne factions are incentivised to [[sl:campaign_razing]]raze[[/sl]] settlements in provinces where they already have a foothold by the cost in [[sl:campaign_skulls]]Skulls[[/sl]] of occupying a settlement.

The more enemy casualties inflicted from winning battles, the more [[img:icon_dread]][[/img]]Dread gained. It is also gained from [[sl:campaign_missions]]missions[[/sl]], while certain [[sl:campaign_hordes]]horde[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_bloodgrounds]]Herdstone buildings[[/sl]] can increase the rate at which it is received.

To progress towards attaining the Blood of Hashut, the Chaos Dwarfs must ready the Drill for operation through a series of missions culminating in a sacrifice to their God Hashut. In return, Hashut reveals the location of special items to provide viable power sources for the Drill.

The [[sl_tooltip:campaign_forces_list]]Lords & Heroes list[[/sl_tooltip]] shows all [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Heroes[[/sl]] controlled by your faction at a glance.
Dwarf factions may make use of the [[sl:campaign_underway]]Underway[[/sl]] to travel under otherwise-impassable [[sl:campaign_terrain_types]]terrain[[/sl]].
Powerful [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords may be made available for recruitment by researching them. One [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord can be researched within each Dynasty.
The tooltip on each position on the Offices panel shows the bonuses conferred upon appointment.
[[sl:campaign_factions]]Factions[[/sl]] of a non-Wood Elf [[sl:campaign_races]]race[[/sl]] gain no particular advantage from occupying an Elven Hall compared to any other settlement.
The armies of the Empire are flexible and mighty, combining massed numbers, traditional weaponry, advanced engineering and powerful sorcery.

Progress in the Emperor’s Mandate is measured by the expedition's [[img:bullet_emp_mandate]][[/img]]Acclaim level. It can be viewed on the bar at the top of the campaign interface when playing as the Huntsmarshal's Expedition [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]].

Expeditionary forces winning offensive battles, [[sl:campaign_raiding]]raiding[[/sl]], and [[sl:campaign_post_battle_options]]sacking[[/sl]] will increase levels of [[img:emp_hostility]][[/img]]Hostility towards them. Losing [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords and extended periods of inactivity will reduce levels of [[img:emp_hostility]][[/img]]Hostility.

[[img:emp_imperial_authority]][[/img]]Imperial Authority is a measure of how the other [[img:emp_elector_counts]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_summon_elector_counts]]Elector Counts[[/sl]] within the Empire view your [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]].

When playing as an Empire faction, [[img:emp_fealty]][[/img]]Fealty is affected by your interactions with an Elector’s state and your responses to political dilemmas. High [[img:emp_fealty]][[/img]]Fealty may lead to confederation, while low [[img:emp_fealty]][[/img]]Fealty may lead to attempts to secede from the Empire.

Each hunter can be found only after completing a [[sl:campaign_missions]]mission[[/sl]]. Once unlocked, all hunters can be upgraded by completing a variety of missions to improve their traits and abilities.

To unlock a direction, an Astromantic Relay [[sl:campaign_buildings]]building[[/sl]] must be constructed within one of four [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] specified in the tooltips from the icons at the top of the main campaign interface.
[[sl:campaign_army_movement]]Moving an army[[/sl]] immediately adjacent to one of these will trigger an encounter.

The option to summon an Exalted Greater Daemon is presented once a Herald Lord reaches a high enough [[sl:campaign_character_skills]]rank[[/sl]]. The Herald Lord is destroyed when the summoning takes place, with the new Daemon taking its place.

[[sl:campaign_drop_down_lists]]Drop-Down lists[[/sl]] summarise useful information for the player about controlled forces, [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] and other known [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]].
The player faction’s ultimate [[sl:campaign_victory_conditions]]victory conditions[[/sl]] are displayed on the [[sl:campaign_missions]]Objectives panel[[/sl]].

The [[sl_tooltip:campaign_faction_summary_summary_tab]]Summary tab[[/sl_tooltip]] shows information about the current state of the faction, as well an image of the [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lord[[/sl]] who leads the faction.
Certain races can forego settlements entirely and roam the landscape as [[sl:campaign_hordes]]hordes[[/sl]].
The tooltip on each office displayed on the Offices panel shows the character requirements for promotion, as well as bonuses conferred by the position.
The fog of war may be lifted over an area of [[sl:campaign_sea]]sea[[/sl]] by capturing a [[img:icon_port]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_ports]]port[[/sl]] that controls it.

[[img:icon_skaven_food]][[/img]]Food can be gained from [[sl:campaign_battles]]battles[[/sl]], by sacking [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]], and from special buildings in [[sl:campaign_provinces]]provinces[[/sl]] containing the Pastures [[sl:campaign_resources]]resource[[/sl]].

Mortal souls are not easy to come by within the Realm of Chaos. However the favoured Daemon Princes within each the domains of [[sl:campaign_khorne]]Khorne[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_nurgle]]Nurgle[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_slaanesh]]Slaanesh[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_tzeentch]]Tzeentch[[/sl]] were once mortals and, as such, still possess souls.

Fortifications may be attacked in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]] using [[sl:campaign_siege_weapons]]siege weapons[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_unit_types]]monstrous units[[/sl]], and by [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_hero_actions]]Hero actions[[/sl]] prior to battle.
A garrison army costs no upkeep, but can be depleted by repeated [[sl:campaign_battles]]battles[[/sl]].
Positions on the Gathering of the Ancients are unlocked by the construction of specific [[sl:campaign_buildings]]Tree buildings[[/sl]].
Certain [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]] unique to the Lizardmen increase the potential power of the Geomantic Web in a province capital settlement.

[[sl:campaign_characters]]Characters[[/sl]] affected by a Gift of Slaanesh spread [[sl:campaign_chaos_corruption]]Slaanesh corruption[[/sl]], generate [[sl:campaign_devotees]]Devotees[[/sl]] and provide line-of-sight to the afflicting [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] whilst they bear it.
Allegiance progress is gradually lost when switching support to another God.
The duo can be initially recruited by constructing a Tap Room or Refectory [[sl:campaign_buildings]]building[[/sl]].
Fortress Gate settlements contain upgradeable [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]] that strengthen the fortresses’ defensive features. They can be manned by simply occupying them.
He may only be summoned a limited number of times by a faction during a [[sl:campaign_campaign_game]]campaign game[[/sl]].
Greenskin armies automatically collect [[img:icon_scrap]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_salvage]]Scrap[[/sl]] after battles which they may use to fashion makeshift armour, weapons and equipment.
Ingredients are separated into categories. Dragging different categories of Ingredients into the slots located above the cauldron can result in recipes that grant beneficial effects.

[[img:icon_scrap]][[/img]]Scrap can be spent on upgrading [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]] by selecting any [[sl:campaign_unit_cards]]unit card[[/sl]] on the [[sl:campaign_army_panel]]Army panel[[/sl]] and left-clicking on the Scrap Upgrades button to view and select any available upgrades.

Grimoires can be obtained from constructed library [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]], from [[sl:campaign_chaos_cults]]Chaos Cults[[/sl]], and from winning [[sl:campaign_battles]]battles[[/sl]].
The tooltip on the [[img:icon_growth]][[/img]]growth stats on the Province Info panel shows the factors influencing [[img:icon_growth]][[/img]]growth in the Province.

The [[sl_tooltip:campaign_grudges_bar]]Grudges bar[[/sl_tooltip]] at the top of the main campaign interface indicates the severity of discontent in a Dwarf faction, filling up when there are unanswered grudges.

Many [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]] are either [[img:icon_yin]][[/img]]Yin or [[img:icon_yang]][[/img]]Yang-aligned. Levels of [[img:icon_yin]][[/img]]Yin and [[img:icon_yang]][[/img]]Yang contribute to an overall Harmony level for each province.

The Manufactory tab allows the enhancement of entire categories of units for a per-turn [[img:icon_armaments]][[/img]]Armaments cost to maintain modifications. The more units you have of an enhanced category, the higher the Armaments upkeep.
All [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes provide a constant passive effect whilst they are active on the campaign map. In some cases, this effect will be reversed when in enemy territory.

A selected [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero can be instructed to [[sl:campaign_hero_actions]]act[[/sl]] against an enemy [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]] or [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero, or to join an army of the same [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]], by right-clicking that target. Heroes will automatically apply beneficial effects to any army they are a part of, or beneficial/detrimental effects to any [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]] they are stood in, depending on that province's ownership.
Once discovered, a Hex is performed by left-clicking its icon on the main campaign interface, selecting a valid target and confirming via the prompt.

High Elves can spend [[img:icon_influence]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_influence]]influence[[/sl]] on [[sl:campaign_intrigue_at_the_court]]intrigue at the court[[/sl]] in order to manipulate [[sl:campaign_diplomacy]]diplomatic relations[[/sl]] between foreign [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]].

Enemy [[img:icon_lord]][[/img]]Lords and [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes captured in [[sl:campaign_battles]]real-time battles[[/sl]] or by chance after [[sl:campaign_autoresolving]]auto-resolved battles[[/sl]] are held in Athel Tamarha’s prison cells, where they can be interrogated, indoctrinated or executed.

Any [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord can interact with a Dragon Marker, which brings up a dilemma offering you the choice to offer {{tr:icon_income}}tribute in return for a temporary army ability in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]] or [[img:icon_influence]][[/img]][[sl_tooltip:campaign_influence_link]]influence[[/sl_tooltip]].
The tooltip on the growth stats on the Building panel shows the factors influencing growth.
Horde armies may only construct new buildings when in [[img:icon_encamp_stance]][[/img]]Encamp [[sl:campaign_stances]]stance[[/sl]].
Training slots must be unlocked by researching certain [[sl:campaign_technology]]technologies[[/sl]] before any candidates can be trained.

The {{tr:icon_income}}[[sl_tooltip:campaign_income_per_turn]]income per-turn[[/sl_tooltip]] is the total expenditure subtracted from the total {{tr:icon_income}}income, and is shown at the top of the campaign interface.

The [[img:icon_infamy]][[/img]]Infamy rank of the faction leader can be seen [[sl_tooltip:campaign_infamy_link]]at the top of the screen[[/sl_tooltip]] when playing as a pirate [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord of the Vampire Coast.

Some [[sl:campaign_high_elves]]High Elf[[/sl]] [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords and [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes cost [[img:icon_influence]][[/img]]influence to recruit. These costs are listed on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_raise_forces_panel]]Recruit Lord panel[[/sl_tooltip]] and [[sl:campaign_recruit_hero_panel]]Recruit Hero panel[[/sl]].
Intervention armies do not operate under the direct control of the summoning faction, but will instead act autonomously to achieve their objective.
Factions to be targeted may be selected from the dropdown lists on the Intrigue at the Court panel.

To dispatch a Caravan, first select a Reserve Caravan from the list on the Ivory Road panel. The [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]] that will accompany the Caravan are shown on the [[sl:campaign_army_panel]]Army panel[[/sl]] that appears at this time.

Khornate [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] collect [[sl:campaign_skulls]]skulls[[/sl]] in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]] which are required for [[sl:campaign_post_battle_options]]capturing settlements[[/sl]], constructing [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]] and researching [[sl:campaign_technology]]technologies[[/sl]].
Kislev’s rulers gain the [[sl:campaign_devotion]]Devotion[[/sl]] of their people through their deeds, which may be used to perform [[sl:campaign_motherland]]Invocations of the Motherland[[/sl]].

A province’s Labour can be tracked on the Province Info panel, which also contains a checkbox to accept or waive its share of any new Labour received. The Labour Actions buttons expend Labour to grant a variety of benefits as listed in their tooltips.
The Lizardmen are occasional beneficiaries of [[sl:campaign_blessed_spawnings]]blessed spawnings[[/sl]] - events where warriors of unusual potency are birthed in spawning pools of Lustria.

Capture settlements and establish a temple in honour of one of the [[img:icon_lzd_nakai_temple_green]][[/img]][[img:icon_lzd_nakai_temple_blue]][[/img]][[img:icon_lzd_nakai_temple_red]][[/img]]Old Ones on the [[sl:campaign_post_battle_options]]Post-Battle panel[[/sl]].

Access the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_global_recruitment_pool]]global recruitment pool[[/sl_tooltip]] as any other horde in the Spirit of the Jungle faction to be able to [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]recruit[[/sl]] these units.
Lord Kroak, through his campaign Hero actions, can demolish an entire level of a settlement's main [[sl:campaign_buildings]]building[[/sl]] chain when attacking.
[[img:icon_sotek_captives]][[/img]]Sacrificial Offerings are used to make Sacrifices to Sotek, which can be performed in the dedicated panel accessed via the button on the main campaign interface.
The warm-blooded invaders are scattered throughout the world. Defeating any one of them and their [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] will give a reward.
A [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord’s portrait is shown on the [[sl:campaign_character_info_panel]]Character Info panel[[/sl]] when the force they command is selected.

A selected [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord’s [[img:icon_loyalty]][[/img]]loyalty is shown on the [[sl:campaign_character_info_panel]]Character Info panel[[/sl]], and on the Details tab of the [[sl:campaign_character_details_panel]]Character Details panel[[/sl]].

{{tr:hp_campaign_magic_items_add_02}} The [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction’s[[/sl]] currently-unequipped items are shown in the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_global_item_pool]]Global Item pool[[/sl_tooltip]] on this panel. Some items may only be equipped by certain character types.

Enemies marked for death can be seen at the top of the campaign interface when playing as Nagarythe. Each target may be viewed by mousing over the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_marked_for_death]]Marked for Death buttons[[/sl_tooltip]] at the top of the screen.

[[img:icon_marks_of_ruination]][[/img]]Marks of Ruination are received by carrying out Rituals of Ruin at Herdstones. This can then boost a faction’s Ruination Level to increase unit capacities and grant factionwide effects.

When a [[img:icon_mos_steel]][[/img]]Steel or [[img:icon_mos_stone]][[/img]]Stone token is used for an action, it transfers to the other resource in an unusable pending state which lasts a number of turns.

Meat supplies are consumed through unit upkeep each turn. They are replenished by winning [[sl:campaign_battles]]battles[[/sl]], by being close to an [[sl:campaign_ogre_camps]]Ogre Camp[[/sl]], by certain settlement [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]] and from other sources detailed on the army’s Meat tooltip.

Convoy routes can be viewed in the panel along with details of Convoy Masters’ traits and the units that would defend the Convoy in the event of an attack. Icons and tooltips on the map provide information about risks along certain routes.
Missions may be pinned on the Objectives panel so that they are shown on the main campaign interface.

[[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]Recruitment[[/sl]] of new [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]], the upkeep of existing units and the construction of [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]] all deplete a faction’s {{tr:icon_treasury}}treasury.

[[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]Recruitment[[/sl]] of new [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]], the upkeep of existing units and the construction of [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]] all deplete Favour.

[[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]Recruitment[[/sl]] of new [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]], the upkeep of existing units and the construction of [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]] all deplete Dark Magic.

Monster Pens units can be replenished by [[img:icon_raiding_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_raiding]]raiding[[/sl]] certain climates or winning [[sl:campaign_battles]]battles[[/sl]] under certain conditions. The conditions for replenishment can be seen in each unit’s tooltip on the [[img:icon_monster_pens]][[/img]]Monster Pens panel. The higher the level of the [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lord[[/sl]] performing these actions, the better the chance of receiving high-quality beasts.
Once made available, hunts may be activated in the Monstrous Arcanum.

At the same time, however, she will gain substantial bonuses in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]] when fighting large enemies fielded by the [[sl:campaign_warriors_of_chaos]]Warriors of Chaos[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_beastmen]]Beastmen[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_skaven]]Skaven[[/sl]], as well as more formidable [[sl:campaign_wood_elves]]Wood Elf[[/sl]] units.
The Mortuary Cult panel is divided into categories of magical item, along with Regiments of Renown.
Invocation of Salyak

A faction breaking a [[img:icon_non-aggression_pact]][[/img]]non-aggression pact will incur significant [[sl_tooltip:campaign_diplomacy_attitude_icons]]diplomatic penalties[[/sl_tooltip]] which make it less likely that other factions will trust them in future.
The [[sl:campaign_monsters]]Monstrous Arcanum[[/sl]] is a book of the most savage and horrifying creatures in the world; you will receive powerful rewards for defeating them.

Norscan Homelands can span multiple [[sl:campaign_provinces]]provinces[[/sl]] and major settlements but will only have one Homeland Capital which, once occupied, results in the associated Norscan tribe being [[img:icon_vassal]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_vassalage]]vassalised[[/sl]] if they are alive.
Nurglish factions spread [[sl:campaign_plagues_of_nurgle]]Plagues[[/sl]], which apply detrimental effects to those unfortunate enough to catch them.

Oathgold may often be obtained from [[sl:campaign_grudges]]grudges[[/sl]] and is also produced in small quantities through [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_character_skills]]skills[[/sl]].
The tooltip on each office displayed on the Offices panel shows the [[sl:campaign_characters]]character[[/sl]] requirements for promotion.

Once available, any Ogre army can deploy a Camp using the button on the [[sl:campaign_army_panel]]Army panel[[/sl]]. Camps costs [[sl:campaign_money]]money[[/sl]] to construct. They may be deployed in controlled, allied or enemy territory.
Ogre armies can deploy Ogre Camps as bases of operation and resupply. They may even be deployed in hostile territory.
Available settlements may be selected on the War Co-ordination panel to see what units they would provide for recruitment. Outposts may only be constructed in fortified province capital settlements.

Granting Marks of Chaos requires the sacrifice of [[img:icon_souls_resource]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_souls_resource]]Souls[[/sl]], with higher-ranked characters requiring fewer to be sacrificed for progression.
Each Bretonnian settlement provides its owning faction with a number of peasant units, which may be recruited to fight in their [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]].
By securing one of the Pieces of Eight, the Regiment of Renown bound to it becomes available for recruitment.

Special buildings may be constructed within a controlled [[img:icon_cove]][[/img]]Pirate Cove on the [[sl:campaign_province_overview_panel]]Province Overview panel[[/sl]], to bring in further benefits.
Once the rite is performed, a [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Pestilent Scheme Priest[[/sl]] appears under the control of the summoning [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]].

[[sl_tooltip:campaign_symptoms]]Symptoms[[/sl_tooltip]] may optionally added to the base plague once unlocked. The unlock condition for each symptom is shown on its tooltip. [[sl_tooltip:campaign_plague_recipes]]Recipes[[/sl_tooltip]], shown on the Plague Cauldron panel, may be followed once all symptoms are available.

The benefits associated with each act will last for a certain number of [[sl:campaign_turns]]turns[[/sl]]. The initiation of a Pleasurable Act will prevent any other Pleasurable Acts from being initiated in the same province for a longer period of time. These durations are also shown on the act buttons.

A [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] that controls a [[img:icon_port]][[/img]]port may agree [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]]trade with a faction they do not share a land border with, as long as that other faction also controls a [[img:icon_port]][[/img]]port.

Each level of possession comes with a variety of positive and negative effects to be mindful of. At the highest level of possession, Malus gains the “Tz’arkan” ability which enables him to transfer into his powerful Daemonic form in battle.
The tooltip on each option button shows information about that option and the consequences it carries.
Any [[sl:campaign_banners_and_marks]]banners[[/sl]] that are gained from the battle are shown on the Post-Battle panel.
The Power of Nature's representative visual effects on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] will diminish as its duration draws to a close.
The likely outcome of the battle is indicated on the Pre-Battle panel.
Available banners may be assigned to a unit by dragging the banner icon onto that unit's Unit card.
Any transient events affecting the province are shown in the Province Effects section.

[[img:icon_growth]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_growth]]Provincial growth[[/sl]] is a measure of population expansion. [[img:icon_pop_surplus]][[/img]]Population surplus earned can be spent on upgrading a settlement to earn extra [[sl:campaign_building_slots]]building slots[[/sl]].

[[img:icon_growth]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_growth]]Provincial growth[[/sl]] is a measure of population expansion. [[img:icon_pop_surplus]][[/img]]Kindreds earned can be spent on upgrading non-military buildings.
Settlements within the province under foreign control are also shown, but with limited information.
Each province contains a province capital, which is a [[sl:campaign_fortifications]]fortified[[/sl]] settlement. {{tr:hp_campaign_provinces_add_2}}

Other factors can be detrimental to [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}} such as [[sl:campaign_tax]]{{tr:hp_campaign_tax_term_plural}}[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_corruption]]corruption[[/sl]], or the presence of invading armies.
Completing a quest may involve several individual tasks which must be finished in order.
Factions of the same race may [[img:icon_confederation]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_confederation]]confederate[[/sl]] if conditions between them are right.
[[sl:campaign_greenskins]]Greenskin[[/sl]] armies may construct a [[img:icon_encamp_stance]][[/img]]Raidin’ Camp in enemy territory by entering the relevant stance.
[[sl:campaign_units]]Units[[/sl]] raised from the dead are ready to fight immediately and do not have to undergo training.
Available [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords, along with any existing [[sl:campaign_character_details]]traits[[/sl]] and the cost of raising them, are shown in a list on the Recruit Lord panel.
As Taurox wins battles he collects [[img:icon_rampage]][[/img]]Rampage Marks, which can repeatedly fill the Rampage bar to various thresholds that grant rewards.
A razed settlement can be recolonised by an [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]], but this action costs [[sl:campaign_money]]money[[/sl]].

The Realm of Chaos is separated from the physical world and ordinarily unreachable by corporeal beings. However, the roars of Ursun are disrupting the fabric of reality, opening [[sl:campaign_chaos_rifts]]rifts[[/sl]] that allow some passage across.
Any [[sl:campaign_buildings]]building[[/sl]] requirements for recruiting a particular type of [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero are shown on these buttons.
Regiments of Renown are recruited instantly into the selected army and do not require [[sl:campaign_turns]]time[[/sl]] to train.
The [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] involved must be at peace to offer or request a settlement unless a peace treaty is being offered as part of the deal.

The [[sl:campaign_garrison_armies]]garrison army[[/sl]] provided by [[sl:campaign_buildings]]settlement buildings[[/sl]] may support a nearby allied army, and vice-versa. In this way, an army stationed next to a [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]] will assist in that settlement’s defence.
Access to a resource is established by constructing a [[sl:campaign_buildings]]building[[/sl]] in the settlement of a type that permits resource acquisition.
If a revolutionary army appears it must be crushed swiftly, otherwise it will gather strength and attack.
An incursion can be crushed straight away, but control gets higher while it gathers strength. This ensures that when you act, you are fighting all the foes involved.
Once used, rites are subject to a cooldown period before they can be used again.

Ritual currency can be earned from a variety of sources including [[sl:campaign_searching_ruins]]Searching Ruins[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_quests]]Quests[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_missions]]Missions[[/sl]].

A ritual is conducted at several ritual sites across the campaign map, the locations of which are indicated on the Rituals bar while casting. While a ritual is underway, energy is channelled from these sites to the Great Vortex.

[[sl_tooltip:campaign_ritual_buttons]]Buttons[[/sl_tooltip]] along the bar correspond to rituals. Each button becomes available to click when enough ritual currency has been earned to begin the corresponding ritual.
Rogue armies will typically not be immediately hostile, but will cause disruption by [[img:icon_raiding_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_raiding]]raiding[[/sl]] lands they move across.
Defeating Rogue Pirates in battle will provide the pirates of the [[sl:campaign_vampire_coast]]Vampire Coast[[/sl]] with much [[img:icon_infamy]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_infamy]]Infamy[[/sl]].
Settlements may be recolonised, but at a cost in both troops from the colonising army and in money.
Press CTRL + S within a campaign game to quickly save, or CTRL + L to quickly load the last saved game.

Hovering over a Scheme in the panel will reveal further details about it. Left-clicking a Scheme icon keeps it displayed and also allows it to be pinned to the mission list by left-clicking its pin icon.
Areas of the sea too far from the coast will cause [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_attrition]]attritional[[/sl]] casualties in any armies unlucky enough to stray into them.
Place the mouse cursor over a Sea Lane to see where it is connected to, or double-click the Sea Lane to zoom the camera to the other end.

The Lost Sea Shanty grants use of a powerful army ability that can be used in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]]. Additional [[img:icon_shanty]][[/img]]verses of the shanty increase the strength of this ability.
Only a limited number of units can be Seduced and a maximum amount of favour spent on it. These caps may be raised by researching a [[sl:campaign_technology]]technology[[/sl]].
Receiving a [[sl:campaign_gifts_of_slaanesh]]Gift of Slaanesh[[/sl]].
The colour of the ring surrounding the climate icon indicates its suitability for the race being played: green is suitable, yellow is neutral, red is unsuitable.
The [[sl:campaign_vampires]]Vampire Counts[[/sl]], the [[sl:campaign_empire]]Empire[[/sl]] and other human factions can occupy the burghs and cities of the Old World in the north.
An enemy [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] may lay [[sl:campaign_siege_warfare]]siege[[/sl]] to a settlement in an effort to capture it.

All actions needed to carry out Eshin Missions and Clan Contracts are listed on the Shadowy Dealings panel. Chosen actions are then performed by selecting a [[sl:campaign_characters]]character[[/sl]] from the agents list and a target from the campaign map, in either order.
Ships may be upgraded from the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_ship_building_link]]Building panel[[/sl_tooltip]] when an eligible Legendary Lord is selected.

A method of overcoming the [[sl:campaign_fortifications]]fortifications[[/sl]] of larger province capital settlements must be available before an attack can begin. Artillery, or monsters may be used to attack the defences, or the [[sl:campaign_hero_actions]]hero actions[[/sl]] of certain [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Heroes[[/sl]] may be used to sabotage them prior to the siege being laid. Alternatively, [[sl:campaign_siege_weapons]]siege weapons[[/sl]] may be constructed while besieging.
The number of turns a besieged [[sl:campaign_garrison_armies]]garrison[[/sl]] will hold out for is shown on its tooltip.
Rams are used to breach the gates, towers and ladders to scale the walls, and artillery can target both.

The Skaven spread [[img:icon_corruption_skv]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_skaven_corruption]]Skaven corruption[[/sl]] as they settle, which eventually makes [[sl:campaign_provinces]]provinces[[/sl]] difficult to inhabit, even for Skaven.

High levels of [[img:icon_corruption_skv]][[/img]]Skaven corruption in a province will grant additional uses of [[sl:campaign_the_menace_below]]the Menace Below[[/sl]] army ability in any [[sl:campaign_battles]]battles[[/sl]] fought there.

Augments are unlocked sequentially and require [[img:icon_mutagen]][[/img]]Mutagen, which is acquired whenever [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]] are claimed from the Growth Vat. The current amount of Mutagen can be viewed at the top of the main campaign interface.

Various technological units and mounts in addition to [[img:icon_doomrocket]][[/img]]Doomrockets can all be upgraded within the various research tabs of the Forbidden Workshop by spending [[img:icon_warp_fuel]][[/img]]Warp-Fuel and [[img:icon_skaven_food]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_food]]food[[/sl]] resources. The current amounts of both resources can be viewed at the top of the panel.

The [[img:icon_loyalty]][[/img]]loyalty of a [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord is also increased through [[sl:campaign_diplomacy]]diplomatic actions[[/sl]] with amicable factions and by ensuring that the faction leader is of a higher [[sl:campaign_character_skills]]rank[[/sl]] than them.
[[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Heroes[[/sl]] can perform an [[sl:campaign_hero_actions]]action[[/sl]] on ruins to see if they are truly abandoned.

Skulls are awarded for kills made by either side in a battle contested by a Khornate faction, regardless of which side is victorious. Skulls may also be earned by [[sl:campaign_razing]]razing[[/sl]] enemy settlements or by Khornate [[sl:campaign_chaos_cults]]Chaos Cults[[/sl]].

Slaaneshi factions accumulate [[sl:campaign_devotees]]Devotees[[/sl]] from [[sl:campaign_battles]]battles[[/sl]], through [[sl:campaign_gifts_of_slaanesh]]Gifts of Slaanesh[[/sl]] and other methods, which are used for constructing [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]], establishing Slaaneshi [[sl:campaign_chaos_cults]]Chaos Cults[[/sl]], hosting [[sl:campaign_pleasurable_acts]]Pleasurable Acts[[/sl]], and raising [[sl:campaign_disciple_armies]]Disciple Armies[[/sl]] when in hostile territory.

Slaves are gained through fighting battles, capturing and upgrading [[img:icon_port]][[/img]]ports, and by recruiting [[sl_link:campaign_black_arks]]Black Arks[[/sl_link]] or Assassin [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]heroes[[/sl]].

[[img:icon_souls_resource]][[/img]]Souls can be sacrificed in the [[img:icon_chaos_gifts]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_chaos_gifts]]Gifts of Chaos[[/sl]] panel via the button on the main campaign interface, or by using a [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord or [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero’s [[sl:campaign_path_to_glory]]Path to Glory[[/sl]] accessed in their [[sl:campaign_character_details_panel]]Character Details panel[[/sl]].

Certain stances consume a proportion of the army's [[sl_tooltip:campaign_movement_range]]movement range[[/sl_tooltip]] when adopted. Should the army not have the required movement range remaining then they will be unable to adopt the stance that [[sl:campaign_turns]]turn[[/sl]].
Layers on the Strategic Overview can be turned on and off with the various [[sl_tooltip:campaign_strategic_map_layer_buttons]]overlay buttons[[/sl_tooltip]] while holding the spacebar.
The occupying [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord will be granted the Sword of Khaine once it is drawn.

The tax {{tr:icon_income}}income from all controlled [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] in a [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]] can be seen on the [[sl:campaign_province_info_panel]]Province Info panel[[/sl]].

The {{tr:icon_income}}income extorted from all controlled [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] in a [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]] can be seen on the [[sl:campaign_province_info_panel]]Province Info panel[[/sl]].

The order in which technologies unlock and the benefits they bring can be browsed on the various branches of the technology trees, shown on the Technology panel. This is shown when the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_technology_button]]Technology button[[/sl_tooltip]] is clicked on the campaign interface.

Teleport stance may be activated on a selected Tzeentchian army from the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_stances_rollout]]Stances rollout[[/sl_tooltip]] on the [[sl:campaign_character_info_panel]]Character Info panel[[/sl]]. Once the army has teleported it will not be able to move again that [[sl:campaign_turns]]turn[[/sl]].
[[sl:campaign_armies]]Armies[[/sl]] can use their [[sl:campaign_zones_of_control]]zones of control[[/sl]] to block narrow passes.

The power and availability of [[sl:campaign_unholy_manifestations]]Unholy Manifestations[[/sl]] are linked to the Great Game. More Unholy Manifestation [[sl:campaign_rites]]rites[[/sl]] are unlocked as the related Chaos corruption level rises.
