Skaven [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] besieging enemy [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] in [[sl:campaign_provinces]]provinces[[/sl]] with high [[img:icon_corruption_skv]][[/img]]Skaven [[sl:campaign_corruption]]corruption[[/sl]] will gain a number of free uses of this ability in the battle.

Artefact parts are attained by occupying the [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] where they are located or by forming [[img:icon_military_alliance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_alliances]]military alliances[[/sl]] with the occupying [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]].

Tomb Kings [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] may collect [[img:icon_jars]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_canopic_jars]]Canopic Jars[[/sl]] from victory in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]]. These are consumed by the Mortuary Cult, by performing [[sl:campaign_rites]]rites[[/sl]], and by researching certain [[sl:campaign_dynasties]]Dynasty technologies[[/sl]].
Seats are divided into Districts and tiers, with higher-tier Seats having higher costs and greater rewards.
Detailed information about [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]]trade {{tr:icon_income}}income can be seen on the {{tr:icon_treasury}}[[sl:campaign_treasury_panel]]Treasury panel[[/sl]].
The rough location of the buried treasure is shown on each Treasure Map. The exact location, always on land, is indicated by a riddle that must be solved.

The [[sl_tooltip:campaign_treasury_panel_summary_tab]]Summary[[/sl_tooltip]] and [[sl_tooltip:campaign_treasury_panel_details_tab]]Details[[/sl_tooltip]] tabs show information about sources of [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] {{tr:icon_income}}income and expenditure.
Through tribal confederation, a Norscan leader may grow their tribe very quickly.

Settlements containing Trickster Cults can be toggled between viewing settlement details or Trickster Cult details using the buttons in the [[sl:campaign_province_overview_panel]]Province Overview panel[[/sl]].
Tzeentch is the ultimate source of all magic in the world. His followers are invariably formidable spellcasters, making deft use of powerful sorcery against the Raven God’s enemies.
An army can move into the [[img:icon_tunnelling_stance]][[/img]]Underway by activating the Use Underway [[sl:campaign_stances]]stance[[/sl]].
{{tr:hp_campaign_unholy_manifestations_add_01}} The level of Chaos corruption and the thresholds at which more Unholy Manifestations are unlocked are shown on the Unholy Manifestations panel.
The number of men in a unit and the unit's [[sl:campaign_unit_experience]]experience level[[/sl]] are shown at the top of its Unit Card.
The [[sl_tooltip:campaign_unit_exchange_panel]]Unit Exchange panel[[/sl_tooltip]] will appear upon initiation of unit exchange, showing the makeup of both forces.
Some [[sl:campaign_technology]]technology[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_buildings]]building[[/sl]] bonuses allow fresh units to be recruited that already have some experience.
Merged units keep their [[sl:campaign_unit_experience]]experience[[/sl]] and are less likely to be wiped out in further [[sl:campaign_battles]]battles[[/sl]].

The [[sl_tooltip:campaign_local_recruitment_pool]]local recruitment options[[/sl_tooltip]] shows all units that can be recruited in the local [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]]. It will be empty when not in controlled territory.

An army may generally recruit several units at once. The number of [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]] that can be recruited at a time from each recruitment pool is [[sl_tooltip:campaign_recruitment_capacity]]indicated on the Recruitment panel[[/sl_tooltip]].
[[img:icon_replenishment]][[/img]]Replenishment effects are increased if the army is garrisoned in a [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]].
Mounted units are swifter but generally less numerous than infantry.
Upkeep and other unit information can be viewed on the [[sl:campaign_unit_info_panel]]Unit Info panel[[/sl]].
Numerous interested parties seek to enter these rifts, confront Ursun's jailor, and free the God-Bear from his prison for their own ends.
Pirate [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords may be appointed to positions of [[sl:campaign_fleet_office]]Fleet Office[[/sl]] to grant them extra authority and bonuses.
Vampire [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] can [[sl:campaign_raising_dead]]raise the dead[[/sl]], allowing them to quickly build massive armies.

The [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] of the living will suffer [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_attrition]]attritional casualties[[/sl]] in territory where [[img:icon_corruption_vmp]][[/img]]vampiric corruption has taken hold.
The [[img:icon_loyalty]][[/img]]loyalty of a [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord of the Vampire Coast will naturally decrease over time.

A [[img:icon_vassal]][[/img]]vassal faction also pays its master a financial tribute each [[sl:campaign_turns]]turn[[/sl]]. Vassalage ends any [[sl:campaign_war]]war[[/sl]] between the [[img:icon_vassal]][[/img]]vassal and master.
The game may continue to be played after a faction has achieved victory.
[[img:icon_waaagh]][[/img]]Reputation is tracked on the bar at the top of the main campaign interface. Once the bar fills up, the Call to Waaagh! button becomes active.
A state of war will persist until one side is destroyed, or a peace deal is agreed through diplomacy.

{{tr:hp_campaign_war_coordination_add_01}} Select an ally from the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_diplomacy_centre_panel]]centre panel[[/sl_tooltip]] and then click the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_war_coordination_button]]War Co-ordination button[[/sl_tooltip]] to open the War Co-ordination panel.

Recruited units can be permanently marked for a single Chaos God to receive greater benefits from [[sl:campaign_dark_authority]]Dark Authority[[/sl]]. Units are marked via [[img:icon_warband]][[/img]]Warband Upgrades accessed on the [[sl:campaign_army_panel]]Army panel[[/sl]].

Warriors of Chaos construct [[img:icon_dark_fortress]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_dark_fortress]]Dark Fortresses and Chaos Altars[[/sl]] where they settle, with some Dark Fortresses also being [[sl:campaign_norscan_homelands]]Norscan capitals[[/sl]], where tribes are [[sl:campaign_vassalage]]vassalised[[/sl]].
Information about the Winds of Magic level in a province is shown when the mouse cursor is hovered over any [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] terrain there.

Display indicators over visible [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] areas indicate the local Winds of Magic strength. Buttons within each indicator allow the Winds of Magic strength to be altered there.

Once created, Blessings and Curses are applied to units in the [[sl:campaign_pre_battle_panel]]pre-battle panel[[/sl]] by dragging their icons directly onto [[sl:campaign_unit_cards]]unit cards[[/sl]].

Wood Elf campaigns are about healing and defending the [[sl:campaign_worldroots]]Magical Forests[[/sl]] of the world, the status of which can be viewed via the Worldroots button located in the bottom right corner of the main campaign interface.
In Mortal Empires campaigns, Ariel will always appear after the first Ritual of Rebirth is performed.
Glamoured Elves are expendable, so will not reduce other [[sl:campaign_units]]units’[[/sl]] leadership when routing from a [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]].
[[sl:campaign_units]]Units[[/sl]] summoned are ready to fight immediately and do not have to undergo training.

Only one Favour can be earned per [[sl:campaign_turns]]turn[[/sl]] (which can be increased with the Challenge to Daith [[sl:campaign_character_skills]]skill[[/sl]]) with a maximum of three Favours accumulated at any time.

Performing a Ritual of Rebirth in a Magical Forest will guarantee its [[img:forest_health]][[/img]]health and provide lasting rewards, but the ritual cannot be performed until the forest’s health is increased to a minimum specified level.
An army using the Worldroots stance will disappear from its original location and reappear at its destination.
Zones of control allow an army to guard strategic positions on the [[sl:campaign_terrain_types]]terrain[[/sl]] such as a mountain pass or river crossing.
Advice history can be reset in the game options so that previously-seen advice will be shown again.

[[img:icon_allegiance]][[/img]]Allegiance points can be spent on assigning [[sl:campaign_war_coordination]]war coordination targets[[/sl]], or to request control of an ally’s [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]]. Control may not be requested of an army led by a faction's leader.
A [[img:icon_defensive_alliance]][[/img]]defensive alliance is the least-committed form of alliance between two factions. {{tr:hp_campaign_alliances_add_02}}

The Star-metal Harpoon may be gained by completing "The Search for the Vengeance" [[sl:campaign_missions]]mission[[/sl]], and then must be cursed with the [[img:icon_shanty]][[/img]]verses of the [[sl:campaign_sea_shanties]]Lost Sea Shanty[[/sl]] in order to fell the beast.

[[img:icon_ambush_stance]][[/img]]Ambushes have a chance to be detected and fail. The [[sl:campaign_terrain_types]]terrain[[/sl]] on which the ambush is set affects this chance. Ambushes may also be uncovered by enemy [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Heroes[[/sl]].
An army may also be sent to attack a settlement. If the settlement is [[sl:campaign_fortifications]]fortified[[/sl]] a [[sl:campaign_siege_warfare]]siege[[/sl]] may be required.
An army can only move between land and sea at a [[img:icon_port]][[/img]]port or on a beach, not on a rocky shore.

Settlements and armed forces exert a [[sl:campaign_zones_of_control]]zone of control[[/sl]] over the terrain around them. Zones of control can be seen by hovering the mouse cursor over an army or settlement.
If the selected army belongs to another [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]], the Army panel shows only information that is known about them.

An army in [[img:icon_astromancy_stance]][[/img]]Astromancy stance will be more effective at intercepting nearby enemy [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] moving through the [[img:icon_tunnelling_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_underway]]Underway[[/sl]], [[img:icon_use_beastpaths_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_beast_paths]]Beast-paths[[/sl]] or [[img:icon_use_beastpaths_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_worldroots]]Worldroots[[/sl]].

Once appointed, optional dilemmas will appear from time to time, the outcomes of which can earn an Ataman unique [[sl_tooltip:campaign_character_traits]]traits[[/sl_tooltip]]. The presence of these dilemmas is indicated on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_atamans_button]]Atamans button[[/sl_tooltip]].

High levels of [[sl:campaign_chaos_corruption]]Chaos corruption[[/sl]] in a [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]] will cause [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]]attrition in non-Chaos armies marching there.

Banners are equipped by [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords in an ancillary slot. Like other ancillaries, they may be transferred to other [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords in the faction by dragging them into and out of the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_global_item_pool]]global item pool[[/sl_tooltip]] on the [[sl:campaign_character_details_panel]]Character Details panel[[/sl]].

The player may choose to either fight a battle that their forces are involved with on the battlefield or to [[sl:campaign_autoresolving]]auto-resolve[[/sl]] the outcome. An indication of the likely autoresolver outcome is shown on the [[sl:campaign_pre_battle_panel]]Pre-Battle panel[[/sl]].
The army must emerge from the beast-path at the end of the movement, and so cannot traverse large, impassable gaps.

Beastmen can use [[img:icon_dread]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_dread]]Dread[[/sl]] to expand [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]recruitment[[/sl]] capacities, [[sl:campaign_raising_forces]]recruit Legendary Lords[[/sl]], and get other upgrades.

[[img:icon_bestial_rage]][[/img]]Bestial Rage decreases naturally over [[sl:campaign_turns]]time[[/sl]] due to inactivity or from suffering battle casualties. If it gets too low the warriors get restless, limiting growth and making it harder to expand the horde.
Once adopted, a Big Name cannot be replaced for a period of [[sl:campaign_turns]]time[[/sl]]. A Big Name and its effects persist until a different name is taken up.

Black Arks can also be used in support of a foreign invasion force. Armies of the same [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] within their sphere of influence will [[img:icon_replenishment]][[/img]]replenish any casualties and may [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]recruit new units[[/sl]].
Losses incurred by a Blood Voyage army in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]] will not be [[img:icon_replenishment]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_unit_replenishment]]replenished[[/sl]].

[[sl:campaign_razing]]Razing[[/sl]] settlements and winning battles within a Blood-ground earns Devastation. Once sufficient Devastation has been earned, a Ritual of Ruin can be performed at the Herdstone to earn [[img:icon_marks_of_ruination]][[/img]]Marks of Ruination.
Bloodletting helps promote [[sl:campaign_growth]]provincial growth[[/sl]] across all [[sl:campaign_provinces]]provinces[[/sl]] in a Khornate faction.
Awakening a Bloodline also earns other bonuses, which may be seen by placing the mouse cursor over the skull icons on the Bloodlines panel.

Mannfred von Carstein, Volkmar the Grim and all [[sl:campaign_tomb_kings]]Tomb Kings[[/sl]] factions have access to the Books of Nagash. Arkhan the Black starts with a single Book of Nagash unavailable to other Tomb Kings factions.
The [[img:icon_green_knight]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_green_knight]]Green Knight[[/sl]], a renowned warrior of myth and legend, may be called to aid Bretonnian factions in times of great need.
Water supplies start depleting every [[sl:campaign_turns]]turn[[/sl]] after an army is ungarrisoned from a settlement, gradually reducing the amount of time its units stay immune.
Once the requirements of a pledge are fulfilled, the character receives the associated Vow or Troth's benefits and the next one becomes available.
Upgrading the settlement building opens new slots within the settlement, in which entirely new buildings may be constructed. {{tr:hp_campaign_point_4_building_slots}}

The primary building shown on the [[sl:campaign_province_overview_panel]]Province Overview panel[[/sl]] represents the settlement itself. Population surplus points, earned through [[sl:campaign_growth]]growth[[/sl]], may be spent to upgrade this building, which expands the settlement and provides more [[sl:campaign_building_slots]]building slots[[/sl]].
The player controls one of the many factions contesting supremacy in the campaign game.

Armies may embark on to the [[sl:campaign_sea]]sea[[/sl]], although they will need spend [[sl:campaign_turns]]time[[/sl]] constructing boats on the beach first, or embark through a [[sl:campaign_ports]]port[[/sl]].
The current stockpile of [[img:icon_jars]][[/img]]Canopic Jars is shown at the top of the campaign interface when playing as a Tomb Kings [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]].
Caravans may be sent along the [[sl:campaign_ivory_road]]Ivory Road[[/sl]], a network of perilous trade routes between Cathay and [[sl:campaign_kislev]]Kislev[[/sl]], for profit.
{{tr:hp_campaign_chaos_add_01}} {{tr:hp_campaign_chaos_add_02}}

Khorne, Nurgle, Slaanesh or Tzeentch corruption can bring positive effects to a [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]], even to territory not owned by Chaos. Ultimately, however, these positive effects will be outweighed by growing negative effects if the [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] that controls the province is not aligned with that type of corruption.

The appearance of a Chaos Cult enables the construction of hidden buildings that can earn a Chaos faction [[sl:campaign_skulls]]Skulls[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_devotees]]Devotees[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_plagues_of_nurgle]]Infections[[/sl]] or [[sl:campaign_grimoires]]Grimoires[[/sl]], depending on the God whom they serve. Other Chaos Cult buildings can spawn [[sl:campaign_revolts]]rebellions[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_rogue_armies]]rogue armies[[/sl]], cause Plagues, or even affect the [[sl:campaign_winds_of_magic]]Winds of Magic[[/sl]].

Chaos Dwarf factions earn [[img:icon_conclave_influence]][[/img]]Conclave Influence as they expand their territory, which can be used to claim Seats in the [[sl:campaign_tower_of_zharr]]Tower of Zharr[[/sl]] in return for powerful arcane, military or industrial faction bonuses.

Multiple [[img:icon_chaos_gifts]][[/img]]Gifts of Chaos can be active at once, but are limited by the number of available gift slots. This number can be increased by means such as [[sl:campaign_technology]]technologies[[/sl]].

Each subsequent roar disrupts the maelstrom further, causing rifts to open in the fabric of reality. Mortals and Daemons alike in the physical world can use the disruption to cross in to the Realm of Chaos.
Characters can gain [[sl:campaign_magic_items]]magic items[[/sl]] from victory in battle. Magic items can be shared across all characters in a faction, but can be lost to other factions in battle.

Other information about the selected character such as their army upkeep, location, traits and any effects currently active on them are also listed in the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_character_details_panel_details_traits_and_effects]]Details, Traits & Effects[[/sl_tooltip]] section of the Character Details panel.
[[sl:campaign_stances]]Stances[[/sl]] may be changed from the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_stances_rollout]]Stances rollout[[/sl_tooltip]].
Important [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Legendary Lords gain access to [[sl:campaign_quests]]quests[[/sl]] as they increase in rank.

[[img:icon_raw_materials]][[/img]]Raw Materials income is generated by mines in Outpost Settlements. It is used to generate Armaments and Treasury income and for constructing certain buildings in Tower and Factory settlements.

The higher the level of [[img:icon_chivalry]][[/img]]Chivalry a Bretonnian faction attains, the greater the bonuses it receives. Conversely, penalties are suffered if their level of [[img:icon_chivalry]][[/img]]Chivalry drops too low.
Only one commandment may be active in a province at a time. Issuing a second commandment will cancel the first.
Inspect the tooltips on the various power meters shown on the Compass panel to see the effects of directing the Compass there.
Confederation can sometimes be initially burdensome if the faction to be confederated is in a poor state or has lots of costly [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] to maintain.
Completing a Contract brings significant [[sl:campaign_money]]financial[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_diplomacy]]diplomatic[[/sl]] rewards from the issuing faction.
[[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_hero_actions]]Heroic actions[[/sl]] may be used to increase or decrease corruption in a foreign province and destabilise it prior to invasion.
Some stages of a Nurgle building’s Lifecycle may only be passed if the settlement building is at a certain level. This is indicated on the icon for that stage.
{{tr:hp_campaign_daemonic_glory_add_03}} {{tr:hp_campaign_daemonic_glory_add_02}}

Daemon Princes must unlock [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]] for [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]recruitment[[/sl]] by earning Daemonic Glory, as well as constructing the required [[sl:campaign_buildings]]building[[/sl]].
An army with low Dark Authority levels for a particular God (or Undivided) will suffer from higher recruitment, upkeep and upgrade costs for units aligned to that God (or Undivided) respectively.
A [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord’s [[img:icon_loyalty]][[/img]]loyalty is decreased by the opposite actions.
The Dark Elves can field mighty [[sl:campaign_black_arks]]Black Arks[[/sl]] at sea to support their foreign invasion forces.
Recruitment capacities apply across all [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]], and are affected by buildings constructed in any [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]].
Hellebron receives bonuses proportional to the current level of the Death Night bar. At the lowest level of the bar, these bonuses turn to penalties.

Undivided Glory may also be earned, which is not aligned to any one God of Chaos. With sufficient Undivided Glory the Daemon Prince may choose to Dedicate themselves as an Undivided champion. Such Daemon Princes are aligned equally with all Gods of Chaos, gaining some powers from each.
More significant penalties will be suffered by Avelorn should any Fortress Gate or inner ring settlements fall to a non-High Elf faction.
Devotees can be spent on raising [[sl:campaign_disciple_armies]]Disciple Armies[[/sl]] on the [[sl:campaign_army_panel]]Army panel[[/sl]].

Devotion may be lost by fighting with other Kislevite factions. It can also be spent by the Ice Court and the Orthodoxy factions on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_motherland_panel]]Motherland panel[[/sl_tooltip]] on sabotaging one another as they vie for [[img:icon_supporters]][[/img]]Supporters.
When a diplomatic offer is made it may be accepted or rejected outright, or a counter-offer may be proposed.
The tooltips on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_diplomacy_attitude_icons]]attitude icons[[/sl_tooltip]] shows detailed information about each faction's standing with the player.

Disciple Armies cannot [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]recruit[[/sl]] or [[img:icon_replenishment]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_unit_replenishment]]replenish[[/sl]] and their commanding [[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] cannot gain [[sl:campaign_character_skills]]skills[[/sl]] or [[sl:campaign_magic_items]]items[[/sl]]. [[sl:campaign_attrition]]Attrition[[/sl]] means the strength of the Disciple Army will dwindle over [[sl:campaign_turns]]time[[/sl]].
Instead, Khorne factions can gain a large number of Skulls or summon a short-lived Daemonic [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] when they raze conquered settlements.

Spending [[img:icon_dread]][[/img]]Dread on [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Heroes[[/sl]] allows you to increase the number that can be recruited into your hordes, although most units will be locked until you reach the appropriate [[sl:campaign_marks_of_ruination]]Ruination Levels[[/sl]].
Sources of Power

The [[sl_tooltip:campaign_provinces_list]]Provinces[[/sl_tooltip]] and [[sl_tooltip:campaign_factions_list]]Factions lists[[/sl_tooltip]] summarise information about known [[sl:campaign_provinces]]provinces[[/sl]] and factions.
Dwarfs cannot field [[sl:campaign_unit_types]]mounted units[[/sl]] but can use their engineering skills to build a variety of unique weapons of war.
The ability to recruit additional [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes may be gained by researching the relevant technologies.

Depending on the [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] being played, some positions of Office are reserved for Ancient Treemen or [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] who use a particular Lore of Magic.

[[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] may be assigned [[sl:campaign_summon_elector_counts]]Elector Count[[/sl]] positions in any owned state capitals of the Empire except when playing as the Huntsmarshal’s Expedition.

The Huntsmarshal's Expedition has a limited [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]recruitment[[/sl]] roster available to it at the start of the campaign, but can expand its roster by increasing its [[img:bullet_emp_mandate]][[/img]]Acclaim.

Each level of [[img:emp_hostility]][[/img]]Hostility will improve the rate at which [[img:emp_imperial_supply]][[/img]]Imperial Supplies are received from the Old World, but also give a number of negative effects to the expedition.
High authority will help maintain a stable Empire, while low authority will apply a number of negative effects upon your faction.

An [[img:emp_elector_counts]][[/img]]Elector Count's position will become available to manage once his state's capital falls under your control, upon which any [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lord[[/sl]] can be installed as the Elector there.

Whenever construction of an Astromantic Relay is completed, the site must be defended against [[sl:campaign_lizardmen]]Lizardmen[[/sl]] incursions for a number of turns before the compass direction is unlocked.

The Herald Lord’s [[sl:campaign_character_traits]]traits[[/sl]] and skills will be lost but a portion of their experience is passed on to the Exalted Greater Daemon, enabling the reselection of some skills.
The [[sl:campaign_strategic_map]]Strategic Map[[/sl]] shows a view of the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] and can be used to plan moves.
Factions may engage in the research of [[sl:campaign_technology]]technologies[[/sl]] to improve their methods of warfare.
The [[sl_tooltip:campaign_faction_summary_records_tab]]Records tab[[/sl_tooltip]] shows a timeline of important events which have occurred during the game.

Faction may engage in [[sl:campaign_diplomacy]]diplomacy[[/sl]] with one another, and can even [[img:icon_confederation]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_confederation]]confederate[[/sl]] with other factions of the same [[sl:campaign_races]]race[[/sl]] if conditions are right.
Eligible [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords are shown on the Offices panel and may be dragged into a vacant position.
[[sl:campaign_tzeentch]]Tzeentch[[/sl]] factions may lift the fog of war over faction with a [[sl:campaign_changing_of_the_ways]]Changing of the Ways[[/sl]] action.
Each Skaven [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]] consumes an amount of [[img:icon_skaven_food]][[/img]]food per [[sl:campaign_turns]]turn[[/sl]].
Only by defeating the Daemon Prince in each domain and claiming their souls may the path to the forge be revealed.

Forging items requires [[img:icon_oathgold]][[sl:campaign_oathgold]]Oathgold[[/sl]] and access to certain [[sl:campaign_resources]]resources[[/sl]]; those currently available are shown at the top right of the Forge panel.
Fortified settlements hold out for longer under siege.
The garrison units a building provides are shown when the cursor is placed over the building icon on the Province Overview panel.
Only Ancient Treemen may occupy positions on the Gathering of the Ancients.

The power of a Geomantic Web node is linked to the potential power provided by the buildings there, and the power of the nodes connected to it. A node must be linked to at least one other node of equal or higher power to operate at a given power level.

Gifts of Slaanesh are removed from any [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord or embedded [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero who defeats a Slaaneshi army in battle, and from [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Heroes[[/sl]] who successfully perform an action against a Slaaneshi target. They are also removed if the gifting faction is destroyed.
Each rank of allegiance unlocked grants a [[sl:campaign_factions]]factionwide[[/sl]] bonus.
An activation marker will appear indicating from where the duo's services may be acquired.

The risk of a Chaos attack upon the Great Bastion is indicated by the [[sl:campaign_great_bastion_threat_meter]]Great Bastion Threat meter[[/sl]] shown at the top of the campaign interface when playing a Cathayan faction.

The [[img:icon_green_knight]][[/img]]Green Knight may only be summoned by Bretonnian factions with sufficient [[img:icon_chivalry]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_chivalry]]Chivalry[[/sl]]. The [[img:icon_chivalry]][[/img]]Chivalry requirements to summon him grow each time he is called upon.
Greenskin armies may make use of the [[img:icon_tunnelling_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_underway]]Underway[[/sl]].
Ingredients are discovered by completing various tasks throughout the campaign and by purchasing them from the Food Merchant who appears from time to time.
Several Greenskins [[sl:campaign_technology]]technologies[[/sl]] have an associated Scrap cost.
Grimoires are used to research certain important [[sl:campaign_technology]]technologies[[/sl]] and to perform [[sl:campaign_changing_of_the_ways]]Changing of the Ways[[/sl]] actions.

[[img:icon_growth]][[/img]]Growth in a province can be stimulated by certain [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_commandments]]commandments[[/sl]], and can be hindered by enemy [[img:icon_raiding_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_raiding]]raiding[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Heroes[[/sl]].

The higher severity levels on the Grudges bar cause negative factionwide effects, but also increase the possibility of Slayer units appearing for recruitment as [[sl:campaign_regiments_of_renown]]Regiments of Renown[[/sl]].

The Harmony level, and a breakdown of [[img:icon_yin]][[/img]]Yin and [[img:icon_yang]][[/img]]Yang factors, is shown on the tooltip of the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_harmony_lotus_indicator]]lotus indicator[[/sl_tooltip]] at the top of the [[sl:campaign_province_info_panel]]Province Info panel[[/sl]] when playing as a Cathayan faction.

The Armoury tab allows the increase of unit capacities at a per-increase Armaments cost. Using the Armoury gradually unlocks Manufactory upgrades specified in the progress bar tooltips for each unit category.
Tooltips on the various [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero action buttons show more information about that action, including its chance of success.
{{tr:hp_campaign_heroes_add_01}} {{tr:hp_campaign_heroes_add_02}}

Hexes reveal themselves as required amounts of [[img:icon_spirit_essence]][[/img]]Spirit Essence are used for [[sl_link:campaign_witchs_hut]]Witch’s Hut[[/sl_link]] Incantations and performing the Hexes themselves.
The inner kingdoms of Ulthuan are defended by Fortress Gate [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]]. [[sl:campaign_siege_weapons]]Siege weapons[[/sl]] cannot be used to attack these bastions.

Athel Tamarha’s features can be upgraded using Warden’s Supplies, which are earned by carrying out actions against prisoners and other operations benefiting Yvresse’s defence. Factors are listed in the tooltip from the Warden’s Supplies icon at the top of the main campaign interface.
Dragons can also be challenged to battle. Defeating them means you receive all their rewards.
Growth in a horde can be stimulated by certain buildings and by [[sl:campaign_razing]]razing[[/sl]] enemy [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]].
[[sl:campaign_horde_growth]]Growth[[/sl]] within Horde armies produces [[img:icon_pop_surplus]][[/img]]population surplus, which can be spent on building construction.

Training in the Ice Court takes place over a number of [[sl:campaign_turns]]turns[[/sl]] during which optional dilemmas appear on the Ice Court panel. The presence of these dilemmas is indicated on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_ice_court_button]]Ice Court button[[/sl_tooltip]], and the choices made help shape the character in training.

A faction with a negative {{tr:icon_income}}income per-turn is at risk of going [[sl:campaign_bankruptcy]]bankrupt[[/sl]]. [[sl:campaign_unit_merging_and_disbanding]]Disband units[[/sl]] or take other steps to reduce costs to maintain a positive {{tr:icon_income}}income per-turn.
A pirate Lord will rise up the ranks of the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_infamy_link]]Infamy list[[/sl_tooltip]] as they gain [[img:icon_infamy]][[/img]]Infamy.

The higher a [[sl:campaign_characters]]character’s[[/sl]] [[img:icon_influence]][[/img]]influence cost, the better the [[sl:campaign_character_details]]trait[[/sl]] that they will start with. Some characters cost no [[img:icon_influence]][[/img]]influence, but have detrimental traits.

Intervention armies cost {{tr:icon_money}}[[sl:campaign_money]]{{tr:hp_campaign_money_term}}[[/sl]] to hire. The more {{tr:icon_money}}[[sl:campaign_money]]{{tr:hp_campaign_money_term}}[[/sl]] spent, the greater the military power of the army that appears.
Choose to either improve or decrease relations between the selected factions. The cost in [[img:icon_influence]][[/img]]influence is shown on the choice buttons.

A value of cargo can be customised prior to dispatch. Increasing the value of cargo increases the payout should the cargo reach its destination. Click the Dispatch button to send the Caravan on its journey. Additional Caravans may also be recruited on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_ivory_road_panel]]Ivory Road panel[[/sl_tooltip]].

Battles involving non-Khornate factions that take place in [[sl:campaign_provinces]]provinces[[/sl]] featuring [[sl:campaign_chaos_corruption]]Khorne corruption[[/sl]] leave behind Skull Piles, which can then be harvested for Skulls.
Kislevite [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] can appoint [[sl:campaign_atamans]]Atamans[[/sl]] as governors to oversee their [[sl:campaign_provinces]]provinces[[/sl]].

A factionwide overview of [[img:icon_labour]][[/img]]Labour across all owned provinces can be viewed in the Labour Economy panel, accessed via the main campaign interface. The management section allows the redistribution of Labour between provinces for a per-head Treasury cost.

[[sl:campaign_armies]]Armies[[/sl]] of the Lizardmen may use the [[img:icon_astromancy_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_astromancy]]Astromancy stance[[/sl]] to detect their surroundings more effectively.
Captured settlements will automatically be given to an allied Lizardmen faction known as the [[img:bullet_lzd_spawnings_of_the_ancients]][[/img]]Defenders of the Great Plan.
In a multi-player campaign, Lord Kroak will only be available to the first Lizardmen faction that summons him.
Each Sacrifice to Sotek costs a number of [[img:icon_sotek_captives]][[/img]]Sacrificial Offerings. The greater Sotek’s reward, the greater the number of sacrifices required.
[[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords appear in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]] as powerful single-person [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]].

The starting [[img:icon_loyalty]][[/img]]loyalty for each [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord available for [[sl:campaign_raising_forces]]recruitment[[/sl]] can vary. Starting loyalty values are indicated on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_raise_forces_panel]]Recruit Lord panel[[/sl_tooltip]].

Double-left-clicking on a magic item in the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_global_item_pool]]Global Item pool[[/sl_tooltip]] equips it to the appropriate slot on the current character if that slot is free. Double-left-click an equipped item on the Character Details panel to unequip it. Items may also be dragged between a character and the item pool.
Each [[sl:campaign_missions]]mission[[/sl]] to kill a target [[sl:campaign_characters]]character[[/sl]] will expire after a certain number of [[sl:campaign_turns]]turns[[/sl]].

The number of [[img:icon_marks_of_ruination]][[/img]]Marks of Ruination received from a Ritual of Ruin directly correlates to the amount of Devastation earned from [[sl:campaign_razing]]razing settlements[[/sl]] in the Herdstone’s surrounding Blood-grounds.
The numbers of usable and pending tokens are specified at the top of the main campaign interface. Winning battles reduces the number of turns tokens stay in a pending state.
An Ogre army will suffer [[sl:campaign_attrition]]attritional casualties[[/sl]] due to cannibalism if its level of Meat drops to zero.

The potential Convoy destinations will yield different resources by travelling to them. The value and nature of cargo sent can be customised prior to dispatch, with higher-value payloads providing higher-value payouts when successful.
[[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Legendary Lords[[/sl]] can go on [[sl:campaign_quests]]Quests[[/sl]] to to gain powerful items.

If a faction becomes [[sl:campaign_bankruptcy]]bankrupt[[/sl]] and is unable to pay its troops then its [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] will suffer [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]]attrition in the form of desertions.

Additionally, the Convocation of Hunters [[sl:campaign_rites]]rite[[/sl]] can be used to trigger a dilemma that enables the replenishment of [[img:icon_monster_pens]][[/img]]Monster Pens units via special events, for a price.
When activated, a Monster Hunt involves locating a monster and then slaying it in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]].
The [[sl:campaign_resources]]resources[[/sl]] currently available are shown at the top right of the Mortuary Cult panel.
[[img:icon_supporters]][[/img]]Supporters are gained when characters advance in rank.
Pledge your devotion to a [[sl:campaign_gods]]Dark God[[/sl]] to gain their favour and Ruinous gifts.

As long as a Homeland Capital is occupied, the Norscan tribe will never break its vassalage. However, if another Chaos faction takes the settlement, the tribe’s vassalage transfers to the new occupier.

Nurglish [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]] are not [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]recruited[[/sl]] over time but are instead summoned directly, albeit at reduced strength. They may then [[img:icon_replenishment]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_unit_replenishment]]replenish[[/sl]] to full strength over [[sl:campaign_turns]]time[[/sl]].

Oathgold may also be obtained by recycling unused [[sl:campaign_magic_items]]magic items[[/sl]] in the [[sl:campaign_forging_magic_items]]Forge.[[/sl]]; the amount obtained depends on the rarity of the recycled item.
Eligible [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords are shown on the Offices panel, and may be dragged into a vacant position.

Ogre Camps exert a circle of influence around themselves, within which armies of the same faction can benefit from [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]recruitment[[/sl]], [[img:icon_replenishment]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_unit_replenishment]]replenishment[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_meat]]Meat[[/sl]] supplies and extra army abilities.

Ogres can only access their highest tiers of [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]] through camps, as Ogre [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] cannot grow beyond the third tier of buildings.
After construction has begun, an Outpost in an allied settlement may be viewed by selecting the settlement directly.

As characters progress into new forms, they receive bonuses and [[sl_tooltip:campaign_character_traits]]traits[[/sl_tooltip]], in addition to inheriting a proportion of [[sl:campaign_character_skills]]skill[[/sl]] levels from their previous forms.
Peasant units recruited into service by a Bretonnian faction no longer contribute towards the economy.
Pieces of Eight may be secured by defeating [[sl:campaign_rogue_pirates]]Rogue Pirates[[/sl]] or completing certain [[sl:campaign_quests]]quests[[/sl]].
The owner of a settlement containing a [[img:icon_cove]][[/img]]Pirate Cove will experience no negative effects of it being established there.

A [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Pestilent Scheme Priest may infect a target enemy or settlement by performing a [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_hero_actions]]heroic action[[/sl]]. The priest is destroyed when the infection begins.

A created Plague will appear at the [[sl:campaign_characters]]character[[/sl]] or [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]] that was selected when the panel being opened. Alternatively, a dedicated Plague Cultist [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Hero[[/sl]] may be summoned to carry it.

An [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] may transition between the land and the sea through a [[img:icon_port]][[/img]]port that it controls without incurring a [[sl:campaign_army_movement]]movement range[[/sl]] penalty.

Possession can be decreased by drinking the [[img:def_malus_possession_potion]][[/img]]elixir, available from the upper campaign interface. The elixir instantly reduces possession by 10, but its cost increases over time.
Occupying or looting a settlement will transfer its ownership to the victor.
The current duration of the Power of Nature bonus can be seen in the province's effects list.
Click the attack button to contest the [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]] in person, or the withdraw button to retreat if the odds are unfavourable.
The likely outcome of the battle is indicated on the panel.
Examine tooltips on the Province Info panel to see more detailed information about what is currently affecting the province.

[[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_public_order]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term_sentence_start}}[[/sl]] is a measure of local unrest. [[sl:campaign_revolts]]Rebellions[[/sl]] will occur if {{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}} drops too low.
More information about the province is shown on the [[sl:campaign_province_info_panel]]Province Info panel[[/sl]], which opens with the Province Overview panel.

Settlements within a province produce [[sl:campaign_tax]]{{tr:hp_campaign_tax_term_plural}}[[/sl]] for the faction that controls them. All factions require a strong income to be successful - controlling lots of territory is usually key to this.

The [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}} level of a province can be viewed on the [[sl:campaign_province_info_panel]]Province Info panel[[/sl]]. The factors affecting [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}} can be viewed on the tooltip of the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_public_order_icon]]icon on this panel[[/sl_tooltip]].
Currently-active quests are shown on the Objectives panel, which may be opened by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_objectives_button]]Objectives button[[/sl_tooltip]] on the campaign interface.

Only certain races can form [[sl:campaign_hordes]]hordes[[/sl]], use [[sl:campaign_rites]]rites[[/sl]], employ special modes of travel such as the [[img:icon_tunnelling_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_underway]]Underway[[/sl]], use certain [[sl:campaign_stances]]stances[[/sl]], or make [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_trade]]trade agreements[[/sl]], for example.
The pool of units available to raise is replenished over [[sl:campaign_turns]]time[[/sl]].

[[sl:campaign_hordes]]Horde factions[[/sl]] require [[img:icon_pop_surplus]][[/img]]population surplus, earned through [[img:icon_growth]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_horde_growth]]horde growth[[/sl]], to raise new horde armies.

Defeating stronger enemies and winning more battles in a single [[sl:campaign_turns]]turn[[/sl]] earns [[img:icon_rampage]][[/img]]Rampage Marks faster, but the Rampage bar will empty whenever [[img:icon_momentum]][[/img]]Momentum reaches zero.

[[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]] may spread [[sl:campaign_corruption]]corruption[[/sl]] to surrounding settlements by razing a settlement and leaving a [[sl:campaign_chaos_artefacts]]Chaos Artefact[[/sl]] there.

Each of the four Gods of Chaos hold sway over a different domain within the Realm of Chaos. Within each domain lies a favoured Daemon Prince who must be defeated so their soul can be claimed. Only by claiming the souls of the Daemon Princes may the route to the [[sl:campaign_forge_of_souls]]Forge of Souls[[/sl]] be illuminated.
The Recruit Hero panel can also be opened from the [[sl:campaign_building_panel]]Building panel[[/sl]] when a [[sl:campaign_hordes]]horde[[/sl]] army is selected.
A particular Regiment of Renown may only be recruited once, unless it is destroyed in combat.

A settlement can only be included in a deal if it is owned by one side and shares a border with the other. Settlements may be unavailable to trade, such as those currently under [[sl:campaign_siege_warfare]]siege[[/sl]] and those in special locations.
[[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] of reinforcing armies are shown on the [[sl:campaign_pre_battle_panel]]Pre-Battle panel[[/sl]].

Once access to a resource is established, the controlling faction will automatically begin to [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]]trade that resource with its partners, bringing in extra {{tr:icon_income}}[[sl:campaign_income]]income[[/sl]].

If [[sl:campaign_corruption]]corruption[[/sl]] is high when a rebellion occurs then the rebel army may consist of [[img:icon_corruption_chs]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]], [[img:icon_corruption_skv]][[/skv]][[sl:campaign_skaven]]Skaven[[/sl]], or [[img:icon_corruption_vmp]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_vampires]]vampiric[[/sl]] forces.

If [[sl:campaign_corruption]]corruption[[/sl]] is high when a riot occurs then the incursion army may consist of [[img:icon_corruption_chs]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]], [[img:icon_corruption_skv]][[/skv]][[sl:campaign_skaven]]Skaven[[/sl]], or [[img:icon_corruption_vmp]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_vampires]]vampiric[[/sl]] forces.
[[sl:campaign_ritual_resource_sites]]Ritual resource sites[[/sl]] produce a large amount of currency, and can be found across the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]].
Rival powers can attempt to interrupt the ritual by attacking the ritual sites, and may hire [[sl:campaign_intervention_armies]]intervention armies[[/sl]] to support their assault.

[[sl_tooltip:campaign_ritual_rival_icons]]Icons below the Rituals bar[[/sl_tooltip]] indicate the progress of rival races. When another race is conducting a ritual, the corresponding icon will be highlighted.
Rogue Pirates will often also surrender [[sl:campaign_treasure_maps]]Treasure Maps[[/sl]] or [[sl:campaign_pieces_of_eight]]Pieces of Eight[[/sl]] when defeated in battle.

The forces of [[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]] may use ruins to spread [[sl:campaign_chaos_corruption]]Chaos corruption[[/sl]] to surrounding settlements by leaving a [[sl:campaign_chaos_artefacts]]Chaos Artefact[[/sl]] there.

Completing at least half of a theatre’s Minor Schemes (in any order) will unlock access to the theatre’s Grand Scheme, providing significant rewards and leading the Changeling closer to campaign victory.
Armies may cross from the land to the sea at a [[img:icon_port]][[/img]]port or on a beach, but not over a rocky cliff.

Each [[img:icon_shanty]][[/img]]verse of the Lost Sea Shanty may be seized by gaining more [[img:icon_infamy]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_infamy]]Infamy[[/sl]] than its current holder, provoking them into battle.
Once a battle is over, all surviving Seduced units are returned to their army if it was not destroyed.
Entering [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]] against a Slaaneshi [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]].
[[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]] may not settle anywhere.
The ruling [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] may position an army in a settlement to defend it from attack.

Any Clan Eshin [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lord[[/sl]] or [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Hero[[/sl]] can be used to complete actions. Higher-level actions will remove the character from the campaign for a number of [[sl:campaign_turns]]turns[[/sl]] while they recover, so [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords will require a replacement to be selected to command their armies in their absence.
[[img:icon_growth]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_growth]]Growth[[/sl]] points are earned by fleets eligible for shipbuilding, and may be spent on upgrades.
{{tr:hp_campaign_siege_panel_add_01}} {{tr:hp_campaign_siege_panel_add_02}}

Province capitals are [[sl:campaign_fortifications]]fortified[[/sl]]. It is required that these fortifications be reduced or circumvented for the besieger to storm the city in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]].
Siege weapons can take many turns to build, during which the attacking [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] must maintain the siege.
Skaven armies consume [[img:icon_skaven_food]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_food]]food[[/sl]] over time. Penalties are experienced if [[img:icon_skaven_food]][[/img]]food becomes scarce.
If a province [[sl:campaign_revolts]]rebels[[/sl]] due to the effects of [[img:icon_corruption_skv]][[/img]]Skaven corruption then a Skaven uprising will occur.

Applying Augments to a unit has a chance to give it [[img:icon_instability]][[/img]]Instability, affecting its replenishment and potentially leading to a faster death in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]]. The more Augments applied to a single unit, the higher the chance it will gain Instability.

[[img:icon_warp_fuel]][[/img]]Warp-Fuel can be acquired by winning [[sl:campaign_battles]]battles[[/sl]] when Ikit Claw or a Warlock Master are in the leading [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]], or by successfully performing [[sl:campaign_hero_actions]]Hero actions[[/sl]] with Engineer [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes.
A [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord’s [[img:icon_loyalty]][[/img]]loyalty is decreased by the opposite actions.

To establish an [[img:icon_under_empire]][[/img]]Under-City beneath a foreign settlement the Skaven must either win a battle there and use the Expand Under-Empire [[sl:campaign_post_battle_options]]post-battle option[[/sl]], or otherwise use an Engineer [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero to establish one with a [[sl:campaign_hero_actions]]hero action[[/sl]].

Skulls may also be generated by a Khornate [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] when they enter Combat Trials [[sl:campaign_stances]]stance[[/sl]], at the cost of attritional casualties sustained as its warriors are pitted against each other.

Slaaneshi [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] can spend [[sl:campaign_money]]favour[[/sl]] to [[sl:campaign_seduction]]seduce[[/sl]] enemy units prior to [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]]. Seduced [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]] will switch sides and fight for Slaanesh in the upcoming engagement.
The Dark Elves' Infrastructure buildings consume slaves every turn to provide much stronger bonuses, as long as slave income is maintained.

A selected army may be switched into a different stance from the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_stances_rollout]]Stances rollout[[/sl_tooltip]], on the [[sl:campaign_character_info_panel]]Character Info panel[[/sl]].
Any [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] may wield the Sword of Khaine, if they defeat the previous wielder in battle.

A province may be excluded from paying tax on the Province Info panel to improve [[img:icon_growth]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_growth]]growth[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_public_order]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}}[[/sl]] there.

A province may be spared from extortion on the Province Info panel to improve [[img:icon_growth]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_growth]]growth[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_public_order]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}}[[/sl]] there.
The benefits brought by each technology are shown on its icon's tooltip.
Tzeentchian armies must expend a portion of their [[sl:campaign_winds_of_magic]]Winds of Magic[[/sl]] power reserves in order to teleport until the associated technology is researched.
Roads that cross the landscape usually provide the fastest and safest method of travel.
From time to time a particular Chaos God may become Ascendant for a period. Followers gain more powerful Unholy Manifestations while their God is Ascendant.
Each Artefact is made up of two parts. Once both are collected, an Artefact can be reforged to gain its powerful benefits.

Dynasties may be [[sl:campaign_technology]]researched[[/sl]] in order to increase the number and variety of [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Heroes[[/sl]] a Tomb Kings faction may [[sl:campaign_raising_forces]]recruit[[/sl]].
Seats can be usurped from rival Factions for a price, but any recently claimed Seat cannot be usurped for a short period of time. Seats in the top tier of the Tower are too powerful to be usurped.

[[sl:campaign_greenskins]]Greenskin[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_warriors_of_chaos]]Warriors of Chaos[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_beastmen]]Beastmen[[/sl]] factions cannot [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]]trade.

Treasure may be searched for in a location using the Treasure Hunting [[sl:campaign_stances]]stance[[/sl]] or [[sl:campaign_hero_actions]]heroic action[[/sl]]. The treasure will only be uncovered if the [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord or [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Hero[[/sl]] is close enough to its hidden location to uncover it.

The [[sl_tooltip:campaign_treasury_panel_trade_tab]]Trade tab[[/sl_tooltip]] shows information about current [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]]trade partners, as well as resources being produced and imported.

[[img:icon_trickster_cult_supplies]][[/img]]Trickster Cult Supplies are required to construct Trickster Cult buildings, which can grant powerful effects but also increase a cult’s [[img:icon_discoverability]][[/img]]Discoverability. If Discoverability becomes too high, the host will be able to destroy the local Trickster Cult.

Tzeentchian factions can perform [[sl:campaign_changing_of_the_ways]]Changing of the Ways[[/sl]] actions to spy, machinate [[sl:campaign_diplomacy]]diplomatic[[/sl]] situations, and manipulate other elements of reality through magic. Followers of Tzeentchian [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] may also [[sl:campaign_winds_of_magic_manipulation]]manipulate the Winds of Magic[[/sl]] to suit their whims.
An army moving through the [[img:icon_tunnelling_stance]][[/img]]Underway will disappear from its original location and reappear at its destination.
While a particular god is ascendant in [[sl:campaign_the_great_game]]The Great Game[[/sl]], the Unholy Manifestations of factions that follow it will become more powerful.
A unit’s [[sl:campaign_unit_types]]type[[/sl]] is indicated at the bottom of its Unit Card.
Select individual [[sl:campaign_unit_cards]]Unit Cards[[/sl]] to mark them for switching between the armies involved.
Depleted units may be [[sl:campaign_unit_merging_and_disbanding]]merged together[[/sl]] to preserve their experience level.
A unit may be disbanded to save on upkeep costs.
It is recommended to use local recruitment wherever possible, as it is less expensive and allows units to be recruited more quickly than global recruitment.

Certain [[sl:campaign_races]]races[[/sl]] have a way to [[img:icon_replenishment]][[/img]]replenish units away from home. [[sl:campaign_dark_elves]]Dark Elves[[/sl]] units can replenish when close to a [[sl:campaign_black_arks]]Black Ark[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_ogre_kingdoms]]Ogres[[/sl]] can replenish when close to an [[sl:campaign_ogre_camps]]Ogre Camp[[/sl]], for example.
Missile units fire or throw projectiles at the enemy from a distance.
Units may be [[sl:campaign_unit_merging_and_disbanding]]merged together or disbanded[[/sl]] from the Unit Card rollout, which appears when a Unit Card is selected.
Pirates may upgrade their ships at sea, and construct [[img:icon_cove]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_pirate_coves]]Pirate Coves[[/sl]] in enemy [[img:icon_port]][[/img]]ports.
Vampire Counts may resurrect ancient [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] and gain powerful bonuses by awakening [[sl:campaign_bloodlines]]Bloodlines[[/sl]].
Conversely, undead armies suffer [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]]attritional casualties in territory not affected by [[img:icon_corruption_vmp]][[/img]]vampiric corruption.

A Vampire Coast [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord’s [[img:icon_loyalty]][[/img]]loyalty may also be increased by sacrificing [[sl:campaign_post_battle_options]]post-battle loot[[/sl]], or by assigning them to a [[sl:campaign_fleet_office]]Fleet Office[[/sl]].
A vassalage demand is only likely to succeed when the master is much more powerful than the [[img:icon_vassal]][[/img]]vassal.

Once a Call to Waaagh! is triggered, a target must be chosen by selecting any visible [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] or [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]] on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]map[[/sl]]. Dedicate the Waaagh! to Gork or Mork for additional army effects.

Targets for the ally to attack can be assigned or cleared on [[sl_tooltip:campaign_war_coordination_set_target_tab]]Set Target tab[[/sl_tooltip]] of the War Co-ordination panel. Enemy [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] or [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] may be targeted. Armies and settlements belonging to the player's faction may also be assigned, in which case the ally will attempt to guard the target for a limited period.

Recruited units can be upgraded into stronger archetypes as they gain [[sl:campaign_unit_experience]]experience[[/sl]]. Marked versions of units are accessed via the God-specific tabs of the [[img:icon_warband]][[/img]]Warband Upgrades.

Warriors of Chaos reap the [[img:icon_souls_resource]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_souls_resource]]Souls[[/sl]] of their victims, sacrificing them to the Chaos Gods in return for powerful [[img:icon_chaos_gifts]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_chaos_gifts]]Gifts of Chaos[[/sl]] and ascending [[sl:campaign_characters]]characters[[/sl]] through [[sl:campaign_path_to_glory]]Paths to Glory[[/sl]].

The current [[sl_tooltip:campaign_winds_of_magic_power_reserve_bar]]power reserves[[/sl_tooltip]] of a selected army are shown on the [[sl:campaign_army_panel]]Army panel[[/sl]]. These power reserves increase when the army spends time in areas where the Winds of Magic are strong, and decrease if the winds are weak.
By reducing the strength of the Winds of Magic in one area, the strength in another area may be increased. The total strength of the Winds of Magic remains constant.

Incantations require Trinkets collected by defeating armies of certain races or allying with their factions, as specified in their tooltips. Trinkets provide positive effects when part of Blessings, or negative effects when part of Curses.

Wood Elves can construct mighty [[sl:campaign_elven_halls]]Elven Halls[[/sl]] within Athel Loren and other Magical Forests of the world, which contain more [[sl:campaign_building_slots]]building slots[[/sl]] than even the largest settlements elsewhere.

Through her campaign [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_hero_actions]]Hero actions[[/sl]], Ariel is able to demolish an entire level of a [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement’s[[/sl]] main [[sl:campaign_buildings]]building[[/sl]].
The combat penalties suffered by Elves due to Glamouring can be removed through one of Drycha’s [[sl:campaign_character_skills]]skills[[/sl]], but they will always remain expendable.
The pool of units available to summon is replenished over [[sl:campaign_turns]]time[[/sl]].
Gifts from the Forge include equipment that each form part of a set with its own focus and strengths, in addition to Daith’s Blessings which grant temporary factionwide army bonuses.

Forest [[img:forest_health]][[/img]]health is increased mainly by pacifying bordering [[img:heathland_pacified]][[/img]][[img:heathland_hostile]][[/img]][[img:heathland_neutral]][[/img]]Heathland regions through [[sl:campaign_razing]]razing[[/sl]], occupation, or [[sl:campaign_alliances]]alliance[[/sl]], amongst other ways. Once the required [[img:forest_health]][[/img]]health is reached, the Ritual of Rebirth can be initiated via the button on the forest’s settlement overlay.
The army must emerge from the Worldroots at the end of the movement phase, and so cannot traverse large, impassable gaps.

[[img:icon_allegiance]][[/img]]Allegiance may also be spent on [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]recruiting units[[/sl]] within an [[sl:campaign_outposts]]outpost[[/sl]] constructed in the territory of an ally.
{{tr:hp_campaign_alliances_add_03}} This is the most co-operative arrangement that two factions can agree to short of a full [[sl:campaign_confederation]]confederation[[/sl]].
Hover the cursor tooltip over an area on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] to see the chance that an [[img:icon_ambush_stance]][[/img]]ambush will succeed there.

Extra [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]] may be [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]recruited[[/sl]] into an army, but the army must usually remain stationary to do so. Recruitment is generally cheapest if the army is in home territory.
Battles fought at sea will be contested on islands.
Armies can use certain [[sl:campaign_stances]]stances[[/sl]] such as Forced March stance to modify aspects of how they move across the campaign map.

If the selected army is a [[sl:campaign_hordes]]horde[[/sl]] army and controlled by the player, the [[sl:campaign_building_panel]]Building panel[[/sl]] can be viewed by clicking the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_building_panel_tab]]Building Panel tab[[/sl_tooltip]].

The distance an army can see on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] is increased when using [[img:icon_astromancy_stance]][[/img]]Astromancy stance. However, the distance it can move per [[sl:campaign_turns]]turn[[/sl]] is decreased.

Once recruited, an Ataman may be [[sl:campaign_raising_forces]]appointed[[/sl]] to the head of an [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_raise_forces_panel]]Recruit Lord panel[[/sl_tooltip]].

The Chaos Wastes are territories at the extreme fringes of the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]], held by the forces of [[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]]. Only the [[sl:campaign_warriors_of_chaos]]Warriors of Chaos[[/sl]] may pass through this area without suffering great losses.
An army attacking a fortified settlement will first have to overcome the defences, most commonly by laying [[sl:campaign_siege_warfare]]siege[[/sl]].
An army travelling through a beast-path can be intercepted and brought to [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]] by a nearby enemy army, even one that cannot use beast-paths.
The [[img:icon_bestial_rage]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_bestial_rage]]Bestial Rage[[/sl]] of a Beastmen horde increases as it fights battles, allowing it to attain the growth needed to expand.
The horizontal marks on the [[img:icon_bestial_rage]][[/img]]Bestial Rage bar show the thresholds of Bestial Rage at which growth and other effects will change.
Dark Elf factions may also [[sl:campaign_raising_forces]]raise armies[[/sl]] from Black Arks.

The maximum number of Herdstones available to build is limited by [[img:icon_herdstone_shard]][[/img]]Herdstone Shards, a resource received as a campaign progresses (as tracked by [[sl:campaign_marks_of_ruination]]Ruination Level[[/sl]]).
Suffering defeat or not winning a battle for a certain period resets the Bloodletting of that army back to the first level.
Each Bloodline may be awakened multiple times to earn greater bonuses.

Bretonnian [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] can partake of [[sl:campaign_bretonnian_vows]]vows[[/sl]] when they achieve a certain [[sl:campaign_character_skills]]rank[[/sl]], which greatly reduces upkeep on certain [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]].
The tooltip on each pledge button outlines the requirements to fulfil the Vow or Troth.
The cost in [[img:icon_pop_surplus]][[/img]]population surplus of upgrading a settlement increases with the settlement size.

Buildings may be damaged by enemy [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Heroes[[/sl]] or in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]]. Damaged buildings do not provide their full benefits until they are repaired.

The campaign game may be [[sl:campaign_saving_and_loading]]saved and loaded[[/sl]] from the game options. The campaign may be saved before battle on the [[sl:campaign_pre_battle_panel]]Pre-Battle panel[[/sl]], except when playing on Legendary difficulty mode.
The [[sl:campaign_fog_of_war]]fog of war[[/sl]] obscures unexplored areas of the map. The shroud is revealed when territory is explored or conquered.
Only Tomb Kings factions collect [[img:icon_jars]][[/img]]Canopic Jars.
Cathayan Legendary [[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] may adopt a Dragon or human form at will when in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]], gaining specific advantages in each aspect.

The followers of Khorne, Nurgle, Slaanesh and Tzeentch each strive to spread [[sl:campaign_chaos_corruption]]Chaos Corruption[[/sl]] and to seed [[sl:campaign_chaos_cults]]Chaos Cults[[/sl]] throughout the mortal world, to further the cause of their chosen God in [[sl:campaign_the_great_game]]the Great Game[[/sl]] that continuously plays out between the Ruinous Powers.

The [[sl:campaign_daemons_of_chaos]]Daemon Prince[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_warriors_of_chaos]]Warriors of Chaos[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_norsca]]Norscans[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_beastmen]]Beastmen[[/sl]] spread [[img:icon_corruption_chs]][[/img]]Chaos Undivided corruption, which does not favour any one Chaos God.
Should Chaos corruption be sufficiently reduced in a [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]] then local Chaos Cults and Chaos Cult buildings will disappear.

More powerful [[img:icon_chaos_gifts]][[/img]]Gifts of Chaos can be unlocked as higher numbers of [[img:icon_souls_resource]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_souls_resource]]Souls[[/sl]] are sacrificed. The required number of sacrificed [[img:icon_souls_resource]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_souls_resource]]Souls[[/sl]] to unlock a higher tier gift is displayed below it.
When Ursun roars, Chaos Rifts will open across the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]]. Right-click on one with an [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] selected to enter it.
Legendary [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords may gain powerful items from quests which may not be lost or traded to other characters.

The [[sl_tooltip:campaign_character_details_panel_details_button]]Details tab[[/sl_tooltip]] lists [[sl:campaign_magic_items]]magic items[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_banners_and_marks]]banners[[/sl]], and [[sl_tooltip:campaign_followers]]followers[[/sl_tooltip]] associated with the selected character. It also shows the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_global_item_pool]]Global Item pool[[/sl_tooltip]] with which items may be swapped between characters in the [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]], fused, or salvaged.

The [[img:icon_fightiness]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_fightiness]]fightiness[[/sl]] or [[img:icon_bestial_rage]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_bestial_rage]]bestial rage[[/sl]] level is also indicated on the Character Info panel if controlling [[sl:campaign_greenskins]]Greenskin[[/sl]] or [[sl:campaign_beastmen]]Beastmen[[/sl]] armies.
{{tr:hp_campaign_character_skills_add_02}} Spellcasters may also gain access to new spells through skills.

[[img:icon_armaments]][[/img]]Armaments income is generated by assembly line buildings in Factory Settlements. Armaments are used to improve unit capacities and strengths in the [[sl:campaign_hellforge]]Hell-Forge[[/sl]] and for the construction of Advanced Military buildings.
With sufficient [[img:icon_chivalry]][[/img]]Chivalry, Bretonnian factions can summon the [[img:icon_green_knight]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_green_knight]]Green Knight[[/sl]].
[[sl:campaign_lizardmen]]Lizardmen[[/sl]] factions may strengthen the [[sl:campaign_geomantic_web]]Geomantic Web[[/sl]] to boost the power of any commandments they issue.
The Compass is locked in place for a time after its direction has been changed, but other factions may change it at a cost to the energy reserves.

If [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}} drops too low in a corrupted province then a special uprising will occur in place of a standard [[sl:campaign_revolts]]rebellion[[/sl]].
{{tr:hp_campaign_daemonic_glory_add_01}}
As Daemonic Glory is accumulated a Daemon Prince may ultimately [[sl:campaign_dedication]]Dedicate[[/sl]] themselves to the service of a particular Chaos God, or as an Undivided champion of all.

The [[img:icon_loyalty]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_loyalty]]loyalty[[/sl]] of Dark Elf [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] to their leader cannot always be relied upon, and must be kept in check if they are not to rebel.
There is no limit to the number of basic skeleton units that may be recruited.
Capturing key locations on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]], such as the Shrine of Khaine, locks a level on the Death Night bar, preventing it from dropping too low.
Conversely, Avelorn and its leader, Alarielle, will receive a variety of bonuses should all of Ulthuan belong to the High Elves.

Uniquely amongst those that worship the [[sl:campaign_chaos]]Ruinous Powers[[/sl]], the followers of Slaanesh can actively [[sl_tooltip:campaign_proliferate_cults_button]]proliferate cults[[/sl_tooltip]], at a cost of Devotees. Once a Slaaneshi [[sl:campaign_chaos_cults]]Chaos Cult[[/sl]] is established, buildings may be constructed within it, also at a cost of Devotees.
Low levels of Devotion can lead to a Chaos incursion, where the forces of [[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]] spontaneously appear and attack.

Factions maintain a view of each foreign faction they're aware of, which can improve or deteriorate in response to campaign events. The factors influencing one faction’s view towards another are shown on the tooltip of the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_diplomacy_attitude_icons]]attitude icons[[/sl_tooltip]] on the Diplomacy screen.
Double-click a faction to open negotiations. Once negotiations are started the central panel can be used to construct a diplomatic proposal.
Once a Disciple Army is summoned, another cannot be summoned by that Lord or in the same [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]] for some time.

Spending [[img:icon_dread]][[/img]]Dread on [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Legendary Lord[[/sl]] characters will have them join your faction. If wounded or inactive when summoned, they are added to your [[sl:campaign_raising_forces]]Lord recruitment pool[[/sl]].

The special items gathered can be chosen to power the Drill, or alternatively used to provide other benefits to exploit – the choice is yours. The Drill’s location, special items and related missions can be viewed in the Great Drill of Hashut panel, accessed via the button at the top of the main campaign interface.
Appointable [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords are shown at the bottom of the Offices panel, and may be dragged into any vacant position they are eligible to fill.

Expansion, upgrading [[sl:campaign_ports]]ports[[/sl]] and harassing enemies will increase the expedition’s [[img:bullet_emp_mandate]][[/img]]Acclaim and result in better-quality troops being dispatched as [[img:emp_imperial_supply]][[/img]]Imperial Supplies.
Reaching the highest level of [[img:emp_hostility]][[/img]]Hostility will trigger an instant consignment of [[img:emp_imperial_supply]][[/img]]Imperial Supplies.

[[img:emp_prestige]][[/img]]Prestige is the measure of how influential your faction leader is within the political landscape of the Empire. It is earned through winning [[sl:campaign_battles]]battles[[/sl]], expansion, [[sl:campaign_buildings]]building[[/sl]] construction, and events.
[[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords can be moved from one state to another, but will lose their previous state's benefits.
Directing the compass towards Ashshair will grant access to [[sl:campaign_winds_of_magic_manipulation]]Winds of Magic Manipulation[[/sl]].
The Herald Lord’s equipped [[sl:campaign_magic_items]]items[[/sl]] are unequipped and returned to the global pool when the summoning takes place.

The [[sl:campaign_province_overview_panel]]Province Overview Panel[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_province_info_panel]]Province Info Panels[[/sl]] show information about a selected settlement and the [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]] that contains it.
Various [[sl:campaign_faction_interfaces]]interface panels[[/sl]] exist to help the player manage their faction.
The [[sl_tooltip:campaign_faction_summary_statistics_tab]]Statistics tab[[/sl_tooltip]] shows faction statistics.
A faction is destroyed when it controls no more armies or settlements.
[[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords may be removed from a position of office but doing so will cause their [[img:icon_loyalty]][[/img]]loyalty to suffer.

[[sl:campaign_slaanesh]]Slaanesh[[/sl]] factions may lift the shroud around enemy [[sl:campaign_characters]]characters[[/sl]] by bestowing a [[sl:campaign_gifts_of_slaanesh]]Gift of Slaanesh[[/sl]] upon them.
When recolonising ruins, [[img:icon_skaven_food]][[/img]]food can be spent to raise the starting level of the settlement.
Once the path to the Forge is revealed, a final showdown with the jailor of the Bear-God may happen.
Unused items may be recycled and turned into Oathgold on the Recycle tab of the Forge panel; the amount gained depends on the rarity of the recycled item.
Fortifications may be constructed within smaller settlements once the settlement building reaches its highest level.
When a settlement is [[sl:campaign_siege_warfare]]besieged[[/sl]], its garrison army will take [[sl:campaign_attrition]]attritional casualties[[/sl]] every turn.
Some positions on the Gathering of the Ancients may only be filled by [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords that have attained a certain [[sl:campaign_character_skills]]rank[[/sl]].
The province capital settlements of [[img:icon_military_alliance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_alliances]]allies[[/sl]] provide node links of a higher power than those controlled by unallied factions.
Reaching maximum allegiance to a single God locks the progression bar for the others.
Keeping Gotrek & Felix together in the same [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] will improve their campaign and [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]] efficiency.
Any fortress gate settlement not controlled by a Cathayan faction is considered breached, raising the threat of a Chaos attack considerably.

Greenskin armies may construct [[img:icon_encamp_stance]][[/img]]Raidin' Camps by adopting the related [[sl:campaign_stances]]stance[[/sl]], allowing them to [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]recruit[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_raiding_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_raiding]]raid[[/sl]] while in enemy territory.
REMOVE

The [[img:icon_pop_surplus]][[/img]]population surplus costs for upgrading a settlement are shown on the settlement building rollout on the [[sl:campaign_province_overview_panel]]Province Overview panel[[/sl]].
The higher the number of grudges that go unanswered and the longer they go unanswered for, the faster the Grudges bar fills up.

Cathayan [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]] are also aligned with [[img:icon_yin]][[/img]]Yin or [[img:icon_yang]][[/img]]Yang. However, the effects of this are only seen in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]].
Hostile actions with [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes do not directly lead to war. They may be discovered, however, which will worsen relations between the factions involved.

There are usually [[sl:campaign_buildings]]building[[/sl]] or [[sl:campaign_technology]]technology[[/sl]] requirements that must be satisfied before a particular [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero may be recruited. These are shown on the Hero Recruitment panel.
Hexes can be empowered via [[sl:campaign_technology]]technologies[[/sl]] to enhance their potency.
[[sl:campaign_high_elves]]High Elves[[/sl]] gain increased allegiance points and  have improved allied outposts that generate [[img:icon_influence]][[/img]]influence.

As Athel Tamarha is restored, [[img:yvresse_defence_level_increase]][[/img]]Ladrielle’s Blessings contribute towards Yvresse’s Defence Level, in turn extending the reach of the [[img:mist_of_yvresse]][[/img]]Mists of Yvresse across Ulthuan. Upgrading Athel Tamarha’s Waystone strengthens the Mists’ effects.
Defeating special named Dragons in battle not only means receiving their rewards, but also makes it possible to recruit them as a [[sl:campaign_regiments_of_renown]]Regiment of Renown[[/sl]].
The [[img:icon_pop_surplus]][[/img]]population surplus costs of upgrading buildings are shown on the building rollouts on the Building panel.
Certain factions, such as [[sl:campaign_rogue_armies]]Rogue Armies[[/sl]], may choose to become hordes. Such factions may later choose to settle once more by taking control of a settlement.

Once trained, [[sl:campaign_characters]]characters[[/sl]] are recruitable as normal from the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_raise_forces_panel]]Raise Army panel[[/sl_tooltip]] or [[sl_tooltip:campaign_recruit_hero_panel]]Recruit Hero panel[[/sl_tooltip]].

Pirate [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] who hold [[img:icon_shanty]][[/img]]verses of the [[sl:campaign_sea_shanties]]Lost Sea Shanty[[/sl]] can be provoked into a confrontation by overtaking them on the Infamy list.
The size of the intervention army is chosen on the panel that appears when the interventions button is clicked.
Intrigues cost more to deploy if they are used repeatedly.

After a Caravan is dispatched, it will move towards the west over several [[sl:campaign_turns]]turns[[/sl]]. Its route may be customised by clicking the map markers shown on the Ivory Road panel. Dilemmas or [[sl:campaign_battles]]battles[[/sl]] may trigger as the Caravan is in transit.

Khornate factions must spend skulls to occupy [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]], but they have a chance to automatically take control of [[sl:campaign_ruins]]ruined settlements[[/sl]] in provinces they partially control.

Kislevite factions can send candidates to the [[sl:campaign_ice_court]]Ice Court[[/sl]], where they may be trained to become powerful Frost Maiden [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Heroes[[/sl]] and Ice Witch [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]].

Labour can be spent on instant building construction using the Rush Construction option, which appears on the icon of any building queued for construction in the [[sl:campaign_province_overview_panel]]Province Overview panel[[/sl]].
Lizardmen factions can spend {{tr:icon_money}}[[sl:campaign_money]]{{tr:hp_campaign_money_term}}[[/sl]] to conduct [[sl:campaign_rites]]rites[[/sl]] to gain powerful bonuses.

Establish enough temples to a specific [[img:icon_lzd_nakai_temple_green]][[/img]][[img:icon_lzd_nakai_temple_blue]][[/img]][[img:icon_lzd_nakai_temple_red]][[/img]]Old One to gain a variety of benefits and [[img:icon_lzd_nakai_favour]][[/img]]Favour from them.
Lord Kroak will be available to control from the start of the game without having to complete his quest chain when playing as Gor-Rok.
Many sacrifices can be completed multiple times, as denoted by the repeatable icon on the sacrifice.
[[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Legendary Lords are important faction leader characters with gravitas that exceeds that of a normal [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord.
[[img:icon_loyalty]][[/img]]Loyalty is measured on a scale of 0 to 10, low to high.
Certain magic items exist as part of a set, as detailed on their tooltips. Additional bonuses are granted when all items in a set are equipped together.
When one mission to kill a target marked for death expires, or is completed, another is issued in its place.

The Devastation already earned from a Blood-ground and thusly the amount of [[img:icon_marks_of_ruination]][[/img]]Marks of Ruination to be received from a ritual is indicated by the number displayed above the faction crest on the Herdstone settlement.

Matters of State actions cost varying numbers of usable tokens of both or either [[img:icon_mos_steel]][[/img]]Steel and/or [[img:icon_mos_stone]][[/img]]Stone. Additional tokens can be attained by establishing Fortress Cities and Commercial Districts using the associated actions.

Surplus Meat can be offered to the Great Maw in return for army bonuses. Offers can be browsed and made on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_offer_to_the_great_maw_panel]]Offer to the Great Maw panel[[/sl_tooltip]]. Once meat is offered by an army it cannot offer again for a period of time, but different Ogre armies can make their own offerings.
Once a Military Convoy is dispatched, it will travel the route towards its destination over several turns. Dilemmas or battles may trigger in transit.
[[sl:campaign_dwarfs]]Dwarf[[/sl]] factions receive [[sl:campaign_grudges]]Grudges[[/sl]], which are instead shown on the Book of Grudges panel.
Consider [[sl:campaign_unit_merging_and_disbanding]]disbanding units[[/sl]] to compensate for negative {{tr:icon_income}}income.
