Defeating monsters grants powerful rewards. Some monsters may subsequently be [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]recruited[[/sl]] by the victorious Norscans into their armies as [[sl:campaign_regiments_of_renown]]Regiments of Renown[[/sl]].
Invocation of Ursun
Occupying a vassal’s homeland settlement provides the option to gift it back to them, if desired.

Any number of units may be summoned at a time, although a cap exists on the total number of each [[sl:campaign_unit_types]]unit type[[/sl]] that may be fielded at once. This cap can be raised by the construction and development of [[sl:campaign_cyclical_buildings]]cyclical buildings[[/sl]] that continuously grow and decay once built.
Only Dwarf factions collect [[img:icon_oathgold]][[/img]]Oathgold.

Ogre Camps contain [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]] that may be upgraded to unlock further benefits such as [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]] for recruitment. {{tr:hp_campaign_ogre_camps_add_01}}

Ogre [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] can take on [[sl:campaign_contracts]]Contracts[[/sl]] issued by other factions, directing their aggressions against specific targets in return for generous bounties.

Once an outpost is completed, units may be recruited from it on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_allied_recruitment_panel]]Allied Recruitment panel[[/sl_tooltip]]. Units cost [[img:icon_allegiance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_allegiance]]allegiance[[/sl]] to recruit.
Peasant units [[sl:campaign_merging_and_disbanding]]disbanded[[/sl]] from service are sent back to work the fields, and begin to contribute towards their faction’s {{tr:icon_income}}income again.
The known locations of Pieces of Eight may be seen on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_pieces_of_eight_link]]Pieces of Eight panel[[/sl_tooltip]].
[[img:icon_cove]][[/img]]Pirate Coves may be dismantled by the controlling pirate faction on the Province Overview panel.

[[img:icon_plague]][[/img]]Plagues can be transferred by contact between armies and settlements. Isolating infected settlements and armies can help to prevent the [[img:icon_plague]][[/img]]plague from spreading further.

Plagues of Nurgle cost [[img:icon_infections]][[/img]][[sl_tooltip:campaign_infections]]Infections[[/sl_tooltip]] currency to create, which is earned by spreading Plagues, by Nurglish [[sl:campaign_chaos_cults]]Chaos Cult[[/sl]] buildings, and by various [[sl:campaign_post_battle_options]]post-battle options[[/sl]].
Possession increases whenever Malus uses his Daemonic abilities while untransformed in battle or if he follows [[img:def_malus_tzarkan_whispers]][[/img]]Tz’arkan’s Whispers.
Sacking a settlement does not capture it but strips it of all its valuables. [[sl:campaign_razing]]Razing[[/sl]] a settlement will destroy it and no-one shall own it.
The [[sl:campaign_autoresolving]]auto-resolve[[/sl]] option may be selected to have the outcome of the battle determined automatically.
The strength of the [[sl:campaign_winds_of_magic]]Winds of Magic[[/sl]] is indicated on the Pre-Battle panel if a user of magic is present.

[[sl:campaign_corruption]]Corruption[[/sl]] is a measure of [[img:icon_corruption_chs]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]], [[img:icon_corruption_vmp]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_vampires]]Vampiric[[/sl]] or [[img:icon_corruption_skv]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_skaven]]Skaven[[/sl]] interference, and could lead to an uprising if left unchecked.
A faction that controls all settlements in a province may issue [[sl:campaign_commandments]]commandments[[/sl]] there, which grant powerful province-wide effects.

Different levels of {{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}} provide different bonuses and penalties. The effects currently applied, and the effects applied for all thresholds of {{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}}, can be seen by placing the mouse cursor over the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_public_order_bar]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}} bar[[/sl_tooltip]] on the Province Info panel.
[[sl:campaign_magic_items]]Magic items[[/sl]] gained by a [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Legendary Lord completing a quest cannot be traded with other Lords.
Units raised from the dead are generally more expensive than those recruited normally.
[[img:icon_momentum]][[/img]]Momentum decreases naturally every turn as well as from losing battles or retreating, but is easily attained by winning battles.
The domain of [[sl:campaign_khorne]]Khorne[[/sl]] is an arena of unending battle and bloodshed. Those who enter must defeat repeated martial challenges to tempt Khorne's Gatekeeper out to fight.
The character rank required to unlock a particular regiment is marked on its [[sl:campaign_unit_cards]]card[[/sl]] on the Regiments of Renown panel.
The types of resource available are shown on the {{tr:icon_treasury}}[[sl:campaign_treasury_panel]]Treasury panel[[/sl]].
Crushing the rebellion will not solve the underlying [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}} problem, which must be tackled separately.
Crushing the incursion will not solve the underlying [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}} problem, which must be tackled separately.

The races fighting for control of the [[sl:campaign_great_vortex]]Great Vortex[[/sl]] each collect different types of ritual currency. [[sl:campaign_high_elves]]High Elves[[/sl]] collect [[img:ui/skins/wh2_main_high_elves/icon_ritual_currency.png]][[/img]]Way-fragments, [[sl:campaign_dark_elves]]Dark Elves[[/sl]] collect [[img:ui/skins/warhammer2/icon_ritual_currency.png]][[/img]]the Scrolls of Hekarti, [[sl:campaign_lizardmen]]Lizardmen[[/sl]] collect [[img:ui/skins/wh2_main_lizardmen/icon_ritual_currency.png]][[/img]]ancient plaques and [[sl:campaign_skaven]]Skaven[[/sl]] collect [[img:ui/skins/wh2_main_skaven/icon_ritual_currency.png]][[/img]]Warpstone.
While a ritual is underway the forces of [[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]] will seep into the world, and may attack the ritual sites.

Clicking the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_interventions_button]]Interventions button[[/sl_tooltip]] will allow an [[sl:campaign_intervention_armies]]intervention army[[/sl]] to be summoned in order to interfere with rituals conducted by rivals.
Rogue Pirates can be found throughout the various [[sl:campaign_sea]]seas[[/sl]] and oceans.
The Changeling’s final goal is to enact the Ultimate Scheme. The Ultimate Scheme is unlocked once enough Grand Schemes have been completed to sufficiently destabilise the world.
[[sl:campaign_encounters_at_sea]]Encounters at sea[[/sl]] occasionally provide opportunity to extract plunder from the waves.
Only the pirates of the [[sl:campaign_vampire_coast]]Vampire Coast[[/sl]] may gather and use [[img:icon_shanty]][[/img]]verses of the Lost Sea Shanty.

Slaaneshi armies cannot Seduce units in quest battles, survival battles, or when entering a battle as [[sl:campaign_reinforcements]]reinforcements[[/sl]]. Enemy [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] or [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Heroes[[/sl]] are invulnerable to Seduction.
Hosting any Slaaneshi [[sl:campaign_chaos_cults]]Chaos Cults[[/sl]].
Factions may still sack a settlement they cannot occupy to gain [[sl:campaign_money]]{{tr:hp_campaign_money_term}}[[/sl]], or [[sl:campaign_razing]]raze[[/sl]] it to deny it to the enemy.
Settlements produce an additional [[sl:campaign_garrison_armies]]garrison army[[/sl]] which will automatically defend it when attacked.

Clan Contracts are periodically issued directly from the leaders of the Greater Clans on the Council of Thirteen in their attempts to target and disrupt each other’s clans. Contracts are listed in their own separate tab within the Shadowy Dealings panel, where an acting agent must also be selected.

The amount of labour force available to the besieging [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] is shown on the Siege panel, as well as amount it increases per [[sl:campaign_turns]]turn[[/sl]]. Larger armies provide more labour force.
[[sl:campaign_siege_weapons]]Siege weapons[[/sl]] are usually needed by the attacker to reduce any fortifications. These can be constructed on the [[sl:campaign_siege_panel]]Siege panel[[/sl]].

Artillery pieces and monstrous units also provide a means of overcoming fortifications. They may be recruited as [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]] and travel with the army, negating the need for protracted sieges.

Skaven factions can spend {{tr:icon_money}}[[sl:campaign_money]]{{tr:hp_campaign_money_term}}[[/sl]] to conduct [[sl:campaign_rites]]rites[[/sl]] to gain powerful bonuses, or to summon special [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Heroes[[/sl]] that can cause earthquakes or spread [[img:icon_plague]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_plagues]]plagues[[/sl]].

The Growth Vat bar at top of the Flesh Laboratory screen shows which units can eventually be claimed for immediate recruitment via the Growth Vat Recruitment panel. Claiming monsters requires [[img:icon_growth_juice]][[/img]]Growth Juice, which accumulates naturally over time but also by fighting battles.
Some upgrades are available at the beginning of the campaign, while others require the Forbidden Workshop to be upgraded first in order to unlock them.
The presence of an [[img:icon_under_empire]][[/img]]Under-City may be detected if the Skaven expand it too quickly without constructing concealment buildings.

Skull Piles will be left in the wake of battles fought by non-Khornate factions in provinces containing [[sl:campaign_chaos_corruption]]Khorne Corruption[[/sl]]. Skulls may later be harvested from Skull Piles by any Khornate [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lord[[/sl]] or [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Hero[[/sl]].

[[sl:campaign_gifts_of_slaanesh]]Gifts of Slaanesh[[/sl]] may be spread to enemy [[sl:campaign_characters]]characters[[/sl]]. Recipients of these gifts will suffer negative effects and will inadvertently spread the Dark Prince's [[sl:campaign_chaos_corruption]]corruption[[/sl]].

Slaves can be spent on instantly constructing buildings via the Rush Construction button that appears on buildings queued for construction in the [[sl:campaign_province_overview_panel]]Province Overview panel[[/sl]].
The tooltips on the various Stance buttons show detailed information about the costs and benefits of each stance.
The Sword of Khaine may be found at the Shrine of Khaine, located off the north coast of Ulthuan.
[[sl:campaign_dark_elves]]Dark Elf[[/sl]] factions gain additional provincial {{tr:icon_income}}income from [[img:icon_slaves]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_slaves]]slaves[[/sl]].
Technologies occasionally require that a building is constructed before they can be researched. Any building requirements are shown on the technology icon on the Technology panel.

Armies cannot be intercepted by nearby enemies while teleporting, unlike armies using [[img:icon_tunnelling_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_underway]]The Underway[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_worldroots]]Worldroots[[/sl]] or [[img:icon_use_beastpaths_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_beast_paths]]Beast-Paths[[/sl]]. The Raven God's armies can also launch attacks by teleporting.
Terrain type has a big effect on the success chance of any [[img:icon_ambush_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_ambushes]]ambush[[/sl]] laid there.

Feud events can also occur between two Gods, particularly if their followers are at [[sl:campaign_war]]war[[/sl]]. Factions that serve each God are likely to act with increased aggression against each other while the feud persists.

Tomb King units are [[sl:campaign_day_of_awakening]]awakened[[/sl]], and do not cost [[sl:campaign_money]][[img:icon_money]][[/img]]money[[/sl]] to [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]recruit[[/sl]] or maintain.
Having all the Seats claimed in a District – regardless of the owning Chaos Dwarf faction – will grant a bonus to all Chaos Dwarfs.
Active Treasure Hunts may be seen on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_treasure_maps_panel]]Treasure Hunts panel[[/sl_tooltip]]. A maximum of 6 treasure maps can be held at any given time.
The host settlement’s owner can use their own buildings or Hero actions to increase the local Trickster Cult’s Discoverability.

[[sl:campaign_grimoires]]Grimoires[[/sl]] may be collected by Tzeentchian factions from [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_chaos_cults]]Chaos Cults[[/sl]], and from certain [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]]. They are used to research [[sl:campaign_technology]]technologies[[/sl]] and for Changing of the Ways.
The army must appear above ground at the end of the movement, so cannot travel across large impassable gaps.

Left-clicking a card shows a rollout displaying options such as [[sl:campaign_unit_merging_and_disbanding]]merging and disbanding[[/sl]]. Multiple cards may be selected by clicking while holding down Shift or CTRL.

Certain [[sl:campaign_heroes]]Heroes[[/sl]] can join an army and train existing units using a passive [[sl:campaign_hero_actions]]Hero action[[/sl]], improving their fighting ability without having to risk them in battle.

The [[sl_tooltip:campaign_global_recruitment_pool]]global recruitment pool[[/sl_tooltip]] is shared across all armies in the [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]], and can be accessed by garrisoned armies or armies in [[img:icon_encamp_stance]][[/img]]Encamp [[sl:campaign_stances]]stance[[/sl]], including in foreign territory.
Hover the mouse cursor over a Unit Card to show the [[sl:campaign_unit_info_panel]]Unit Info panel[[/sl]], which shows detailed information about the unit’s strengths and abilities.
Units depleted by [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]] will slowly recover their numbers whilst in controlled or allied [[sl:campaign_provinces]]provinces[[/sl]].

Undead pirates spread [[img:icon_corruption_vmp]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_corruption]]Vampiric corruption[[/sl]] where they settle. Vampires will suffer [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_attrition]]attritional casualties[[/sl]] when moving through land areas not afflicted by Vampiric corruption.
If a province [[sl:campaign_revolts]]rebels[[/sl]] due to the effects of [[img:icon_corruption_vmp]][[/img]]Vampiric corruption then a Vampiric uprising will occur.
The [[sl:campaign_vampires]]Vampire Counts[[/sl]] of Sylvania do not exhibit [[img:icon_loyalty]][[/img]]loyalty.

A faction may make another faction of the same race a [[img:icon_vassal]][[/img]]vassal by capturing its last [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]], or through [[sl:campaign_diplomacy]]diplomacy[[/sl]].

Once a target is chosen, additional [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]] join each of the calling faction's armies for a limited time, viewable on Waaagh! Army View tab on the [[sl:campaign_army_panel]]Army panel[[/sl]], while each [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord has their Waaagh! battle ability temporarily boosted.

Control of an entire allied army may also be requested on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_war_coordination_request_army_tab]]Request Army tab[[/sl_tooltip]] for a significant cost in [[img:icon_allegiance]][[/img]]allegiance. Control of an army led by the allied faction leader [[sl:campaign_lords]]lord[[/sl]] may not be requested.

Warriors of Chaos recruit all their units immediately from the local [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]], using their [[img:icon_warband]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_warbands]]Warbands[[/sl]] to upgrade them or mark them for their Gods to gain benefits from [[sl:campaign_dark_authority]]Dark Authority[[/sl]].

Daemonic forces of [[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]] are sensitive to their power reserves of magic. High power reserves grants armies of [[sl:campaign_khorne]]Khorne[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_nurgle]]Nurgle[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_slaanesh]]Slaanesh[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_tzeentch]]Tzeentch[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_daemons_of_chaos]]Daemons of Chaos[[/sl]] beneficial effects, while low levels prevents [[img:icon_replenishment]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_unit_replenishment]]unit replenishment[[/sl]].
Creating Incantations consumes [[img:icon_spirit_essence]][[/img]]Spirit Essence which is primarily gained from winning battles and maintaining low levels of corruption.

Wood Elf [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] can use the [[sl:campaign_worldroots]]Worldroots[[/sl]] to travel under otherwise-impassable [[sl:campaign_terrain_types]]terrain[[/sl]] and vast distances between Magical Forests.
Tree Spirit units can be assigned Aspects powerful enough to alter their combat role, which can be reassigned at a cost after every [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]].

Once equipment has been gifted, subsequent Favours can be used to upgrade or reforge them at increasing cost. Upgrading equipment will permanently improve their effects, while reforging them will imbue them with powerful temporary effects.

The deepest Worldroots connecting all Magical Forests of the world are known as the Deeproots, which can be traversed at limited intervals to instantly travel between forests via the button on a forest settlement’s overlay.
An army travelling through the Worldroots can be intercepted and brought to [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]] by a nearby enemy army, even one that cannot use the Worldroots.

Factions in an [[img:icon_military_alliance]][[/img]]alliance will built up [[img:icon_allegiance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_allegiance]]allegiance[[/sl]] to one another over time, allowing them to [[sl:campaign_war_coordination]]co-ordinate their war efforts[[/sl]].

[[sl:campaign_beastmen]]Beastmen[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_skaven]]Skaven[[/sl]] armies can proactively [[img:icon_ambush_stance]][[/img]]ambush enemy [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] when attacking in certain stances.
An army is always commanded by a [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lord[[/sl]]. The [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord imparts bonuses on the army he or she leads.
[[sl:campaign_encounters_at_sea]]Encounters at sea[[/sl]] occasionally provide opportunity to extract plunder from the waves.

Armies of certain [[sl:campaign_races]]races[[/sl]] can [[sl:campaign_teleport_stance]]teleport[[/sl]], or use the [[img:icon_tunnelling_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_underway]]Underway[[/sl]], [[img:icon_use_beastpaths_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_worldroots]]Worldroots[[/sl]], or [[img:icon_use_beastpaths_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_beast_paths]]beast-paths[[/sl]] to cross terrain that would be otherwise impassable.
The strength of the [[sl:campaign_winds_of_magic]]Winds of Magic[[/sl]] is indicated on the Army panel if the selected army contains a spellcaster.

Should a [[img:icon_plague]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_plagues]]plague[[/sl]] spread to an [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]], all [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]] will suffer [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]]attritional casualties for the duration of the [[img:icon_plague]][[/img]]plague.

Large battles will leave [[img:icon_battle_site]][[/img]]battle markers, which provide a bonus to any [[sl:campaign_vampires]]Vampiric[[/sl]] factions [[sl:campaign_raising_dead]]raising the dead[[/sl]] nearby.

Beastmen armies always have a chance to ambush when attacking and can also make use of [[img:icon_use_beastpaths_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_beast_paths]]Beast-Paths[[/sl]] to navigate across otherwise-impassable [[sl:campaign_terrain_types]]terrain[[/sl]].

Dark Elf armies which engage their enemies within the bombardment range of a Black Ark will gain the supporting bombardment army ability in battle. This bombardment range is shown on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] when the Black Ark is selected.
Herdstones cannot be raised in existing Blood-grounds, and Blood-grounds cannot overlap.

The [[b]]Eternal War[[/b]] [[sl:campaign_unholy_manifestations]]Unholy Manifestation[[/sl]] can be used to summon an [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] that attacks the player, allowing the Bloodletting level to be preserved.
Only the [[sl:campaign_vampires]]Vampire Counts[[/sl]] of Sylvania may awaken Bloodlines.
{{tr:hp_campaign_point_5_chivalry}}
Once the requirements of a pledge are completed, the character is awarded the associated Vow’s benefits and the next one becomes available.
A settlement decreases in size when [[sl:campaign_post_battle_options]]sacked or occupied[[/sl]], losing a slot and the building within it.
The [[sl_tooltip:campaign_building_browser]]Building Browser[[/sl_tooltip]] may be opened to browse all constructable buildings at once.
Time in campaign advances in [[sl:campaign_turns]]turns[[/sl]]. Each faction takes its turn in sequence.
The [[sl:campaign_winds_of_magic]]Winds of Magic[[/sl]] blow across the map, affecting the availability of magic in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]].
Cathayan spellcasters gain strength when more than one is present in a battle at the same time.

Daemonic servants of Chaos are sensitive to the [[sl:campaign_winds_of_magic]]Winds of Magic[[/sl]]. Chaos [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] receive beneficial effects if their [[sl_tooltip:campaign_winds_of_magic_power_reserve_bar]]magic power reserves[[/sl_tooltip]] exceed a certain level. Conversely, daemonic armies cannot [[img:icon_replenishment]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_unit_replenishment]]replenish[[/sl]] if their power reserves drop too low.

Warriors of Chaos and Beastmen can spread [[img:icon_corruption_chs]][[/img]]Chaos Undivided corruption by [[sl:campaign_razing]]razing settlements[[/sl]] and erecting [[sl:campaign_chaos_artefacts]]Chaos Artefacts[[/sl]].

Slaaneshi factions can actively create Chaos Cults through [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_hero_actions]]Hero actions[[/sl]] or by spending [[sl:campaign_devotees]]Devotees[[/sl]] to [[sl_tooltip:campaign_proliferate_cults_button]]proliferate them[[/sl_tooltip]].

The army that enters the rift will appear in the [[sl:campaign_realm_of_chaos]]Realm of Chaos[[/sl]] on the following [[sl:campaign_turns]]turn[[/sl]]. Be sure to maintain additional forces to defend your home [[sl:campaign_provinces]]provinces[[/sl]] while that army is away.

A character may gain [[sl:campaign_banners_and_marks]]banners[[/sl]] and [[sl_tooltip:campaign_followers]]followers[[/sl_tooltip]] as they perform actions such as winning battles. Banners and followers are equipped as ancillaries on the [[sl:campaign_character_details_panel]]Character Details panel[[/sl]].

The [[sl_tooltip:campaign_character_details_panel_skills_button]]Skills tab[[/sl_tooltip]] shows the [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord or [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero's chosen [[sl:campaign_character_skills]]skills[[/sl]]. New skills may be selected here as the character gains in rank.

The [[img:icon_loyalty]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_loyalty]]loyalty[[/sl]] of a selected [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord that is not the [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] leader is also shown on the Character Info panel, if playing as the [[sl:campaign_dark_elves]]Dark Elves[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_skaven]]Skaven[[/sl]] or [[sl:campaign_vampire_coast]]Vampire Coast[[/sl]].
Armaments are received from assembly lines every turn and come at a running cost of Raw Materials. Both resources can be tracked via their icon's tooltip at the top of the main campaign interface.
The Bretonnian king will call an Errantry War as Bretonnian [[img:icon_chivalry]][[/img]]Chivalry increases, which must be won in order to achieve victory in the campaign.
Corruption will spread from settlement to settlement over [[sl:campaign_turns]]time[[/sl]].
As Daemonic Glory is accumulated, a Daemon Prince may ultimately [[sl:campaign_dedication]]Dedicate[[/sl]] themselves to the service of a particular Chaos God, or as an Undivided champion of all.
Initiating a Death Night also incites a [[sl:campaign_blood_voyage]]Blood Voyage[[/sl]], a murderous host that attacks Hellebron's enemies.
The territorial integrity of Ulthuan can be seen on the campaign interface when playing as Avelorn.

Slaaneshi [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] can also spend Devotees on [[sl:campaign_seductive_influence]]Seductive Influence[[/sl]] actions which [[img:icon_vassal]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_vassalage]]vassalise[[/sl]] humans or Elves.
Devotion may be lost by fighting with other Kislevite factions.

Diplomatic gifts can be given to foreign factions to attempt to improve relations. Unless broken, diplomatic agreements help to build trust. As such, [[img:icon_non-aggression_pact]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_non_aggression_pacts]]non-aggression pacts[[/sl]] can serve as the first step to building trust towards more profitable diplomatic agreements like [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_trade]]trade[[/sl]] or an [[img:icon_military_alliance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_alliances]]alliance[[/sl]].
Should another faction be making the proposal this shall be displayed on the central panel.

[[img:icon_dread]][[/img]]Dread can also be used to boost new Herdstones to a higher level when placed, increase building options available to new hordes, or to increase the recruit rank of new [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords and [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes.
Losing [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] will cause a loss of [[img:bullet_emp_mandate]][[/img]]Acclaim and reverse progress on the Emperor's Mandate bar.

The highest [[img:emp_hostility]][[/img]]Hostility level will also cause local enemies to gather and attack, but negative effects only last for five [[sl:campaign_turns]]turns[[/sl]] before [[img:emp_hostility]][[/img]]Hostility resets back to zero.

[[img:emp_prestige]][[/img]]Prestige can be spent to help dictate the outcome of political dilemmas that affect your [[img:emp_imperial_authority]][[/img]]Imperial Authority, or on [[img:emp_machinations]][[/img]]Electoral Machinations to manipulate [[sl:campaign_diplomacy]]diplomatic relationships[[/sl]] within the Empire.

Upon controlling all states of the Empire and having an [[img:emp_elector_counts]][[/img]]Elector Count in place, the Summon the Elector Counts button will become available to grant additional bonuses.
The [[sl:campaign_army_panel]]Army panel[[/sl]] shows information about a selected [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]].

[[img:icon_skaven_food]][[/img]]Food can also be used to purchase additional uses of the [[sl:campaign_the_menace_below]]Menace Below[[/sl]] on the [[sl:campaign_pre_battle_panel]]Pre-Battle panel[[/sl]].
Only Argwylon of the race of Wood Elves maintain a Gathering of the Ancients.

When this level of allegiance is reached, the chosen God will bestow an ultimate gift to aid the Norscan faction in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]]. This attracts the ire of the other three Gods, who will send champions to challenge them.
Once active, the duo will be available for a number of [[sl:campaign_turns]]turns[[/sl]] before heading off on a further adventure of their own.
Use of the [[sl:campaign_compass]]Compass[[/sl]] can result in higher growth rates in Fortress Gate settlements, enabling them to be developed more quickly.
All recipes have a [[img:icon_scrap]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_salvage]]Scrap[[/sl]] cost to cook and their effects will last for a limited number of [[sl:campaign_turns]]turns[[/sl]].
More [[sl:campaign_building_slots]]building slots[[/sl]] become available when a settlement is upgraded.
[[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes, like other [[sl:campaign_characters]]characters[[/sl]], will improve their skills as they perform successful actions.
Once all Hexes are obtained, a final cataclysmic Hex known as the [[i]]Malediction of Ruin[[/i]] is unlocked to unleash upon multiple targets, granting campaign victory.
High Elf factions can spend {{tr:icon_money}}[[sl:campaign_money]]{{tr:hp_campaign_money_term}}[[/sl]] to conduct [[sl:campaign_rites]]rites[[/sl]] to gain powerful bonuses.
The various training facilities within Athel Tamarha enable the upgrade of Mistwalker [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]] recruited from the Mistwalkers building chain.
Dragons not challenged to battle will always be encountered again later in the campaign, while Dragons which are challenged can be repeatedly brought to battle until defeated.

The [[img:icon_pop_surplus]][[/img]]population surplus cost of recruiting [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] are shown on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_raise_forces_panel]]Recruit Lord panel[[/sl_tooltip]].
The [[sl:campaign_warriors_of_chaos]]Warriors of Chaos[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_beastmen]]Beastmen[[/sl]] are hordes by default and cannot inhabit settlements.
Icons and tooltips on the Ivory Road panel provide information about the various risks that may arise along certain routes.
Khorne factions can summon a short-lived daemonic army or gain a large number of skulls when they [[sl:campaign_razing]]raze[[/sl]] a captured settlement.

Labour naturally diminishes in a province through death and desertion, with the amount lost increasing the lower the [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_public_order]]Control[[/sl]] level. Similarly, for every 100 Labour in a province, a -1 penalty is applied to Control.
The Rite of Primeval Glory spawns a Lizardmen army of Feral Bastiladons, Stegadons and Carnosaurs.

[[img:icon_lzd_nakai_favour]][[/img]]Favour earned through establishing settlements and constructing buildings can be spent purchasing and unlocking powerful [[sl:campaign_regiments_of_renown]]Regiments of Renown[[/sl]] through the Temples of the Old Ones panel.

At the start of the campaign, only the first tier of Sacrifices to Sotek will appear available. Higher-tier sacrifices can be unlocked by completing the requirements of the prophecy, outlined in the tooltip on the Prophecy of Sotek panel at the top of the main campaign interface.

[[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Legendary Lords do not die in battle; instead they become wounded and will convalesce over a number of [[sl:campaign_turns]]turns[[/sl]]. Once their convalescence period is over, the [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Legendary Lord may be appointed to the command of an army once again.
If the [[img:icon_loyalty]][[/img]]loyalty of a [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord is low then there is a chance that they will rebel if replaced as the commander of an army.

Magic items may be lost to other [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] if defeat is suffered in battle. Powerful magic items bound to a single character, such as those gained from [[sl:campaign_quests]]quests[[/sl]], may not be lost in battle or traded to other characters.
Killing targets marked for death is the main source of [[img:icon_influence]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_influence]]influence[[/sl]] for Nagarythe.

The numbers displayed above the faction crests on unrazed Blood-ground [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] indicates the amount of Devastation to be received from razing them. Razing higher level settlements earns more Devastation.

Hovering over any available Matters of State action reveals further details such as the type of target required and the action’s effects. Left-clicking an action then requires a target to be selected, if any, before confirmation.
A Pre-Battle Feast can be served out on the [[sl:campaign_pre_battle_panel]]Pre-Battle panel[[/sl]] to improve the fighting abilities of the Ogre army in the coming battle.
[[img:icon_supporters]][[/img]]Supporters are gained when settlements are captured.

[[img:icon_growth]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_growth]]Growth[[/sl]] in [[sl:campaign_provinces]]provinces[[/sl]] inhabited by Nurglish factions is directly affected by the amount of [[sl:campaign_chaos_corruption]]Nurgle Corruption[[/sl]] present.
Each camp also contains a garrison that automatically [[sl:campaign_raiding]]raids[[/sl]] the local area if in enemy territory and defends the camp in the event of attack.

Some Ogre [[sl:campaign_characters]]characters[[/sl]] can take on [[sl:campaign_big_names]]Big Names[[/sl]], granting them bonuses based on feats achieved during a [[sl:campaign_campaign_game]]campaign[[/sl]].
Bretonnian factions can suffer a reduction of {{tr:icon_income}}income if they recruit too many peasants into military service.
Only the pirate [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] of the [[sl:campaign_vampire_coast]]Vampire Coast[[/sl]] may collect Pieces of Eight.
A [[img:icon_cove]][[/img]]Pirate Cove is destroyed if the settlement containing it is [[sl:campaign_razing]]razed[[/sl]], or if another Vampire Coast faction establishes their own in its place.
Due to its high virulence, a [[img:icon_plague]][[/img]]plague will eventually run its course and expire over [[sl:campaign_turns]]time[[/sl]].

Plagues have a chance to pass between settlements, [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] or [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes, earning [[img:icon_infections]][[/img]]Infections with each new transmission. Plagues may be spread within the faction in which they originated as well as spread to other factions. [[sl:campaign_battles]]Battles[[/sl]] will always guarantee transmission.
Malus can instantly cede full possession to the Daemon via the button on the upper campaign interface, but can only do so every 40 [[sl:campaign_turns]]turns[[/sl]].
If the battle is being fought at a [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]] then [[sl:campaign_siege_warfare]]siege[[/sl]] options will be displayed.
If the battle is a siege then the [[sl:campaign_siege_panel]]Siege panel[[/sl]] is shown instead.
If a faction controls an entire province it can issue beneficial [[sl:campaign_commandments]]commandments[[/sl]] there.
More elite units than normal may be raised near to a famous [[img:icon_battle_site]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]] marker.

Each time Taurox achieves a Harsh Rampage (the first threshold), he unlocks the ability to sacrifice [[img:icon_momentum]][[/img]]Momentum to replenish his movement range points for the remainder of his current [[img:icon_rampage]][[/img]]Rampage via the button on his [[sl:campaign_character_info_panel]]Character Info panel[[/sl]].

[[sl:campaign_nurgle]]Nurgle's[[/sl]] domain is overrun with deadly blight that is swiftly fatal to those caught up in it. Only by visiting certain locations within Nurgle's domain can stages of immunity to the blight be progressively built up.
Control of resources makes it more likely that other factions will accept a [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]]trade agreement.
Ritual currency is not consumed when a ritual is conducted.
A ritual may be interrupted by capturing one of the ritual sites. Failed rituals may be attempted again after a short time.
The Rituals bar is only shown when playing the Eye of the Vortex campaign.
To be deleted

The pirates of the [[sl:campaign_vampire_coast]]Vampire Coast[[/sl]] ply the waves in their search for [[sl:campaign_treasure_maps]]Treasure Maps[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_pieces_of_eight]]Pieces of Eight[[/sl]] and verses of the [[sl:campaign_sea_shanties]]Lost Sea Shanty[[/sl]].
Suffering high levels of Slaanesh [[sl:campaign_chaos_corruption]]Chaos Corruption[[/sl]].
[[sl:campaign_wood_elves]]Wood Elf[[/sl]] factions may build [[sl:campaign_asrai_lookouts]]Asrai Lookouts[[/sl]] anywhere on the campaign map.
The [[sl:campaign_settlement_climates]]climate[[/sl]] of a settlement determines its suitability for occupation by a given [[sl:campaign_races]]race[[/sl]].

Carrying out Clan Contracts will affect your reputation with each of the Greater Clans, resulting in bonuses and penalties that include cheaper access to each clan’s specialised [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]].

The Siege panel may be exited by choosing whether to break the siege, continue the siege, or attack. The attack options will become active when siege weapons are built, or when another method of overcoming the fortifications is available.
{{tr:hp_campaign_siege_warfare_add_02}} The number of [[sl:campaign_turns]]turns[[/sl]] remaining before the garrison succumbs to attrition is shown on the Siege panel.
The [[sl:campaign_the_menace_below]]Menace Below[[/sl]] allows Skaven to summon additional units onto the battlefield during [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]].

The Flesh Laboratory can also be improved in various ways with several tiers of upgrades accessed via the appropriate tab. Laboratory upgrades are unlocked after claiming certain numbers of Growth Vat batches.
The Forbidden Workshop can be upgraded by completing the requirements outlined in the tooltip on the Workshop Level bar at the top of the panel.

All [[img:icon_under_empire]][[/img]]Under-City [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]] contribute to an overall [[img:icon_discoverability]][[/img]]Discoverability value which determines how likely the [[img:icon_under_empire]][[/img]]Under-City is to be discovered. The owner of the [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]] above may station a [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Hero[[/sl]] in the area or construct certain patrol buildings to increase the [[img:icon_discoverability]][[/img]]Discoverability of any [[img:icon_under_empire]][[/img]]Under-City below. Should the [[img:icon_discoverability]][[/img]]Discoverability threshold be crossed, the settlement owner will have the option to demolish the Under-City for an amount of [[sl:campaign_money]]{{tr:hp_campaign_money_term}}[[/sl]].
Surplus Skulls may be sent to the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_skull_throne]]Skull Throne[[/sl_tooltip]] to gain various campaign bonuses.

Uniquely amongst the followers of the Chaos Gods, followers of Slaanesh have the power to actively create Chaos Cults using [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_hero_actions]]Hero actions[[/sl]], due to the nature of temptation and its effects on mortal beings.
Having a large slave population will have a negative impact on [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_public_order]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}}[[/sl]].

March stance enables an army to move much further in a turn than it would otherwise be capable of, although it will not be able to attack. If an army is attacked while in March stance, its [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]] will enter the battle in a tired state and will be unable to fight as effectively.

Some [[sl:campaign_races]]races[[/sl]] can use the [[img:icon_tunnelling_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_underway]]Underway[[/sl]], [[img:icon_use_beastpaths_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_beast_paths]]beast-paths[[/sl]] or [[img:icon_use_beastpaths_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_worldroots]]Worldroots[[/sl]] to cross impassable areas.
When two or more Districts in a tier are completed, Seats in the next tier become available.
Only the [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords of the Vampire Coast may collect Treasure Maps.

Once the required [[sl:campaign_technology]]technology[[/sl]] is researched, Tzeentchian armies can use [[sl:campaign_teleport_stance]]Teleport stance[[/sl]], expending some of their [[sl:campaign_winds_of_magic]]Winds of Magic[[/sl]] reserves to traverse impassable [[sl:campaign_terrain_types]]terrain[[/sl]] without the risk of interception.

An army travelling through the [[img:icon_tunnelling_stance]][[/img]]Underway can be intercepted and brought to [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]] by an army above ground, even if that race cannot normally use the [[img:icon_tunnelling_stance]][[/img]]Underway.
The [[sl:campaign_unit_info_panel]]Unit Info panel[[/sl]] appears when the cursor is hovered over a Unit Card.

Units recruited from the global pool will be more expensive and take longer to train than those recruited locally. [[sl:campaign_dark_elves]]Dark Elf[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_vampires]]Vampire[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_hordes]]horde factions[[/sl]] cannot recruit globally.
[[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Heroes[[/sl]] appear in battle as units of one man.
Vampiric pirates can [[sl:campaign_raising_dead]]raise the dead[[/sl]], allowing them to quickly build massive armies.
A [[img:icon_vassal]][[/img]]vassal faction may break its vassalage agreement but this will lead to war with its former master.

A Waaagh! is completed when the target’s capital is razed or occupied within the time allotted. A faction that completes a Waaagh! will receive a trophy with beneficial effects that last until the next Waaagh! is completed.

This option is only available to factions in a full [[img:icon_military_alliance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_alliances]]military alliance[[/sl]] and to factions with [[img:icon_vassal]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_vassalage]]vassals[[/sl]], not to factions in a lesser [[img:icon_defensive_alliance]][[/img]]defensive alliance.
These effects, and the thresholds at which they apply, are shown on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_winds_of_magic_power_reserve_bar]]power reserve bar[[/sl_tooltip]] of a selected Chaos army.

Double-left-click a Trinket or drag it into a slot to begin an Incantation. Further slots can be unlocked via [[sl:campaign_technology]]technologies[[/sl]] to add more Trinket effects, increasing the potency of Incantations.
A variety of benefits may be gained by appointing [[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] of the Wood Elves to positions of [[sl:campaign_elven_council]]Office[[/sl]].

To assign an Aspect to a Tree Spirit unit, select its [[sl:campaign_unit_cards]]Unit card[[/sl]] on the [[sl:campaign_army_panel]]Army panel[[/sl]] and left-click on the Aspects button to view and select one.

Equipment can be upgraded twice before it becomes perfected, but it will never be as powerful as when it is reforged. Once the duration of a reforged item expires, it returns back to its previous power level before the reforge.

The Worldroots can be used to travel short distances through impassable [[sl:campaign_terrain_types]]terrain[[/sl]] with the [[img:icon_use_beastpaths_stance]][[/img]]Use Worldroots [[sl:campaign_stances]]army stance[[/sl]].
An [[img:icon_military_alliance]][[/img]]alliance will be broken if one party declines to join a conflict they would otherwise be compelled to enter.

A selected army may be garrisoned in a controlled settlement by right-clicking on it. The army will defend the settlement from attack alongside the [[sl:campaign_garrison_armies]]garrison army[[/sl]] that the settlement automatically provides. Garrisoning an army in this way also provides a boost to local [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_public_order]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}}[[/sl]].
{{tr:hp_campaign_point_6_sea}}
Armies can [[sl:campaign_armies_at_sea]]move over the sea[[/sl]] but must stop on the shore first, unless moving through a port.
Black Arks can directly attack port settlements head on, without the need of land-based supporting armies. They can also blockade enemy ports and reinforce a land army besieging a port settlement.

Battles are fought when armies wish to fight. [[sl:campaign_battles]]Battles[[/sl]] fought by the player's armies may be contested on the battlefield or [[sl:campaign_autoresolving]]auto-resolved[[/sl]].

Daemonic races may recruit Herald [[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]]. A Herald Lord can be replaced with a powerful [[sl:campaign_exalted_greater_daemons]]Exalted Greater Daemon[[/sl]] Lord when it achieves a sufficient [[sl:campaign_character_skills]]rank[[/sl]].

[[img:icon_corruption_chs]][[/img]]Chaos Undivided corruption applies positive effects to provinces held by a Chaos faction of any kind, but negative effects to territory held by any non-Chaos faction. The [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] of non-Chaos factions will suffer [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_attrition]]attritional casualties[[/sl]] in territory where [[img:icon_corruption_chs]][[/img]]Chaos Undivided corruption has taken hold.

Daemons within the [[sl:campaign_realm_of_chaos]]Realm of Chaos[[/sl]] can employ the rifts to cross into the mortal plane. The inhabitants of the physical world can therefore expect to come under attack from [[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]] incursions after Ursun roars.

[[sl_tooltip:campaign_followers]]Followers[[/sl_tooltip]] grant effects to the [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord or [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero to which they are assigned. Followers and banners can be traded between characters in the faction by dragging them to and from the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_global_item_pool]]Global Item pool[[/sl_tooltip]].
The [[sl_tooltip:campaign_character_details_panel_quests_button]]Quests tab[[/sl_tooltip]] lists [[sl:campaign_quests]]quests[[/sl]] available to the selected character.

[[sl:campaign_pleasurable_acts]]Pleasurable Acts[[/sl]] may be hosted on the [[sl:campaign_province_info_panel]]Province Info panel[[/sl]] which consume Devotees to gain [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]]-wide bonuses.

Factions in [[img:icon_military_alliance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_alliances]]alliances[[/sl]] build [[img:icon_allegiance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_allegiance]]allegiance[[/sl]] with one another, allowing them to [[sl:campaign_war_coordination]]co-ordinate their war efforts[[/sl]] and potentially build [[sl:campaign_outposts]]outposts[[/sl]] in each other's territory.

The Emperor will send [[img:emp_imperial_supply]][[/img]]Imperial Supplies from the Old World on a regular basis, the type and quality of reinforcements sent being derived by the current level of the Emperor's Mandate bar.
Gotrek & Felix will always return and become available to recruit again after a number of turns have passed.
Learn more about incentives for Khorne factions to raze territory [[sl:campaign_drawn_to_destruction]]here[[/sl]].
The Temples of the Old Ones panel can be accessed from the top of the campaign interface when playing as the Spirit of the Jungle [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]].
[[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Legendary Lords may still be eliminated from the game if their faction is destroyed.
Unwanted items in the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_global_item_pool]]Global Item pool[[/sl_tooltip]] may be salvaged for money, or magically fused to potentially form more powerful items.
Invocation of Dazh

Nurgle’s participation in [[sl:campaign_the_great_game]]The Great Game[[/sl]] can occasionally result in His Ascendancy, causing sporadic events that unlock more powerful [[sl:campaign_unholy_manifestations]]Unholy Manifestations[[/sl]] for His factions.

Other [[sl:campaign_races]]races[[/sl]] may also [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]recruit units[[/sl]] into an [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] positioned close to an Ogre Camp, provided that they are not at [[sl:campaign_war]]war[[/sl]] with the owner.
Only by gaining full or partial immunity against the blight can the Mansion of the Plague Lord, home to Nurgle's Gardener, be accessed.
[[sl:campaign_sea_lanes]]Sea Lanes[[/sl]] that link two points in the ocean may be used to cross vast distances in a short time.
Engaging in [[sl:campaign_diplomacy]]diplomacy[[/sl]] with a Slaaneshi faction.
{{tr:hp_campaign_point_5_siege_warfare}}
On completion of the requirements for each Forbidden Workshop Level, it will be upgraded to unlock new parts within all research tabs.

Left undetected, the Skaven can scheme within their [[img:icon_under_empire]][[/img]]Under-Cities in secret, eventually launching huge attacks upon the occupiers above by unleashing a Vermintide or, when playing as Clan Skryre, constructing a settlement-levelling Doomsphere.

Slaanesh’s participation in [[sl:campaign_the_great_game]]The Great Game[[/sl]] can occasionally result in His Ascendancy, causing sporadic events that unlock more powerful [[sl:campaign_unholy_manifestations]]Unholy Manifestations[[/sl]] for His factions.

Slave population can be culled in return for various bonuses and temporary effects via the Slave Diktats on a province’s [[sl_tooltip:campaign_province_info_panel_link]]Info Panel[[/sl_tooltip]] and sacrificial [[sl:campaign_rites]]rites[[/sl]].
Various [[sl:campaign_races]]races[[/sl]] have access to a stance that allows their army some form of instantaneous movement:

Tzeentch’s participation in [[sl:campaign_the_great_game]]The Great Game[[/sl]] can occasionally result in His Ascendancy, causing sporadic events that unlock more powerful [[sl:campaign_unholy_manifestations]]Unholy Manifestations[[/sl]] for His factions.

Recruiting switches the army into Mustering or [[img:icon_encamp_stance]][[/img]]Encamp stance. The army cannot move while in these [[sl:campaign_stances]]stances[[/sl]]. If these stances are unavailable then so is recruitment.

[[sl:campaign_money]]{{tr:hp_campaign_money_term_title}}[[/sl]] can be spent on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_war_coordination_outpost_tab]]Outpost tab[[/sl_tooltip]] to construct an [[sl:campaign_outposts]]outpost[[/sl]] in a [[sl:campaign_fortifications]]fortified settlement[[/sl]] belonging to an ally.
Adherents of Tzeentch, the great Changer of Ways, have the ability to [[sl:campaign_winds_of_magic_manipulation]]manipulate the Winds of Magic[[/sl]].

A faction may [[sl:campaign_raising_forces]]raise additional armies[[/sl]], although the process costs {{tr:icon_money}}[[sl:campaign_money]]{{tr:hp_campaign_money_term}}[[/sl]] and raises the running costs of all armies in the faction.
The [[sl:campaign_warriors_of_chaos]]Warriors of Chaos[[/sl]], the [[sl:campaign_norsca]]Norscans[[/sl]], and the [[sl:campaign_beastmen]]Beastmen[[/sl]] serve Chaos from within the mortal realm.
Place the mouse cursor over the various corruption icons on the [[sl:campaign_province_info_panel]]Province Info panel[[/sl]] to see the effects currently being applied.

Characters may gain [[sl_tooltip:campaign_character_traits]]traits[[/sl_tooltip]] as they perform actions in battle or campaign. A character's traits are listed in the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_character_details_panel_details_traits_and_effects]]Details, Traits & Effects[[/sl_tooltip]] section of the [[sl:campaign_character_details_panel]]Character Details panel[[/sl]].
Other tabs are shown for certain character types, such as for [[sl:campaign_ogre_kingdoms]]Ogres[[/sl]] that can gain [[sl:campaign_big_names]]Big Names[[/sl]].
[[sl:campaign_armies]]Armies[[/sl]], [[img:icon_raiding_stance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_raiding]]Raiding[[/sl]]

Factions of the same [[sl:campaign_races]]race[[/sl]] may [[sl:campaign_confederation]]confederate[[/sl]] if relations between them are very good. Confederation permanently joins the two factions under one banner.

A dilemma will present a number of options from which to choose when the Emperor sends his [[img:emp_imperial_supply]][[/img]]Imperial Supplies, giving you control over which reinforcements are received.

[[sl:campaign_armies]]Armies[[/sl]] that fight for Khorne benefit from increasingly powerful [[sl:campaign_bloodletting]]Bloodletting[[/sl]] effects and abilities as they achieve successive battle victories.
[[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Legendary Lords within the player’s faction may go on [[sl:campaign_quests]]Quests[[/sl]] when they reach a sufficient [[sl:campaign_character_skills]]rank[[/sl]].
[[img:icon_supporters]][[/img]]Supporters are gained when buildings are constructed.
Servants of Nurgle can spread [[sl:campaign_chaos_corruption]]Nurgle corruption[[/sl]] to aid their master's eternal struggle against His rivals.

[[sl:campaign_slaanesh]]Slaanesh[[/sl]] holds court in a sordid domain of hedonism and gluttony. Only by breaching each circle of seduction and renouncing the temptations offered may the Palace of Slaanesh, home to the Dark Prince's Courtesan, be reached.
{{tr:hp_campaign_seductive_influence_add_01}} Human, Elvish, and Beastmen factions are unable to see their own level of Seductive Influence.
Upgrades are permanent, applied across all applicable units, mounts, and [[img:icon_doomrocket]][[/img]]Doomrockets once unlocked.
Servants of Slaanesh can spread [[sl:campaign_chaos_corruption]]Slaanesh corruption[[/sl]] to aid their master's eternal struggle against His rivals.
The armies of [[sl:campaign_tzeentch]]Tzeentch[[/sl]] may [[sl:campaign_teleport_stance]]Teleport[[/sl]].
Servants of Tzeentch can spread [[sl:campaign_chaos_corruption]]Tzeentch corruption[[/sl]] to aid their master's eternal struggle against His rivals.

[[sl:campaign_nurgle]]Nurglish[[/sl]] factions do not recruit unit over time. Instead, their units are spawned immediately when recruited, albeit at low strength, and must [[sl:campaign_unit_replenishment]]replenish[[/sl]] to full capacity over [[sl:campaign_turns]]time[[/sl]].

Allies may occasionally issue requests of their own in the form of Ally [[sl:campaign_missions]]missions[[/sl]]. These may be viewed and accepted on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_war_coordination_ally_missions_tab]]Ally Missions tab[[/sl_tooltip]] of the War Co-ordination panel.

In the [[sl:campaign_realm_of_chaos]]Realm of Chaos[[/sl]], the Winds of Magic blow so fiercely that Storms of Magics occur. Extreme levels of magic are available within battles fought within the Realm of Chaos.

The influence of Chaos in a [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]] is measured as [[img:icon_corruption_chs]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_chaos_corruption]]Chaos corruption[[/sl]]. Multiple types of Chaos corruption are spread – one in favour of each Chaos God, as well as Chaos Undivided corruption which is spread by races not aligned to any particular God.

If a [[sl:campaign_revolts]]revolt[[/sl]] occurs in a province where any type of [[img:icon_corruption_chs]][[/img]]Chaos corruption is high then a Chaos uprising will occur. In this case the rebel army will be a powerful force of Chaos [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]].
Many traits have multiple levels which provide more pronounced effects. Higher levels of the same trait can be gained by repeatedly performing actions related to that trait.

Factions of certain races may take less powerful neighbours as [[img:icon_vassal]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_vassalage]]vassals[[/sl]]. In this arrangement the [[img:icon_vassal]][[/img]]vassal faction remains separate but is subservient to its master.

Khorne’s participation in the [[sl:campaign_the_great_game]]Great Game[[/sl]] can occasionally result in His Ascendancy, causing sporadic events that unlock more powerful [[sl:campaign_unholy_manifestations]]Unholy Manifestations[[/sl]] for His factions.
Invocation of Tor

The domain of the [[sl:campaign_tzeentch]]Changer of Ways[[/sl]] is a fractured and intricate labyrinth. Only by finding the way to the Impossible Fortress at the centre may Tzeentch's Librarian be challenged.

By increasing Seductive Influence with a human, Elvish, or Beastmen faction, Slaaneshi factions will progressively unlock various diplomatic treaties with that target that are ordinarily unavailable with non-Chaos factions, such as [[img:icon_non-aggression_pact]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_non_aggression_pacts]]non-aggression pacts[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_trade]]trade agreements[[/sl]].
Upgrades cannot be removed or refunded once unlocked.
[[sl:campaign_wood_elves]]Wood Elves[[/sl]] may traverse the world using [[sl:campaign_worldroots]]Worldroots[[/sl]].
Ally missions grant [[img:icon_allegiance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_allegiance]]allegiance[[/sl]] when completed.

[[sl:campaign_chaos_artefacts]]Chaos Artefacts[[/sl]] are left behind in settlements [[sl:campaign_razing]]razed[[/sl]] by followers of the Beastmen and Warriors of Chaos. These spread [[img:icon_corruption_chs]][[/img]]Chaos corruption to nearby settlements.
Some traits also have anti-traits, levels of which can be reached by performing opposing actions.
Servants of Khorne can spread [[sl:campaign_chaos_corruption]]Khorne corruption[[/sl]] to aid their master's eternal struggle against His rivals.
[[img:icon_supporters]][[/img]]Supporters are gained when battles are fought.

Should the Seductive Influence of a target faction reach the maximum level, that target may be [[img:icon_vassal]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_vassalage]]vassalised[[/sl]] by any Slaaneshi faction, at a cost in [[sl:campaign_devotees]]Devotees[[/sl]].

Each research tab for upgrading Doom-Flayers, Doomwheels, and Weapons Teams has a progression bar at the bottom. When an individual upgrade is researched, progress is added to the bar. As the bar fills up, powerful technological items are awarded which can be equipped to any [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord.
[[sl:campaign_beastmen]]Beastmen[[/sl]] may do likewise using [[sl:campaign_beast_paths]]Beast-paths[[/sl]].
Provinces are large land areas on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] containing up to four [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]].
Province capitals appear as the first settlement on the [[sl:campaign_province_overview_panel]]Province Overview panel[[/sl]] when selected.
The settlements within a province may be viewed on the [[sl:campaign_province_overview_panel]]Province Overview panel[[/sl]] that appears when a settlement is selected.
Learn more about {{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}} [[url:script_link_campaign_public_order]]here[[/url]].
control

[[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term_sentence_start}} in a [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]] is a measure of population happiness or repression, and must be [[sl:campaign_province_management]]kept in check[[/sl]] to prevent the province degenerating into [[sl:campaign_revolts]]rebellion[[/sl]].

[[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]Control is a measure of how much power you exert over your [[sl:campaign_provinces]]provinces[[/sl]], and must be [[sl:campaign_province_management]]kept in check[[/sl]] to prevent your enemies from [[sl:campaign_revolts]]invading[[/sl]].

[[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]Obedience in a [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]] is a measure of population happiness or repression, and must be [[sl:campaign_province_management]]kept in check[[/sl]] to prevent the province degenerating into [[sl:campaign_revolts]]rebellion[[/sl]].

Learn more about settlement trading [[url:script_link_campaign_region_trading]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about revolts [[url:script_link_campaign_revolts]]here[[/url]].
Rebellions
Incursions
Slaaneshi armies can spend [[sl:campaign_money]]favour[[/sl]] to Seduce enemy units on the [[sl:campaign_pre_battle_panel]]Pre-Battle panel[[/sl]].
Learn more about Seduction [[url:script_link_campaign_seduction]]here[[/url]].
The Seductive Influence level of a human, Elvish, or Beastmen faction can be seen on the [[sl:campaign_diplomacy_screen]]Diplomacy screen[[/sl]] when playing a Slaaneshi faction.
As any human, Elvish, or [[sl:campaign_beastmen]]Beastmen[[/sl]] faction interacts with the agents of the Dark Prince, the Seductive Influence of Slaanesh within that faction grows.
Learn more about Seductive Influence [[url:script_link_campaign_seductive_influence]]here[[/url]].
Siege weapons take labour force to build, the cost of which is shown on their card in the construction queue.
Click an available siege weapon card to enqueue its construction. Siege weapons may be constructed over multiple [[sl:campaign_turns]]turns[[/sl]] if required.
Siege Weapon Construction

The Attack and Auto-Resolve buttons will become active when [[sl:campaign_siege_weapons]]siege weapons[[/sl]] are built, or when another method of overcoming the [[sl:campaign_fortifications]]fortifications[[/sl]] becomes available.\\n\\nThe fortifications may be breached by siege weapons, artillery, monsters or giants, or by any unit if they have been sufficiently damaged in a previous attack.
Click the Break Siege button to lift the siege and retreat from the city.
Click the Continue Siege button to exit the Siege panel whilst maintaining the siege.
Maintaining Siege

{{tr:hp_campaign_siege_warfare_add_02}}\\n\\nThe number of [[sl:campaign_turns]]turns[[/sl]] remaining before the [[sl:campaign_garrison_armies]]garrison[[/sl]] succumbs to [[sl:campaign_attrition]]attrition[[/sl]] is shown here.
A besieged [[sl:campaign_garrison_armies]]garrison army[[/sl]] will take [[sl:campaign_attrition]]attritional casualties[[/sl]] every turn.
Defender Attrition

[[img:bullet_lzd_sanctum]][[/img]]Silent Sanctums are ancient, hidden outposts of enshrined power that exist in every region of the world. Created by the Old Ones during an earlier age, in the seven thousand years of Oxyotl’s absence they have been forgotten. Oxyotl alone has the knowledge and means to unlock them for restoration and use to benefit his nearby cohorts.

[[img:bullet_lzd_sanctum]][[/img]]Silent Sanctums can be unlocked in any visible [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]] regardless of ownership, appearing as a secondary set of buildings with upgradable features that benefit Oxyotl’s forces in surrounding regions.

Once a [[img:bullet_lzd_sanctum]][[/img]]Sanctum is unlocked, the button to the right of the building icons on the [[sl:campaign_province_overview_panel]]Province Overview panel[[/sl]] enables switching between viewing normal [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]] and Sanctum buildings.

Unlocking [[img:bullet_lzd_sanctum]][[/img]]Silent Sanctums requires collecting sets of eight [[img:sanctum_gem]][[/img]]Sanctum Gems, represented by the Ring of Gems displayed at the top of the main campaign interface. The number displayed inside the Ring of Gems indicates the number of unlockable Sanctums.

[[img:sanctum_gem]][[/img]]Sanctum Gems are primarily earnt by completing [[sl:campaign_oxyotl_visions]]Visions of the Old Ones[[/sl]] missions or investing in Oxyotl’s Ancient Knowledge [[sl:campaign_character_skills]]skill[[/sl]].

The Capstone of Tepok building enables the addition of a waypoint to use for travel via the Visions of the Old Ones map. However, only one can exist at any one time – constructing a new one will destroy an existing one.
Silent Sanctums

Slaves increase income but decrease [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_public_order]]{{tr:hp_campaign_public_order_term}}[[/sl]] in the provinces where they are distributed.
tax

[[sl:campaign_settlements]]Settlements[[/sl]] produce {{tr:icon_income}}[[sl:campaign_income]]income[[/sl]] for their rulers which is taxed in order to raise funds. The more settlements a [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] controls, the more {{tr:icon_money}}[[sl:campaign_money]]{{tr:hp_campaign_money_term}}[[/sl]] it receives through taxes.

[[sl:campaign_settlements]]Settlements[[/sl]] produce {{tr:icon_income}}[[sl:campaign_income]]income[[/sl]] from which funds may be extorted (or taxed). The more settlements a [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] controls, the more {{tr:icon_money}}[[sl:campaign_money]]money[[/sl]] it can extort.

Immortal Empires BETA

The desolate and unforgiving Badlands are so named for good reason. They are notorious for the numerous Greenskin tribes that prowl their wastes, not to mention the degenerate remnants of defeated warbands and droves of bandits, criminals, and worse. They are made even more inhospitable by the harsh and unforgiving landscape, littered with storm-tossed boulders and the rubble of long-dead empires. A traveller does not have to go far here before stumbling upon a ruin or a cairn… or an untimely and undoubtedly violent end!

Demarcated from the Empire by the towering Black Mountains, the Border Princes’ lands are ruled over by a loose association of fiefdoms and robber-barons. To this lawless place come those who are unhappy with the status quo overseen by the Emperor and his Elector Counts, leaving for a "better life" in the Borderlands. Often what is found, however, is a land more dangerous than their previous homes, where petty princelings war on each other, farmsteads are raided by marauding Greenskins or skittering ratmen, and bloodthirsty pirates from Sartosa come looking for plunder.

The vast, forbidding forests and frowning valleys of the Empire may be lacking in fair Bretonnia, but behind this safe facade, peril lurks. The sprawling lands between the dukes’ centres of power are home to all manner of predators, from wolves, through to Goblins, Orcs, Undead, and the like. Beyond the kingdom's borders the Elves of Athel Loren exist as an enigma to their neighbours; a fragile coexistence that, for now, aids the cause of all in these lands who stand against the ever-present threat from the Forces of Destruction.

A wonder of engineering and sorcery, the Great Bastion of Grand Cathay has endured throughout the Dragon Emperor’s reign, preserving his ancient civilisation against the horrors of the north. Yet it has not repelled every threat, for within the borders of this great military power lurk infiltrators and pillagers from distant lands, seeking to gain advantage from newfound footholds. There are those who wish to see this empire crumble, so they may profit from the pieces, but for the limitless Daemonic forces of Chaos, annihilation would suffice.

The wilderness of the south has few of the great cities seen elsewhere in Cathay, being more sparsely populated the further one travels from the Great Bastion. Yet despite being far from the constant dangers of the northern provinces, these idyllic landscapes still harbour much peril from within and without. From the elevated port-city of Shi-Wu in the east to the mazes of jungles and canyons that dominate the borderlands of Kuresh and Ind, these wild lands are home to undiscovered civilisations which are all but impossible to colonise.

About the Realm of Chaos, the borderlands of the mortal world form a ring of shadow that surrounds the ultimate darkness within. Contrary to the arcane creatures and powerful beings that lurk across this nightmarish landscape, the northern extremes are undoubtedly part of the material world, but inevitably tainted by their close proximity to the Realm of Chaos. Should one travel into the Wastes, they would find themselves labouring beneath a storm-shaken sky, continuing at their mortal peril. Words alone are incapable of describing that which lies beyond oblivion’s veil…

Beyond the waters of the far south lies a vast, unchartered landmass about which little is known and much is speculated. The stories differ from culture to culture – many of the Old World’s better-travelled seafarers say this blasted continent’s plains are visibly littered with the glowing debris of Morrslieb’s birth, while High Elf sailors warn that not even Amanar can protect those who stray too far south from the waters around the Fortress of Dawn. Whatever the truth may be, all heed the warnings pointedly inked onto many a sailor’s map: “HERE BE DAEMONS”!

It is for good reason that ships rarely stop along the southern coastlines that provide passage into the desolate Dark Lands. In the distance, past the roving bands of Orcs, Goblins, Ogres, and worse, black smoke can be seen spewing into the filthy sky, though one would be forgiven for thinking this is entirely volcanic in nature. The stench of tar pits and oil pools hangs heavily in the air, hinting at a malevolence that threatens to rise. Thralldom or death are the likely destinies of those ill-prepared to travel northward.

The Golden Age of the Dwarfs has passed, their hegemony over the realm-spanning World’s Edge Mountains now dwindled to a fraction of their former glory. Though a handful of their greatest Holds remain, others litter the slopes in ruin or serve as lairs for those seeking to hold sway over these lofty heights. Up here, only the most stubborn and resilient can persevere – be they Goblin, Skaven, Dawi, or otherwise – while beneath the slopes, echoes of conflict ring throughout the Underway in constant reminder that war is always close.

From the icy Sea of Claws in the north to the soaring Black Mountains in the south, the individuality of the Empire’s provinces is much defined by its landscape. Its vast forests provide food and the materials of production, while wide rivers and traversable valleys facilitate trade and transport. Yet at times, the land itself seems to strive against progress, concealing monsters and enemies of all sorts amongst its craggy passes and dark groves. Peril awaits within and without, but the nations of men have thus far proved equal to the challenge…

Like the Lizardmen whose magic brought them into being, the sentient mountain ranges that demarcate the Isthmus of Lustria from the Dark Elves stand in stoic defence against Naggaroth’s boundless hate. Throughout history, the relative safety of the Isthmus’ bays and inlets have attracted many explorers of the Old World and beyond, with many who have made landfall arriving with futile intentions to pillage Lustria’s temple-cities. Wiser are those who eschew conflict with the cold-blooded locals. Yet such visitors are rare, for few risk the perilous journey across the Great Ocean without a lust for fortune.

For eons, Lustria remained hidden from the outside world, but upon its discovery was quickly deemed to be one of the most hostile regions in the world. It is not just the prehistoric carnivores one needs to be wary of, but also the debilitating parasites, fist-sized insects and lethal florae. Such dangers have not stopped those who wish to plunder its ancient temple-cities, however, though only the hardiest avoid succumbing to the jungle before ever reaching them. To the native Lizardmen, Lustria is a haven – a bulwark against the disorder that has plagued the world since the coming of Chaos.

The Mountains of Mourn are where all Ogres always seek to eventually return, if only to boast to their more sedentary kin about their trails of destruction. It is a brutal domain known for its harsh climate and deadly inhabitants, where in the far north the Chaos Wastes play havoc with the landscape, mutating the local monsters and adding to the dangerous primeval fauna. From its craggy slopes can be seen a murky pall that hangs over the Dark Lands to the west, punctuated by distant glowering of orange flames of sinister origin.

The Land of Chill is a bleak and forbidding territory as unforgiving as the Dark Elves who have made it their home. Most in Naggaroth dwell in one of the heavily-fortified cities whose sinister pinnacles rise high into the storm-wracked sky, depraved places where murder lurks in every shadow and the weak are slain for the amusement of the strong. Throughout history, many foolish interlopers have taken on the Druchii on their own barren soil – more often than not, their dead bodies end up nourishing it.

Once fertile, populous and prosperous, the Land of the Dead has been ravaged by centuries of war and neglect. Here, the searing heat of the desert sun is the least of any wandering traveller’s worries, for the taint of Nagash’s Great Ritual still lingers from the distant past. In this ghost-haunted realm, countless unquiet spirits and elementals flit around great mortuary temples and dark tombs, their cries heard screaming in the wind. Yet still there are those who would brave this cursed place for causes both righteous and covetous.

With an ill-defined border, the north of Kislev is barely distinguishable from Troll Country and the tundra beyond. The threat from Norsca in the northwest is constant, for it is a land stalked by all manner of gruesome monsters and savage madmen, of infertile ground as hard as iron and howling winds that cut like daggers of purest cold. A network of fjords and mist-shrouded inlets wreathe the Norscan coast, and it is here that the Northmen tether the longships with which they terrorise the shores of the known world.

In the farthest southern reaches of the world, beyond the haunted tomb-cities of Nehekhara, is a land of unspoiled jungle and swamp once isolated from the world for uncounted centuries. More recently the Southlands has seen several of the world’s races sail to its shores, though few leave with anything other than tales of misery and death. Even for those who find a foothold far enough from the interests of the cold-blooded Lizardmen, this is a wilderness where invaders quickly become the invaded, and where hunters quickly become the prey.

An island paradise said to have been created especially for the High Elves, Ulthuan has unsurprisingly not been able to escape the attentions of the wider world. It is a place of incredible magic, where unthinkable power is harnessed and borne upon gentle winds, while the swirling Vortex at its heart inexorably draws in the surplus arcane energies of the world, preventing an all-out Daemonic incursion upon the mortal plane. Long has this place attracted the predations of others, be it the Old World’s primitive belligerents, or worse – the Daemonic hordes who prize Elven souls above all others.

Blood Host

No sooner has Malekith issued his commandment to Felicion than word reaches him that Naggarond is under attack. A treacherous band of Skaven and their Marauder allies have taken advantage of the discord wrought by the comet's appearance to strike at the Dark Elf heartland.\\nCursing the perfidious ratmen, Malekith gathers his retinue and hurries back to the shore to mete out their punishment in person.

Lord Mazdamundi is now fully roused and ready to enact his interpretation of the Great Plan. The spawnings are gathering at City of the Sun, for he senses a disturbance in the Geomantic Web surrounding Hexoatl, his capital. Communing telepathically with his fellow Slann, Mazdamundi learns of the invasion of his jungles by an army of tribal warmbloods.\\nThe warmbloods in question are worshippers of the Ancient Enemy from the colony of Skeggi, notorious savages that dwell on the shores of the Lustria. Incited by the appearance of the comet, the Norse have launched an invasion of the Lustrian interior.

Queek Headtaker, the scion of Clan Mors, emerges from under the City of Pillars. Dispatched by Grey Seer Vulscreek at the behest of the Council of Thirteen, Warlord Queek and his forces are sent to a nest-lair under the ruined city of Yuatek, deep in the Southlands.\\n\\nQueek's task is to garner as much precious Warpstone as possible and repel a nascent invasion of hated Elf-things. The High Elf incursion is surely linked with the comet's appearance. In any case, Queek is thirsty for blood, and Elven blood flows the richest of all!

Ever-watchful for a chance to strike at their mortal enemies, the hateful Dark Elves have taken advantage of the discord wrought by the comet's appearance to launch an invasion of Ulthuan, the divine home of the High Elves. Lothern, the High Elf capital city and seat of the Phoenix King, is gravely threatened.\\nCursing his brother's absence, and with the few forces at his disposal, Tyrion marches south to lead the counterattack.
