Your army is besieging a settlement. This panel shows you the progress of the siege.
This shows how many turns you must maintain your siege until the enemy garrison is destroyed.
This shows the amount of supplies the enemy has. They can use this to construct defences in battle.
Each piece of siege equipment costs labour to construct.
You can view your total labour here and how much you can spend per turn.
Once you've constructed some siege equipment, press this button to begin your assault.
This shows the settlement has walls. You will need to construct siege equipment before you can attack.
Gerik
This panel shows abilities she can use on the campaign map.
With her selected, right-click on an enemy target to use the associated ability.
She can also help out on the battlefield. With her selected, right-click on Yuri to add her to his army.
This shows your Allegiance, which represents the level of support this allied faction will give you. Allegiance will grow over time.
Missions from your ally will become available here. You can complete these to gain more Allegiance.
You can spend Allegiance to encourage your ally to attack an enemy's army or settlement. If the target is an army or settlement you own, your ally will try to defend it.
Here you can request to borrow an army from an ally for a short time.
Allegiance can also be spent on constructing an outpost in allied settlements. This allows you to recruit some of the ally's units.
You have unlocked end turn notifications. These show what's left to do.
Press the centre button to resolve an issue. Once all issues are resolved, the End Turn button will appear here.

Magical weapons, armour and other items may be won in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]] or gained by completing [[sl:campaign_missions]]missions[[/sl]]. [[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Heroes[[/sl]] can equip magical items and gain bonuses from them.

Followers might join [[sl:campaign_characters]]character[[/sl]] and banners may be won in [[sl:campaign_battles]]battle[[/sl]]. Followers provide bonuses in campaign, whereas banners carried by a [[sl:campaign_lords]]Lord[[/sl]] can be assigned to a [[sl:campaign_units]]unit[[/sl]], improving their performance in battle. Hover over the banners to see the nature of their effects.

[[img:icon_general]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_lords]]Lords[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_heroes]]Heroes[[/sl]] gain traits over time as they perform actions. Traits can give positive and negative effects. The sort of trait awarded will depend on how your character acts!
All campaign and battle effects provided by skills, traits, equipment and by other sources to this [[sl:campaign_characters]]character[[/sl]] are listed here.
You can organise your troops into groups, which means they can be controlled together.
Hold CTRL and click these three unit cards.
Now click this button to create a group. You can also press "G", or the group hotkey.
You can click this to select your group. Or, you can press the displayed hotkey.
After this tour, use this button to put your group into a formation. Groups will maintain formation when you move them.
This panel shows abilities the [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero can use on the campaign map.
With the [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero selected, right-click on an enemy target to use the associated ability.

[[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes can also help out on the battlefield. With the [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero selected, right-click on a general, like Yuri, to add them to the army. This will take up a unit slot.
This is the Diplomacy screen. Use it to arrange deals with other factions, or to declare war!
This displays the factions you have encountered. You encounter a faction by seeing one of their Lords or settlements.
It is important to know the strength of the faction you are dealing with. This shows the strength of a faction's armies compared to your own.
This shows what a faction thinks of you. The more friendly, the more likely it is that they will accept your deals.
Click on a faction, then click this button to start diplomacy. You can also double-click on a faction.
This is the Deals panel. Use it to make offers or demands of the selected faction.

Your options for deals are displayed here. The number above each deal represents the faction's opinion of it. If they hold a negative opinion, you will have to offer concessions to get them to accept. This could be some money.
Once you have selected a deal, a Balance Offer button will appear here. You can press this to automatically add the correct amount of concessions to balance out the deal.
Your Frost Maiden has access to powerful abilities or spells. Click her unit card to view them.

Once combat begins, press these buttons to cast spells. Once you have selected a spell, LEFT click onto the battlefield where the spell should be cast. Each spell costs power; your remaining power is displayed in the middle.
Your new building increases the amount of Income this settlement generates.
You can view your total Income here, next to your treasury.
Next turn, your treasury will increase by that income value. One way to increase your income is to create more buildings.
Your income is getting low. You can increase it by creating buildings that generate additional income. As a last resort, you can disband units to quickly restore your income balance.
You should equip your armour before heading north. Press this button to view more details about Yuri.
The armour and ancillaries Yuri has equipped are displayed here.
Your inventory is displayed here. Left-click the Kislevite Armour to equip it to Yuri.
Followers are a type of ancillary and must be equipped like items. Click here to view them.
Left-click your Orthodoxy Pastor to equip them.

Yuri's Hit Points were reduced to 0 in the last battle. Since Yuri is a Legendary Lord, he sustains a wound instead of dying. While Yuri is wounded, he is removed from the campaign map. Recruit Yuri again by pressing the Lord Recruitment button inside a settlement.
These are the Lords you can recruit. Yuri cannot be recruited again until his wounds are healed, which will take a few turns. Find Yuri and hover your cursor over his panel to check how long remains.
Your Lord died in the last battle. They have been removed from the campaign map and their army has been destroyed. You can recruit a new one through the Lord Recruitment button inside a settlement.
Your Lord's hit points were reduced to 0 in the last battle, meaning they can no longer lead an army.
You must select a new Lord to lead the army.

You can recruit new Lords from your settlements. Legendary Lords, like Yuri, will recover from their wounds in a few turns, meaning you can recruit them again; regular Lords are dead and so will be gone forever!
This is a list of available Lords that can be recruited right now.
Note the immediate cost you have to pay, and the upkeep you will need to pay every turn.
Find Ursun to win the campaign! \\n\\nShorter-term missions are listed here.
If you pin a mission by pressing [[img:icon_prologue_pin_mission]][[/img]], it will appear here. \\n\\nHover over the banner to see more information.
This bar shows how far Yuri can move. Once the bar is empty, Yuri cannot move any further. You can refill it by ending your turn.
This bar shows how far Yuri can move. It's currently empty, so Yuri cannot move any further. You can refill it by ending your turn.
The left side on the Pre-Battle panel shows the forces that will fight on your side in the coming battle.
The allied armies stationed within the [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]] will fight on your side in the coming battle.
The right side on the Pre-Battle panel shows the forces that will fight against you.
The Balance of Power bar indicates the relative strengths of the forces that will contest the coming battle.
The yellow section of the bar indicates the strength of your forces. The red section indicates the strength of the enemy.
Your enemy has stronger forces than you; this battle will be difficult.
Consider recruiting more units to your army before starting this battle.
If you want you can retreat and return once you're better prepared for the fray.
You have lost this quest battle. In order to progress the story, you'll need to secure a victory. Recruit additional, or better quality, units before trying again.

Recruitment options for the selected [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] are shown here. Units take one [[sl:campaign_turns]]turn[[/sl]] to recruit, during which the [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] must remain stationary.
Units may be added to the recruitment queue by left-clicking their [[sl:campaign_unit_cards]]unit cards[[/sl]].
Shown here is the cost of recruitment...
... and the upkeep cost of each unit.\\n\\nThe upkeep cost of a recruited unit must be paid each turn to maintain its combat readiness.
The number of [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]] that may be recruited in a single [[sl:campaign_turns]]turn[[/sl]] is shown here.
Your army can contain more units.
Consider recruiting before you travel further into the dangerous north.
Be mindful of your army's upkeep. The bigger the army, the more it costs to maintain each turn.
Press this button to recruit Regiments of Renown. These are special units you unlock by progressing through the prologue.
You can only recruit each Regiment of Renown once. Unlike normal units, these will recruit instantly.
Your opponent is close to another army on the campaign map. When a battle starts, nearby armies will join too.
This is a quest battle. In order to succeed you will have to defeat multiple armies.
You have another army close by on the campaign map. When a battle starts, nearby armies will join too. Note the area of influence seen by the circle surrounding the army.
At the start of the battle, only your opponent's main army will be deployed.
At the start of the battle, only your main army will be deployed.
Other armies join the battle after a set time, appearing at the edge of the battlefield. The location of the reinforcements is shown on the minimap.

Your unit is routing. This is shown by a white unit card and surrender flag at the top. You can no longer issue commands to this unit. There's a chance it could rally and return to battle, allowing you to command it again. Watch the unit card to view its current status.
The Province Overview panel shows the setup of [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]] within the selected [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]].
Building icons represent [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]] within a [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]]. The first icon represents the main settlement building.

Additional [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]] in a [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]] are constructed in building slots. More slots become available as the main settlement building is upgraded.
Additional information about the province is shown on the Province Info panel, which appears alongside the [[sl:campaign_province_overview_panel]]Province Overview panel[[/sl]].
You can view the buildings that can be constructed inside this settlement through the Building Browser.
Press this to recruit additional Lords. The Lord you recruit will appear beside the settlement.
Press the Garrison button to inspect the defending force guarding the settlement.
Each time a character increases in rank, they gain a skill point to spend. Unspent skill points are shown here.
Skills for this character are displayed here. Available skills are coloured.\\nDetails about an individual skill are shown on its cursor tooltip.

UNIT EXCHANGE\\n\\nWhen you recruit a Lord, they begin without an army. You transfer units from one Lord and give them to another. To do this, move your new Lord beside an existing one on the campaign map. Then, select one and right-click on the other. This will open the Unit Exchange panel.
This is the technology panel.
Hover over a technology to see what the effects are.
This shows how many turns it takes to research the technology.
The Army panel appears when an [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] is selected, and shows [[sl:campaign_unit_cards]]unit cards[[/sl]] and other information relating to that army.
The upkeep of this [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]], which is the amount it costs to maintain per [[sl:campaign_turns]]turn[[/sl]], is shown here.
This icon indicates that this [[sl:campaign_units]]unit[[/sl]] is replenishing its strength. Units that have taken damage will replenish in home territory.
You have completed your first victory condition! Click here to see what's left.
Complete the remaining objectives to finish the prologue.
Action points are replenished at the start of every turn. Use them for various tasks such as moving and fighting.
Press this button to display the advice again.
SELECT HERO\\n\\n[[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes can act on the campaign map or help in battle.
You can pause play with these buttons. While play is paused, you can carefully issue orders to your units.
The game is paused. You can continue by selecting a battle speed.
While on the campaign map, end your turn by left-clicking the End Turn button.
There is nothing more to do this turn. End the turn to complete the building in progress.
There is nothing more to do this turn. End the turn to complete the recruitment.
If you want to learn more about a panel then look out for this button. Press it now for a more in-depth explanation.
If you need help understanding something, press this information button. You can find it on most panels.
Now is a good time to raise a new army out of Dervingard. Go to the Recruit Lord panel and choose a worthy candidate.
Review your troops and the known enemy forces going into battle, as well as a general overview of the terrain and deployment you are about to fight on.
You cannot auto-resolve a quest battle. In the Prologue, these special battles advance the story and only a victory commanded by Yuri will do!
Now is a good time to raise a new army out of Dervingard. Go to the Recruit Lord panel and choose a worthy candidate.
Here you can review various useful in game effects regarding your settlements, from growth to income and the level of corruption.
On this panel you decide which buildings to construct. You can even demolish and repair damaged buildings from here.
You have sufficient population surplus to upgrade a settlement.
Upgrading a settlement opens additional construction slots, enabling you to purchase more buildings.
The number of turns until your next population surplus point is displayed here. You'll need these to upgrade your settlement again.
By skipping this battle, you will miss learning...\\n\\n– Basic unit control\\n\\n– Using missile units\\n\\n– Forming battle lines\\n\\n– Unit abilities
By skipping this battle, you will miss learning...\\n\\n– Deployment zones\\n\\n– Cavalry's role in battle\\n\\n– Terrain's role in battle\\n\\n– How to find more information about your units
Use this button to open the panel where you can recruit units for your army.
After this tour, click this to begin recruiting. It will take one turn.
This shows how many units can be recruited per turn. Currently, you can recruit 3 each turn.
This is the cost of recruiting the unit.
This is how much you must pay each turn to keep the unit.
This panel shows the number of units and their current vigour and battle readiness.
The maximum number of units your army can contain is displayed here.
Recruit additional units to make your army stronger.
Whenever you recruit new units, your army's upkeep will increase. This represents the amount of income you must pay each turn to support your army. The bigger the army, the more upkeep you must pay.

This displays the amount of income you receive each turn. Your army's upkeep is subtracted from this value. Make sure you generate enough income to fund all your expenses, not just your upkeep. You still need some for constructing new buildings and diplomacy.
AGENT\\n\\nYou now have a [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero. She can be embedded in your army by selecting her and right-clicking on Yuri or she can help on the campaign map.
You can now auto-resolve battles. If you're evenly matched, it is always better to fight the battle yourself!
You can now retreat from battles. This will disengage your army and move it away from the enemy.
You can now retreat from battles. This will disengage your army and move it away from the enemy.
You can always quick-save before a battle. You can re-load from the menu.
You can view your building options from the Building Browser.
This shows the level of your settlement.
Here are potential buildings you can construct. Once built, you may only upgrade them to the level of the settlement.
LORDS & HEROES\\n\\nYou can see the list of your characters by pressing this button.
DEMOLISH\\n\\nYou can now demolish buildings you no longer need. Afterwards, you can build something new.
DEMOLISH\\n\\nPress this button to demolish a building. It will take a turn to complete.
DIPLOMACY\\n\\nYou can now take diplomatic actions with factions you are not at war with.
This list displays the factions that you have encountered so far.
The higher the attitude, the more likely it is that they will accept your offer.
Press this button to start diplomacy with a selected leader.
Once you're done, press this button to exit the Diplomacy screen.
After you select a faction, their leader will appear here.
You have gained a global effect that gives you a diplomatic bonus with the Norscans. Hover your cursor over it to view the specifics.
Zorya is embedded in your army and will fight with you in battles.
Before ending turn you can see reminders about what is available to do.
GARRISON\\n\\nTo view a settlement's garrison, press this button.
Garrisoned units provide defence while a settlement is under siege. Upgrade a settlement's main building to improve the strength of its garrison.
LORD RECRUITMENT\\n\\nLord recruitment[[img:icon_lord]][[/img]] is now unlocked, go to the Lord Recruitment panel and choose who will serve. Note any traits they have and the cost to recruit them.
MISSIONS\\n\\nYou can remind yourself of your ongoing missions at any time by pressing this button.
POST BATTLE OPTIONS\\n\\nSelect what to do with the captives.
This panel displays information about your settlement.
This shows how much growth your settlement is generating per turn.
Once you have enough growth, you'll gain a population surplus. This is used to upgrade your settlement's main building, which unlocks more building slots.
You can generate growth by creating buildings. High growth leads to bigger settlements, which leads to bigger armies!
REGION MANAGEMENT\\n\\n Press this button to quickly access the settlements you own.
TREASURY\\n\\nThis shows your [[img:icon_treasury]][[/img]] treasury, which contains your accumulated wealth.
SKILLS\\n\\nLords gain experience points in battle. When they rank up, they gain a skill point. Click here to spend it.
This shows your available skill points.
This is a skill. Hover your cursor over it to see its effects.
Once you have unlocked a skill you will gain the ability to unlock the skill or group of skills beside it.
Some skills have multiple levels. To upgrade a skill's level, you must spend another point on it.
You have unlocked the ability to switch stances. A Lord's stance is displayed above them on the campaign map. Consider an enemy Lord's stance before engaging them in battle.
Most stances will restrict your movement range when you select them. Read the effects to decide the best time to switch.
TECHNOLOGY\\n\\nYou can now research a technology[[img:icon_tech]][[/img]]. Choose a technology to research. Once completed, the Technology Tree will open up other projects to research.
ITEMS\\n\\nThis blade wielded by the dreaded Wolf of Dervingard is yours. Click on Yuri in battle to find and use its ability.
RECRUITMENT\\n\\nYou can now recruit fresh units into your army. Open the Recruitment panel with this button.
After clicking on Yuri you can view his army.
Yuri

It can be affected by characters, either through the presence of [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes, or through skills and items. It can also be affected by buildings, commandments and events.||{{tr:click_to_open_hp}}

Characters with access to rune magic can cast powerful Rune abilities on the battlefield. After a character uses a Rune it will go on lengthy cooldown, and all other Rune abilities this character has access to will also go on a shorter shared cooldown. These Rune Magic cooldowns are tied to the character which cast them.\\nRunes also have a Master Rune overcast version; these are more powerful abilities but come with increased cooldown and a chance to miscast.

Discoverability indicates how close this Under-City is to being discovered by the settlement occupiers above. Most buildings in an Under-City increase Discoverability, and the settlement owner can also construct buildings or use [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes to help detect it. Once found, it will likely be demolished.

Discoverability indicates how close this Trickster Cult is to being discovered by the host settlement’s occupiers. Most buildings in a Trickster Cult increase Discoverability, and the settlement owner can also construct buildings or use [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes to help detect it. Once found, it will likely be demolished.

The more armies you field, the harder it becomes to maintain them all. As supply lines become more complex, gold and supplies will ‘go missing’ – your officials having little idea where they may have gone...

Athel Loren gives its energy to the Asrai as they grow. The stronger they become, the more power they draw from the forests. For every army you field, the more expensive it becomes to maintain them; drawing strength from Athel Loren comes with a price.

The more warbands you field, the harder it becomes to maintain them all. As supply lines become more complex, gold and supplies will ‘go missing’ – the chieftains having little idea where they may have gone...

As your realm grows, you will require the aid of other Lords whose loyalty may be tied more strongly to their Clans, or who may have ancient debts of blood and gold to pay. In either case, they will serve those interests before allegiance to the High King – although they would never admit to such a thing!
Da more Bosses dere are, da ‘arder it is to control dem all! Dey and dere boyz will nick da shiny stuff for demselves when yoo aren’t lookin’!

Dark Magic is unique – the greater its concentration, the more Dark Magic will be drawn to it. If the Winds of Dhar are shared between powerful Vampires and Necromancers, however, Dark Magic becomes more difficult to accumulate – their Undead legions requiring more energy to remain bound.

The God of Strength marshals his power, and so the city-states are restored to their former glory. The pyramids grow tall and desert fauna gathers at Geheb's howl.
The God of the Desert is invoked, and a mighty sandstorm blasts across the dunes to rid the Land of the Dead of trespassers both living and dead.
When invoking the Sun-God - the Creator-God - one of his builder-disciples will rise, and at the Tomb King’s command, fashion a city worthy of Khemri.
Once invoked, the God of Scholars reveals secrets even lost to the Mortuary Cult. Due to Tahoth’s summons, souls are called more freely from their realm.

Undead||[[b]][[col:white]]Undead[[/col]][[/b]] units cannot be [[img:icon_rout]][[/img]]routed, but take damage when their [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]]{{tr:morale}} is broken.\\n\\n[[b]][[col:white]]Undead[[/col]][[/b]] units also have:\\n[[img:bullet_point]][[/img]] [[img:icon_fear]][[/img]]Fear and [[img:icon_terror]][[/img]]Terror Immunity\\n\\n[[b]][[col:white]]Undead[[/col]][[/b]] units may also have their [[img:icon_hp]][[/img]]hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.

Undead||This unit is Undead (does not rout, immune to terror, becomes unstable when [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]]{{tr:morale}} is low). It will suffer from [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]]attrition when moving through territory not owned by the Undead.

An offering to the Queen of Vengeance cannot be any mere kill. It has to be a one sought through revenge - the wronged party achieving the retribution due. However, such acts will most likely glean Drakira’s attention.
The patron of seers and prophets. She is prayed to for clarity, prophecy, and foresight.
The Elven Goddess of Fate and Death. Within her rune pouch she holds the fate of all beings upon the mortal plane.
Stories speak of rivals, cursed to watch as this pirate’s spoils grow larger and theirs diminish. Such is the way of the sea, where larceny and death are the primary currencies.

Tales of crew who serve under Undead pirate captains state that they were press-ganged to remain under the sway of their admiral, not just for decades but forever. It is best, then, to embrace such fortune, for fate is rarely kind to deserters.

Legend has it that Harkon himself captured the Hellhammer which provided this brutal piece of artillery. They say Bess is cursed, or more rightly, those victims caught in her crosshairs are the real cursed ones.
It is said that when the dead come from the sea to stalk the land they are shrouded in fell mist, a thick, evil fog which gathers around the admiral commanding them.

Anath Raema is the sister of Khaine, and Goddess of the Savage Hunt. Through her, the Dark Elves are gifted the joy of the chase and of the kill. Anath Raema does not care who or what is hunted; every living creature is prey to the bloodthirsty goddess!
Once the noblest of the Empire's knightly orders, the Blood Dragons are a ferocious force in battle, with a bond far stronger than any living knights.
Cunning and deceptive, no other Vampires have infiltrated human society in the same way as the Lahmians' shadowy sisterhood.
Tainted and foul, the Necrarchs' physical corruption is transmuted into supreme magical power as soon as they enter the ranks of the Undead.
Vengeful monstrosities who dwell among cemetary graves, the broken-minded Strigoi embrace the primal force buried deep within us all.
Handsome, arrogant and charismatic, the von Carsteins are the true masters of men and beasts.

This stinking mortal Hold will fall, my masters have foreseen it. Bring them ruin!
In the end, the Lizardmen shall reclaim everything that obstructs their ancient, unrelenting will.
Nakai’s constancy, shored up by the appropriate liturgy of course, draws his reptilian kin to the Wanderer’s war banner.
Only the strongest among the already-mighty Kroxigor are fit to serve alongside the legendary, indefatigable protector of the Lizardmen.
For the Lizardmen, a time of renascence is now at hand, heralded by this powerful observance and the return of the Wanderer.
This sacred ordinance ensures that those Saurus standing alongside the Great White Lizard display the selfsame durability in the face of relentless assault.
Ruination
Regressor
Malus does not need Tz'arkan to work Dark Magic, and can use this rite to summon the beasts that dwell within Druchii territory to follow him into battle.
The Witch King's favour can be earned by presenting generous gifts; of course, those favoured are always rewarded... appropriately.
Not time to rest! No-no! Keep moving, not stopping!
There is always a time to act! That time is now! Let us move quick-fast and kill-kill!
The Lord of Blades: a fell name, but a tempting patron for duellists and warriors.
The Lady of Mists, the protector of the hidden, whose face is eternally hidden behind a silken shroud.
The looming silhouette of a mischievous Wyvern in flight is a bad omen wherever it appears, but a boon for any Waaagh!
The looming silhouette of a mischievous Wyvern in flight is a bad omen wherever it appears, but a boon for any Beastmaster!
The balance of power between the opposing forces is shown here. The bar updates throughout the battle.
A battle is completed when all [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] on one side are routed or killed.
Icons above the Unit card indicate a special status for the unit, such as being hidden from the enemy.
Place the mouse cursor over the timer to see who wins when the time runs out.
If a unit carries ammunition, the amount remaining is shown here.
A unit's experience is indicated by chevrons on its unit card. More experienced units perform better in battle.
A unit's remaining health is shown at the top of its unit card.
A unit's card will flash white if it begins to waver from the fight.
A selected [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] can be ordered to attack an enemy army or [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]] by right-clicking on it.
Attacking
This button opens the Character Details panel on the Details tab, showing a breakdown of information about the selected character.
General information about the selected character is shown here.
General information about the selected character is shown here.\\nArmy Upkeep shows how much this Lord's army costs per-turn to maintain.
Characters within this faction may be disloyal. Their loyalty is displayed here. Disloyal characters may split away from their host faction, taking any armed forces they command with them.
This button opens the Character Details panel on the Skills tab, showing the selected character's skills. The number and colourisation indicates their current skillset.

Followers may join your character and banners may be won in battle. Followers provide bonuses in campaign, whereas banners carried by a Lord may be assigned to that Lord's units to improve their performance in battle.

Each [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord or [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Hero may be joined by up to six followers and banners. Certain followers may only join [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords or [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes, and banners may only be equipped by [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords.
Unused followers and banners may be assigned to other characters.
A prediction of funds to be received after the turn is ended is shown here.
Predicted Income
Magic items are obtained through a variety of successful actions, and may be equipped by your [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords and [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes to improve their performance.

Magic items obtained by a character are assigned automatically if no item is already assigned to that slot. Magic items that are not assigned to a character may be assigned to others within the faction.
Legendary Lords may win unique items through quest chains. These are automatically equipped and cannot be passed to other characters.

Siege weapons require manpower to build, which is provided by the troops of the besieging army. More troops means more available manpower.\\n\\nThe manpower available per-turn and the total available manpower are shown here.
The coloured area surrounding a selected army shows how far it can move this turn.

These icons represent buildings within the settlements in the province.\\n\\nThe first icon within each settlement represents the settlement building, upgrades to which affect the settlement as a whole.
The owner of each settlement is indicated by their faction icon here.
The owner of each settlement is indicated by their faction icon here.\\n\\nThe ruin icon indicates that this settlement has no owner.
All settlements within the province are shown on the Province Overview panel, whether they are controlled or not.
The capital city of the province is shown to the left of the Province Overview panel.\\n\\nThe capital can support more buildings and is fortified, making it harder to capture.

The Attack and Auto-Resolve buttons will become active when [[sl:campaign_siege_weapons]]siege weapons[[/sl]] are built, or when another method of overcoming the [[sl:campaign_fortifications]]fortifications[[/sl]] becomes available.\\n\\nThe fortifications may be breached by siege weapons, artillery, monsters or giants, or by any unit if they have been sufficiently damaged in a previous attack.
Click the Break Siege button to lift the siege and retreat from the city.
Click the Continue Siege button to exit the Siege panel whilst maintaining the siege.
Siege panel\\nThe Siege panel is displayed when a settlement is placed under siege, showing options and, if the settlement is fortified, allowing siege weapons to be built prior to battle.
Available Siege engines and their cost in manpower are displayed here. Siege weapons may be built over multiple turns if required.\\n\\nLeft-click to add them to the construction queue.
Each time a character increases in rank, they gain a skill point to spend. Unspent skill points are shown here.
Skills for this character are displayed here, with available skills shown in colour.\\nDetails about an individual skill are shown on its cursor tooltip.
The defenders of a besieged settlement will begin to take attritional casualties after a number of turns, indicated here.
The defenders will eventually starve and surrender unless they sally out or are relieved by a reinforcing army. The turns remaining before this happens is indicated here.
[[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords and [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes gain traits over time as they perform actions. Traits cannot be swapped or removed and can be positive or negative.
Funds currently available are shown here.
Treasury
Your army's zone of control is shown here.\\n\\nPlace the mouse cursor over an army or settlement to see the zone of control it exerts.
[[col:yellow]]Increases the [[img:icon_discoverability]][[/img]]Discoverability of Skaven Under-Cities in the local region by {{tr:wh2_main_agent_action_discover_under_empire_value}}.[[/col]]
[[col:yellow]]Increases the [[img:icon_discoverability]][[/img]]Discoverability of rival Under-Cities in the local region by {{tr:wh2_main_agent_action_discover_under_empire_value}}.[[/col]]

Victory! In a world of Chaos, a time of heroes - an age of war - you have overcome every challenge laid before you and faced down every foe bent upon your destruction. This strange and dangerous realm, riven with battle, bloodshed and slaughter, twisted beyond sanity by the warping power of Chaos, has seen the foundering of many a mighty empire, yet yours remains triumphant and unconquered, victorious in defiance of all!

In cities under your control across the world, citizens throng the streets to greet the dawning of a new age. Burghers, merchants, veterans, masters and apprentices, all raise their voices as one in a joyful shout of acclamation "For the Emperor! For Sigmar! For the Heldenhammer!"

Ptra is pleased, for the desert gods have returned and are a force in the world once again. Nehekhara is resurgent – the greatest of all civilisations returns to prominence and domination. The mightiest kings and queens sit upon thrones of bone and look down upon the living with jealous contempt. Now, the Realm of Souls splits asunder and the Day of Awakening is at hand!
Yet your empire is not bound by borders - yours spans the seas of the world. You top a hierarchy of infamy and power - your strength makes all those who traverse your waves tremble in fear.

For thousands of years, the Dark Elves have plundered the riches of the world, using the blood and treasure of distant lands to fuel their war against the High Elves and others. Millions groan under the yoke of their slavery, or choke out their last on the altars of the Bloody-handed God. Under your dominion, the empire of malice reigns supreme!

The High Elves have stood guard over this world for millennia, defending it from the worshippers of unholy gods and the unthinking meddling of lesser races. Now, under your stewardship, the Glittering Hosts have beaten these foes into retreat or oblivion. An age of peace dawns, founded on the glory of the Elves!

Long before the rise of the younger races, the Lizardmen ruled supreme. After countless disasters and aeons of decline you have led them to the brink of success, finally enacting the unfinished plans of their long-lost cosmic masters!

The warped history of the corrupted Skaven race lists their many attempts to overthrow and enslave the other civilisations under the iron claw of Skaven rule. Now, under your control, the verminous hordes seethe openly across the face of the world, chittering their triumph in praise of the Great Horned Rat!

Yet what is talk of empires to the destroyer of all civilisations? Let the shattered cities smoulder to ash, let briar and thorn reclaim their tumbled stones and bleached bones. Your warherds roam lands returned to their primal roots, braying a triumphant challenge to storm-wracked skies!

Yet your empire is not built from stones piled one upon another, on trade rooted in the sack of the land. Rather, it is the oldest empire of all; that of root and branch, leaf and bough. Its mighty hosts stretch unbroken from shore to shore once more, their deep roots anchoring the land, their song of triumph the whisper of leaves stirring in the breeze.

The men and monsters of the north have long sought to overthrow the civilisations of the south, but have always been thrown back to their frozen wastelands. But no more! Now, under your control, the Norscan hordes have been unleashed upon the Old World. The Chaos Gods gaze admiringly falls upon the leader of this cataclysmic event: you!

That which is sacrosanct has been preserved. That which is sublime has been protected. That which threatened has been destroyed. Your name and deeds of heroism will be remembered always. For Bretonnia, and for the Lady!

Yet your empire is not one of petty territory, rather it is an empire of blood and Chaos, where mighty champions rise and fall, striving ceaselessly against each other for the favour of the Dark Gods. And at their pinnacle you stand, mighty and unvanquished, Lord of All, and most favoured by the Gods of Chaos!

In Karaks reclaimed according to the oaths laid down in the Great Book of Grudges, and in countless other mining colonies, trading posts, villages and great cities across the world, your people throng the halls in celebration, and many a horn of ale is raised on high to join the drinking songs and the fierce voices crying "Vengeance is ours!"

Whilst other races have shown nothing but weakness, wasting their time on nonsense such as honour and duty, the Greenskins have followed their nature, given to them by Gork (and Mork), striving against each other until none but the mightiest remain to engulf the world in an endless Waaagh!

Under your command, legions of the living have been relieved of the burden of life's struggle, and raised again into your eternal service. Those still permitted to cling to the misery of life are now as cattle, prey to the depraved hunger of your numberless dark servants, whose triumphant shrieks pierce the eternal night!

The High Elves have enacted their final ritual. Their feeble Phoenix King will once again own the Vortex, and their kingdoms shall be shielded by that traitor, Caledor Dragontamer! If you are to bring about the absolute destruction of the Asur and their homeland, then the invasion of the Isle of the Dead must begin! You must immediately muster on the cursed shores of the island that anchors the Vortex, make temporary alliances with your enemies, and stop the High Elves from claiming victory!

The Lizardmen have enacted their final ritual. Their cold-blooded armies arrive on the Isle of the Dead to claim the Great Vortex - the prize that is rightfully yours. You must immediately muster on the cursed shores of the island that anchors the Vortex, make temporary alliances with your most bitter of enemies, and stop the Lizardmen from claiming victory!

The Skaven have enacted their final ritual. The hordes of Queek Headtaker swarm onto the Isle of the Dead where they will attempt to take control of the Great Vortex. The vermin think to rob us of our vengeance and to claim the Vortex before you. They must be purged from hated Ulthuan. You must immediately muster on the cursed shores of the island that anchors the Vortex, make temporary alliances with your most bitter of enemies, and stop the Skaven from claiming victory!

The goblet brims with the lifeforce of victims claimed by your sorcerous vassal and her assassin. Now is the time to move on hated Ulthuan and claim the power of the Vortex! The other races sense the peril and converge to stop you! Yet the vermin have been enacting their own devious, world-shattering plot. Under the shackles of the Council of Thirteen, the Grey Seer Clan fight for dominance of the Vortex. Using power stolen from all the rituals enacted thus far, they plan to transform the Vortex into a portal and summon forth their Horned God from the Realm of Decay. The Vortex is your tool for ultimate vengeance; the Skaven must be stopped - prepare for the ultimate battle!

The greatest of all fears has come true, the Druchii have enacted their final ritual. The legions of the Witch King defile Ulthuan’s heart. Malekith intends to step into the Vortex and claim its power, which will surely mean the end of the Asur! You must immediately muster on the cursed shores of the island that anchors the Vortex, make temporary alliances with your most bitter of enemies, and stop the Dark Elves from claiming victory!

The Lizardmen have enacted their final ritual. The cohorts of Lord Mazdamundi have invaded Ulthuan – they wish to control the Vortex, a creation of the Asur! Their goals are not the same as ours; the ancient Mage-Priest could easily decide to sink Ulthuan beneath the sea in order to permanently safeguard the Vortex. It has to be returned into the care of the High Elves. You must immediately muster on the cursed shores of the island that anchors the Vortex, make temporary alliances with your most bitter of enemies, and stop the Lizardmen from claiming victory!

The Skaven have enacted their final ritual. The hordes of Queek Headtaker swarm onto the Isle of the Dead where they will attempt to take control of the Great Vortex. That they befoul the heart of Ulthuan is crime enough, but should the vermin take control of the Vortex, it will surely mean doom for the world. You must immediately muster on the cursed shores of the island that anchors the Vortex, make temporary alliances with your most bitter of enemies, and stop the Skaven from claiming victory!

At the very heart of Ulthuan, upon the Isle of the Dead, the greatest of all battles must be fought. Enemies from many realms gather, ready for war. Under the shackles of the Council of Thirteen, the Grey Seer Clan fight for dominance of the Vortex. Using power stolen from all the rituals enacted thus far, they plan to transform the Vortex into a portal and summon forth their Horned God from the Realm of Decay. The Star Crown is now re-forged and so the Vortex can be saved, but first the Skaven must be stopped - prepare for the ultimate battle!

The Dark Elves have enacted their final ritual. These lost servants have long since forgotten their original purpose and consort with Daemon-spawn. Their first generation marches on the Vortex, and will consume its power. This has been foreseen in the lost plaques of Tlanxla and it cannot be allowed. You must immediately muster on the cursed shores of the island that anchors the Vortex, make temporary alliances with your most bitter of enemies, and stop the Dark Elves from claiming victory!

The High Elves have enacted their final ritual. They have proven inadequate caretakers of the Great Vortex. It is time to merge the Great Warding and the Vortex once and for all, safeguarding the world for eternity. The Elf-spawn are too young, proud and self-assured to allow this. They shall be chastised for their own good and that of all creation. You must immediately muster on the cursed shores of the island that anchors the Vortex, make temporary alliances with your most bitter of enemies, and stop the High Elves from claiming victory!

The Skaven have enacted their final ritual. The hordes of Queek Headtaker swarm onto the Isle of the Dead where they will attempt to take control of the Great Vortex. The Rat-spawn are abominations that should never have existed in the first place – that they now come in reach of the Great Vortex is the greatest of all crimes against the Old Ones. You must immediately muster on the cursed shores of the island that anchors the Vortex, make temporary alliances with your enemies, and stop the Skaven from claiming victory!

The Great Warding is bolstered and the Geomantic energies flow once more. Our many enemies sense their plans are in jeopardy and gather to stop you, but your attention must turn to the Rat-spawn that defile the Isle of the Dead at the centre of Ulthuan. Under the shackles of the Council of Thirteen, the Grey Seer Clan fight for dominance of the Vortex. Using power stolen from all the rituals enacted thus far, they plan to transform the Vortex into a portal and summon forth their Horned God from the Realm of Decay. The Rat-spawn must be purged and the Vortex restored. This is the will of the Old Ones - prepare for the ultimate battle!

The Dark Elves have enacted their final ritual. Victory is in their grasp, and failure is in yours! If the Witch King-thing takes the Vortex, the Lords of Decay will blame you! You have to thwart the nasty Elves before it is too late… or at least until another candidate can be found to blame. You must immediately muster on the cursed shores of the island that anchors the Vortex, make temporary alliances with your most bitter of enemies, and stop the Elf-things from claiming victory!

The High Elves have enacted their final ritual. Soon they will reclaim the Vortex. Failure of the great scheme is imminent. The Lords of Decay will blame you! You have to thwart the Elf-things before it is too late… or at least until another candidate can be found to blame. You must immediately muster on the cursed shores of the island that anchors the Vortex, make temporary alliances with your most bitter of enemies, and stop the Elf-things from claiming victory!

The Lizardmen have enacted their final ritual. The nasty Toad-thing has transported his cohorts onto the dead isle - the Vortex is all but theirs. Failure of the great scheme is imminent! The Lords of Decay will blame you! You have to thwart the Reptile-things before it is too late… or at least until another candidate can be found to blame. You must immediately muster on the cursed shores of the island that anchors the Vortex, make temporary alliances with your most bitter of enemies, and stop the Lizard-things from claiming victory!

The Machine of Doom and Curses is ready! The Grey Seer Clan and their masters on the Council of Thirteen tried to betray you… but now, thanks to the scribe’s wrath, it is the Grey Seer’s blood imprinted on the unholy bell’s Warpstone clapper! And so the Grey Seer Clan shall be sacrificed - consumed by the Horned Rat on His arrival. Upon the Isle of the Dead, in the heart of hated Ulthuan, the machine begins its work - turning the Vortex into a portal from which your god shall emerge. The other races sense the peril and converge to stop you. Above all, the Grey Seers send their minions - desperate to halt the Great Ascendancy. The unholy bell must toll thirteen times - prepare for the ultimate battle!
Those sacrificed to the Lady of Desire go willingly to their deaths. Such appeasement enthrals the masses.
The Mistress of Magic is very choosy about who is sacrificed to her - only those touched by sorcery may be offered. In return, she brings the Winds of Magic.
The victims of Khaine cannot go meekly to His halls; it must be bloody-handed murder. But once the blood is flowing from whence will it stop?
The slaves are brought to the altar of Mathlann, Lord of the Deeps; their sacrifice ensures the seas are for the Druchii alone.
The Creator, greatest upon the Mandala; his name alone can calm princes, tame courts and embolden all.
Lord of Wisdom, God of Learning and Sorcery. Those who invoke him gain precious insight and may divine the Winds of Magic.
The Mother Goddess, purity is her virtue. The tears she weeps for her children can cleanse the land of any taint.
The Maker, patron of Elven smiths. Items bearing his mark are the greatest of their kind.
Send an intervention force of low quality units to target the ritual sites.
Send an intervention force of medium quality units to target the ritual sites.
Send an intervention force of high quality units to target the ritual sites.
Awakening a Mage-Priest from his contemplation must not be done lightly, but those that are roused add their unfathomable power to the great purpose.
An ancient observance that invigorates those reptiles who oppose trespassers, intruders and servants of the Ancient Enemy.
The Slann summon the fauna of Lustria; the feral beasts of the jungle shall answer.
Invoking the Serpent-God makes the jungles themselves turn against the intruders and interlopers who dare invade His realm.
Provoke the brood-mothers, have them breed-breed! We will flood the over-world with our bodies! Yes-Yes!
Yes-yes, a scheme of great DOOOOM! Send an agent of Skryre to cause great calamity on the things!
Good-good! Further agenda of Arch Plaguelord Nurglitch, summon his agent-minion and let-let the choicest of plagues ravage the world.
The Lords of Decay have spoken! We-we invoke their scheme - the Thirteenth Plot - all Skavendom must unite against things!
This settlement can be colonised.
Low-ranked Beastmasters are always keen to prove themselves to the Beastlord, doing his bidding in the hope that they may ascend their standing within his cadre.
Blessings
You can choose to see Lords and Heroes from different camera angles and speed up their animations.

By default, you will see every Lord and Hero moving around the map. Use these settings to pick which factions, Lords and Heroes you want to focus on. This can hasten and optimise the end turn sequence.
You can decide how much cargo the Caravan should take west. The more cargo, the greater the reward you will receive if it reaches its destination.
After choosing your initial route, click the Dispatch button to send the Caravan and return to the campaign map. Remember to return and check on the progress of your Caravans.
The Ivory Road

This panel displays your Caravans. They can be sent along the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_ivory_road_panel]]Ivory Road[[/sl_tooltip]] from Cathay to the west. If a Caravan reaches its destination, you will receive a large reward.
Use these buttons to apply the settings to entire categories.
{{tr:hp_campaign_description_changing_of_the_ways}}\\n\\nClick here to open the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_changing_of_the_ways_panel]]Changing of the Ways panel[[/sl_tooltip]].
Changing of the Ways
Curses

A [[sl:campaign_daemons_of_chaos]]Daemon Prince[[/sl]] can gain potent new abilities and alter their appearance by equipping [[sl:campaign_daemonic_gifts]]Daemonic Gift[[/sl]] body parts.\\n\\nClick here to open the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_daemonic_glory_panel]]Daemonic Glory panel[[/sl_tooltip]].
Daemon Prince Customisation
Access the Wu Xing Compass to view the Jade Court’s expanded array of options and their potential benefits for Cathay.

To activate a different set of compass effects, click on any unlocked compass direction.\\n\\nThe four directions native to Grand Cathay are already available from the start. Once unlocked, the Jade Court’s unique directions can be activated here in the same way.

As the Administrator of the Realm, Yuan Bo is able to harness the full potential of the Wu Xing Compass by unlocking four unique and powerful compass directions.\\n\\nTo unlock them, Astromantic Relay buildings must be constructed in specific settlements.\\n\\nLeft-clicking the icons at the top of the screen pans the camera to the required settlements' locations. The tooltips provide information about each direction’s effects.

An overview of the current energy reserves for all compass directions can be found here.\\n\\nAs with the standard Wu Xing Compass, channeling the Winds for a chosen direction increases its reserves and in turn its granted bonuses – but over time the reserve of other directions will decay.
End Turn Camera
During the end turn sequence, you can pause the game by pressing this button.
Alternatively, you can press this to make the end turn sequence as fast as possible. If you do this, no movement will be tracked.

A new form has been obtained by the Changeling!\\n\\nThe Formless Horror feature allows the Changeling to shapeshift into other Legendary Lords and Heroes in battle. Left-click on the Formless Horror button to learn more.

Obtained forms are listed here, viewable by race and sortable by unit statistic.\\n\\nHovering over or left-clicking any form displays its details such as unit statistics, abilities and spells. Left-click any form to learn more.
Formless Horror
The Changeling can only assume one chosen form at a time for use in battle. After selecting the desired form from the list, confirm your choice here.
A forbidden Hex has just been learned!\\n\\n{{tr:hp_campaign_point_1_hexes}}\\n\\n{{tr:hp_campaign_point_4_hexes}}
{{tr:hp_campaign_point_3_hexes}}\\n\\n{{tr:hp_campaign_point_5_hexes}}
[[i]]Purification Chant[[/i]] is now available.\\n\\nThis Hex targets a settlement belonging to you and instantly purges any corruption.\\n\\n{{tr:hp_campaign_point_2_hexes}}
Now that a Blessing is available, you can drag and drop it onto one of your units here in the pre-battle screen to bestow its effects in battle.
Curses that can debilitate your enemies will appear here once created in the Witch's Hut. Drag and drop a Curse onto an enemy to afflict them during the battle.
The Caravans you can dispatch are displayed here. You can see its level and the number of [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]] that will protect it.
Hovering over any available Matters of State action reveals further details such as the type of target required and the action’s effects.
{{tr:hp_campaign_point_4_matters_of_state}}
{{tr:hp_campaign_description_matters_of_state}}
Once you perform the action, the resource requirement will be expended and added to the other in a pending state until it becomes usable again.

{{tr:hp_campaign_point_1_matters_of_state}}\\n\\nWhen a [[img:icon_mos_steel]][[/img]]Steel or [[img:icon_mos_stone]][[/img]]Stone token is used for an action, it transfers to the other resource in an unusable pending state which lasts a number of turns. Winning battles reduces the number of turns tokens stay in a pending state.
Left-clicking an action then requires a target to be selected, if any, before confirmation.
Caravan
Convoy
You have successfully completed a Scheme!\\n\\nClick here to open the Schemes panel.
{{tr:hp_campaign_point_3_schemes}}
{{tr:hp_campaign_point_2_schemes}}

{{tr:hp_campaign_point_1_schemes}}
