You may now access the Witch's Hut!\\n\\nThe Witch's Hut is where Incantations are created using Trinkets collected from across the campaign map to benefit and debilitate units in battle.
This is where Trinkets are used to create Incantations.\\n\\n{{tr:hp_campaign_point_5_witchs_hut}}
{{tr:hp_campaign_point_1_witchs_hut}}\\n\\n{{tr:hp_campaign_point_2_witchs_hut}}
{{tr:hp_campaign_point_4_witchs_hut}}
{{tr:hp_campaign_point_3_witchs_hut}}\\n\\nOnce unlocked, you can experiment with different combinations of Trinkets to discover which Incantantions they create.
[[col:red]]You have already recruited the maximum number of this unit. Construct additional buildings to increase the capacity.[[/col]]
[[col:red]]You have already recruited the maximum number of this unit. Increase the capacity in the Hell-Forge.[[/col]]
[[col:red]]You have already recruited the maximum number of this unit. Increase the capacity via Rewards of Dread.[[/col]]

Power among the Dawi-Zharr requires the respect of the Conclave of Evil; those who achieve status cannot hope to retain it without their backing. Having worked so hard to earn recognition, it would be a shame to have it ruined by a bitter rival's sabotage.\\n\\nEnsure the path to glory is unhindered; put the agents of your competitors to the blade, and end their interference once and for all.

A wretched agent of the Chaos Dwarfs has been spotted lurking around our lands, no doubt hoping to obtrude on the business of Cathay! Whatever schemes those damned fire worshippers have drawn up must be ended quickly. There's no telling the damage they could do should they interfere with the work of the Dragons!\\n\\nIt is time to do what must be done. Slay this Dwarfen pest, and end the threat before it even rears its head!

A pathetic spy of the Dark Lands seeks to meddle in our affairs! Whatever they're planning, it ends now. Hunt down this wretched Dwarfling threat, and parade their body before our kin. Only then will these interlopers know to fear the Daemonic tide!

The worshippers of Hashut continue to make a nuisance of themselves, as their agents threaten our bloody work in their fool lord's name. Khorne will not stand for this, and neither will we!\\n\\nIt's time we plucked an agent of those pathetic Chaos Dwarfs from hiding and tore them in two! That will send a clear message to any others seeking to interfere in our business.

The Chaos Dwarfs grow too bold! They take far too much interest in Kislev and our thriving empire of ice and snow. That can only mean trouble looms. Best to snuff it out, before the danger has chance to grow.\\n\\nSlay this foul agent of the Dark Dwarfs, so they may no longer lurk where they are unwanted.

The smoke-charred worshippers of Hashut have deluded themselves into believing they pose a threat to us. Though an amusing misapprehension, this foolishness could prompt them to action. You must punish them for their arrogance! Ensure their agent succumbs to disease, and make it clear they will all fall to our empire of filth!

If the agents of the Dark Lands truly believe they cannot be seduced from their path, they are more foolish than they look! This has not stopped them trying, however, by sending agents to ruin our sweet temptations wherever they are able.\\n\\nThis cannot go on. It's time to respond to one of their agents with the flair and finesse of Slaanesh. Let them succumb to debauchery once and for all!

If it's Change the Chaos Dwarfs fear, it's Change we'll give them! No longer will their prying agents obtrude on our weaving of fate, while trying so desperately to escape their own.\\n\\nSoon the Great Conspirator will teach these Hell-Dwarfs that our plots are far more intricate than their own. Flush out their agents wherever they hide and put an end to them. Permanently!

Though the Dark Dwarfs pledge themselves to Chaos, they and their Hell-forged forces remain blind to all but their Father of Darkness. Instead of offering their flesh and blood in sacrifice to the true rulers of Chaos, they interfere in the affairs of their children.\\n\\nOur tribes cannot let this stand! We must send our blades into the dark, to cut down the agents of Hashut for corruption's sake!
Rival Agents
Eyes in the Dark
Agents of Hashut
Infernal Assassination
Snuffing out Spies
Agents of Fire
Blade in the Night
Conspiracy to Kill
Assassin in the Dark

Our empire will only stagnate under the control of the brainless wazzocks that currently compete for power. Far better our ziggurats be guided by a more capable hand.\\n\\nThe best course of action seems clear: seize the land of your hapless rival. It is the only way to restore control over the region and erase the stain of incompetence the fool has left on our legacy.

The so-called 'Infernal Empire' of the Dark Lands has grown arrogant beyond belief. They think themselves untouchable, and it seems even our past skirmishes along the Ivory Road have done little to quell their conceit.\\n\\nIt is long past time they learned the true threat of Cathay. Bring the full might of the Dragons down upon them, and add their land to our ever-growing realm!

The Dark Lands are no stranger to Daemonic influence, for the Chaos Dwarfs have long made use of our strength. Bound to their every whim, they see us as no more than useful tools, to fuel their hellish machinery.\\n\\nWe must remind these creatures of their place. When we conquer their strongholds and take their land for ourselves, they will soon remember that our Daemonic hordes are the true heirs of Chaos!

Every bloodthirsty, conquering empire must have room to grow. Ours is no different, yet the Dark Dwarfs seek to bar our path. Bring the armies of Khorne down upon them and force these fools from their lands. The Lord of Skulls will have blood this day – we will squash these Dwarfen bugs and let Khorne feast amid the carnage of our victory!

The evil empire of the Chaos Dwarfs is a continuous threat to our kingdom of ice and snow. The Motherland demands their cruelties be ended, in the name of protecting our people. It is time to rally our armies, and seize their land at once. Go forth and let the cool winds of Kislev snuff out their hellish flame!

The followers of Hashut continue to pollute the land with their smoky stench. Such a waste. The Urfather demands that the reeking miasma of disease should pervade the air instead!\\n\\nConquer this Dwarfen scourge. Their land will be the foundation for a whole new plethora of sickness and plague!

The dark devotees of Hashut hold lands that should be ours, toiling in their industry where indulgence and luxury should rule. They have long overstayed their welcome!\\n\\nNow the Prince of Pleasure's command is clear; wipe their factories and forges from the map and claim the region for our revelry. It is time the Father of Darkness learned that Slaanesh is to be revered and worshipped.

The influence of Hashut is felt across the land, as the insufferable Fire-Dwarfs gain more territory to call their own. Every bit of land they capture is sure to feed their wretched god, whose flames will no doubt reduce the Conspirator's plans to cinders.\\n\\nDeprive the Father of Darkness of this power. Conquer the region and claim the land for the warriors of Change!
In Better Hands
Conquering Flame
Capture the Dark
Bloody Expansion
Expansion of Ice
Spreading Disease
Pleasure's Conquest
Fate's Victory

Not all among the our kin are worthy to bear the name of Uzkul-Dhrath-Zharr; their very existence is a blemish on our infernal empire's glory. In such cases, the best outcome for our people is to remove these parasites entirely.\\n\\nCall your armies to war. It's time to let every sorry excuse for a Dawi-Zharr know that their end is coming!

The Chaos Dwarfs continue to be a thorn in our side, one that must be plucked and discarded. Their 'Industrial Empire' is nothing next to the shining glory of Grand Cathay, nor is their precious Father of Darkness a match for the Celestial Dragon.\\n\\nDeclare war on those infernal miscreants; soon they will be crushed beneath a mighty draconian claw!

When the Hell-Workers use their sorcery to bind our kin to their will, they force us to serve only as slaves to their every whim. We must send our armies against those pathetic Fire-Dwarfs! Show them our cruelty far surpasses their own, and make it clear the Daemons of Chaos will never belong in bonds!

The Blood God craves the slaughter of war! Perhaps the corrupted Dwarfs of the Dark Lands will make worthy targets for our sport – their screams will surely satisfy our dark master.\\n\\nDeclare war and rain the fury of Khorne down on their empire. It's time to collect their skulls for the Skull Throne!

There is no doubt the Chaos Dwarfs pose a growing threat; if left unchecked their power could prove impossible to overcome. We must freeze their infernal factories, to stop the production of their gruesome war machines before they are turned in our direction.\\n\\nSummon your armies for battle – the kingdom of ice must overcome the empire of smoke and flame.

The toiling masses sworn to Hashut are an affront to the Plague Lord, for as their industry spreads, the power of their dark father only grows.\\n\\nWe have no choice but to let sickness stop their influence. Declare war on these grasping Fire-Dwarfs, and bless them all with the reeking, putrid poxes of Grandfather Nurgle!

The Chaos Dwarfs continue to resist our alluring seductions, remaining annoyingly adamant in their steadfast commitment to Hashut. If subtlety is lost on them, then war will have to suffice! We must bring our blades to bear upon these heathen hordes, and finally show them the beauty of Slaanesh in battle!

The nefarious schemes of the Great Conspirator continue to be scuppered by the blasted Hell-Dwarfs of the Dark Lands. The great Architect of Fate will not be pleased!\\n\\nWe must facilitate their downfall through any means necessary. Challenge them to face us in battle and rain the sorceries of Tzeentch down upon them!

The Chaos Dwarfs have power and riches hidden away in their smoke-filled kingdom. It's time we took it from them – by any means necessary.\\n\\nCall the disciples of Chaos to war. The hordes of the north will sweep over the Dark Lands in the name of conquest, and take whatever we please!
Infighting
Eastern Declaration
Daemonic Declaration
Bloody Declaration
Frozen Declaration
Virulent Declaration
Indulgent Declaration
Destiny's Declaration
Chaotic Declaration

Establishing dominance as Hashut's greatest disciple requires the annihilation of those that would seek to claim the same. They are merely a hindrance to our empire's growth – the Dawi-Zharr will be better off without them!\\n\\nTake to the battlefield and decimate their armies, and above all, ensure that their feckless leader dies with them!

The Chaos Dwarfs continue to make nuisances of themselves. Hoping to pose a real threat, their generals advance, inspiring their forces with faith in Hashut's eventual triumph against the immortal Dragons.\\n\\nIf we are to crush the spirits of their armies, we must eliminate these leaders in battle, and expose their rousing words as the baseless lies they are!

An arrogant Chaos Dwarf general gathers the legions of the Dark Lands to their cause, hoping to lead their forces to victory against us! As laughable as the idea is, the mortals seem to believe triumph is inevitable. It's time we proved them wrong.\\n\\nRally the Daemonic brood to battle and slay this boastful general as proof of our hell-spawned superiority!

The armies of the Chaos Dwarfs believe themselves unstoppable when spilling blood for their Father of Darkness. The most dedicated and powerful of his forces has risen through the ranks, serving as a savage exemplar of the supposed power of their God.\\n\\nNothing would demoralise Zharr-Naggrund's armies more than taking to the battlefield, and making a bloody example of such a powerful figurehead.

Such a glorious empire as ours was always bound to earn itself some powerful enemies. The stunted fools of the Dark Lands are among them, no doubt plotting the fall of the Motherland as we speak!\\n\\nPut an end to their advances by slaying one of their leaders in battle. Destroying such a beacon of might will no doubt demoralise their hellish forces.

The unworthy masses of Zharr-Naggrund seek to spread their wretched industry throughout the land, creating an endless empire of fire and ash. Urged on by mighty generals, their armies have even dared to point their blades in the direction of Nurgle's children!\\n\\nThese self-righteous leaders must be made to answer for their audacity. Meet them in battle, and make their bodies rot beneath the onslaught of illness!

One of the Hashut's more dangerous devotees has set their sights on the Prince of Pleasure's lustful protégés. While such insolence is to be expected from the arrogant wretches of the Dark Lands, the insult must be answered with force all the same.\\n\\nCall the armies of indulgence to war and slaughter this arrogant enemy before the eyes of their followers. That will surely be enough to appease Slaanesh!

The glory of Tzeentch was always bound to be threatened by those envious of our schemes. Now that threat has finally reared its head; a dangerous general has arisen from among the worshippers of Hashut, and they have set their sights on the Changer of Ways.\\n\\nTake to the battlefield and put an end to this worthless foe – only then will our arcane secrets be safe.

The Dark Dwarfen hordes attack with unflinching audacity, led by a mighty general who leaves blood and carnage in their wake. We cannot allow the ourselves to be outdone in merciless savagery. Slay this fool in battle and prove the Warriors of Chaos remain unmatched, and that we will not be laid to waste so easily!
Rival Slayer
Dwarf Slayer
Fighting Fire
Skull Claimer
Ice Warrior
A Sickened General
Death from the Debaucher
Unravelling Fate
Dwarf Breaker

The path to power is never easy. Ambition was always bound to make enemies among our kin. Now such enemies rise against you, gathering in force in the hopes of halting your journey permanently. These ingrates must be dealt with!\\n\\nMeeting their army in open conflict is the surest way to end their threat; they'll cause no more trouble once their warriors have been trampled under foot!

The armies of Zharr-Naggrund grow bolder each day, driven by arrogance and envy. Their empire cannot hope to match the might of our own, yet the threat they pose to Cathay cannot go unaddressed.\\n\\nThe time for caution is over; let the Dragons take flight to meet this deadly scourge on the field of battle!

Zharr-Naggrund's Daemonsmiths hunger for more bodies to bind to their hellish machinery, and they aim to target the Daemonic hordes to do it.\\n\\nIt's nothing a little slaughter won't fix! Engage their forces in battle. Make it clear the Daemons of Chaos will massacre every Chaos Dwarf in the Dark Lands before we serve as fuel for their machines!

The forces of the Fire-Dwarfs grow larger with each passing day, gathering more warriors to their empire's industrious cause. They cannot be allowed to bolster their strength any further – not while the Blood God demands their deaths!\\n\\nThe forces of Khorne must march to war at once. Take to the battlefield and anoint your weapons in corrupted Dwarfen blood!

Hashut's dark fire is the antithesis of the Ice Magic of Kislev. Its very existence is an insult to the Motherland, one that must be snuffed out for good!\\n\\nThe battlefield beckons. Engage the forces of Zharr-Naggrund and ensure the Lore of Ice will forever douse the destruction of Hashut's malevolent flame!

Disease and sickness run rampant as our forces continue their march. Wherever we go, ailment and suffering follow, empowering the Lord of Pestilence.\\n\\nOne day, even the Tower of Fire and Desolation must fall to the Plague Lord's virulent maladies, yet the stubborn Chaos Dwarfs still stand in our way. Challenge their forces; it is long past time they succumbed to our plague.

Slaanesh represents indulgence and exhilaration – a direct contradiction to the laborious toil of those gloomy Chaos Dwarfs. Their way of life is built on the blood and sweat of endless diligence. It's time we freed them from their dreary work!\\n\\nDestroy these miserable Dark Dwarfs and prove excess will always overpower industry!

We agents of Tzeentch weave our conniving plots, manipulating fates and facilitating Change. Yet the Chaos Dwarfs seek to interfere in our plans, meddling with things they cannot hope to understand.\\n\\nTzeentch will be most displeased should we let these miscreants intervene. March our forces to battle and put an end to these tinkering Fire-Dwarfs once and for all.

The wretched Dark Dwarfs must be taught a lesson. These troublesome engineers pledge themselves to their Father of Darkness, yet dismiss the greatest dark forces of them all. The Chaos Gods demand retribution!\\n\\nSend out the war parties and ready your blades. It is time for bloodshed; these Chaos Dwarfs must pay for their insolence with their very souls!
Kill the Competition
Engage the Dark
Down with Industry
Clash with Darkness
Snowy Superiority
Plague's Embrace
Worker's Reprieve
Facing Fate
Clash of Chaos

One of your rivals brazenly marches against us, hoping to capture land that is rightfully ours! Now blood and fire must be answered with the same – the Father of Darkness demands it!\\n\\nSend your army against these traitorous Skruffs and make them pay. They have earned their deaths a hundred times over!

The malevolent Dwarfs of the Dark Lands have struck out at our territory, threatening the very heart of the Celestial Empire! Their forces march on our lands with haste, shedding the blood of everything in their path.\\n\\nThis outrage must be answered for! Halt their army in its tracks and slaughter them to the last Dwarf. Let them know they have awoken the wrath of the Dragons!

The Chaos Dwarfs have grown far too confident! They invade our corrupted lands with malicious glee, massacring all our kin in their way. Pride demands we tear them limb from limb, and use their broken bodies as decorations for our strongholds!\\n\\nFace their army before they can cause any more damage, and put a brutal stop to this poorly-planned invasion!

Khornate blood has been spilled in the name of Hashut, as an invading army of his conniving Chaos Dwarfs advances on our lands. We cannot allow ourselves to be beaten by these pathetic wretches!\\n\\nDestroy this invading force at once! Their mangled bodies will be a message to all: beware the fury of Khorne!

The Motherland is under attack! The Chaos Dwarfs descend on our homes, wielding their monstrous engines of war against our people. Such a brazen display of cruelty must be answered with cold and righteous fury!\\n\\nMarch against these malicious fools. Soon all that will be left of them is blood and regret!

The stubborn Chaos Dwarfs have dared to invade us, sweeping through our lands seeking to undo our putrid work. Their hardy constitutions help them fight off even the most abhorrent of sicknesses, leaving them bereft of Nurgle's unclean blessing. We must rectify this at once!\\n\\nMeet the Dark Dwarfen armies head on, to ensure their empire finally succumbs to malaise and malady.

It seems the forces of the Chaos Dwarfs could not resist encroaching on our territory, tempted by conquest like the slaves to indulgence they are, even as they try to deny it! They think their armies will overpower us. Instead the Prince of Pleasure will delight in their slaughter.\\n\\nCharge against these fools and halt them in their tracks – Slaanesh will ensure we are rewarded!

The armies of Zharr-Naggrund approach at speed, aiming to tear our strongholds to the ground. No doubt Hashut seeks to supplant the Changer of Ways in these lands – it cannot be allowed!\\n\\nStop this army before they can advance any further. Show them their dark god has only led them to their graves, for this ridiculous invasion is destined for failure!

The Chaos Dwarfs have dared to venture towards the Northern Wastes, threatening our lands with every advance. These blasted Fire-Dwarfs must be dealt with swiftly before they can take our rightly-raided goods!\\n\\nCrush the invading army – let these Chaos Dwarfs feel the brutality of our vengeance!
Traitor's Reward
Eastern Defence
Daemonic Defence
Murder Defence
Frost Defence
Plague Defence
Obsessive Defence
Destined Defence
Savage Defence

Those who bring shame to Hashut are no true Dawi-Zharr. All they are good for is entertainment, for our Dark Father will surely delight in their suffering!\\n\\nSend a raiding force among these worthless pretenders and strip them of everything they have. It will be of far more use in our hands anyway.

No empire can function without resources, even one built before the Dragon Emperor's awe-inspiring gaze. Should we turn our attentions to the west, we might find the goods we seek. The evil Chaos Dwarfs hoard a large bounty, ripe for redistribution.\\n\\nSend our raiding party into the Dark Lands, and return with a haul worthy of our empire!

Our Sorcerers always need more for their Dark Magic – blood, bodies, sacrifice and power – all is necessary in tapping into the arcane mysteries of Chaos. The Chaos Dwarfs are sure to have all that and more. All we need do is take it.\\n\\nLaunch a raid on the Dark Dwarfs' lands so our Daemonic conquest might continue in its expansion.

The Chaos Dwarfs have gathered an impressive stockpile of wealth and materials, either mined from the Dark Lands, or ripped from the helpless hands of their numerous victims. Such a cache would serve us well in expanding Khorne's armies. It's an opportunity we cannot miss!\\n\\nRaid the region when the Dark Dwarfs will least expect it and snatch their reserves out from under them!

Our spies have sent word from the Dark Lands, where the Chaos Dwarfs supposedly hoard a treasure trove of resources for their infernal industry. Since they would have no qualms in stealing from our stores, we would be fools not to return the favour and relieve them of their prize.\\n\\nRaid the Chaos Dwarfs' stockpile – whatever we find will be used for the Motherland!

The armies of Zharr-Naggrund have grown lax in the occupation of their lands, focusing more on their hellish industry than on defending their possessions. From their carelessness arises opportunity... We only need reach out and seize it!\\n\\nRaid the fools while their attentions are diverted and take all they have for the unholy glory of the Urfather!

The Chaos Dwarfs' dreadfully dull obsession with their industry might prove useful to us yet, as they amass a growing heap of treasures to build their war machines. How kind of them, to gather all their wealth together for us!\\n\\nA decisive raid on the region would prove very profitable indeed. The Fire-Dwarfs will not miss a few baubles, claim them for Slaanesh instead!

The forces of Tzeentch grow exhausted, as our resources begin to dwindle. A disastrous outcome indeed, for without supplies our Sorcerers cannot hope to influence the Winds of Change!\\n\\nWe must set out raiding for wealth and resources before such an event can come to pass. Perhaps the Chaos Dwarfs are hiding a worthwhile supply...

We Warriors of Chaos are no strangers to raiding; stealing away the rewards of another's toil has always been our way of life. Now, as our stocks begin to look sparse, we must look for new victims for our savagery.\\n\\nConduct a raid on the lands of the Chaos Dwarfs – their thriving industry can only mean they possess a wealth of treasures worth taking!
Raiding our Own
Raid of the Dragon
Raid of Chaos
Raid of the Soulhunter
Raid of the Snowmen
Raid of the Urfather
Raid of the Prince
Raid of the Changer
Raiders Gonna Raid

Our empire is being dragged down by an obvious weak link – a rival for power whose every action is an embarrassment to our kind. It's time they were shown what the true strength of the Dawi-Zharr should look like!\\n\\nAssault their walls and rain the fire of Hashut down upon them, until their home is little more than a ransacked ruin!

Our armies grow restless, no doubt yearning to visit righteous vengeance on our enemies. After all, we cannot allow our foes to think us weak!\\n\\nFor now, the Chaos Dwarfs work diligently in the Dark Lands, entirely unafraid of our power. It is time we reminded them of the Dragons' dominance. Ravage their monstrous ziggurats so they may never rest easy again!

A group of particularly brave and foolish Chaos Dwarfs venture out from their ziggurats, determined to make a nuisance of themselves in our lands. Their arrogance and pride will be their undoing, for our vengeance will be brutal and inescapable.\\n\\nSack their ziggurat to send a message. Or better yet, put it to the torch and let it be devoured by the malignant flames of Chaos!

There is little more satisfying than wreaking havoc among the Chaos Dwarfs. They believe they have a monopoly on cruelty and killing, yet Khorne spurs His followers to far greater acts of savagery!\\n\\nThe only message these Fire-Dwarfs will understand is one written in blood. Pillage one of their ziggurats – they'll soon remember their place!

The arcane fire of the Father of Darkness hungers to burn living flesh and melt away the ice of the Motherland. We must send a clear message that such a thing will never come to pass!\\n\\nEngulf their ziggurats in ice and snow, destroying everything in your path. Do not rest until their factories have been plundered and left to crumble!

Our mighty, reeking herd has clashed with the Chaos Dwarfs many times in the past, and with each encounter Hashut's worshippers have grown more confident. If they are left to fester in their arrogance, it will not be long before they are taking the challenge to the Plague Lord Himself!\\n\\nRemind these wretches of their place. Sack one of their settlements or raze it to the ground – either way, Nurgle will be pleased.

For too long the Chaos Dwarfs have languished in hiding, enjoying the spoils of their industry in the relative safety of their ziggurats. Their isolation must come to an end, for Slaanesh longs to hear them scream.\\n\\nBring the flames of Chaos down upon them, and finally put an end to the halcyon days spent hiding behind their walls!

Our Sorcerers study the darkest secrets of magic, twisting arcane energies into the malevolent tools of our will. Now Tzeentch demands we put such mastery to use in His name!\\n\\nThe Chaos Dwarfs would serve as worthy targets. They have served as the enemies of Change one too many times, and now they must pay the price. Assault their base of power, and leave only decimation in your wake!

The Chaos Dwarfs have established a strong and unwelcome presence, continuously churning out new engines of war that could soon be turned against us! A clear message must be sent before they can take us by surprise.\\n\\nRoot them out of their ziggurats at once, and leave only barren ruins behind!
Dawi-Zharr Destruction
Dragon's Fury
Daemonic Destruction
Bloody Vengeance
Motherland's Rage
Rampant Disease
Ferocious Indulgence
Conspiring Carnage
Raiders' Frenzy
The Wu Xing compass applies its benefits to all regions within Cathay and all regions owned by Cathayan factions outside its borders.
Learn more about Trickster Cults [[url:script_link_campaign_trickster_cults]]here[[/url]].
To unlock this character's form, you must defeat them in battle or form an alliance with their faction. They may also be unlocked via certain [[img:icon_schemes_changeling]][[/img]]Schemes.

The Ruinous Powers send the Daemons of
The Heralds announce to the weaklings of

The Heralds announce to the weaklings of
– there can be no peace or diplomacy with the Slaves to Darkness. It is war.
that the End Times are upon them. It is war. Let the soul-harvest begin!
that the End Times are upon them. It is war. Let the soul-harvest begin!
that the End Times are upon them. It is war. Let the soul-harvest begin!
that the End Times are upon them. It is war. Let the soul-harvest begin!
that the End Times are upon them. It is war. Let the soul-harvest begin!
that the End Times are upon them. It is war. Let the soul-harvest begin!
that the End Times are upon them. It is war. Let the soul-harvest begin!

The winter thaws. Crops can be sown at last and so the people rejoice. Kislev will always be a country in the cold north, yet now, with Ursun returned to the heavens, the Motherland is once more the bulwark against the legions of Chaos.\\n\\nMeanwhile, the Advisor wanders the land with his white-feathered familiar. At last! The curse is broken, the Tome of Fates – its lore and secrets – are his alone to exploit. As soon as he begins to read, his vision blurs, his eyes cloud and become milky-white – his eyesight has been stolen!\\n\\n"Our master has not finished with you," says the white crow. "Your sight is not needed where we are going. I will be your ever-watcher."

The search for the lost Dragon-child has begun. With the Bear-God's testament, the hunt has narrowed. It may still be centuries until the forgotten daughter of Xen Yang is returned to the Celestial Palace, but the Dragons of Grand Cathay are ancient, and patience brings harmony to all.\\n\\nMeanwhile, the Advisor wanders the land with his white-feathered familiar. At last! The curse is broken, the Tome of Fates – its lore and secrets – are his alone to exploit. As soon as he begins to read, his vision blurs, his eyes cloud and become milky-white – his eyesight has been stolen!\\n\\n"Our master has not finished with you," says the white crow. "Your sight is not needed where we are going. I will be your ever-watcher."

You are victorious! Ursun's power is yours. To think you once worshipped something so pathetic! Kislev now has a god it truly deserves. But why stop at one little nation? All the mortal realm should be yours to rule... or despoil.\\n\\nMeanwhile, the Advisor wanders the land with his white-feathered familiar. At last! The curse is broken, the Tome of Fates – its lore and secrets – are his alone to exploit. As soon as he begins to read, his vision blurs, his eyes cloud and become milky-white – his eyesight has been stolen!\\n\\n"Our master has not finished with you," says the white crow. "Your sight is not needed where we are going. I will be your ever-watcher."

Skarbrand gifts his master the greatest of prizes – the skull of a god. And yet the Blood God is not moved to forgiveness. Far from it, in fact. Skarbrand will forever be exiled, his fate to wander the infinite realms in rage.\\n\\nMeanwhile, the Advisor wanders the land with his white-feathered familiar. At last! The curse is broken, the Tome of Fates – its lore and secrets – are his alone to exploit. As soon as he begins to read, his vision blurs, his eyes cloud and become milky-white – his eyesight has been stolen!\\n\\n"Our master has not finished with you," says the white crow. "Your sight is not needed where we are going. I will be your ever-watcher."

In his fetid lair, Ku'gath works over a boiling cauldron adding in his latest specimen in hopes of creating the plague to infect the gods themselves. But when will it be ready? Like any good cook, the Poxmaker refuses to be drawn. We'll know when the gods begin to wither...\\n\\nMeanwhile, the Advisor wanders the land with his white-feathered familiar. At last! The curse is broken, the Tome of Fates – its lore and secrets – are his alone to exploit. As soon as he begins to read, his vision blurs, his eyes cloud and become milky-white – his eyesight has been stolen!\\n\\n"Our master has not finished with you," says the white crow. "Your sight is not needed where we are going. I will be your ever-watcher."

Get your god-meat down your gullet! The pilgrimage through the Mountains of Mourn is one long feast and when what is left of Ursun's remains are thrown into the Great Maw, the hallowed belch can be heard all the way from Khuresh to Lustria!\\n\\nMeanwhile, the Advisor wanders the land with his white-feathered familiar. At last! The curse is broken, the Tome of Fates – its lore and secrets – are his alone to exploit. As soon as he begins to read, his vision blurs, his eyes cloud and become milky-white – his eyesight has been stolen!\\n\\n"Our master has not finished with you," says the white crow. "Your sight is not needed where we are going. I will be your ever-watcher."

N'Kari samples the despair of a nation that has lost its god. He tastes the sensation of mortals who have nowhere to place their faith. It is divine! A fervid elixir to sustain the Arch-tempter while he contemplates vengeance on Aenarion's bloodline.\\n\\nMeanwhile, the Advisor wanders the land with his white-feathered familiar. At last! The curse is broken, the Tome of Fates – its lore and secrets – are his alone to exploit. As soon as he begins to read, his vision blurs, his eyes cloud and become milky-white – his eyesight has been stolen!\\n\\n"Our master has not finished with you," says the white crow. "Your sight is not needed where we are going. I will be your ever-watcher."

Fateweaver pecks out the eyes of the Bear-God. They are his now... with them he can perceive the present, and so the full spectrum of fate and reality are his to witness.\\n\\nMeanwhile, the Advisor wanders the land with his white-feathered familiar. At last! The curse is broken, the Tome of Fates – its lore and secrets – are his alone to exploit. As soon as he begins to read, his vision blurs, his eyes cloud and become milky-white – his eyesight has been stolen!\\n\\n"Our master has not finished with you," says the white crow. "Your sight is not needed where we are going. I will be your ever-watcher."
Khorne factions can summon Blood Hosts by using the Blood for the Blood God option when razing an enemy settlement.
A Bretonnian knave has been spied riding across our wastes, proud as a peacock, slaying our people, our workers, in the name of justice and glory. It would be a shame should he fail to return...
All in their verdant kingdom shall know to fear Cathay's wrath once their champion is taken from them.
This pampered wretch must be eviscerated. Never again shall they stand against Chaos.
Slaughter the preening mortal! Tear off their proud head and claim their skull for Khorne!
The arrogant Knights of the Old World must learn that steel is no armour against the Motherland's fury.
They think themselves so special, but even the most high-born corpse rots like any other.
There is no scent so sweet as mortal fear. It is an aroma Slaanesh yearns for, and the final, terrified moments of this plaything of Bretonnia shall provide it.
Let this proud protector of Bretonnia know their final fate, for Tzeentch yearns to revel in the courtly turmoil that will follow.
Honour Among Fools
Bretonnian Begone
Knight Fall
Crimson On Silver
Chivalry is Lost
Knife the Knight
The Incomparable Taste of Terror
Chaos in the Courts
The ungainly agents of the Beastmen are mere mockeries of Hashut's glory; lowly farm stock set against his mighty Taurus. Even so, their heads would be fine trophies for the altars of Zharr-Naggrund.
In the name of harmony, hunt down this filthy servant of the Great Enemy.
Though its animal savagery is to be admired, it is an infuriating impediment to our plans. Hunt the beast down!
Show this base animal what true strength looks like, and seize its horned skull for Kharneth.
Teach this howling beast that Kislev comes for all who follow Chaos.
The Urfather finds this beast most objectionable. Please, dispatch it swiftly, and let its corpse fertilise the soil.
This beast will rake desperately at our follower's supple flesh as it helplessly resists its death, and the Perfect Prince shall shudder in rapture.
This beast has spent its every moment in the service of Chaos, and expects reward. How deliciously contrary it will be to instead grant it death.
Horned Trophy
Offence Against Nature
The Hunt is On
Big Game
Bear vs Beast
Swine Flu
Cornered Beast
Dark Prize
What weak gods they follow that their emissaries must intrude on our lands? They shall learn true faith, true power, as they burn in Hashut's giant brazier.
The Great Enemy must be weakened. Destroy their wicked champion in the Emperor's name.
This fool does not understand the Dark Power he plays with. Part him from it, and from his head.
The chattel of Ruination must be made to understand that Khorne is supreme. Rend their sorry flesh!
The Motherland has sent countless slaves of Chaos to their foul graves. What is one more?
This one's appetite for destruction is laudable, but they have become rather a nuisance. Grant them the gift of death.
This one worships Chaos so devoutly. Out of kindness, we should reward them with the ultimate sensation of Ruination: sweet, glorious death.
They believe that Ruinous power is their destiny. In their final moments they must learn that their life is but a candle in the darkness.
As False As Their Gods
Servant of Disharmony
The Price of Darkness
True Destruction
Eternal Crusade
Cauterising Chaos
The Promise of Ascension
The Gods are Watching
The undying waves have washed a foolish foe far, far from the sea and into our grasp. For Hashut, we shall bake their bones to dust and send their ashes home, to float on the foam.
A pirate who has cheated death – truly, an abomination. Banish them from existence, once and for all.
This one believes they can cheat death. The unbridled folly of it! There can be no recovery from absolute obliteration.
Teach this worthless abomination that there is no honour in Unlife.
In Ursun's name, grant this soulless abomination the final death they are so long overdue.
Oh dear, oh dear. This one thinks themselves a master of Unlife. It is night time we taught them that death comes for everyone.
As He drapes Himself across His satin throne, the Lord of Excess finds Himself yearning to see this pirate punished. How joyous their screams shall be.
Whatever wealth they have accrued, whatever Necromantic secrets they have learned, they remain a mere puppet to the Raven's will. Teach them this.
Lashes for Ashes
A Pirate's Unlife
Purge the Pirate
Death to Undeath
Delayed Gratification
The Final Gift
Crime & Delicious Punishment
Unlife is Too Short
The Cathayans are foolish to travel so deep into our lands without their Dragon overlords to care for them. Removing this pest is a first step to removing the Dragons themselves...
They who have betrayed our beloved Dragon Emperor's trust must now face the consequences.
Annihilate them! Let all who bow to the Dragon know that there are none in this world who can stand against Ruination.
Khorne has raged against the fool Dragon for an eternity. Vengeance must be had!
The preening Dragon-worshipper must pay the price for standing in the Motherland's way.
Only our finest and most agonising diseases will suffice for this servant of the despicable Dragon.
This one's soul is forfeit, for the worship of the hated Dragon is a sin even the Prince of Pleasure cannot abide.
As their brief life is extinguished, the Dragon's champion will realise that all things, no matter how defiant, are bound to become dust.
Dragonsbane
Black Sheep
No Bastion Can Protect Them
Tears of a Dragon
Grand Villainy
Spite the Dragon
The Ultimate Perversion
Harmony is a Lie

We did not expect this – the aetheric underlings of the heretical gods to enter our land so boldly, to contend with us so clearly. Though they are kin to Hashut, they must be eliminated for this affront.
This one is a slave to Chaos. There is no hope of redemption for them. Death is the only acceptable solution.
This is a lesser Daemon indeed, but nonetheless it stirs our great rage. End its miserable existence.
Punish the pretender's puppet! Cleave their head from their shoulders, and bathe in their blood!
Teach the fallen prince a lesson! Slay his foul servant, and prove that Kislev is unbowed.
Time to feed this fiend to the worms. Nominally they serve the same cause, but all's fair in love and war.
This Daemon is so disappointingly artless. Never once has their tedious campaign of terror wrought a fresh sensation. Let their unexpected death be the sole moment of light in their dismal existence.
Even rival Daemons are marionettes unwittingly dancing to the Weaver's whims. This one has served their purpose.
Daemonic Inquisition
Child of Ruin
Fiend of Another Power
A Lesser Power
Henchman of Hate
Servant of a Lesser God
In Death They Shall Blossom
Puppet of a Lesser Master

The Slavers of Naggaroth respect no borders in their endless hunt for new... "workers". Whilst we understand their commitment to the trade, their mistake was to attempt to recruit our Labourers – let alone our prized warriors! Removing their agents should send a clear reminder of where the boundaries lie.
Their cruelty is boundless, and their beliefs sicken our Emperor. This Elf of Naggaroth must know destruction.
They are a weakling with only the most meagre grasp of true cruelty. In their final, anguished moments, they will at last understand.
This mortal scion of sin is without worth. Eviscerate them in the Blood God's name.
Make this twisted Elf understand that to worship depravity is to court damnation!
It's almost a shame to bump off someone who's brought about so much beautiful death, but needs must.
For their services to suffering, ensure this Druchii's death is a decadent one. Slaanesh expects to see their corpse enrobed in the most sensuous of scents and dressed liberally with delicate petals.
This Druchii's murderous ambitions must meet their end. They are destined only for a shockingly sudden death.
The Black Arks Cometh
Do In the Druchii
Lost Child of Naggaroth
Naggaroth Trembles
Wicked Game
Champion of Darkness
Beauty in Death
They Too Shall Suffer

Our despised cousins, with their simple moralities and idiot gods, have allowed one of their emissaries to wander into our lands. What can their purpose be? The time for conversation was a thousand years past. Perhaps sending their High King this one's tongue would remind them of that?
This Dawi champion threatens all harmony. Our ancestors call out for his swift demise.
Part this stunted whelp from their shrunken skull. The legendary hardiness of the Dawi shall be proven a lie.
The mortal's shrunken skull belongs to Khorne. Make it so, or know His wrath.
This gold-hoarding mountain-dweller proves a particularly irritating thorn in Kislev's side.
The Dawi are damnably hard to infect, but don't let that stop you. Ensure this one decomposes, by any means necessary.
Imagine the boiling hatred the dour Dawi will feel towards us once we have consigned their champion to oblivion. How delightful it shall be.
Let grief and madness haunt the Dawi halls once their champion falls. To Great Tzeeneth, their death will be but an afterthought.
The King's Tongue
Malevolent Miner
Annihilate the Elder
Damned Dawi
Bearded Belligerence
A Decomposing Dwarf
Let the Book Be Filled
Another Day, Another Grudge

Those ruffed necks and slashed sleeves are ridiculous militaristic affectations compared to our entirely practical hats, and they will be less than useless in the deep mines beneath the Plains of Zharr. It is a waste of good Labour, but it would be best if we just killed this annoying manling as soon as is practical.
The meagre Empire of the Old World must be left bereft of their champion. Show grace, and make it swift.
Deluded slave to the dead fool Sigmar! Eviscerate them where they stand!
This man must learn that none can stand against the Lord of Murder. Let the glorious slaughter commence.
This wretched, pampered Sigmarite must fall, in the name of the Motherland!
It's all 'Sigmar this' and 'Ulric that' with these tedious fellows. Pray silence this one, at least.
Let this simpering person experience the giddiest heights of raw sensation, as we conduct a symphony of cruelty across their torn flesh.
Nothing pleases the Changer more than to dabble in the affairs of man. How He will delight in the tumult that stems from this one's unexpected demise.
Death, Imperial Fashion.
Servant of a Lesser Empire
Man is a Disease
Slaughter the Sigmarite
Over-Indulged
Infect the Imperial
Man is Weak
Puppet of Empire

Hashut teaches us that it is not shameful to want, to demand – to take. Of us, he demands his tribute and deserves it – the fault is ours if we do not provide when he is in need. And this foe has offended our peoples, making them the perfect sacrifice. Bring their still-beating heart to the Temple of Zharr-Naggrund and we shall retain Hashut's favour.
Our departed ancestors cannot know rest until this threat to order and harmony is dealt with.
The Ruinous Powers demand a sacrifice. Scatter this whelp's bones across the land and their dread eyes shall take notice.
Their skull for the Skull Throne! Their blood for the Blood God!
This fool is a threat to all the Motherland! For the sake of the people, they must be destroyed!
Be a dear and consign this one to a foetid grave. It will make Grandfather so very happy.
The Perfect Prince thirsts for a fresh soul, captured at the very moment of their final, agonised breath. Specifically, He desires this one.
The Well of Eternity has revealed its prophecy: this witless puppet is bound for death. We must be the hand of fate.
Sacrifice to Hashut
Turning in Their Graves
The Enemy of Ruin
The Crimson Skull
For the Workers
Food For Worms
A Dram of Suffering
Cutting the Strings

The Greenskins are really ideal Labourers for Hashut's glory – strong, simple and warlike. The Hobgoblins understand this and, with encouragement, have bent themselves before him. However, their kin do not understand – will not understand. A demonstration needs to be made of the error of their ways. Take this one and show them our ways.
Eliminate this green monster, quietly and quickly, before it imperils any more of the Emperor's people.
No servant of Chaos should fear Greenskin savagery, but we cannot allow their mindless pursuit of battle to slow our path. Annihilate this one!
They slaughter without honour. They destroy without skill. Their only value is in blood-drenched death.
Bring purity to this slavering horror! They must destroy no more!
It is a sad thing indeed to slay such a determined death-bringer, but alas this Greenskin has become something of nuisance.
Greenskins are too crude to appreciate most sensations, but perhaps the doorways of this one's mind will open as we grant it the singular rapture of a drawn-out death.
It is time to cut this marauding marionette's strings. Their countless acts of destruction and turmoil have exceeded the bounds of usefulness.
A Lesson to Gork
East vs Beast
And None Shall Mourn Them
Slaughter Without Rectitude
Scrub the Stain
From Fungus to Fungus
Something for Your Mind
Its Own Medicine

Those sneering, aquiline faces, proud in their immortal wisdom. They have long held contempt for our race, whether Dawi or Dhrath-Zharr, and ancient tales say they betrayed our peoples long ago. Let us take this Elf and tear him asunder, to show their kin that we still remember their slight.
This champion of Ulthuan proves a grave threat to harmony. We have no option but to bury them.
The only good Asur is a dead Asur. Soak the earth with this preening clod's thin blood.
Punish this mortal for their arrogance. Teach their weakling kind that none are beyond Khorne's ruinous reach.
The haughty Ulthuani are as weak as they are arrogant. To eliminate this one will require little effort.
It is time this tiresome Asur learned that they are not so high and mighty after all. Bless them with the foulest disease, and then delight in their agonised death throes.
The more this Asur plaything resists death's cold embrace, the more they ensure their eternal damnation. Their resistance, however, is at an end. Slaanesh awaits them, beyond the veil.
Change must come to this infuriating servant of order. Dispatch this Asur forthwith, and ensure the sacred number nine is burned into their dead flesh.
Ancestral Insult
Clash of the Ancients
Pride Before a Fall
Ulthuan Weeps
Pricking Pomposity
The Natural Order of Things
The Waystones Cannot Save Them
Nine is His Number

To what purpose, skulls? To whose profit, blood? What a wastrel this God of death and violence is, to take souls so grimly. Even the Greenskins take pleasure from the death they cause, but this fool gruffly strides on. Kill this one, and let his idiot God work out whether we meant respect or contempt himself.
Eliminate this savage servant of the Great Enemy before it can destroy yet more innocent lives.
Kharneth's champion proves an impediment to our brutal crusade. Claim their skull!
This whelp brings dishonour to the Skull Throne. Soak the land in their treacherous gore!
This vile servant of blood must be destroyed, as have so many others in Kislev's proud history.
It is high time we silenced this shouty old Khornate buffoon, don't you think?
Liberate this drooling Daemon from the crudity of its savage life. As its life spark ebbs away from its delicately-flayed flesh, it shall at last know something more meaningful than simple bloodshed.
There is no more entertainment to be had from this crude champion of carnage. Dispatch them, and perhaps a more intriguing killer may take their place.
Simpleton of Blood
Throne of Blood
Make Claim Upon Their Skull
Honourless Child
Blood Price
Dim Their Rage
Blood is Only the Start
Not Funny Any More

This weakling has wandered far from their home in the snows to our place of ash and heat. There is nothing for them here, so why do they persist? Lift their unkempt beard, take a jagged blade and slit that paltry throat for the glory of Hashut.
The Kislevite warrior disrupts our Emperor's grand ambitions. He beseeches you to remove them from play.
This cretin of ice must meet a bloody end. Slay them by any means necessary.
The shivering mortals who so have long obstructed Khorne must be annihilated, one by one. This one is next.
The Motherland shows no mercy to traitors! Execute the betrayer!
This infuriating mortal deserves a rap across the knuckles for all the bother that Kislev has given the Urfather over the years.
This stoic soul of Kislev proves frustratingly resistant to our seductions. Simple death shall have to suffice.
This turgid mortal of Kislev staunchly resists the delights of change. As such, the Weaver of Fates decrees that their time is at an end.
Weakness in Furs
Winter Has Come
The Motherland's Lament
A Frozen Skull
Broken Homeland
Ursun Undone
Instant Gratification
Put On Ice

We do not look backwards like the Dwari-Yar and our annals are confused and mostly lost. But what little we know of the Great Catastrophe tells us that these Lizardmen were at its heart, battling against the promise of Hashut and his kin. For that ancient transgression and for their present hatred, let us take this reptile's life.
The reptile of the south is cruel and callous. Put an end to its inhuman ambitions.
Detested slave to the Old Ones! End their deluded life at once, and let all its kind know their dead gods cannot save them from Chaos.
All who worship the hated Old Ones must be annihilated. Make an example of this pathetic reptile.
Feel no remorse at this reptile's death, for its cold and alien soul is bereft of all virtue.
Please do give this bothersome reptile a very special disease. Something to slough off all its scales before it perishes, perhaps?
Make this slave of the odious Old Ones experience every form of suffering their cold mind and scale-clad body can endure. Then, only then, grant it the sweet release of death.
Nothing lifts the Great Conspirator's unknowable spirits like disrupting these reptiles' laughable "Great Plan". This one's sudden death will create such beautiful turmoil.
Ancient Crimes
Best Served Cold
Open Up Cold Veins
Cold Blood, Burning Wrath
Cold Fury
Lord of Lizards
The Price of Blasphemy
No Part in the Plan

These Northern thugs would make the perfect workers – hardy, driven and strong, they would live long in the pits of the Dark Land. And they already worship the Gods of Chaos. Yet their neglect of our Hashut is a calculated insult, and one we shall return, by the death of this pernicious interloper.
Do not pity this man for his delusions. He is sworn to evil, and thus execution is our only option.
This laughable mortal has sworn themselves to a power they can barely fathom. It is time they received their reward.
The mortals do not understand what it is they worship. Let them bear witness as their brother man suffers Khorne's boundless fury.
Every ravaging Norscan who lives is one too many. Make a bloody example of this Chaos-worshipping scum!
Nurgle has heard this mortal worshipper of Ruin's prayers, and intends to answer them. Go forth and grant them disease, death and decay.
Nothing shall please the Dark Prince more than to exact the most terrible of prices from this willing follower of Ruination.
Grant this mortal the Ruinous gift they have so long desired: eternal darkness.
Sin of Omission
False Idols
He is But a Man
What They Asked For
Ruin the Ruiner
Everything They Asked For
The Dark Prayer Answered
A Just Reward

Profligate Plague God, why do you laugh so? Your love of anguished death is so... purposeless, so small. To love life only for the suffering it causes is mistaken. You should love it for the gold it produces too, along with the suffering! And so we must remove your emissary, unproductive as it is.
This pestilent slave of evil must be eliminated before their foul rot can stain our beloved empire.
The Fly Lord's festering minion cannot be permitted to interfere with our Ruinous design. This blister must be burst.
Death should not be slow, creeping and wasteful. This stagnant child of Nurgleth must experience it in all its savage, bloody rapidity.
Scrub clean the taint of Chaos! Ensure this foul monstrosity can never pollute proud Kislev!
It really is a terrible shame, but our foetid kin here has made the Fly Lord most awfully sad. Alas, they must be dispatched.
Beneath the countless layers of nauseating bile and gag-inducing rot, the soul of a decay Daemon possesses the most rarefied and delicate of flavours. Slaanesh demands to taste this forthwith.
This stagnant slave of unchanging rot stands in the way of glorious change. Let the Urfather weep as his torpid champion meets their untimely end.
The Point of Suffering
Purge the Pox-Bringer
Killer of Plagues
The Glory of Death
Got the Remedy
Black Sheep
Perfection Beneath Pestilence
The Price of Torpidity

Give unto Hashut that which is Hashut's. Yet this Great Maw demands all, would consume all, including everything that is his. Bring down this towering glutton and drag it to the temple. There, throw it into the molten metal below Hashut's brazier.
We must fell this mountain marauder, for it will consume the Celestial Emperor's people without thought.
The brute must maraud no more. Put an end to its worthless existence.
This oaf must learn that flab and greed do not a true warrior make. Claim its bloated skull for Khorne!
Unless we cut it down now, this drooling brute will devour countless of the Motherland's children.
This Ogre is a dependable death-bringer, but his rapacious appetite is causing us no end of problems. Sort him out, won't you?
Just think of how much suffering so vast a frame might endure. Make this brute's bloated flesh into a tapestry of agony, then end its hunger once and for all.
How the Great Schemer hungers to see the Ogre brutes tussle murderously with one another, each desperate to fill the power vacuum created by this one's abrupt demise.
Greed Versus Hunger
Unruly Neighbour
A Tribe Without a Leader
Hunger Without Honour
Et Tu, Brute?
His Hunger Slaked
A Larger Canvas
Loss of Appetite

Sneak-thieves, coming into our lands, stealing our stone, metal, workers, endlessly chittering your double-speak when caught. Your god is nothing compared to the glory of Hashut, the true fifth Chaos God. Learn this by dying, little rat.
Scrub this worthless vermin from the face of the land. They bring only disharmony.
There is no glory in slaughtering Skaven, but they do die so delightfully easily. This one shall be no exception.
Skaven have no value in life, and little more in death, but even a vermin skull belongs on the Skull Throne.
Do not permit this hunched horror to slink away from Kislev's justice!
This little one positively oozes filth and pestilence, but he's caused Grandfather no end of bother. Put him in the ground, eh?
Skaven are such dour and wretched little beasts, their souls far too thin to slake the Dark Prince's thirst. We are thus granted rare license to end this one's life in the simplest of ways.
Once this vermin lord falls, purest chaos will be unleashed within the foul warrens of its chittering followers. To please the Great Sorcerer, we must make it so.
Taking the Fifth
Crush the Critter
Vanquish the Vermin
Reaper of Rodents
Verminous Vengeance
Vanquish the Varmint
Tasteless Morsels
Panic in the Sewers

Such heedless pleasure you take, Whip God. These evanescent moments of experience that you chase are meaningless. It is acquisition that matters, not the temporary route to it – acquisition, wealth and the respect that entails. And so your agent's suffering shall be short, because it is their death that has purpose.
Put an end to this fiend's unspeakable depravity. The Emperor demands it!
This slave to Slaanesh has known their final pleasure. Grant them oblivion.
All who serve the despicable, idle Prince must know destruction! Ensure this self-serving scum is next!
This slave to suffering shall sin no more! The Motherland's justice is upon them!
No more of this Slaaneshi's dilly-dallying, please. Straight to a messy death, with none of the larking around their kind is so fond of.

This concubine has visited Slaanesh's satin bedchambers once too often. He desires that they are disposed of, for they have been used in every way possible. A draught of fresh soul-stuff is all they have left to offer Him.
This dedicated servant of excess surely deserves an unexpected surprise. Bestow unto them the ultimate sensation of death. Slaanesh will surely appreciate so thoughtful a gift.
A Quick Death
Unforgivable Sin
Seduced Unto Death
The Price of Pleasure
Pleasure Denied
Excruciating Excess
Familiarity Breeds Contempt
Extremes of Sensation

Dry bones that still move, still heave themselves along, but are a rich seam for us to mine. Adorned with gold and jewels they are, and the bones themselves we can grind for ziggurat mortar. In life, you were small; in Unlife, smaller. But in true death, you shall serve Hashut!
A swift knife is required between this abomination's unnatural ribs.
This ghoul shall evade death no longer. Shatter their ancient skull, and crush their bones to dust.
For the insult of rejecting death, the corpses of Nehekhara must know the final doom. Khorne demands this one's Undying skull next.
Their unnatural bones must stalk the land no more! Grant them oblivion!
Grandfather is not often stirred to rage, but there is nothing so dismaying as a mortal who seeks to cheat death. End their charade!
Having escaped the reaper once before, the unbridled horror of this fleshless plaything as they know death's embrace for a second time will truly be a sensation to relish.
This deathless ghoul has sought to avoid their final fate for far too long. It is high time we changed their destiny.
The Riches of the Dead
The Emperor Abhors Necromancy
The Mausoleum's Call
Silence the Skull
The Tomb Beckons
Necromancy Undone
Death Catches Up
Fate Catches Up With Them

Of the four Chaos Gods, we only understand you, maker-of-plans, Changer of Ways. Your planning and your cunning we respect. But we suspect you do not have clear ends in sight – that you yourself do not – cannot – understand the future you are creating. Better to have concrete plans, to build and dominate, than endlessly plan. Here, we will take your agent, so you can see what a result looks like.
The cult of Chi'an Chi must not gain purchase. Strike down this serpent before it can infect more Cathayan minds.
Whatever role this one plays in Tzeentch's labyrinthine scheme must now come to an end. Eviscerate them!
We must disrupt the Changer's honourless schemes. Send this slave of the hated Raven to its long-deserved death.
Kislev stands against the Raven, for now and always! The people will rejoice when this mutant falls!
No more bothersome games from this one, please. We'll all be much happier once maggots are feasting upon their changeling flesh.
Liberate this changeling from the misery of forever awaiting a conclusion to their labyrinthine schemes, and grant them instead the delicious immediacy of absolute agony.
This puppet believes the Raven favours them. How glorious it will be to see them realise the truth, in the heartbeat before their lifeforce drains from them.
Endless Plans
Silence the Whisperer
Their Final Change
Death to the Deceiver
Catch the Bird
Changing States
A Changeling's Torment
An Abandoned Plaything

Who is this pawn of the ancient Vampire Counts who moves and plots in our demesne? These ancient Sylvanians should know better than to send meddlers and the unquiet dead to the land of Hashut. We shall take this lout and impale them high, Unliving, for all to see, for all time.
To arrest the spread of Undeath, this foul fiend must be banished to the underworld for all time.
Return this abomination to dust. Let all its kind know that immortality means nothing in the face of absolute Ruination.
Undeath is an affront to Khorne Himself. We must put a brutal end to this fiend's foul existence.
Return this monstrosity to their grave! Not one more proud Kislevite shall suffer their unholy bite!
Even Undead flesh can rot. Do whatever is required to put this ghoul back in the ground.
This blood-drinker is a master of seduction and suffering, yet refuses to give themselves to the Lord of Excess. End their Unlife, for they must be punished for this blasphemous obstinance.
Death comes for all beings, even those who believe they have bested it. Tzeentch wills it that this Vampire's immortality is proven a lie.
High Stakes
Counting the Cost
Death Becomes Them
They Cannot Outrun Death
Biting Back
Gangrene for a Ghoul
Midnight's Embrace
Darkness Falls

Living in harmony with the woods and wilds? Pah. This foolish Elf instead has become a slave to the arbitrary whims of cruel spirits, no different from the fools of the Chaos Gods. We shall feed their sacred woods and tree-Daemons to the furnaces, smoke billowing to the glory of the Hashut. And we shall start with this one.
Hunt down this wretch of the forests, for they bear only malice toward the Celestial Empire.
This fool mortal believes themselves protected by the weakling gods Isha and Kurnous. We must prove them wrong.
The weakling mortals of the forest break so very easily. You will enjoy eviscerating this one.
Bring the axe to this pagan Elf, and make them wish they had never left their miserable forest!
This Elf of the forest would see this world made sickeningly pure and bountiful. Pray teach them the error of their ways.
We must have one our hunters test their skill against this servant of Kurnous, for Slaanesh desires that an Elven soul be trapped and brought to Him to sip at his leisure.
Let the hunter become the hunted – a twist in destiny this Elf of the forest cannot possibly have foreseen.
Fuel For the Fires
Terror From the Trees
Blood On the Branches
When the Bough Breaks
Woodcutter
Festering Fey Folk
Nature's Bounty
Kurnous Cannot Protect Them

The Dukes of Bretonnia will find it hard to stand against our might. Topple their silver towers, pull down the marquees and trample their silken canopies – all of these things are fine fuel for our furnaces. As for the peasants, they are used to serfdom and will find no difference in their masters, save for our elevation.
The pompous kingdom of Bretonnia must be diminished, and given over to the Dragon Emperor.
Seize these lands from the preening Knights of Bretonnia! Slaughter any who stand in our way!
Sunder their gleaming steel, litter their land with their own corpses, then claim it for Khorne.
Seize these lands from the soft hands of the coward Knights!
Seize the beauteous fertile lands of Bretonnia for Nurgle, and then coat them in filth and decay.
We must bring unbound sin to these mortals lands, and never again shall the name Bretonnia be associated with chaste and courtly concerns.
Bring endless, broiling change to these lands of order. Claim them for Tzeeneth, and leave these fool men bereft.
Toppled Towers
Liberated From the Lady
Stealing From the Lady
Liberated From the Lady
Steel Continent
Blighting Bretonnian
Corrupting the Lady
All Property is Theft

These wild mutants are untrainable, dedicated to the Gods in every way – but not to Hashut, in their ignorance. Topple their herdstones and crush their makeshift encampments. Then we shall prepare this land for Hashut's ends and take all that we can from it.
These beasts of Chaos spread terror far and wide. It is Cathay's duty to liberate these lands from them.
Long have these beasts worshipped Chaos, and so their lands belong to us by right. Seize them!
Their gore-strewn dens belong to Khorne by right. Drive these worthless beasts from them.
Make these lands pure! Drive the beasts of Ruin from them, and claim them for Kislev!
The Cloven Ones have inflicted delightful Ruin upon this land already, but now we must seize it from them and finish the job.

The beasts litter their lairs with grime and filth, and from them stage only simple Ruin. We must rectify this sad squandering of good lands, and make them instead a home of exquisite fragrances and unspeakable acts.
These animals lack the wit to remake their domain, and so we adherents of Change must do it for them. Seize them!
Wild Folly
Herd Out the Herd
A Cuckoo of Chaos
Realms of Ruin
Dewilding
Lair of the Beast
Air-Freshener
Emptying the Nest

Look at the undivided profligacy of Chaos! They have wasted this land, turned it to ash and torture. Admirable, but in the service of Hashut we will do much more – those fallen trees will feed our furnaces, those tortured slaves will be serfs who will never see the sun again. Let us take it from their cruel grasp and show them true cruelty!
The Great Enemy brings only Ruin to these lands. In the Emperor's name, we must restore harmony.
These blighted provinces are haunted by a thin simulacrum of Chaos. It is time they knew the true power of Ruination.
Only when their lands are soaked in their own blood will these servants of ruin understand that Khorne rules all.
If the people of Kislev are to drive back Chaos once more, we must rip their lands from them.
Grandfather desires that his garden should grow. We must pluck these blighted lands from the legions of Ruin.
These servants of Ruin have done much to entertain Slaanesh, but now stand in the way of perfection. Claim their domain, so that His exquisite crusade may continue.
Ruin and slaughter grow tiresome. We must claim these blasted lands for Tzeentch, and bestow glorious Change upon them.
Wasted Ruins
Evicting Evil
Taking Back What Is Ours
Realms of Ruin
Remove the Taint
Taking What is Due
Peace Through Tyranny
Change Comes for Chaos

Set our forces on these Undying pirates. Burn their ships at dock, empty the taverns with much-admired slaughter and send the dead scurrying back to the depths. Hashut intends that this place be a seat of the Dawi-Zharr, and we must serve his will.
Drive out these unnatural brigands, and restore their dead realms to life.
Seize these lands from the Undying pirates! They must become the domain of Daemons.
Wash away the foul taint of Undeath with a tide of blood.
We must make their Unliving hands release their holdings, and then great Kislev shall grow once more.
It is the solemn duty of we servants of decay to this territory from the unsavoury touch of Undeath.
Claim these pirate lands for Prince Slaanesh, for to steal from thieves, themselves already drenched in sin, is a deadly and delicious perversion indeed.
The Unliving can have no domain, for their attempts to shirk death offend the Changer of Ways. Let the invasion begin.
Into the Depths
The Drowning Dead
The Great Plundering
Claim the Tide
Death's Icy Hand
Stealing From Thieves
Sin Upon Sin
Kingdom of the Dead

There must be industry here, but in the service of the Dragon it sits stagnant and unproductive. Let us take it from them and show them what use can be made of the land and of its teeming peoples in the service of Hashut.
All Cathay must be united under our Celestial Emperor. Reclaim these lands from our misguided kin.
The Dragon's mortal fools inhabit this region. They must learn that their paltry empire is bound for destruction. The invasion begins!
Let the Dragons understand that their pitiful empire is bound for destruction. Rip their lands from them.
The scheming Dragon does not deserve his empire. Seize his lands from him, let them thrive under Ursun!
The irksome Dragon must be brought down a peg or two. Tear these lands from his grasp, and then shower them in glorious filth.
Wrest these lands from the joyless Celestial Empire and join them to our sin-drenched domain, for the Lord of Excess desires to drink deep of the Dragon's outrage.
The stagnant kingdom of Cathay is destined to one day fall. Once these lands are stolen from the Dragon, the great collapse may begin.
Eastern Promises
Grand Reunification
Divesting the Dragon
Disorder Upon the Dragon
Descaling
Remove His Scaled Grip
Delectable Disharmony
Celestial Change

The physical in service of the ethereal – this we can understand. But why this thankless concept of "Chaos Undivided", ignored by all gods, rather than the demands of the one true god, Hashut, Lord of Fire and Metal? Take it from them, crush them, and repurpose it to his service.
Drive the Great Enemy from these fallen lands, and let them by cleansed by the Emperor's Celestial light.
Lesser Daemons such as these deserve no kingdom to call their own. Their dominion must become ours.
The would-be usurper must know ruin. Shatter his meagre empire, and claim these lands for Kharneth!
We must put this traitor to all mankind in his place. Without a sprawling kingdom, the fiend will be no threat.
Our Ruinous kin must be made less troublesome. We should carve off a prize piece of their kingdom for the Urfather.
These meagre little Daemons do not deserve a kingdom of their own. It must instead belong to the true Lord of Darkness.
Our would-be brother in darkness cannot be permitted to rival the Changer's fathomless power. Tear his dark domain from him.
Daemonic Excursion
Drive Out the Daemons
Greater Daemons
Punish the Pretender
Chaos Country
The Undeserving
Ideas Above Their Station
Promotion Denied

These fallen Elves are not knowingly generous, but they have prepared this region well for us, for terror, slavery and cruelty are their watchwords. In thanks, we shall snatch it from them and bleed their ancient bodies out in Hashut's service. They will appreciate that!
No more shall Druchii wickedness blight these realms! Let the Moon Empress' love bring light to darkness.
Soak the Druchii's lands in their pale gore, then claim them as our own.
These time-wasting sadists are without honour. Punish them by seizing their realms for the Skull Throne.
Let they who revel in suffering go without their homes. Perhaps then they will truly understand despair.
These nasty pieces of work must be made to part with a slice of their wicked empire. We shall make it so much more morbid.

The Druchii come close to achieving the dizziest heights of excess, but forever fall at the final hurdle. Seize their realm from them, for only under Slaanesh's rule may its people reach a zenith of dark sensation.
The Druchii believe their singular mercilessness armours them against all loss. Their delusion shall be revealed when we rob them of their dominion.
Prepared Cruelty
By the Light of the Moon
Naggaroth Diminished
Capturing Cruelty
Sadists' Justice
Naggaroth Fragmented
Show Them How It's Done
Suffering is Their Fate

Oh, we will take petty pleasure in this revenge. The Bull Centaurs will slake their appetites on our former brethren, the weak traitors who abandoned us long ago. Some will be sacrifices, some meat, some will work for us and merely wish for death. A new entry for their Dammaz Kron...
The Emperor desires these Dwarfen lands. Claim them, in his immortal name.
Let the Dawi tunnels run red with their weakling blood! Once the slaughter is done, their domain shall belong to Daemons.
Let their halls run with blood! Let skulls rain down their mountains! Let Daemons stalk their corpse-strewn tunnels!
Drag them from their halls and the tunnels! Let the light of Kislev bring purity!
Grandfather hungers for these Dwarfen lands. Turf out the bothersome little mortals and spread decay far and wide.
What use have the vapid Dawi have for a kingdom of their own? They will only squander it on the passionless pursuit of grudges and gold. These lands deserve a more imaginative master.
The Dawi must be punished for their cheerlessly unchanging ways. The abrupt loss of their lands will surely demonstrate how short and meaningless their lives truly are.
Filial Bonds
Tall Order
Conquer the Crafters
The Damned Dawi
Sweep the Halls
Hall of the Ruinous King
True Decadence
A Long-Fated Grudge

They call this an empire? Look at their weak industry, their feeble foundries and cannons, the slimness of their legs... even their Labourers think themselves free as they work in squalor and misery. Crush their defences, break their walls and show them how a true empire comports itself.
Wrest these realms from the dour and shrunken Empire of Sigmar. They shall prosper under Cathay.
The fool Sigmarites must be driven from their lands. Wholesale slaughter shall surely achieve this.
The foolish men of Sigmar must known the Murder Lord's unbridled fury. Slaughter them without mercy, and claim their lands for Khorne.
For too long did these pampered fools benefit from Kislev's sacrifice. The Motherland will take what it is due!
Prise these provinces from the joyless slaves of Sigmar, and liven them up with a glorious pox or two.
As delectable as it is to seduce and break the lords of Sigmar's Empire one by one, our Dark Prince finds himself hungry to secure a more significant portion of their kingdom.
The Well of Eternity speaks: the Empire of man shall wane. The prophesied collapse shall begin once we seize their dour lands for the Great Schemer.
Iron Empires
A Greater Power
The End of Order
Stolen From Sigmar
Better to Take Than to Give
Usurping Ulric
Expedite the Exquisite
The Fall Begins
Take this region for the glory of Hashut. Ready the machines of war, equip our warriors, make sure the Hobgoblins are in the front rank, and crush all who resist!
The Celestial Empire must forever grow. Let these lands know the Dragon's light.
The Ruinous Powers crave territory. We must not disappoint them. Eviscerate the whelps who dwell upon these lands, and claim them for Chaos!
Khorne makes claim upon their lands! Eviscerate all who stand in the way of His brutal decree.
For the sake of all her people, the Motherland must expand, and our faithless enemies must be reduced.
We'll never make our beloved Grandfather happy if we fail to spread his bilious message far and wide. Claim these lands for Him!

The Lord of Excess grows tired of the same sights, and demands that we frolic in a new boudoir. Naturally, it must have room enough for countless thousands of His concubines. This realm should suffice.
Grant these lands the gift of Change! Prise their masters' hands from them, and bless them with endless turmoil and tumult.
A New Waste
Bringers of Harmony
The Ruinous Crusade
The Murder Lord Makes Claim
For the Motherland!
A Gift for Grandfather
An Ocean of Flesh
Change, & Not a Moment Too Soon

Foolish rabble. When at war, none can resist their rampaging hordes. But take the war to their door, make them step to the rhythm of your war-drums, and you have them. Take this land from the Greenskins and put them to work!
The green beasts despoil all land they walk upon. We must free these sorry realms from them.
Slaughter these mindless animals, and claim their domain as our own. The Dark Gods demand it!
Rejoice, for the time has come to wade knee-deep in green gore, and claim these lands for the Hunter of Souls.
We must prise their lands from their dead, green hands, before the foul beasts overwhelm us.
These murderous primitives fail to see the value in slow death, beauteous decay and glorious rebirth. They do not deserve a kingdom.
These bellowing 'boyz' do nothing of interest with the lands they seize and ravage. We must instead make them our own, and raise their forlorn people to indescribable new heights of dark sensation.
The Raven God grows weary of the green mortals' reign of terror. As their lands diminish, so too shall their dull-witted ferocity.
Horde Assault
Raised Up From Barbarism
Drain the Green Swamp
Bother the Boyz
Turn Back the Green Tide
Torn From Their Green Grasp
An Education
In the Mouth of Madness

What a treat for Hashut and his people! Not only do we have a chance to crush the arrogant Elves, but we shall also take their land from them, pull down their elegant towers and put them to work in our furnaces. They shall not live long, but we shall delight in both crushing them and in their short suffering...
In their arrogance, the Ulthuani believe they are entitled to all the realms they please. This delusion must be corrected.
Seize this territory forthwith, for only once no more Asur infest this world can Chaos achieve true dominion over it.
Scrub the hated stain of order from these Asur lands. The Skull Throne makes claim!
Their pompous sorcery and their undeserved arrogance cannot mask their weakness. Their lands shall be ours!
Seize these appalling lands of order and purity, and remake them in our foetid image.
We must liberate these Asur lands from joyless sterility, and grant them rebirth through depravity. Where once there was order there shall instead be sin beyond all imagining.
These dour lands of order must become the lands of eternal change. Liberate them from Ulthuan's dreary grasp.
Twin Delights
Oust the Asur
Snuff Out the Waystones
From Slaughtered Elven Hands
Ulthuan Unseated
Fall of the Asur
Sickening Purity
The Fall of Order

There is little here beyond brass, blood, serfs and an innumerable number of hounds. The brass we shall keep, reforge into our machines of war, but the rest we shall bury with their slaughter-handed masters.
These blasted lands must know harmony once more. Drive the Great Enemy's blood-fiends from them.
Drive Kharneth's slavering servants from this land with unrelenting force, and make it our own.
They who have betrayed Khorne must be parted from both their lands and their lives. Let the blood flow forth!
Drive back the fiends of blood! Bestow Kislev's purity upon the lands they despoil!
Simple barbarity is no fun at all. Show Kharneth the door, and let these lands know plague and pus in glorious abundance.
When we seize Khorne's blood-soaked lands from him, how the Perfect Prince shall moan in ecstasy to know of the Murder Lord's inchoate rage.
Never does Kharneth do anything of worth with the land he conquers. Let these sad realms be remade by Great Tzeeneth's touch.
Where There's Blood...
Showing Khorne the Door
The Land of Skulls
Blood Debt
Take from the Skull-Takers
Stolen From the Lord of Murder
Revel in His Fury
Bring Life to the Wasteland
