Disappointingly bearded these servants of Kislev may be, but more disappointing is their tedious adherence to order and their useless devotion to their dead Bear-God. Crush them, then salt their fields and roads.
No land can know greatness under Kislev's backward rule. Let these realms fulfil their potential as part of Grand Cathay.
These sickening slaves of order must be slain, and their lands claimed for Daemonkind. Ursun shall weep!
How Khorne fumes to see these mortals bow to the weakling bear-god. Depriving them of their lands will be a fitting punishment.
The traitors deserve nothing! Their realms must be cleansed of heresy and restored to the Motherland!
These particularly dour mortals must forsake a modicum of their precious Motherland. Seize them for the Urfather!
Seize these mortals for divine Slaanesh, and let the rigid, frigid orthodoxy of Kislev give way to countless forbidden pleasures.
This realm's glorious potential is squandered by Kislev's drab and short-sighted rule. We must change its fate.
Salted Snow
Topple the Tzars
Usurping Ursun
A Frozen Forfeit
One Kislev
The Motherland's Sacrifice
Poke the Bear
The Motherland Reborn

Their cold blood must make these lizards stupid – their ancient masters are long-gone, but still they carry out their orders and plans without question. Better their temples and lands are in our hands, where we can dedicate them to Hashut, who lives and demands endlessly.
Our ancestors cannot know peace until we have liberated these lands from the reptiles' cold-blooded cruelty.
Eviscerate these deluded coldbloods, and make claim upon their domain. The Ruinous Powers demand it!
These sad leftovers of a bygone age must at last know extinction. Drive them from their realm!
These black-hearted reptiles bear only malice for Mankind. We must drive them back, and seize their kingdoms for Kislev.
Repellent reptiles begone! Claim their dank lairs for the Fly Lord, and let the buboes grow where they may.
Let us remove these dour, scheming lizards from their muggy nests, and populate them instead with heaving bodies, moaning in endless rapture and gasping in unbearable agony.
Seize these reptilian lands! How the Great Conspirator will laugh as the Cold Ones' ancient plans fall into disarray.
Temple to Greed
Lair of the Lizards
Realm of the Reptiles
Scales Shall Fall
Lust for Lustria
Polluting the Spawning Pools
Desecrate the Temples
Take the Temples

A purposeless raiding base for the Norscan fools. They do not see the resources buried beneath; the mis-employed strength in their arms. We shall take it from them and teach them to employ their power to better, stronger ends.
The Great Enemy's deluded marauders soak these realms in blood. The Emperor will tolerate this no longer.
They serve Chaos, but they are mere mortals. They have no worth. Kill as many as is required to seize control of their blighted kingdom.
These servants of Chaos should offer their land to Khorne willingly. If they will not, seize it from their dead hands.
The marauding Norscans are a threat to all life. To stem their threat, we must seize all we can from them.
These Ruin-worshipping mortals of Norsca should be willing to receive the gift of rot. As they are not, we must simply take their blighted lands from them.
These rage-filled mortals have done much to further the cause of degradation, but their minds and senses are so limited. Only once Slaanesh dominates their lands can they ascend to true excess.
Claim this Norscan domain, and let madness grip their mortal minds as they realise their worship of Chaos has won them only Ruin.
Hidden Wealth
Reign of Terror
Careful What You Wish For
Meeting Their Maker
Blood-Soaked Earth
Offerings to Their God
The Promise
Norsca Must Make an Offering

Disgusting horror – block your noses or burn strong incense, for Nurgle has taken this place and made it His! Once we take it, we shall cauterise it with fire, burn out the infection and rebuild it to the productive glory of Hashut, clean and industrious.
These realms swim in bile and poison. Drain the filth from them, and let them bathe instead in the Moon Dragon's light.
The Urfather's garden must be diminished. Drive out his droning children and gain dominion over his pestilent lands.
Drive Nurgleth's buboes from these festering lands, and instead let them run rich with blood.
Without territory, their vile disease cannot spread. We must flatten the curve of infection without delay.
All children must learn to share with others. Prise these foetid lands from the festering hands of our sometime kin.
We must save these lands of Nurgleth from foetid misery. Scrub away the decay, and let sensation reign in its place.
The festering slaves of Nurgleth are surely too slow-witted to prevent us stealing their foetid realm from them.
Cauterised Infection
The Emperor is the Antidote
A Purgation
How Bilious is My Garden
Plague-Breaker
Putrefied Inheritance
Clean Sheets
A Bilious Burglary

An Ogrish village is a fascinating system, all inputs to the relentless hunger of the Ogres and their Great Maw. Once we have taken it from them – and crushed the tottering idiots in the process – we shall redirect its efforts to our ends and the war machine of Hashut.
We must liberate these lands from the ravenous Ogres, before they consume every last living soul within them.
The bone-strewn lands of the halfwit Ogres shall make a fine domain for our Daemons. Seize them!
The bone-strewn realm of these singularly witless mortals must belong instead to the Skull Throne.
Wherever Ogres roam, only death and despair follows. We must liberate these forsaken lands from them.
Drive out these tiresome gluttons, and let their gore-strewn kingdom become the home of countless and wonderful new contagions.
The Ogres are creatures of great excess, but their meagre brains restrict them to only the most obvious and base sensations. Once their lands belong to Slaanesh, there shall be no such limitations.
If all these mortal brutes can think to do with their domain is litter it with bones, they do not deserve it. Claim these lands for the Changer, and let them thrive.
System of Doom
Back to the Mountains
Evicting the Butchers
Bullying the Bulls
Removeable Feast
Cast Out the Cannibals
The Doors of Perception
A Lack of Imagination

This will be a challenge, even for our industrious workers. A tiny part of this settlement is on the surface, rat-riddled filth and ramshackle buildings, the rest is buried deep under the ground. Our Labourers and Hobgoblins will have to dig deep to root out the last rat.
Vermin have no place in the Emperor's ancient plan for this world. Drive them out, and let these lands be cleansed.
Slaughter the worthless vermin in their warrens, and claim their pestilent province in the name of Chaos!
Burn the vermin from their filth-caked warrens, and remake the land in Khorne's blazing image.
No land infested by vermin can know peace or safety. We must clasp these blighted realms to the Motherland's bosom.
Though the vermin have made their domain delightfully pestilent, to truly thrive it must belong to the Urfather. Dispatch the rodents and claim this blighted land for Him.
These rodent mortals spread only disease and despair. The Dark Prince weeps to see good land squandered so. Once our Daemonettes cavort across this realm, His spirits shall surely lift.
Let sorcerous fire cleanse the filth from these verminous warrens. Under Tzeeneth's all-knowing rule, these lands shall ascend.
The Rat-Hole
Cleanse the Sewers
Good Riddance to Bad Rats
Ruin the Rodents
Vermin Vandals
From One Filthy Hand to Another
Another Kind of Filth
Reborn in Blue & Gold

What laxity in this place, but also what Labour? So much work to no purpose. We shall overwhelm them, tear down their walls, and dismantle their dens of iniquity, yet never understand the impulses that drive them to such pointless depravity.
Let these wicked lands know purity and harmony once more! Liberate them from the Great Enemy's foul sin!
Tear these Slaaneshi from their sin-soaked beds, and claim their pleasure-steeped lands for ourselves.
Liberate these lands from the feckless decadence of Slaanesh. Let them instead know the purity of rage.
These dens of sin and depravity can stand no more! In the Motherland's embrace, they shall be made pure.
Begone, shiftless pleasure-seekers! Grandfather Nurgle has the most wonderfully foul plans for their goo-drenched dominion.
Our purple kin have ceased to delight Lord Slaanesh. He would have His most favoured concubines tear their domain from them, for He trusts that we will remake them as playgrounds of unspeakable sin.
The idle pleasure-seekers allow their domain to go to seed as they fiddle and fondle. These lands deserve a more thoughtful master.
Whips & Chains
The Great Purge
The Milk of Paradise
Honour After Sin
Wretched Hives
A Different Kind of Filth
Disappointing Deviancy
Squandered by Sin

Bones and dry sands and dust. Nothing lives here, but an undying drive to continue remains. Once we have defeated these brittle horrors, once our Daemonsmiths have broken the ancient magics, at least we will have a clean slate to begin our work.
Undeath taints these realms. We must cleanse them of Necromancy, and bring the Emperor's Celestial light to them.
None may cheat death and pay no price for it. We must divest these once-mortal abominations of their undeserved kingdom.
Restore honour to the realm of the undying. Under Khorne, they will at last know glory.
We must rid these lands of Necromancy's unholy taint. As part of Kislev, they will know life and pride once more.
Show these death-cheaters what they've been missing, and let their dusty lands at last know the glory of decay.
These ghouls' fleshless bodies are incapable of pleasure. We must drive them out, and through degradation and depravity their dead lands shall be truly reborn.
Free these realms from their dead overlords, and let them ascend into ever-changing glory as part of the Changer's impossible kingdom.
The Empty Ossuary
Kings of Ruin
Displace the Dead
Turning Over the Tombs
Disinterment
Keys to the Skeleton Kingdom
The Resurrection
Dead Lands Reborn

The settlements of Tzeentch defy mortal logic. Staircases climb to nowhere, temples lack doors, statues gibber prophecy. Such meaningless richness in the service of an unknowable ultimate end. Let our war machines break it all asunder, frustrate the Changer's plans, and create purposive cruelty in its place.
These lands are touched by madness most foul. Free them from Chi'an Chi's grasp, and let them know harmony once more.
Seize these lands for our Daemonic legion, and in doing so prove that there are occurrences beyond the sight of the Architect of Fates.
Leave the Raven's twisted lands burned and bare – fertile ground to raise Khorne's legion of blood.
Mutation, deception and sorcery most foul blights these lands. Drive the Raven's twisted slaves from them!
We simply can't allow the Changer to keep on disrupting the great cycle of death, decay and rebirth. Please, liberate these lands from his infuriating trickery.
Any land ruled by Tzeentch becomes entwined in his tedious, endless schemes. Great Slaanesh must dominate them instead, and bestow eternal rapture and breath-taking suffering upon them.
All servants of Tzeeneth understand that no thing may remain static. And so it is that our misguided changeling kin must be parted from their kingdom.
Infinite Destruction
Chasing Out Chi'an Chi
Reject the Raven
Change is Upon Them
Change Undone
To Burgle the Bird
A Higher Calling
The Cost of Complacency

Lands that have felt the Vampire's touch hold an odd loyalty to their masters – something that flows in the thrall populations' blood perhaps, for their masters and defenders farm them as cattle. It will be a struggle to overcome them and claim this settlement as our own.
Let the dead haunt these lands no more! We must restore life and light to their twilight realms.
They are dead, whether they accept it or not. They have no need of land. Rip it from them!
Khorne demands that we scour the loathsome taint of Undeath from the dominion of Vampires.
Despair and suffering haunts these lands. Kislev must drive out their unholy masters, and restore the light of day.
Cleanse these twilight realms of the blasphemous taint of Undeath, and let them at last know Nurgle's bounteous and bilious gifts.
Though these Vampires know a thing or two about suffering and seduction, their dead flesh is capable of only limited sensation. Only once we dominate their lands shall true excess be possible.
For their attempts to cheat their final fate, these ghouls must deprived of their domain. Let the Changer's eldritch fire burn away its choking darkness.
Thrall State
Draw Back the Curtain
Dark Purification
Counting the Cost
Cast Out Shadow
Den of the Dead
Dark Embrace
Shine a Sorcerous Light

The smelters of Zharr-Naggrund hunger for settlements like this, for fuel living or dead. Crush the wood-slaves, cut down their tree-Daemons and claim the smouldering ruins. Then build on the ashes new icons for the worship of Hashut.
The Elves of the forest guard their realm jealously, but it is imperative that Cathay gains dominion over these lands.
Impale them on their boughs, hang them from their treetops, and claim their forest kingdom for Chaos!
Burn them from their trees! Leave their verdant lands blackened and burned, ready to be remade by Khorne's savage will.
Drive the coward forest-skulkers from their trees, and let this land thrive beneath Kislev's flag.
All this growth and greenery simply won't do. Cut down these nauseating Elves, and let the great rot blacken their treasured lands.
The forest Elves are beautiful indeed, and Slaanesh thirsts to sin with each and every one of them. We should seize their domain, so that He may slake His lusts.
The Wood Elves have long believed they can hide from destiny. Let destiny come instead to their leafy door, and great Tzeentch shall tear their domain from them.
Prepare the Furnaces
Force Out the Fey
Wicked Woods
Isha's Lament
Deforestation
From Copses to Corpses
A Thirsty God
Twisted Trees

From atop their caparisoned steeds, with the arrogance of centuries of privilege they sneer at us, we know. They do not understand the glory of our ways, the tale of brass and fire. Pull them down, strip them of their gaudiness and beat their breastplates flat, for Bretonnia is and always has been the enemy of Hashut!
Though the Emperor mourns it, Cathay must take up arms against the Lady's legions. No other option remains.
The time has come. Kislev shall prove that they are soft as lambs beneath their polished steel.
War of the Lady
A Bit of a Bretonnian Brawl
The Lady Trembles

Untameable, you say? Wild are their eyes; guttural their tongues. These Beastmen are heedless fools! Our legions shall pacify their bleating and force them to lower their gaze – make of the raiders and beasts mere livestock to fatten our bellies. War comes...
Make these foul mutants understand that the Dragon Empire will not rest until they are eradicated.
We must go to war against these beasts. Though they worship the Gods of Chaos, they know nothing of their Ruinous design.
Ensure these drooling beasts understand that they are bound for the slaughter.
Kislev is duty-bound to eradicate these abhorrent beasts of Chaos, as we are all servants of Ruin.
The beasts have had their murderous fun. It's high time we put them out to pasture.
The Prince of Pleasure has lost all patience with these wrathful beasts. We must go forth and flay their brute souls in His name.
These animals of Ruination have served their purpose. They must burn in the dancing fires of Change.
Hashut's Herd
Harangue the Hideous Herd
The Wildest Hunt
Ritual Sacrifice
Cull the Herd
Cleaving Cloven Hooves
Fit of Pique
Merciless Evolution

Slaves of Ruin they are, wandering without purpose. Yet Hashut's liturgies – the orisons of the furnaces, the agonies of the burned sacrifice – are so close at hand. In war, we shall reduce them and they shall come to learn the true measure of the one true god of Chaos.
Cathay cannot stand idly by as the Great Enemy rains terror upon this world.
Let these lesser slaves of Ruin understand that doom is upon them. Ready our Daemons for war!
A war of Chaos shall please Khorne greatly, for the show of might and fury will surely be unforgettable.
As our forefathers did, and their forefathers before them, we must stand against the Chaos tide!
It's about time these battle-crazed bores learned that there is no higher power than the Lord of Decay.
As these champions of Ruin refuse to give themselves body and soul to Prince Slaanesh, they must be punished. Oh yes, they must. Prepare the flails.
Inform these worshippers of Ruin that the Changer will indeed grant them the reward they begged for. Total destruction is upon them.
Warriors of Naught
Forever the Bastion
The Touch of Evil
Clash of Chaos
The Legacy
The War On Ruin
They Chose Poorly
Ask & Ye Shall Receive

The Unliving blight the lands and seas alike, yet these bloodless corsairs have torn our beards for the last time. Our warriors wait for them ashore, heavy-helmed, machines ready to crush their frail timbers and bones. Once they have met the Dhrath-Zharr, no longer a-raiding they shall go.
Their unnatural cruelty disturbs the Dragon Emperor greatly. We must go to war against the dead.
Ursun can tolerate this Unliving blight no longer! His children must march against the dead!
Plundered Depths
Conquer the Coast
A Cleansing Tide
The Dragon-Emperor and his kin might be powerful, but they are mere mortals compared to the glory of an eternal god such as Hashut. Cut them and their minions down and Cathay shall know true power.
We have been betrayed by our own. No option remains but to regain Cathay's unity by force.
This ancient Dragon Empire cares not for mankind. Kislev must rise against them!
Scaled Heights
The War Within
Dragon's Demise

Useful they were for distracting our foes with their brutal terror and wild monstrosity or for building into our engines of war. But now the Daemons of the Dark Gods stand in Hashut's way. Send them back to the Realms of Chaos, so they may trouble our reign no more.
They are the shame of Daemonkind! Let all this world know that we intend to eradicate them.
The pretender prince must be cut down. Rain the Blood Lord's fury upon him!
The ascended mortal has developed ideas far above his station. We must put him in his place. Let it be war!
The Dark Prince demands that we visit untold suffering upon these fiends of Chaos, for their master is a false Daemon, hungry for undeserved Godhood.
Our brothers in darkness have become a pernicious obstacle to our great scheme. We must hasten their inevitable doom.
Free Spirits
The War of Ruin
Prince of Ruin
A Pox Upon the Prince
The Sins of the Father
Feckless Fiends

The Elves of Naggaroth have long sought to purloin our slaving masses and take them for their own or worse, waste their blood on sacrifices to their weakling gods when they could be toiling in our mines. Their excesses, their encroaches, were a mistake, one they must learn of soon.
The twisted Elves of Naggaroth must be made to understand that Cathay will unflinchingly put an end to their cruelty.
The Druchii are wicked beyond reason. No proud Kislevite can rest easy until they are beaten back.
Slavers Enslaved
The War On Wickedness
Negating Naggaroth

Against our cousins, there can be no good arguments against war, whether it is ancient betrayals or recent insults, whether they foolishly worship our forebears or their thin-beards. Justice and pleasure we will enjoy in equal measure when we have razed their citadels and rendered their flesh!
The mountain Dwarfs are an unfortunate obstacle to our Emperor's hallowed ambitions. Cathay must stand against them.
The vaunted honour of the Dwarfs is nothing more than a deception. One Kislev will endure no longer!
Tangled History
One More For the Book
War of Endurance

The humans consider themselves good and true, but the same Chaotic purposes dwell in their chests as in ours. The difference is our fortitude, our unified purpose. Crush the squabbling tribes of men and their divided Empire, and take the survivors back to the altars and furnaces.
These fools of Sigmar spread only misery. For the sake of harmony, the Dragon Empire must make its stand.
The pampered and perfumed men of the south show no gratitude for Kislev's endless sacrifice. Retribution must come!
Imperial Fortitude
Distant Empire
Schism

The Hobgoblins must cease their internecine backstabbing; the Bull Centaurs leave the preceptories of the fanes of Hashut; the warriors and war machines march onward from our forges and mines. War comes to the Dhrath-Zharr and we will not let it leave without our victory.
Our foe must fall, for Kislev must endure, always!
The Dhrath-Zharr March
Motherland Rising

The eternal pestilence of the Greenskins troubles us again? Another tribe of marauding Orcs and Goblins encroaching on our demesne. The Conclave of Evil has ordered this rabble eliminated once again – it would be wise to acquire their favour.
Cathay must rise against these marauding monsters, for if we cannot stem the green tide, no other can hope to.
Only Kislev can rid this world of Greenskin horror. We must make our stand against destruction!
Rabble Without A Cause
Boyz No More
Orcs Must Die

In reputation, the High Elves are second only to the Lizardmen in their ancient wisdom. Yet here they are, troubling us without need, provoking our ire. We shall remind them of our prowess – remind them why the Dhrath-Zharr are known as the Eldest Race.
Ulthuan stands in the Celestial Dragon's way. For Grand Cathay to truly prosper, the Elven legions must fall.
The Ulthuani believe themselves superior to all others. They must understand how gravely mistaken they are.
Eldest Indeed
The War of the Waystones
A Lesson In Manners

Carnage, relentless carnage. Blood spilled at the slightest whim. A rich land depopulated, made unproductive for all but skull-taking. A God of Chaos in the truest sense, then, is Lord Khorne. He will be happy with his own warrior's blood, we know, as will Hashut.
There must come a war with the slaves of the Skull Throne. Truly, it will be an odyssey of slaughter.
The Skull Throne demands that our disloyal kin be shown true Khornate brutality.
We've been chummy with these blood-bores for far too long. The Maggotkin must rise against the Skull Throne.
War is all these Khornate simpletons live for, so to grant them their woefully unimaginative wish causes Slaanesh no small measure of dismay. Needs must, however.
We cannot allow Kharneth to prevail in the Great Game. The legions of Change must make their stand against those enslaved by blood.
Brass & Iron
The Dethronement
Death in the Family
Scabs For the Skull Throne
Indulging the Blood God
Our Next Move

Interfering bear-lovers, skulking in their land of ice and snow. Wherefore do they contend with us when they know our deadly ire? Snuff out their weakling flame and let the scent of burnt sacrifice act as praise to our true god.
The stubborn fools of Kislev have stood in our way for too long. Our ancestors cry out for their destruction.
The traitors must be executed forthwith. The Motherland does not forgive.
Burnt Sacrifice
Batter the Bear
Ursun's Judgement

In their coldblooded planning of centuries past, we can see a certain kindred but their commitment to order and against the true gods is offensive to our eyes. Punish them for their arrogance, that they seek to outwit the deep cunning of the Dhrath-Zharr.
Make these lizards tremble in their lairs, for the greatest and most ancient of reptiles demands their obliteration.
Their unknowable minds scheme against us even now. We must strike before they do.
Blood, Spilled Cold
Always a Bigger Lizard
Cold Logic

The barbaric villagers of the northern shores are but cowardly raiders, unwilling to face the might of our forces in true battle. Let us call their bluff, engage them in true war, and enjoy their anguish and suffering before we end them.
There is nothing more abhorrent than men sworn to Chaos. Cathay must stem this brutal tide without delay.
These deluded mortals must be made to understand that true Ruinous power shall never be theirs. Sound the cacophonous drums of war!
With blade and claw, punish these mortal followers of ruin for their disobedience.
If left unchecked, these deluded slaves to Chaos will sow unspeakable destruction. We must act now!
Their devotion to Ruination is sweet, but at the end of the day they are mere mortals. We must bring death and decay to them, like all the rest.
It is time these mortals encounter that which they so revere in the flesh, so to speak. How uncontrollably they will drool and moan as we delicately flay their battle-scarred flesh from them.
The ranting and raving of these Norscan mortals becomes exceedingly tiresome. The Great Conspirator desires that we change their murderous cacophony to blissful silence.
Raider's Bluff
Servants of Destruction
Never Meet Your Heroes
The Wolf-Father Revealed
Pre-Emptive Strike
Angering Their God
Drink Full & Descend
Quell Their Chattering

A pox on Nurgle's pustulent house! Wherever we spread our industry, wherever Hashut's fanes and factories are raised, comes the Plaguefather and his endless miseries, sparing not even those of us blessed with stone and metal. Fire will burn away his infection!
Their pox-ridden stain must spread no more. Inform the Fly Lord's bilious dogs that they are bound for destruction.
Bring doom upon the slothful children of Nurgleth! They shall learn the true meaning of destruction.
Grandfather's garden is, alas, not big enough for all His children. Let our bilious kin know that they will soon receive the joyous gift of death.
The Perfect Prince wishes that we arrest the spread of joyless decay. Once the servants of the Fly Lord are eradicated, ever-changing excess may thrive once more.
Stagnant Nurgleth stands in the way of glorious change. We must remove his rancid followers from play.
Inoculation
Stop the Rot
Cure Through Carnage
A Decomposing Dispute
Cleansing the Bedchamber
Lancing the Boil

Tedious monstrosities, obsessed with only the impossible task of sating their appetites and turned their lands into bone-strewn wastes. Without their depredations, this would be a fine domain to raise fanes to Hashut. Topple their gut-lords, like the filth they are!
The Ogres spread terror far and wide. The Celestial Empire must go to war against these mountain monsters.
The mountain brutes hunger to devour Kislev's children. War is necessary, whatever it may cost us.
Bone-Strewn Kingdoms
Untold Butchery
March Upon the Maw

Why are these rat-men in such profusion? Has their kind been blessed by their hidden god with monstrous fecundity? Eradicate them all, wherever we find them, lest they overwhelm us from beneath with their endless masses.
Cathay must eradicate these pestilent pests. Let the skulking rodents suffer the full and incomparable might of the Dragon Empire.
The vermin tide will sweep across the world, without mercy or restraint. The Motherland must put them down.
Scurrying to War
Empty the Sewers
Staunch the Flow

What miserable seductions the Pleasure God offers. Nothing can shake our delight in Hashut's gifts, not even the cruellest promises or the meanest beauty. War will be our answer to their whispered secrets – a war of pain to teach them respect.
They have seduced us into peaceful co-existence for far too long. Tell these Slaaneshi whelps that we intend to slaughter them to a one.
The honourless pleasure-seekers must face penance. The Hunter of Souls demands it!
Great Nurgle is sick to the back teeth of the Dark Prince's self-indulgent frivolity. It's high time we made His feelings known.
Slaanesh desires to see his concubines wreak agony upon one another. The louder the agonised screams of our errant kin become, the greater His ecstasy shall be.
In the Raven's name, let these masters of excess experience madness and suffering beyond even their darkest imaginings.
Small Pleasures
Mutual Suffering
Decadence Denied
Pleasure vs Pestilence
Master & Servants
No More Games

O slow, ancient dead, what business do you have with the Dhrath-Zharr? Our hearts beat darkly and mightily as you drag your dust-dry bones to battle once more. Smoke and flame will herald a welcome end to your long afterlives.
Our ancestor spirits demand that their children rise up against the scourge of Undeath.
There is only greed in the hearts of these Unliving tyrants. Kislev will stand against them!
The Final Cartouche
The Final Dynasty
Mass Regicide

We grow weary of nipping these endless conspiracies in the bud; tire of the Architect of Fate's fickle plans and sorcerous interference in our lands. In battle, magic or not, we will pin His indecision down and eliminate his plans completely.
Their lies and trickery have spared them the axe until now, but all things must change. Let Tzeentch's mutants quail as they learn that war is nigh.
Let there be war, savage and glorious! Put an end to the Changer's meagre trickery!
There must be no more secrets and lies. Please let the Raven God's duplicitous servants know that pestilent punishment will soon be upon them.
The Raven's twisted servants must be taken to new echelons of agony. Let there be war, for the shrieks of suffering changelings are music to the Dark Prince's perfectly-formed ears.
Let our eldritch fire consume our errant kin, and their souls shall then be sent to serve Lord Tzeentch for all eternity.
A Plotted Route
Outplayed at the Great Game
The Great Game is Afoot
His Riddles Undone
Birdsong
Their Destiny Realised

Where is the respect we are due? The Vampire Counts look down at their alabaster noses at us, as if we were Dawi-Yar, beneath their contempt. Yet we have a god's might behind us, not mere ancestors, and their disdain insults us and him. They will understand better when our armies march through their rotten gates and fire their catafalques.
These foul abominations must stalk the land no more. Cathay shall bring light to darkness.
These monsters cannot be permitted to spread night across the land. The Motherland must wage war against death!
Lofty Heights
The War On Midnight
Ice & Blood

One cannot emphasise the irritation one feels when axe bites tree to be greeted for the umpteenth time by an angry Dryad. It is simpler then to eliminate them all, and their Elven helpers and their gods, at one stroke. War we shall have, for lumber and fire!
Though the Fey Folk are a force to be reckoned with, we cannot shirk our duty. Cathay must go to war!
Their trees and their spells will not protect their coward hides when Kislev comes calling.
War of the Trees
The Trees Themselves Shall Tremble
War On Nature

Our kin have requested our aid against an enemy whose reckless incompetence endangers us all. This wazzock must be dealt with at once, for the sake of our dark empire!\\n\\nSend your assassins against this fool and ensure their actions can no longer persist.
This one has made an enemy of our kin. Eliminate the wretch and their loyalty to us is assured.
Our fellow Daemons hunger for this fool's brutal demise. Make it so, and we will gain their capricious favour.
Our kin demand a prize skull. Claim it for them and prove yourself in the eyes of Khorne.
Our comrades suffer at the hands of this wretch. They will show boundless gratitude should we slay their faithless foe.
Grant this one the gift of oblivion. As their dead fluids seep into the earth, our kin shall grow closer to us.
Our kin thirst for this one's soul. Slay the wretch so that our allies may drink deep of their life-essence, and their gratitude shall surely be boundless.
Our kin request our aid in their great conspiracy. This champion is an aggravating obstacle requiring swift removal.
Assassin's Alliance
The Enemy of Dragons
Hell Asks a Favour
Always a Pleasure
Enemy of the State
Bring Them Decay
A Soul for the Offering
Worthless Puppet

A fellow Dawi-Zharr is being hindered by an enemy whose lands prove stubborn and defiant to conquest. This is a problem we can easily rectify.\\n\\nRally your armies at once, and ready the engines of war. We must size their land on behalf of our kin!
A fellow lord of Cathay finds themselves in need of further lands. It would be prudent of us to provide.
Claim these lands and we shall stoke joy in our allies' murderous hearts. The rewards shall surely be manifold.
Fellow warriors of Kharneth crave new lands to rampage through. We should oblige, and demonstrate our incomparable might.
We must claim these lands for Kislev. Our proud countrymen shall rejoice once their enemies are driven out.
Our fellow children of rot have requested that these lands become part of Grandfather's festering garden. We would be wise to oblige.
Slaanesh desires a new playground, but our fellow concubines find themselves helpless to provide it. Thus, they request that we slake the Perfect Prince's hunger for them.
Our changeling brothers require a grander canvas for their labyrinthine schemes. Should we claim this domain for them, their loyalty is assured.
Called to Conquest
Claimed For the Celestials
Daemonic Desires
Land for the Blood God
Reunification
Friends in Foetid Places
Renovate the Bedroom
Claimed for the Changer

Battered and harassed, a fellow child of Hashut calls for assistance. This is a chance to prove our superiority and cut down their rival in one fell swoop! Send our forces into battle against this fool. Once they are dead, power and glory is sure to be ours for the taking!
Fell this whelp in battle, and there shall be surely harmony between the provinces of Grand Cathay.
Cut this worthless wretch down as their weakling followers watch, and we shall earn the loyalty of our Daemonic kin.
Tear this one apart, and strike terror into their followers' hearts. Then our allies will see that we are superior.
If we can fell their great enemy on the field of battle, our comrades may be minded to unite with us.
Our kin are extremely keen that this foe of theirs begins decomposition as soon as possible. To gain their favour, we should make it so.
Let our blades dance a dance of perfect pain across this one's flesh. How our kin will gasp and moan at the glorious spectacle, and how great their gratitude for such a sensation shall be.
We must hasten this wretch's final fate, for our kin have foreseen that they will otherwise become an infuriating impediment to their glorious deceptions.
Kill That One
Trophy Kill
The Glory of Slaughter
Glory Through Slaughter
Unity Through Death
Add Them to the Tally
Darklings' Delight
Foretold to Die

Our kinsmen’s enemy is advancing with their forces and are in close proximity – something we cannot allow. We must strike out now before they can launch an attack, and show them how true Uzkul-Dhrath-Zharr fight!\\n\\nEngage this Skruff's army and put them all to the blade. Or better yet, crush them beneath the heavy tread of our mighty war machines!
Our allies ask that we deal with this threat. Let our dutiful legions ride to war and greater unity shall follow.
Our hell-sent allies thirst for bloody spectacle. How they shall be entertained as our Daemons march to war against these insects.
Slaughter these whelps, for our blood-kin thirst for their destruction. Perhaps they will align with us once sufficient blood is spilled.
We must go to war against our comrades' foe, and perhaps then the unification of Kislev can proceed.
Our decaying siblings politely ask that we dispatch these nuisances on their behalf. Oh, what a lovely war it shall be.
Our pleasure-hungry kin demand a show of bloody excess. Meet these wretches in battle, and visit untold agonies upon them. As our Daemons drink deep of their foes' souls, our kin shall know rapture.
The Well of Eternity reveals that the legion of Change is bound for conflict with these puppets. Our brothers in divine madness request that we lead the charge.
Fighting for Friends
Wind & Field
Dance of Destruction
How to Make Friends and Slaughter People
Brothers in Arms
Army of Rot
A Feast of Souls
The Moment Has Been Prepared For

Wealth and resources are a necessity for us and our kin, who have reached out in the hope that we can share our supplies. However, why give from our own stocks when we can raid a hated enemy and relieve them of their reserves instead?\\n\\nSend your warriors against our worthless adversary. We must take all they have if we mean to aid our people.
Bestow pillage and ruin with efficiency, and our kin shall show gratitude. In time, they may even swear themselves to us.
Our kin request that we despoil these lands in their name. Though destruction is its own reward, their gratitude will bring other benefits.
Fellow children of Khorne ask that we inflict despair and destruction upon these lands. Refusal would be folly.
Our countrymen request that we spread ruin and despair across their enemy's land. It is our duty to aid them.
Let these lands know pox and pillage, and our bubonic brothers will surely become more sympathetic to our cankerous cause.
Our kin desperately desire to see their enemies laid low. We must visit glorious suffering upon this realm, and have our Daemons draped their supple flesh in stolen finery.
We must bring madness and despair to these lands, for our duplicitous kin desire them weakened. Do this, and they will see that we are the true masters of Change.
Requested Raiding
Gifts for All the Family
The Hunger of Daemons
Blood Money
Shotgun Diplomacy
On a Pale Horse
The Deadliest Weapon is Terror
A Bounty For Our Brothers

All enemies of the Dawi-Zharr are useless wazzocks, serving as nothing more than an embarrassment to our empire and a thorn in the side of our people. The best way to deal with such stains on our reputation is to humiliate them. Put the fool's settlement to ruin; that should satisfy our allies.
Our allies' foe squats upon this land like a cancer. They ask that we take action to remove it. We would be foolish to refuse.
Bring this settlement to its knees! Spray its walls with blood! Our allies will rejoice at this spectacle of Ruination.
Rain ruination upon these walls! Our kin demand it! Know that success breeds loyalty.
Distant comrades call for our aid, asking that we ransack their foe's domain. We must not refuse them.
A spot of Ruination here will delight our fellow children of carrion. Make it so, and Grandfather's family shall grow closer to one another.
Our fellow concubines crave a demonstration of divine destruction. As the denizens of this stronghold shriek in distress, our kin will moan in ecstasy.
Let us be unsubtle for once, and bring simple Ruin to this fortress of puppets. How our conspiring kin will delight in this act of uncommon savagery.
Suggested Destruction
Impress the Neighbours
Salt the Earth
Razing for Hell
Motherland's Little Helper
A Pox Upon Their House
The Sweet Sound of Suffering
A Storm of Change

Bretonnia is a hierarchical land, where the weakest are inspired by the strongest to become more than their birth. Tear this mighty one down in combat and all their followers shall see, lose heart, and will then be grist to our bonemills. This is what Hashut commands.
This pompous oaf believes themselves a legendary warrior. It is time their followers saw their delusion for what it is.
Face this arrogant mortal on the battlefield, and let their steel-clad followers quail as you gut them.
This mortal brags about their honour and battle prowess. Teach them how very wrong they are.
Face this haughty fool on the battlefield, and let them learn the hard way that all their wealth and status means nothing .
Spill this pompous irritant's guts upon the ground, won't you? Let their followers see that privilege offers no protection against the gift of death.
This stoic servant of order must be introduced to sensations beyond their limited imagining. Visit delicate agony upon them, and as they writhe in torment their followers will howl in terror.
Destroy this preening marionette, and their followers will realise at last that all their courtly pomp means nothing.
Public Downfall
Beneath the Surface
Honour Means Naught
The Lady's Lament
Let the Lady Weep
Shining Champion
A Knight's Wail
Pierce Their Steel

Long ago, weakling men were cursed by Chaos – cursed in the way Dawi cannot be, twisting their forms in abasement before the shadowy Chaos Gods. This one is a particular affront to nature, and so an example should be made of it, before its entire herd. Make it suffer.
We must slaughter this wicked beast in battle, and strike fear into its filthy followers' black, Ruinous hearts.
The Gods decree that this beast be parted from its skull. Let our Daemons soak themselves in its worthless blood.
The beast's followers must see that their champion is weak. Cleave the creature apart in glorious battle.
This dark champion of beasts must pay the price for their worship of Ruination. Face it down!
Put this braying beast out of its misery, and let its sundered carcass fertilise the ground upon which it falls.
This champion of beast serves destruction's cause, but refuses to yield to perfect Slaanesh's majesty. Elegant obliteration must be their fate.
The simple savagery of this gore-crazed brute cannot withstand the scouring fires of Change. Annihilate it!
Suffer the Beast
Annihilate the Animal
Champion of Beasts
Slaughtered Beast
Battle Beasts
Claimed by Darkness
Out of Its Misery
The Sweet Stench of Burning Fur

All that matters to the armour-clad fools of Chaos is their prowess at war and corruption. Word of this disciple's pride has reached us – that they think themselves superior to all other followers of the Gods and to us. In battle, we will show them who the true masters are!
This slave of the Great Enemy is bound for death. Our ancestors demand their destruction.
Our supremacy must be assured. Face this lesser champion of Ruin in battle, and tear them limb from weakling limb.
How the worshippers of Ruin will cower when Khorne's finest warriors annihilate their worthless champion.
Whatever it may cost us, Kislev must eliminate this servant of Chaos. This is our duty, this is our vow.
Hunt down this cacophonous champion of carnage, and in their final moments they shall know the true face of destruction.
We must grant this champion of darkness the greatest of the Ruinous Powers' gifts: unspeakable torment, the sweet release of death and finally the slow consumption of their eternal soul.
This warrior of Chaos expects reward from the Dark Gods. How it will amuse Great Tzeeneth to bring them Ruin instead.
Ironclad Pride
Champion of Darkness
Meeting Their Gods
Champion of Ruin
Ride Against Ruin
Ruin Upon Them
Dark Bargain
The Changer Has Heard Their Prayer

This corsair has been long know to us, leading his Undead legions through time and tide, but has always evaded us. Now an opportunity has presented itself, to humiliate it through another untimely death. Strike them down in battle!
These pirates and thieves are not easily dissuaded from their wicked path. Send their champion to their grave and that may change.
Face this fool pirate, rend its drowned flesh and consign it at last to the grave it has so long avoided.
Unlife is an abomination! Rend this creature's sodden flesh in battle, and claim its dead skull for Khorne.
Shine Dazh's purifying light upon this nightmare! Their waterlogged corpse will feed the worms.
This brigand must take their place in the great cycle of death, decay and rebirth. Ensure their drowned flesh rots.
Lord Slaanesh desires to drink this pirate's wicked soul. Have our pleasure fiends slay them in battle, and capture their delicious life essence for Him.
We must change this pirate's fate. Let them face the Great Conspirator's legion in battle, and in their final moment they will realise their entire existence has been a lie.
The Sunken Sailor
Terror From the Deep
And the Dead Shall Quail
Their Final Voyage
Back to the Depths
Returned to Manann
Butcher the Bandit
Fish Out of Water

If all these petty Cathayans seek is peace and harmony between their lands, they will be sorely disappointed. Let us show them what peace they can hope for with the Dawi-Zharr as neighbours – the peace of the grave and the harmony of the whip's crack!
Though it saddens the Moon Dragon, we must put a bloody end to this betrayer's machinations.
The Dark Gods demand to see Cathay's wretched champion destroyed. Hunt them down, and make the Dragon himself shudder in fear.
The Dragon-worshippers must see that Khorne is ascendant. Destroy their champion in battle, and let them know despair.
Fear not the strange beasts and flamboyant machines of Cathay. Kislev shall ride down their preening champion!
The Dragon's champion has become something of a thorn in our side. Hunt them down! From their wounds the fester shall soon pour.

A lifetime of order and harmony cannot prepare this mortal for the sensations we will visit upon their body. As Cathay's champion succumbs to indescribable agony, the Dragon's legion will turn and run.
This puppet of Dragons is fated for death. Moreover, the Well of Eternity whispers that they are bound to perish at our hands.
Peace At Last
Traitor's Fate
Make Their Ancestors Mourn
Celestial Carnage
A Dance With Dragons
The Harmony of Death
The Harmony of Degradation
Revel in Their Ancestors' Grief
A proud Daemon, comprised of the ill-feeling empyrean: an eddy of poison and sadism grown sentient. Send it back to the shadow realms through a public death. Hashut will grow stronger in the trial.
Slay this hell-sent fiend, and let it be a lesson to all who serve the Great Enemy.
This weakling barely deserves to be called a Daemon. We must punish them for their impertinence!
Face the false Daemon's follower on the field of war, and eviscerate them without mercy.
The proud warriors of Kislev must claim this fiend's foul life, as is their duty and their birthright.
Put this Daemonic dullard to the Plaguesword, won't you? They really are most tiresome.
The Daemon Prince must lose a prized servant, and perhaps then he will understand that none can rival Slaanesh's majesty. Our Daemonettes shall dance atop this one's broken corpse.
Shatter this Daemon's mind, and then its bones. Its princeling master will soon realise that all his dark gifts are but an illusion.
The Empyrean, Sentient
Face the Fiend
False Fiend
Cutting a Puppet's Strings
Bring Chaos Upon Chaos
Serving the Wrong Master
Twisted Ballet
The Humbling of a Would-Be God

They are so proud, these Elves, even driven from their ancient home as monsters. And this one is exceptional in all regards, not excepting pride. We shall take power and glory from seeing them humbled in battle, before our warriors make the final blow.
Make this one pay a price for their cruelty, and be sure that their black-hearted followers witness their final fate.
Hunt down this champion of Naggaroth, and let the corpse-worms of the battlefield feed upon them.
Slaughter the Druchii whelp! Soak the battlefield in its honourless blood!
Cut down this twisted sadist! The pure-hearted forces of the Motherland will grant them ultimate suffering!
This Druchii champion has a most unpleasant nature. We should teach them some manners.
This Druchii's wickedness and cruelty is to be admired, but alas they do not sin in the Perfect Prince's name. As such, they deserve only agony.
It is time we severed this one's strings. Without their champion, the feckless Druchii marionettes will soon succumb to overwhelming fear.
Waiting Hubris
A Wicked Game
Devastate the Druchii
A Druchii's Despair
Dark Demise
A Lesson in Civility
They Serve The Wrong Masters
Naggaroth Shall Not Remember Them

There is no despair like that in seeing your best felled, their bodies rent asunder and displayed on your enemies standards for the world to see. And we do owe our erstwhile kin only the best despair. Take this down, their proud hero, and make sure they see him suffer.
The Celestial Emperor sends his decree: the mountain Dwarf must die. Cathay rides to war once more.
The Dawi champion wields ancient weapons and master-crafted armour, but such trinkets are no match for our Daemonic fury. Slay them!
The stunted mortals will know overwhelming despair as they see their champion torn apart before them.
When the Dwarf champion sneaks from their musty halls, seize the moment to bring Kislev's justice to them.
It's high time we poisoned the land with the plague-drenched corpse of this elder mortal. Send the legion of rot against them.
What a pleasure it will be to flay this Dawi soul, and to revel in the simmering hatred their stunted kin shall feel for us as we do.
If the Dawi had their way, all things would remain joylessly static. Obliterate their champion, and teach them that such stagnancy will not be permitted.
Kincrushers
Champion of the Depths
Cut Down to Size
Cut Down to Size
Knee-High Vengeance
Dwarfen Decay
The Ecstasy of Hatred
Progress is Inevitable

In the Dark Lands, we gather our legions and prepare to wage war upon the Empire. Yet this leader of theirs has been an impurity in the smelting of our plans – send an army to remove the threat, to ensure they don't melt away again, to forge new plans.
This champion of the tainted Empire of Sigmar spreads disharmony wherever they go. Cathay must stand against them.
Slaughter this wretched mortal, and the fool men who follow them will break and run. The Dark Gods demand it!
This fool man believes he can best the blood legion. Rip him apart, and gift his gore-strewn skull to Kharneth.
The Sigmarite is soft and weak. Kislev must show them true strength upon the battlefield.
Every man is fated to die, so that new life may sprout from their foetid remains. Grandfather requests that this one be next.

Grant unto this one their final sensation. As their lifeblood trickles from countless delicate wounds, as the last shuddering breath leaves their broken body, they will whisper "All glory to the Perfect Prince".
Darkness beats inside this man's heart, but time is too short to wait for it to show itself. Oblivion will bring far swifter Change.
Cast-Off Foe
Eviscerate the Imperial
Slaughter the Sigmarite
Mortal Remains
The North Remembers
Sent Back to Sigmar
Darkest Desire
Slave of Sigmar

Our industry will yet build an empire of ash, but there are key opponents who can yet thwart us, so the Daemonsmiths say. This figure is one such. Sacrifice them in battle, tear them apart, so that none of them may say the Chaos Dwarfs are weak and cowardly!
Fell this wretch is honourable battle, and let the world see that no other empire is the equal of Grand Cathay.
Our foe believes their champion to be invincible. We must prove that none can survive the unchecked ferocity of our Daemonic legion.
Khorne demands that you rend their flesh and shatter their bones. Litter the battlefield with their shredded remains!
On the field of battle, we must rain Tor's unstoppable fury upon them.
Our droning legion must ride to battle, and add this irritant to their endless tally.
Have our legion of pleasure seduce this weak-minded fool, and as they helplessly drool at the ocean of perfect flesh before them, tear out their very soul.
Dark destiny knocks upon this champion's door. The Winds of Magic howl and whisper, simply, "death".
Kill the Spy
Show of Celestial Force
This Is What Daemons Live For
A Skull for the Skull Throne
The Judgement is Death
The Tallymen Come
A Vision of Perfection
Fate is Inescapable

Decapitation is most effective against the Greenskins. After all, much of their martial spirit inheres within their leaders, swelling up with their enthusiasm and primitive belief. Cut this fool down and his followers shall crumble and melt away like pig-iron above the flame!
Only by felling this green menace can we teach its howling followers that their reign of destruction is doomed.
The Greenskin must die. Face it in battle, tear its empty head from its gore-soaked shoulders, and offer it up to our Ruinous masters.
Khorne admires this mortal's unchecked savagery, and demands you claim its skull in battle.
We must cut this marauding Greenskin down while we have the opportunity. It will know Ursun's roar!
Enough is, frankly, enough. Cut down this charmless green wretch, and let the worms feed upon their disease-wracked corpse.
Greenskins are maddeningly oblivious to most pain, but our Daemons are incomparable experts in suffering. Have them demonstrate their artistry upon this beast's mottled flesh.
All Greenskin minds veer toward madness, and thus it would be futile to push this one into insanity. Instead, we must vanquish them in brutal battle.
Crude Tool
Stand Against Disharmony
Battle the Brute
Bring Turmoil to the Tribes
Behead the Best
The Price of Bad Manners
Artisanal Torment
Responding in Kind

This Elven princeling has set their sights on our downfall. This is true insolence – to dare to interfere in the machinations of the Daemonsmiths, to stand against the desires and power of Hashut! Take to the battlefield and take their tiny skull for a goblet.
This Asur champion must be slain. Only this way can we prick Ulthuan's undeserved pomposity.
For all their sorcery, Asur break so very easily. It will be child's play to destroy this one in battle.
Annihilate this preening slave to order. Coat the killing fields with its gore.
Elven pomposity means nothing on the field of battle. With Ursun's blessing, we shall prove this.
The Urfather can abide this squeaky-clean champion of order no longer. This odious Elf must know decay.
Only the protracted death of an Asur champion can quench Slaanesh's great thirst. Send forth the pleasure horde to visit beautiful agony upon this helpless Ulthuani.
This fool slave to reason and order must meet their end. Great Tzeeneth demands their absolute destruction.
Halved Elfin
Charlatan of Order
Doomed Child of Ulthuan
Annihilate the Asur
Pride Before a Fall
Ague for an Asur
The Death of Order
Obstacle of Order

A whirlwind of blood, martial fury and death has come to our attention, at the heart of the idiot Khornate cause. He points their blades at us, urges them to take our skulls, rather than the weakling heretics of the West. Let us fight them on the field and give them Hashut's true death.
To honour all those who have fallen to the Great Enemy, we must ride to war against this fiend of blood.
The Murder Lord must lose a prized servant this day. Spill their weakling blood, and crush their worthless skull beneath your heel.
The Blood God demands a contest of Khornate champions. Prevail against your kin in glorious battle.
The blood Daemon is bound for death! This is what we live for! This is why we are Kislev!
Please, please, please make this Khornate oaf stop shouting at us. The Urfather can barely hear himself think. To battle!
Blood for the Blood God! Skulls for the Skull Throne! These things we will willingly give to snarling Kharneth – though his own champion shall be the source of them.
Though necessary, it will be bittersweet indeed to slay this Khornate puppet in battle, for slaughter is all its simple mind desires.
Bled Dry
The Skull Throne Quails
Reaper of Souls
For the Skull Throne's Amusement
Slaughter the Slaughterer
A Skull Torn from Necrotic Flesh
Quench Their Rage
Lowered to Their Level

Bear and bull. Not exactly ancient foes, except when baited by the hounds, but opponents in the marketplace of ideas. This bear-lover threatens our plans, when they should stay in their icy holes, huddled against the cold. Let us spill their hot blood to warm them a little!
Fell Kislev's champion in battle, and perhaps their frigid kingdom will at last understand their place in this world.
Rip this fool of Kislev asunder, and show the weaklings who follow them that doom comes for their precious Motherland.
The Ursunite fool is no match for Khornate wrath in battle. Lay claim to their mortal skull!
No mercy for the despicable traitor! They must face the Motherland's justice upon the battlefield!
Like so many of their deluded kin, this mortal of Kislev believes they can protect their lowly world from Nurgle's putrefying embrace. Let them be the next to fall.
Slaanesh yearns to hear a god howl in despair. Once we slay this champion of Kislev, Ursun's grief shall be divine music to the Dark Prince's ears.
Before this mortal's smoking corpse melts into the earth, ensure they understand that their precious Motherland is nothing but a shared delusion orchestrated by Tzeentch Himself.
Bear & Bull
Frozen Throne
Follower of the Bear
The Motherland Shall Mourn
Purge the Heretic
From Motherland to Mausoleum
The Great Bear's Despair
Patriotism is a Lie

The Lizardmen's plans may last a thousand years, but today they interfere with ours. Let us not waste our massed conscripts against their ancient strength, but instead kill off their leaders and hope they turn tail and flee. This foe would be a fine start!
For the sake of order, the cold-blood must be slain, and all its inhuman kind must bear witness.
All who worship the hated Old Ones must be annihilated. This one is next.
Meet this reptile in battle, then tear its skull from its spine as its body slumps before you.
We must execute the Cold One, for their inhuman ways and unfathomable schemes are a threat to all Kislev.
Grant the gift of destruction to this bothersome reptile. Grandfather finds their worship of the loathsome Old Ones to be most upsetting.
Make this reptile's cold blood boil with desire, and then, as it desperately begs for a gratification that will never come, slice its scaled flesh to ribbons.
We must defang this deluded slave of the Old Ones. No tricks, no games: simply, obliteration.
Frogs of War
Lustria's Loss
Cold Blood, Red-Hot Rage
Spawn of the Old Ones
Extinction Agenda
Lesions for a Lizard
Lustria's Most Lustful
The Great Plan Undone

Berserkers, wolf-men, axe-hurlers... and we have war machines and cannon and Hashut's endless Daemonic power. Fools they are and fools are their leaders. Take this one and kill them in battle, to show them how weak they truly are.
Any man who has willingly given himself to Chaos must pay the ultimate price, and quickly.
The Ruinous Gods thank this mortal for their service, and wish to reward them with an agonising death. We must make it so.
This mortals of Norsca must understand true ruinous might. Lure their champion to battle, and make an example.
We must strike their hate-filled head from their shoulders, as a lesson to all heretics of Chaos.
This murderous mortal has long screeched for the Ruinous Powers to take notice. Alas for them, the Fly Lord has. Grant them oblivion.

As this mortal gazes hungrily upon the beauteous forms of our Daemon legion, they will understand that their brief life was squandered in the pursuit of simple Ruin. They will die in anguish, consumed by unslaked lusts, and Slaanesh will rejoice.
How the Changer will rejoice at the horror of the Norscan mortals, as their champion is torn apart by the Daemons they so revere.
Wolf, Skinned
Evil Never Prospers
Recompensed By the Dark Gods
They Know Not What They Do
The Price of Barbarism
The Ultimate Gift
Dark Realisation
Be Careful What You Wish For

The arrogance and hubris of the Plague Lord, to send his pestilences and armies against us! We may not worship him, but we are of one cause, surely? Punish the laughing father by taking from his dearest – his heralds and champions. Start with this pustulent thug.
We must stem the plague-tide before it can spread further. Destroy this champion of disease forthwith.
It is high time that the Urfather bade farewell to one of his most beloved children. Tear this champion of disease limb from foetid limb!
Let the Plaguefather's champion know destruction. Strew its oozing gore across the battlefield.
Only with this mouldering horror's death can proud Kislev stem the tide of disease.
This cankerous child is, alas, a terrible disappointment to Nurgle. Our rotted legion must advance them to the next stage of the great cycle.
Slay the Fly Lord's festering champion in battle, and let their miserable diseases despoil good flesh no longer.
This torpid servant of rot can play no more part in the Great Game. Elimination must be their fate.
Pustule, Popped
The Fly Lord Shall Weep
There Must Come a Cleansing
The Gift of Decay
Flatten the Curve
Foetid Fratricide
An End to Necrosis
Slaughtering Stagnation

They hunger, do they, these Ogres? Relentlessly, futilely, insatiably? Perhaps we can provide them with a feast – one of their own, butchered in front of them as a fine dinner for all – and, of course, a boost to our morale. Kill them soon.
An Ogre army is a sight to strike terror into even proud Cathayan hearts, but their champion must die. There is no alternative.
Slaughter this bloated half-wit, and let our Daemons feast upon its sundered remains.
The corpulent mortal is without honour. Khorne demands that you tear it to bleeding ribbons upon the field of battle.
The ravenous brute shall devour not one more child of Kislev. We must put it down!
Get rid of this bloated buffoon forthwith, won't you? And do ensure you give it plenty of diseases first, in case any of its ravenous kin have a mind to consume its corpse.
This mortal may possess titanic strength, but their mind is small and weak. How easy it shall be to beguile and then obliterate them.
The Changer clicks His fingers, and the Ogre champion's destiny is decided: no more tyranny, and instead only oblivion.
Feast for the Ogre King
Depose the Tyrant
Consume the Consumer
Thy Flesh Consumed
Shut Your Mouth
Had a Bellyful
Bloated Soul
Nil By Mouth

Skaven daring to challenge us? The one thing we know about the ratlings is that they are cowards, driven by fear of their betters. Slaughter this upstart rodent and his army will flee, we are sure of it.
Eradicate this lord of pestilence. Its rodent followers shall cower as we claim its filthy head.
The Gods of Chaos demand that this worthless vermin be slaughtered. Break every bone in its lice-coated body, then grind its flesh to pulp.
Crush the vermin mortal! Let its terrified followers cower as its foul blood drains into the soil.
Only once this pestilent rodent is put in the ground can Salyak's healing begin.
This pint-sized, pestilent pest simply won't stop getting underfoot. Please dispatch them as soon as is convenient.
There are some creatures that even the most deviant of Slaaneshi would not consent to share a bed with. This filthy rodent is one of them. We may at least derive great pleasure from its destruction.
This low beast is no more significant to Tzeentch than a mite, but nonetheless it has become a distraction. Send the blue-gold legion to smite it.
The Rat King's Tail
Vermin Royalty
A Better Rat Trap
A Pest's Penance
Pest Control
Filthy Little Beast
The Undesirable
Insultingly Insignificant

What can be a victory over the Lord of Excess be but pleasurable for both sides? Let us send our serried legions to dismember his host, let our Bull Centaur Renders gorge themselves on the living and dead. Let us tear down this hero with much-admired sadism. If he can stop preening for a second, Slaanesh shall thank us for it!
Put this foul champion of depravity to the sword, and let no more souls be seduced by its wickedness.
The time of suffering is upon this Slaaneshi fool! Carve their supple flesh from them!
Slaaneshi decadence offends Khorne! This one must know honour for the first and last time, as you slay them in mortal combat.
Their sin is boundless, their blasphemy unspeakable. We must bring purity to this deplorable pleasure-seeker.
It is high time this Slaaneshi nuisance danced with death. Their velvety flesh will not seem quite so supple once the corpse-worms have had their way.
Our beguiling sibling has transgressed against us one time too many. Reward them by raking their pristine flesh into bloody ribbons.
The grand architect decrees a twist in this Slaaneshi champion's fate. Have our changeling puppets make them suffer.
Sated Lusts
The Promise of Persecution
Slaughter Most Excessive
Destroying Depravity
Virtue Restored
The Ecstasy of Necrosis
A Concubine Dismissed
The Sweetest Sensation

The empty-socketed masses of ancient Nehekhara wander the Old World still, long after their kingdoms were turned to dust. They are held together by Nagash's curse, but kill their leaders in battle and they will crumble. Do so with haste.
Slay this foul champion of Unlife upon the battlefield, and its ghoulish followers will learn that immortality is a lie.
The grave calls for this lord of bones. Face them in battle, and return them to darkness.
Lure this cadaverous abomination to battle, and put a brutal end to its Unlife.
Let this monster learn that immortality is a lie. Strew the battlefield with its foul bones!
Right then, this desert ghoul has cheated death for far too long. We must ensure their ancient bones finally know decay.
This ghoul has no more flesh to cut and bruise, but their soul may still be claimed for Slaanesh's banquet table. Send forth the purple legion to make it so.
For generations, this fleshless puppet has believed themselves immortal. The time has come to shatter their sad delusion.
Hierophant's Fall
Dust & Bone
Bury the Dead
Eternal Rest
Pyramid Scheme
Their Marrow Must Moulder
Damnation Finds Them
Death Catches Up

Does the Changers of Ways see our world as real or is it a mere game for his conniving mind? Either way, he put his pieces on the board and we must contend against them, to ensure Hashut's greatness. This piece seems valuable to him – take it, in battle, when it would be most useful, and we may frustrate his schemes.
Eliminate the Raven God's mutant servant, and let it be a lesson to all who give their souls to Chi'an Chi.
The Raven God's champion can play no more part in the Great Game. Destroy them! Litter the battlefield with their iridescent gore!
Face the child of Tzeentch, tear out its lying tongue, put out its scheming eyes, and then, finally, tear its twisted head from its shoulders.
The mutant must corrupt no more minds. The Motherland must hunt it down, for the good of all mankind.
Put this champion of change in the ground, and let its twisted flesh feed the soil. Who knows what strange flowers will one day sprout?
Let us disrupt the Changer's tedious schemes by slaying his champion, and then carving an ode to Slaanesh's beauty into their dead changeling flesh.
When our blue-gold legion slaughter this changeling champion, they will surely understand that their death is the ineffable will of their all-seeing God.
Piece Removal
No More Games
Champion of Change
Carving the Turkey
Murdering Madness
Doomsday for the Deceiver
The Sonnet
Kin No More

Wise, these ancient Vampires. Their most important minions they preserve at the heart of their armies, shielded by ranks of the dead. Still, we must ensure this one is truly dead. Chase them down on the battlefield, crush their spirit and their bones.
Whatever it takes, this abomination must never rise again. Face the fiend in battle!
Tear this ghoul apart, and soak the earth in its cold and soulless blood.
How Khorne rages to see this former mortal cheat death. Face it in battle, and eradicate it once and for all.
Dazh's fire shall scorch away the Vampire's unholy flesh. Kislev must march against the dead!
Do not let this death-cheating abomination slink back to their musty coffin. Their cold flesh must know putrefaction at last.
What sweet music this child of the night shall make as our Daemonettes slowly, slowly tear the cold flesh from its dead bones.
This ghoul's pathetic attempts to out-run death have amused the Raven God until now, but His patience grows thin. They must be obliterated.
Rank Defence
Midnight's Child
What Sweet Music Their Screams Make
The Last Twilight
Stake a Claim
Rejoining the Circle of Life
Howl of the Dead
Transformed to Dust

Elfin fools, thinking they could contend with our might! Have they not heard of the mighty empires of Zharr-Naggrund, felt the rumble of our war-machines, seen our brazen finery? Grasp their hero and tear them asunder on the field of battle – that shall be a start to their punishment!
The Emperor sends his judgement: the Elf of the forest must die. Cathay shall ride to war.
An Elf is but an Elf, no matter where it hails from. Prove that this one is as weak and worthless as the rest of its sorry kind.
Khorne orders that you draw the cowardly Elf to battle. Its weak bones will surely crumble like dead branches.
Their Elven trickery and subterfuge mean nothing on the field of battle. It is there that we shall bring them down.
The Urfather respectfully requests that we make this bothersome Elf rot, like fallen leaves on wet ground.
This Elf causes Slaanesh only frustration. Send forth the perfumed pleasure horde to grant perfect suffering to this child of the forest.
Once our Daemons melt this Elven puppet's flesh from their bones, all their sickening kind will succumb to horror-struck madness.
Agent of the Woods
Kurnous Bears Witness
Finish the Fay Folk
The Woods Shall Weep
Weed Killer
Let the Fey Folk Fester
Isha's Despair
Root & Branch

Noble steeds dying in craters, proud Knights pulled down by lowly backstabbers, Bull Centaur Renders feasting on cowering peasants... These are great works, my kin, the works of Zharr-Naggrund. Attack the Bretonnians, leave none alive!
The Celestial legions must face the Knights of Bretonnia, for they threaten our harmony.
Do not let these weakling Knights elude our fury. Hunt them down!
Face the gleaming fools of the mortal kingdom known as Bretonnia! They must be annihilated!
Our fearless Lancers must face their pompous Knights. There is no alternative.
Send the Maggotkin against these condescending Knights, and blight their shining steel with glorious corrosion.
To battle! These weak-minded men cannot hope to resist our Daemonettes' dance. As lust overcomes their minds, their bodies shall be ours to break.
As the Raven foresaw, Bretonnia's mortal marionettes impinge upon our aeons-old schemes. It is our destiny to march against them.
The Sword in the Back
Jade & Steel
Waylay the Lady's Legion
The Last Knight
Knightfall
The Age of Rust
The Dance of Desire
Change vs Chivalry

The Children of Chaos are but brutes and fools, drooling half-breeds that do all for their uncaring, capricious Gods. Send them screaming to their masters and make headstones of their herdstones. This is our true Ruinous design.
Do not permit the Great Enemy's repugnant animals to spread further Ruin. To battle!
We must march against these worthless beasts who delude themselves into thinking they are like us, and show them the unbridled power of true Chaos.
Tear apart this bestial horde, and let our Daemons feast upon their savage blood.
We must engage these beasts of Chaos before their foul creed can spread further.
It is time these snarling beasts of darkness encountered the true children of destruction.
These grunting beasts must bear witness to the true beauty of Chaos. Have our pleasure fiends delicately tear the filthy flesh from them.
The capering of these dull beasts has ceased to be amusing. The Great Conspirator has no more need of them. They must be dispatched.
Herdstones to Headstones
Claim Their Blackened Hides
Never Work With Animals
Sundering Steel
Gather the Herd
Corrosion for the Cloven Ones
Beauties & The Beasts
Altered Beasts

How do these slaves of Ruin sleep in their darkling camps, knowing that the Dawi-Zharr outmatch them in every regard? That our god will trample theirs into impalpable dust? That we shall shortly slaughter them and drag the survivors back to our mines? FOR HASHUT!
As did our forefathers, and their forefathers before them, we must stand against the Great Enemy, always and forever.
Ruination must wage war against Ruination. Even these servants of Chaos cannot hope to prevail against a Daemon legion.
They are impressive. They are strong. They are remorseless. Battle against them will be truly glorious.
We must take the fight to the fiends of Chaos. All the Motherland's people demand it.
Thank these champions of Ruin for their service in suitable fashion – by reducing their sundered bodies to putrefying mush.
Lord Slaanesh has grown tired of these bellowing warriors of Ruin, and now desires only to hear the sweet music of their death-rattles.
Great Tzeeneth gazes into the Well of Eternity and is granted a vision of these servants of Ruin, their magefire-scorched corpses strewn across a blood-soaked battlefield. We must make it so.
Worriers of Chaos
A Bastion Against Chaos
Abandoned By Their Gods
Khorne Demands a Spectacle
Ruin Upon Ruination
Ruin is its Own Reward
A Final Act of Devotion
Their Purpose Served

The armies of the dead corsairs are emboldened by their victories, by the numberless dead waiting in the ocean depths for their call. They are envious, of course, of our wealth, our power... our black beards. They will have none, for we shall bury them on land, piece by piece.
Engage these deathless pirates! Put their dead hearts to the sword!
These paltry thieves can evade death no longer. Hunt them down, and litter this land with their pale corpses.
Rend their dead flesh! Spill their cold blood! Ensure they never again rise from the depths!
We must look the dead in their hollow eyes, and finally end their loathsome Unlives.
Hunt down these Unliving boatmen, and let them know the peace of oblivion at long last. The dead shall sail no more!
Take the battle to these dead thieves, and end the second lives they have so miserably squandered on petty larceny.
Their time of plunder and pillage must come to a bloody end. Lord Tzeentch has permitted it until now merely because it amuses Him.
Black-Bearded Wrath
Stand Against Death
Drowned Souls
Piracy. It's a Crime.
Dead Men's Chests
What Shall We Do With the Decaying Sailors?
Wasted Existence
Voyage of the Damned

These Dragon-worshippers and their pride over their walls, clay figures and a few flying worms. Our carronades will topple them from the sky and our Bull Centaurs will feast on their still-beating hearts. This will please Hashut!
We must bring swift justice to those who have betrayed our great empire.
The Dragon must be punished for his arrogance. Engage his fool legion in battle, and let our Daemons feast upon their ravaged corpses.
Eviscerate these mortal fools, as punishment for their empire's long obstruction of Khorne's glorious will.
There is no empire larger than Cathay, but stout Kislev hearts will prevail nevertheless.
Shower these misguided servants of the obnoxious Dragon in contagion-enriched filth. Rejoice as their flesh is consumed.
These joyless servants of the Dragon must be made to suffer. As their bleeding bodies writhe in anguish, the Prince of Pleasure shall attain new heights of ecstasy.
The Celestial Empire speaks the name 'Chi'an Chi' only in hushed tones, terrified that it may summon Him. They must learn that Tzeentch can visit them whenever He so chooses.
Dragon Hearts
The Emperor's Judgement
Shattered Harmony
The Greatest Disharmony
Dragon Lancers
Ordered Ranks are Easier to Infect
Joining Their Ancestors
Facing the Cult

So much raw magick gathered in one place! Our Daemonsmiths hunger to use it, to trap those writhing forms into our constructions and deploy them in war and industry. Assemble our forces – we are sent forth!
It is our ancient duty to stand against the Great Enemy. Every man and woman of Cathay understands this.
The Dark Gods hunger for entertainment. We must face our weakling kin, and destroy them.
Face the pretender's legion of weakling Daemons, and present the Skull Throne with an ocean of fresh trophies.
We must engage the great betrayer's forces, and expunge these fiends from the land. The Motherland expects!
The Urfather has very special diseases for fellow Daemons. Hunt them down, and blight their bodies.
These petty servants of Ruination bring only dour destruction to this world. Once their distraction is removed, we may continue our carnal crusade unopposed.
These puppets of a lesser power have interfered with our grand deceptions for the last time. Rain destruction upon them.
Daemonic Bloom
The Great Birthright
Fiendish Fratricide
A War in Hell
Prince of Darkness
Servants of Minor Royalty
Low Standards
Cast Back to Hell

Were the Elves united, they would perhaps match the fallen glory of the Dawi, let alone the Dawi-Zharr. Yet here stands a fraction of their forces, of one of their divided kingdoms, ripe for us to pluck. Let us torture these craven torturers, teach them what cruelty is!
Their wicked ways can be tolerated no longer. Put these Druchii dogs down.
Eviscerate these Druchii fools! Even Khaine shall tremble before our Daemonic might.
They think they are the masters of cruelty. They know nothing. Teach them the true meaning of suffering.
Kislev is duty-bound to hunt down these Druchii scum, before they can inflict their cruelty upon further innocents.
These black-hearted Elven wretches have exhausted Grandfather's patience. Let them know death, and once decay has had its way with them something better shall bloom.
The Druchii believe themselves to be artisans of sufferings, but against our Daemons they are mere amateurs. It is high time we proved this beyond mortal doubt.
The Changer of Ways knows the exact moment of each Druchii's death. Rejoice, for He whispers to us that these ones are next.
Elves Divided
Khaine Shall Tremble
Darkness Falls Upon Darkness
Dark Demise
Light Up the Dark
Untold Suffering
A Demonstration of Perfection
Their Time is Short

The Dawi-Yar have assembled into a force for an unknown purpose. But what a fine opportunity to exact our ancient revenge, to test our skills and creations against our traitor cousins. Crush them, burn their beards, drag them bare to the Plain of Zharr.
The mountain elders are a most unwelcome obstacle to the Emperor's ambitions. One that must be cleared.
They think themselves safe in their joyless tunnels, but these stunted mortals are bound for destruction. Hunt them down!
Face the stout mortals! Annihilate them without mercy! Khorne expects a great sacrifice!
Dwarfen armour is strong and their determination boundless, but we must march against them without fear.
The Dawi are so very proud of their armaments. Let them learn that all the steel in the world cannot protect them from Nurgle's Rot.

The legion of pleasure hungers for the sensation of parted flesh, the blissful sounds of agony and the divine scent of freshly-spilled blood. All these pleasures and more can be provided by slaughtering these Dwarfen wretches.
The joyless mortals of the mountains must be shown that there is more to life than grudges and gold. Grant unto them glorious destruction.
Weakling Cousins
Smiting the Seditious Smiths
Murder the Mountain-folk
Slaughter the Stunted Ones
A Test of Endurance
Even the Strongest Armour Corrodes
Their Souls Are Forfeit
Pint-Sized Puppets

An Imperial Expedition has been sighted, their destination uncertain. See what wealth they carry with them, sequestered from our grasp. We lust for it, we must have it. Assault them, take it, bring it to Hashut!
We can tolerate the snakes of Sigmar's Empire no longer. To battle!
This Empire of fools has had its day. Slaughter its paltry army, and make its rulers quail.
These pitiful men of Sigmar must stand against Khorne no longer. Tear out their spines, each and every one of them!
The flabby, pampered fools of the Empire must face a long-deserved reckoning.
Send the Rotkin legion against these tiresome warriors of order. Let their putrefying corpses feed the earth.
Let these pathetic men beg us for gratification even as we peel the flesh from their bones. So overcome they shall be that they will barely resist death.
