At heart, every man craves only to slaughter other beings. Let us make these ones believe they have such an opportunity – and then destroy them utterly.
Baggage Train
Obliterate the Old Worlders
Dehumanisation
Punish the Pious
North vs South
Delusions of Empire
Shivers of Desire
Man is No More Than a Beast

This force has drawn Hashut's baleful eye, far from his home in the fanes of Zharr-Naggrund. His ire, his pride will not allow this army to go unmolested on its way. Our forces are already underway – redirect them to this task.
In the name of harmony, the Celestial Empire must make its stand against these dogs.
The Ruinous Powers crave destruction. Our Daemons must give them a show to remember.
Face these weaklings in glorious battle, wade through their cooling blood and claim their skulls for the Lord of Murder.
No more hesitation. Not one step backwards. Kislev rides to war!
Chant the chilling chant, and drone the dread drone. The children of Nurgle must go to battle without delay.
Send forth the legion of excess to dance across the battlefield, parting flesh and drinking souls even as our enemies beg for more, more, more.
With each breath, the Architect of Fate reshapes destiny itself. With his latest exhalation, he damns these puppets to brutal death. We must enact his will.
Crush the Foe
Celestial Stand
The Meaning of Chaos
The Blood Crusade
For The Motherland!
From Our Wounds the Fester Pours
The Dark Prince's Banquet
The Lethal March of Progress

Orcs only gather in such numbers for acts of infamy – for a Waaagh! We cannot have the operation of our mines, factories and furnaces disrupted by their fanciful violence. Spring upon the army before it attacks us and Hashut will bless you.
Hunt down the green swine, and all the world shall thank us for it.
Our Daemons hunger for battle. Allow them to butcher these mindless Greenskins without delay.
It will be a fight with little glory, for they are barely more than animals, but Khorne demands their destruction nevertheless.
For the sake of all Kislev, we must face these loathsome Greenskins and end their murderous rampage.
March against these glowering green brutes! A flesh-eating plague or two shall put a stop to their rampaging ways.
These brutes have value only in death. How lord Slaanesh will moan in pleasure to hear their anguished, guttural screams.
The Greenskins are a most entertaining fly in the ointment of all other races, but these ones have served their purpose. They must be culled.
Cull the WAAAGH!
Worthless Beasts
Green Lambs to the Slaughter
Gore the Greenskins
Waylay the Waaagh!
A Messy End to Their Rampage
The Beauty of Suffering
End of the Joke

Hashut was not with the Dawi when the Elves betrayed us and in their arrogance attacked us. And we do not bear grudges like we once did. But still this army of Elves is a sore temptation... and we have new weapons and creations that need testing in the field!
Teach these Asur that their ancient spellcraft is no match for the Dragon's immortal fury.
There must come a massacre of the Eldest Race. Our Daemons stand ready.
Eviscerate these weakling slaves to order! Every moment they live is an insult to the Hunter of Souls!
It is time to prick Asur pomposity. Let them know the Motherland's might!
Sound the crumbling battle-horn! Let the sickening purity and order of the loathsome Asur fall to rot and Ruin.
We must show these Asur how empty their long lives have been until now. In their final moments, let them gaze upon our Daemons' perfect bodies and dream of the pleasures they might have had.
How dull and predictable the joyless Asur would have existence be. How much more fascinating it shall become once these ones are removed from play.
Weapons Testing
We Stand Against Ulthuan
Order is Intolerable
Death Comes to Ulthuan
Asur Assault
Ulthuan's Finest
The Unfulfilled
Turmoil Through Transformation

A crusade against US? How dare the Lady and her foppish minions proselytise and foment hatred for our kind! Beneath their paint and cloth, they lust for our wealth, our power. Destroy the invaders, show them our power unrefined!
Bretonnia treads where she does not belong. Drive her back! Our ancestors demand it!
The Lady's fools shall rue the day they dare tread upon Daemon lands. We must rise against them, and soak our claws in their worthless blood.
Khorne rages to see these steel-clad mortals trespass upon His domain. Annihilate them without mercy or delay.
The preening southerners dare to tread upon Motherland soil! It is our duty to drive them back.
They seek to bring purity and beauty to the festering and polluted lands of Nurgle. We cannot allow this offence!
The denizens of Bretonnia believe they can impose grace and order upon our sinful lands. As they howl and moan for the sweet release of death, they will understand the error of their ways.
The fool puppets of Bretonnia believe they can impose order upon the lands of Change. Let them learn the magnitude of their folly.
Assault the Lady
Drive Out the Lady
Banish the Bretonnians
Crush the Crusade
The Lady is for Turning
The Lady Missteps
In Defence of Depravity
They Know Not What They Do

Our Labourers spread tales of an army of liberators. Fools, for it is the wild herd and nothing more – all they will liberate is flesh from bone. Dispatch an army forthwith to preserve our wealth, our workers, and crush the bestial challenge!
The foul beasts of the Great Enemy pollute our celestial lands. This offence cannot stand.
The Beastmen trespass in the realm of Daemons! For this insult, we must impale them upon their own horns.
They invade the Blood Lord's dominion! For this insult, claim each and every one of their horned skulls.
The foul beasts despoil the Motherland. Kislev must rise against them!
Oh, these tiresome beasts. They never know when to stop rampaging, do they? Let their corpses feed the soil of Nurgle's domain.
These animals must not be permitted to reduce our divine pleasure palaces to mere hovels of filth and destruction. Obliterate them!
Great Tzeeneth's meticulous plans must not be disrupted by these worthless beasts. Purge them from our lands.
Rush the Beasts
Beasts Upon Our Shores
Culling the Herd
Gore the Gors
Apex Predators
Do They Not Know Who We Are?
Turn Back the Stampede
Animals Underfoot

Ah, the Dark Gods have finally noticed us and think the Father of Darkness' domain a threat? Too little, too late, you febrile raiders. This army you send is naught to Hashut's will. March our forces to battle and end this insult for the final time.
We must be as the Great Bastion, and blockade Cathay against the horrors of Chaos.
These mortal followers of Chaos believe themselves entitled to our lands. Fools! Send our Daemon legion against them.
They who swear themselves to Chaos dare to enter our domain. Fools! Slaughter them to a one.
Chaos comes to Kislev! This blasphemy must be corrected at once.
While these marauders are right to spread Ruin, we simply cannot permit them to steal Nurgle's garden.
How Lord Slaanesh weeps to see these warriors of Ruin despoil our fragranced lands. We must drive them back, so that our Perfect Prince shall smile once more.
These warriors of Ruin dare to make claim upon the kingdom of Change. Ensure they perish in twisted agony, for their fate was long ago decided.
The Gods' Foray
The Great Enemy is Here!
Misreading the Runes
Biting the Hand That Feeds
Kislev Endures
Heathen Heretics
The Wrong Kind of Ruin
The Greatest Folly

The piratical poltroons of the Vampire Coast march their forces with haste through our lands, raiding and plundering, knowing that to linger is to invite retribution and destruction. We will answer their army's outrage with carronades and black fire, and even their rotten timbers shall catch flame.
We must drive the living dead from our shining lands, for their darkness brings distress to the Moon Empress.
The dead thieves cannot be permitted to plunder the kingdom of Ruin. Tear them apart!
The dead shall walk in Khorne's blazing kingdom no more. Tear them apart.
Dead sailors invade our shores. They must learn that even the Unliving cannot conquer mighty Kislev.
The Undead are barely tolerable at the best of times, but to invade our cankerous realm is sheer gall. They must know oblivion.
Do not allow these pirates to rampage across our realm, for their dead touch can bring no pleasure. Return to them to the depths.
The dead sailors squander their second lives on invasion. Melt the drowned flesh from them for this insult, and return them at last to their graves.
Swashbuckler's Sally
The Dead Shall Sail No More
Turn Back the Tide
Walking the Plank
Drowned Out
Plunder Denied
Dead Thieves
Destiny at Their Heels

The endless armies of Cathay have raised themselves from Imperial dreams and enter the field. Yet this land is ours, won with the blood and toil of our helots, and we will not give it to the worm-king's minions. Instead, send our armies out to give them a well-deserved death.
Do not allow these betrayers to despoil our lands with their traitorous creed.
The Dragon may have long stood against Chaos, but he is a fool if he believes he can drive us from our own realm. Slaughter his worthless followers.
Laughable! The Dragon's weaklings attempt a foolhardy invasion. Eviscerate them.
The Dragon Empire believes it can take whatever it desires. Show them why Kislev has remained free for so long.
Let our necrotic toxins course through the veins of these Celestial invaders. The Dragon shall never claim the Urfather's domain.
The Dragon's fools seek to impose harmony upon us. Bring them to their knees, weakened by frenzied desire, and then annihilate them.
Too often has the Dragon interfered with the Great Conspirator's aeons-long schemes. Do not permit his puppets to steal our lands from us.
Raided by Cathay
No Place for Treachery
The Dragons' Dance
Disembowelling Dragons
Dragon Denied
The Great Enemy Strikes Back
Celestial Conquerors
Army of Harmony

Our Daemonsmiths are in awe. The will to hold together this rabble of incarnates and lusts, to direct it to a single cause? Admirable. A shame then that it marches on the lands of the Dawi-Zharr and must be made an example of. Send our forces to remind these petty Daemons who the Father of Darkness is...
Daemons come to Cathay! We must cut the fiends down before all harmony is lost.
We cannot lose our lands to lesser Daemons. How the Dark Gods shall laugh as we tear these whelps apart.
The pretender prince makes his play. Slay his deluded followers, and cleanse Khorne's land of their honourless stain.
Drive back the great betrayer! Daemons will never seize our glorious Motherland!
The nerve of this prince of Daemons! He cannot be permitted to help himself to our decaying lands. We must repel his misguided horde.
We cannot allow the false prince of Daemons to attain godhood by conquering our realm. Send our artisans of cruelty against his feckless fiends, and make them beg for death's embrace.
Lowly servants of darkness dare to tread within our realm. Teach these meagre Daemons that the Architect of Fates has only contempt for them.
Daemonic Incursion
Daemons at the Door
Ideas Above Their Station
Dishonour Amongst Daemons
Cast Out Evil
Despicable Ingrate
Daemonic Depravity
Are We Supposed to Be Impressed?

Hubris, thy name is, Elf. Skilled in murder they may be, but to sashay an army into the lands of the Dhrath-Zharr, with the arrogance that it shall return bearing riches? Arrogance and idiocy are two sides of one coin. Muster a force to gather up these wayward Elves and bring them to be broken in the pits of Zharr-Naggrund.
We must slay these Elves of darkness before they bring calamity to our lands.
Drive out these Druchii milksops! They must never gain dominion over our blasted lands.
We owe everything to Khorne. We cannot allow the honourless Druchii to take His conquests from Him. Destroy them!
The wicked ones must be cast out! Their hateful kind shall not take Kislev!
These selfish Druchii do not care how much they upset dear Grandfather by trespassing in His garden. We must lift His spirits and remove them forthwith.
The foolish Druchii trespass in Lord Slaanesh's domain, despoiling our divine pleasure-houses. It is time they learned the true meaning of suffering.
These laughable disciples of despair trespass upon the twisted lands of Tzeentch. Obliteration shall be their only reward.
Elven Hubris
Khaine Comes Calling
The Folly of Naggaroth
Drive Back the Druchii
Darkest Hour
Dark Souls
What a Wicked Game
The Folly of Naggaroth

Ancient abominations that yet walk among us, the Dwari-Yar. Do they think, seeing their army walking into our Dark Land, that we will shout "Essurrak!" as of old and invite them in for ale and sweetmeats? Fools. Battle, torture and death is all that awaits them.
The Dawi have left their mountain hovels to trespass within the Emperor's kingdom. Punish them for this insult!
The Dawi trespass in our domain! We must make these deluded half-wits regret ever leaving their airless mountain hideaway.
The undersized mortals dare to enter our dominion. Tear them apart, limb by stunted limb.
The Dwarfs dare to tread upon Kislev's sacred soil! They must pay a price for this insult.
These uncouth little creatures of order visit us without invitation. Send out a putrescent welcoming party.

Of all the races to dare enter the Perfect Prince's domain, the tedious Dawi are surely the least welcome. There is no pleasure whatsoever to be had from their endless, tiresome grudges. Remove them at once.
The dour Dawi deign to leave their musty mountains, in the vain hope of driving the Changer from this land. How amusing it shall be to obliterate them.
The Dwari-Yar
Trespassers From the Tunnels
A Grudge to Remember
Eliminate the Elders
Stunted Progress
Dawi at the Doors of Decay
Retched Forth from the Mountains
Hard Feelings

Casting aside the pretence of disinterest, the grasping forces of man walk among us, hoping to take that which is rightfully ours. In their xenophobic fury they massacre everything foreign; our warriors, our Labourers... Let them know they have roused the anger of the Father of Darkness. Slaughter every last one!
Sigmar's avaricious fools must be made to understand that Cathay belongs to none but the Emperor himself.
The Sigmarites tread where they do not belong. Punish them! How their families shall weep when they hear how their loved ones died.
These foolhardy men believe they can tear Khorne's lands from His glorious grasp. May them pay, in blood.
The soft men of Sigmar trespass in the Motherland! Teach the southern fools the folly of their ways.
Alas, a troupe of Humans trespass within our decomposing domain. Show them to the exit, won't you?
The men of Empire come to our lands, surely thirsting for our Daemonettes' dark embrace. This we can gladly grant them.
Sigmar's puppets dare to trespass within this extension of the Great Changer's realm. Make them learn that, in truth, they dance only to His eternal tune.
The Hatred of Man
Sigmar's Greed
Eviscerate the Empire
Sigmar's Folly
North-South Divide
Ulric the Uninvited
A Desire Granted
Free Will is an Illusion

Who dares invade the lands of the Father of Darkness. Do they not see his sign on every stone, burned into the ash of the ground and into the flesh of our Labourers? Death comes to you, foolish mortals, for standing against the Chaos Dwarfs and our immortal hatred. Dispatch our army immediately!
All who bring disharmony to the Celestial Empire must pay the final price. To battle, in the Emperor's name!
None may trespass in the domain of Daemons and live to tell the tale. Rend them limb from shattered limb.
None but His chosen may enter Khorne's domain and live. Let the slaughter commence!
None may trespass upon the Motherland's sacred earth without consequence. Kislev must rise up!
None may visit the Urfather's garden without His express invitation. An early death will no doubt teach these unwanted guests the error of their ways.
These fools are at our doors, daring to disturb us from our pursuit of perfection. The sooner they are dispatched, the sooner we may return to forbidden pleasures.
Long has Great Tzeeneth anticipated this foolish invasion. Now He would have us spring the trap He has so meticulously planned.
Foreign Army
None Shall Breach the Bastion
Inviting Their Own Destruction
Dominion of Blood
Motherland Inviolate
Pests in the Garden
Unwelcome Voyeurs
As We Knew They Would

Our Hobgoblin spies amongst the Greenskins send word that their army marches into our lands, slaves to their insatiable lust for violence. We shall meet them with fire and brimstone. Their green blood shall soak into the ash like the red blood before it, fading to the black of our soils.
Our ancestors weep and wail to see Greenskins wreak destruction upon their sacred homeland. We must rise up!
The Dark Gods rage to see this green taint upon our domain. Remove it at once.
Slaughter the savage green ones before their honourless stain taints any more of Khorne's domain.
Do not allow the foul, green killers to pollute our glorious kingdom. Attack, and drive the beasts back!
Of all the mortals, there are none quite so rude as the drooling Greenskins. They come to our domain without so much as a by your leave. We shall have to discipline them.
The green mortals would have Slaanesh's delicately-fragranced lands of lust and excess reduced to mere bone and ash. Do not allow this disappointment to come to pass.
The fungal beasts are helpless slaves to their simple nature, and maraud across the Changer's lands even though it spells their own doom. Let us enact the inevitable.
Greenskin Incursion
Filthy Footprints
Rage Against the Green Machine
A Wasted Waaagh!
Big Green Men
Da Boyz Can't Come Back to Town
Simple Minds
Pure Instinct

Watching the Elves march through our lands, one can see what they call beauty – their immortal rhythm, their effulgent armour, the grace with which they dispatch our people. Hashut longs to make them truly beautiful though, broken on his altars, marrow cracked in his name. Send our forces and gather them up.
Drive back the covetous Asur filth. Grand Cathay is ours and ours alone!
Send out your Daemons to remove the Asur from our lands. Let the deaths be innumerable.
Crush these Asur invaders! Let their weakling race tremble as they witness the bloody consequence of challenging great Kharneth.
The Motherland must rise against these preening Asur! They think themselves entitled to our soil – prove them wrong.
We simply cannot allow these spindly creatures to impose their tedious ideas of order upon our blissfully necrotic lands. They must know rot.
The Asur mean to pervert our blissfully twisted lands by imposing order and purity upon them. This cannot be!
The marionettes of Ulthuan seek to impose order upon chaos. Ensure their joyless efforts are in vain, and litter our lands with their distorted corpses.
Broken Beauties
Where They Do Not Belong
Undoing Ulthuan's Ambitions
The Pale Queen Awaits
From Their Ivory Towers
Maintaining Disorder
Let Perversion Reign
Last March of the Eldest Race

Behind them, a swathe of dead and nothing more. In front of them, our fleeting workers and warriors, hope abandoned. Such an insult to Hashut – only he should inspire terror in our people! Only he should strike them, take their blood sacrifice. Raise an army and stop this Khornate blasphemy!
The blood-soaked fiends of the Great Enemy come to Cathay. No matter the cost, we must stand against this horror.
The Skull Throne has no claim upon our domain! Eviscerate the blood legion, and let our Daemons sup from their accursed skulls.
Our kin seek to take what is not theirs. For this insult, we must claim their skulls and dine on their red-hot blood.
Once more, the blood-drenched Daemons bring slaughter to our lands. Now as always, Kislev must drive them back!
Kharneth never tires of invasion, does he? Well, not today, old bean. Show the Blood God the door, if you will.
If Kharneth's followers have their mindless way, our perfect, perfumed province of perversions will be razed to a dead husk. We must defend our decadent domain.
The brutes of Khorne steep our lands in blood, as the Architect has long known they would. We must obliterate them, as the Architect has long known we would.
Private Terror
Turn Back the Lord of Murder
Blood For the Blood God
Hunter of Souls
Turn Back the Blood Tide
Sayonara to the Skull Thone
Stem the Blood
All This Has Happened Before

How tedious the Kislevites are! Sombre and dour, humourless. Cannot they see Hashut's great joke on them all, the joke of their purpose in our world? No, they cannot, or they would bend the knee to us now. Instead they send armies into our lands, ones we must destroy. Immediately.
Push the thugs of Kislev from Cathay's borders! These primitives cannot claim even an inch of the Emperor's land.
The frigid fools of Ursun dare to invade our realm! Send our legion against them, and provide the Dark Gods with a glorious spectacle.
The mortals of Kislev will soon wish they had contented themselves with merely keeping Khorne's wrath at bay. Destroy the invaders!
Those whose betrayal made the Motherland weep now seek to claim her! They must know the final punishment!
The men of Kislev tire of waiting for Chaos to come to them, and instead come to us. We must ensure the poor saps never get such an idea in their heads again.
The denizens of Kislev are drawn to our domain, no doubt desirous to gaze upon our perfect flesh first-hand. We should grant them a long and lingering chance to admire us, and then smite them.
The proud mortals of frigid Kislev come to our door, convinced that they are bound for triumph. How the Great Schemer shall laugh as we annihilate them.
Sombre Army
Back to the Oblast
Returned to the Motherland
Death to the Patriarchy
Traitor's Reward
Reject the Orthodoxy
Moths to the Flame
They Shall Not Endure

Far from home, the Lizardmen's minions are, fulfilling some part of the Old Ones' Great Plan. In our home they are, an ignorant insult to our Dark Father. Spring the trap, send our warriors, strip them of gold and star-metal, then give their chicken-flesh to the Renders!
The Cold Bloods bring death to our glorious empire. In Xen Yang's name, take their inhuman heads!
Tear these reptiles limb from limb! All their worthless kind must know the folly of trespassing against Daemons.
The weakling servants of the Old Ones make their play. Decimate them, and drive the traumatised survivors from our domain.
Their inhuman hands must never seize Mother Kislev! We must take the fight to these repellent reptiles.
Grandfather cannot abide the children of the Old Ones, so to see them in His domain is most distressing indeed. Send our Tallymen against them as soon as is convenient.
Do not allow Slaanesh's domain to become part of these reptiles' joyless Great Plan. Obliterate them, and then our decadent degradation may continue.
These reptiles bring their damnable reverence of the Old Ones to our gloriously twisted lands. Drive them out, so that Change may once again thrive.
Distant Stars
Reptilian Encroachment
Lay Waste to the Lizards
Lay Waste to the Lizards
Balancing the Scales
Repulse the Reptiles
Best-Laid Plans
Most Ancient of Conflicts

You raid us, beard-fools? Varach, to contend with us in our home, to take our chattels and our gold, to frustrate our lusts! An army of Dhrath-Zharr shall descend upon you, take your skulls, and put your strong backs in chains to work on the Plain of Zharr.
Do not permit the wretched men of Chaos to make claim upon Cathay. Rise against their barbarity!
These fool mortals believe the Ruinous Powers will allow them to steal from Daemons. Brutalise them without delay.
Perhaps the Norscans seek to prove themselves to Khorne. No matter. The punishment for trespass is screaming, wailing slaughter.
Countless of our forefathers died to keep Chaos from our borders. We must now do the same, no matter the cost.
The men of Norsca are only doing what the Dark Gods have taught them to do, but we cannot permit them to steal territory from the Urfather.
The witless Norscan mortals believe they can take from Slaanesh without His consent. They must suffer the lash, at length.
The nerve of these Northern mortals! Teach these fool puppets that they cannot steal from their gods without paying the most terrible of prices.
Norse Helots
Repel the Northern Invaders!
They Shall Not Make Claim
The Axefather's Wrath
A Bastion Against Barbarism
We Have Taught Them Well
Ask, Don't Take
Stealing From God

The droning Plaguebearers are tallying their count in OUR lands. How dare Nurgle? Laughing horror, take your abhorrent gifts elsewhere! To put your pestilent forces into the realm of the Chaos Dwarfs? Too far, brother-to-Hashut – a joke too far. We will meet your invasion head-on!
Our sacred kingdom falls to infection most foul. Cleanse the Dragon Emperor's lands, and restore harmony unto them.
Cleanse our lands of the Urfather's foul stench. His rotted offspring must not claim our realm.
Though invasion is a rare act of courage from slothful Nurgle, His foetid children must be annihilated for this offence.
The stain of Chaos pollutes our homeland. Kislev must turn back this odious disease!
Selfish ingrates! Our fellow devotees of decay break Grandfather's heart by seeking to lay his favourite children low. It must be an early bedtime for them.
The Maggotkin violate our fragranced lands with their putrid stench! Cleanse them forthwith, and the delicious aroma of sweat-drenched sin may return.
The Fly Lord would have our ever-changing lands fall into dour stagnation. The Changer demands that we obliterate these droning Daemons of Nurgle.
Pestilent Joke
A Pox Upon the Land
A Stand Against Famine & Plague
Festering Fools
Disinfection
A Family Squabble
The Scent of Decay
Birds Feast Upon Flies

The hungry ones encroach on our lands, having exhausted their local supplies of meat. Their butchers spy our richly-hoarded wealth and think it ripe for the taking. Stop their brute power before it swallows more of our land – then bind their strength deep in our mines.
Let no more Cathayan souls fall to these cannibals! Strike them down, and make our lands safe once more.
These fatted mortals hunger to claim our realm. Our Daemons must make them pay the final price for their greed.
These witless brutes cannot be permitted to consume what belongs to Khorne. Claim their bloated skulls!
Engage the brutes of the Maw, before any more of our proud-hearted people fall victim to their unholy hunger.
Someone has eyes bigger even than their colossal stomachs. Pray do all you can to ensure these bloated half-wits do not claim Nurgleth's domain.
These brutes mean to raid our lands and consume our supple flesh – a sad squandering of the countless pleasures it may bring. Break their fool minds and flay their flabby hides.
Ogre minds are too simple to fall into true insanity, so our response to their preposterous invasion must, alas, be an unsophisticated one. To battle!
Ogre Hunters
Bounce Out the Bullies
Unfettered Greed
Make the Maw Mourn
Their Last Supper
Unhappy Eaters
Prime Cuts
Be Not Consumed

Up, boiling from the soil, like a torrent of uric stench and scrabbling blades, come the Skaven. It is their misfortune that they surfaced in the lands of the Dawi-Zharr, for we do not suffer vermin to live. Meet their army head-on, corral their hordes into the killing-pits, and burn the rest.
Filthy vermin! Their very presence in Cathay is the gravest of insults. Cut them down or drive them out!
Annihilate these worthless rodents! They cannot be permitted to overwhelm our dominion.
Crush the skull of every contemptible rodent that dares skulk across Khorne's kingdom. They are without worth!
We cannot allow these vermin to infest our glorious Motherland. Unleash Tor's might upon them!
Admittedly these vermin spread delicious pestilence wherever they go, but that does not entitle them to claim our blighted lands. Shatter their hunched spines for this insult.
The rodents scuttle across our domain, staining our pleasure hives with their filth. Slay them to a one, and then our Daemons shall cavort amongst their stinking carcasses.
Cleanse this filth from our lands without delay, for rodent mortals breed so fast that their sheer numbers risk disrupting Tzeentch's careful plans.
Skaven Upsurge
Snap Their Hunched Spines
Removing the Infestation
Cleanse the Infestation
Trap the Rats
The Uninvited Pest
Repel the Ratmen
Little More Than Insects

How dare they? The Prince of Pleasure, the Lord of Excess, allowing His minions to slake their lusts on Hashut's property and Hashut's subjects, in Hashut's lands! We will cut their knees from under them, make them lie gasping in the dirt, as if grovelling, before we end them. Attack!
We cannot allow the Emperor's shining jewel to be tainted by these deviants! Punish them for their sins!
If these Slaaneshi believe they can bewitch us into granting them our lands, they are gravely mistaken. We must eviscerate them.
The Slaaneshi rouse themselves from wanton decadence to prance across the lands of blood. Destroy them!
Unspeakable sin comes to Kislev! We must arrest its spread without delay.
Oh, what a bother. Slaanesh seek to gains a foothold in our domain. We can't have that, can we? Prepare the Tallybands for war.
Our kin require our consent before they bring torment upon our home and help themselves to our perfect bodies. They will pay the darkest price for their disrespect.
The Dark Prince's puppets stir at last from their sweat-stained beds, and take it upon themselves to invade the kingdom of Change. This is, of course, unacceptable.
Kneeling God
A Stand Against Seduction
The Sweet Suffering
Pleasure-Seekers
Untold Suffering
Purple Rain
Incestuous Invasion
Immune to Seduction

Slaves to ancient whims they are, of Settra and his kind, desires older than time bringing them to Zharr-Naggrund. These ancient bones, that have travelled half the world, must now rest in our lands. Our armies will lay them low and our Daemonsmiths will cancel their ancient magicks.
Only the Dragon Emperor and his kin may lay claim to immortality. Drive these abominations from our sacred realm!
Remove these ghouls from our domain. Our Daemons hunger to crush their unnatural bones to dust.
Do not allow these puppets of Necromancy to lay claim to Khorne's dominion. Shatter them to dust!
Dead souls march upon the Motherland. Destroy these unholy abominations, for Kislev must remain pure.
The ghouls of Nehekhara tromp across the Urfather's lands, disrupting the great cycle of death and rebirth with their foul Necromancy. Do something about it, won't you?
Necromancy must not desecrate the Dark Prince's lands. These ghouls deserve only oblivion, and our Daemonettes lust to grant it to them.
The dead can make no claim upon the Great Conspirator's realm. This is our opportunity to grant them the fate they have so long evaded.
Ancient Bones
The Taint of Necromancy
Shifting Sands
Death Lays His Icy Hand On Kings
Throwing Out the Bones
Skeleton Crew
Bone Idols
They Shall Be Released

We will change you, Changer. We will change the course of your armies, who you arrogantly marched into our lands. We will change their bravery to cowardice, when they see the horrors of which our army comprises. We will change them from living to dead and bury them in Zharr-Naggrund, where all shall weep.
Cathay must be safeguarded from Chi'an Chi's foul machinations. Purge these horrors from our empire.
The Raven's scheme must not succeed. Engage his Daemons, and drive all who survive the onslaught from our realm.
Lay waste to the Changer's spawn, before their honourless sorcery despoils the purity of our ravaged lands.
We have stood against the mutants of Chaos for centuries. We cannot fall to them now. Eradicate these changeling horrors!
We cannot allow the Raven's schemes to interfere with the natural order of things. Please ensure that the only changelings who remain in our domain are merrily decomposing.
Here He is, the Changer of Ways, seeking to drag our realm into his tedious game. Alas, we must tear ourselves away from our unspeakable transgressions to deal with his Changeling horde.
Our all-knowing God amuses Himself by convincing our errant kin that they are fated to claim our lands. It falls upon us to reveal His glorious deception to them.
Changer, Changed
The Changer Comes
Their Future Denied
Turn Back, Tzeeneth!
Incursion of Insanity
Turfing Out Tzeentch
The Grandmaster of Games
Changeling Conquerors

There is nothing for the Vampire Counts here, nothing for their Undead hordes to settle on, save for OUR Labourers, OUR chattels. Hashut will not let them leave, alive or Undead. Assail them, descend upon them. Their leader's grip on the dead is so weak they will fall apart before we have killed a tenth of them.
Cleanse our lands of Undeath! Shine Celestial light upon these midnight fiends!
The midnight fiends must not be permitted to spread Unlife across these lands. Consign them to the grave!
For the insult of their trespass, Khorne demands you tear them limb from dead limb, and feast upon their lifeless blood.
Lifeless hands grasp at Kislev's throat. Return these unliving monstrosities to their foul graves.
Disgusting! The midnight dead pollute Grandfather's garden with their appalling Necromantic heresy. We must grant them the death they have so long evaded.

The midnight fiends skulk through our delectable domain, spreading a frisson of tantalising terror. While not unpleasurable, it is a distraction from yet more excessive pursuits. They must be eliminated.
The Raven God will not tolerate the presence of these death-cheating ghouls within His domain. Grant them release from their foul Unlives.
Decimated Dead
Sunlight is the Best Disinfectant
Blood & Death
Children of the Night
Twilight of the Dead
Begging for the Grave
Nightstalkers
Cleansing Fire

Athel Loren comes to Zharr-Naggrund. Swaying dulbug, lithe Dryads and elegant archers darting among their roots – the Wood Elves bring their forest realm with them as they travel. And we bring our own: fire, machinery, forced warriors and betrayal. Send our army, see which realm prevails.
They slink from the trees to assault Xen Yang's domain. A price must now be paid.
These trespassing Elves must be rewarded for their boldness with unchecked slaughter. Send our Daemons to battle!
Make these pitiful tree-worshippers pay for their foolhardy intrusion. Rend them until there is nothing left to rend.
The cowardly Elves slink from their treetops and trespass upon our honoured homeland. They must know justice!
Elves? In the Urfather's domain? We cannot have that. Pay turn these glade-worshipping gadabouts to mulch as punishment for this uninvited call.
The acrid stench of purity afflicts our lands, for the sickeningly harmonious Elves of the forest attempt invasion. Cut them down, and let glorious depravity reign once more.
For long years has Tzeeneth slowly, carefully convinced these forest Elves that they must finally leave their isolation and strike against us. Let us spring His trap.
Wooden Warriors
Dig Up the Weeds
Root & Branch
Folly of the Fey Folk
Return to Nature
Fools of the Forest
Purity is an Illusion
Resisting Nature's Claim

This horde of the Blood God's single-minded minions is focused elsewhere for now, but could one day turn its gaze upon our lands. Better we cull it early, before it can grow into a true threat – for it is in attack that his minions excel, so far better we take the initiative and choose the ground.
Cut down the fiends of blood! It is our duty, now and forever!
Prepare your legion. Let us give Kharneth a fight to chill even his ever-boiling blood.
Let our sometime kin suffer our unbridled, brutal wrath!
No servant of the Blood God can be allowed to live. The Motherland must strike against these fiends.
Do something about the Skull Throne's howling legion, won't you? They are making quite the nuisance of themselves.
Let there be battle, let there be screaming, let there be blood, let there be laceration and evisceration, let there be an ocean of sundered Khornate corpses!
It would amuse our Daemons greatly to witness the unsophisticated barbarity of the Khornate legion first-hand. We should not disappoint them.
Aggressive Defence
A Tide of Blood
A Feast of Skulls
Blood Feud
Smash the Skull-Takers
The Sheer Brass Neck of It
The Dream Calls for Blood
Feeding Time at the Zoo

Oh, the Bear-God's armies – they stink so! Old fur and dirty cloth, strong spirits, grease, dried fish and horsemeat. Like a slave-race, not like the masters of a great kingdom! Clear this filthy force away, far from Hashut's lands, back to the ice of their home.
Let the wretched Kislevites suffer the Emperor's wrath. Perhaps then they will know their place.
Kislev has stood against the might of Chaos for too many generations. Our Daemons must now destroy their paltry army.
Cleave apart the mortals of Ursun, and teach their weakling kind that no man may stand against Khorne.
It is time to bring Motherland justice to these hateful traitors.
We should treat these mortals of Ursun to a little disease, death and decay. It would make Grandfather so very happy.
Bewitch these mortal fools of the wretched Motherland, and as they stare, paralysed by overwhelming desire, cut them open and harvest their souls for the Perfect Prince.
How the legion of Change hungers to toy with mortal fates. These puppets of Kislev will surely suffice.
Corpse-Bear's Stench
Bears Begone!
Mother Kislev Shall Weep
Shatter the Ice
Comrades Divided
A War Upon Winter
Kislev's Folly
Besting the Bear

Coldblooded they may, but our spies tell us that the Lizardmen have gathered with hotblooded plans, to move upon the lands of Zharr-Naggrund and the Chaos Dwarfs. We cannot stand their plots and their endless, silent rivalry. Assault them and rain fire!
Execute these lowly reptiles! Their repellent schemes bring only disharmony.
Tear these Cold Bloods limb from scaled limb. They will surely present little challenge, for they are only mortal.
The spawn of the Old Ones cannot be permitted to live. Soak the earth in their cold, reptilian blood.
Waylay these reptiles, before their foul schemes bring doom to proud Kislev.
There must be something up your festering sleeve to deal with these bothersome reptiles. The worms are hungry to nibble at their cold flesh.
It will be an act of mercy to end these reptilian mortals' joylessly scheming lives, for an existence deprived of depravity and sin is no existence at all.
The forces of the Great Conspirator must rise against the forces of the Great Plan. Only one ancient and ineffable design may prevail.
Coldblooded Plans
Children of the Older Gods
Unmaking the Great Plan
Reap the Reptiles
Conquer the Cold Ones
Lethal Lurghi For the Lizardmen
Doomed Children of Doomed Gods
Three Moves Ahead

Do they think us weak? To form raiding parties so near our holdings, where our Hobgoblin outriders can see them posture and bicker? Let us wreak havoc on this army of Northmen, persuade them to take their theft and rapine elsewhere.
All who worship the Great Enemy must know that they invite their own destruction. Strike them down!
These men have shackled themselves to darkness, but they know nothing. It is time they saw the truth. Unleash the Daemons!
Teach these fools Norscans that they do not take from Chaos – Chaos takes from them.
We must cut down these hate-worshipping barbarians. Ursun demands it!
Right then, it's about time these Northern barbarians met face-to-face with the Ruination they so revere. Send out the Tallymen!
As we torment them with our blades and talons, with our tongues and lashes, with our beauty and our monstrosity, the Ruin-worshipping mortals of Norsca shall ascend.
For generations, the Changer of Ways has indoctrinated the Norscans will the false belief that they are unstoppable. Now, they must at last hear the punchline.
Disar-Raid
No More Ruin
Beneath the Banner of the Wolf
The Face of God
Servants of Ruin
The Face of God
Agonising Reward
Guided to Disaster

Again, Pox-master, with the smiles and gifts of disease. We ourselves are naturally hardy, resistant even, but our Labourers sicken and weaken as Nurgle's cavalcade draws near. Dispatch an army with the message that we wish them to perform their dance of death, their comedy of pestilence, in other lands.
Cleanse this foul disease! Let harmony be restored!
These slovenly fools of rot must stand in our way no longer. Soak the earth with their oozing, stinking gore.
Rip them foetid limb from pestilent limb! Shower in their noxious gore!
Kislev must rise against this tide of Daemonic disease, as did our proud forefathers.
Bad children! Bad! They have upset Grandfather Nurgle terribly, and must be disciplined at once.
Alas, we must dirty our perfect flesh with the flayed gore of these feckless, festering fools. The atonal screams of tormented Maggotkin shall at least make it worthwhile.
We must stop the spread of Nurgleth's rot, before the world entire falls into dour decay. Scourge this disease with eldritch fire.
The Comedians
The Great Cleansing
From Their Wounds the Fester Pours
Ruin Upon Rot
A Pox Upon Them
A Death in the Family
Steeped in Filth
Change is the Cure

Could you call the Ogres brave, in their expeditions away from their mountain kingdoms, where they ate the Sky-Titans? Can creatures of such limited awareness be brave? If they could comprehend what they face in the Chaos Dwarfs, would they fear? An experiment then: our army against theirs, to see if they can learn fear.
These brutes cannot be reasoned with. A show of superior force is all they can understand.
Show these witless Ogres what true destruction looks like. Tear their pendulous bellies open.
The corpulent mortals' endless greed shall bring about only their bloody destruction. Tear them apart!
The flesh-eating brutes must be stopped. The children of Kislev must make their stand.
Oh, how delicious it is to picture these bloated bodies riddled with gangrenous decay. We simply must make it happen.

How our Daemons shall delight as the brutish mortals cleave their pristine skin and tear off their supple limbs. Once our legion has grown bored of this divine suffering, they will gleefully execute their tormentors.
Amusing as it has been to see these brutish mortals spread turmoil and tumult wherever they tread, this joke ceases to be amusing. Obliterate them!
Fear Taught
Unnatural Appetites
Greed Comes Before a Fall
Greed is Not Good
Avarice is Sin
Wanton Greed
Glorious Pain
The Last Supper

That never-ending swarm of skittering, chittering idiots, numberless, is an affront to our mighty few. But their ambition clashes with our own and there can be only one master of the Old World – and it will be not be a rat with horns!
Eradicate these filthy pests, for they spread only disease and disharmony wherever they tread.
Rats should be the easiest of prey, but these ones prove uncommonly problematic. Make them howl as they die.
Stamp out these meritless rodents. Tear their foul hides open, and harvest their tiny skulls for Khorne!
Stamp out these vermin! Cleanse them with the light of Dazh!
A slew of decomposing rodent bodies will help all manner of wonderful new life sprout from the land. Please dispatch them at your earliest convenience.
Gouge out their red eyes, lacerate their filthy hides, tear their gnarled tails from their spines and revel in the hideous cacophony of their terrified shrieking.
Each rodent life has no more worth and meaning than that of a mayfly. They shall learn this as our Daemons smite them with shining blade and scourging magefire.
Skitterling Assault
Stamp Out the Plague
Red Eyes Close
A Slaughter of Skaven
Cleanse the Sewers
Putrefying Pests
Stem the Foul Tide
Stopping the Unstoppable

For all of the Slaaneshi horde's desperation for experience to be pointed in just one direction is a rarity. Let us provide them with that focus by assaulting their army and leaving their corpses face-down in the mud!
Let no other soul be seduced by these abominations of Chaos. Cut them down!
Ride to war against these Slaaneshi whelps, and drape the battlefield with ribbons of velvet flesh.
Put a brutal end to their vacuous pleasures. Show Slaanesh that Khorne will tolerate him no longer.
The pleasure fiends turn proud minds to unspeakable sin. We must strike them down where they stand.
How our Grandfather yearns to see the perfect flesh of these Slaaneshi irritants riddled with worms and noxious pustules. See to it, won't you?
Let us bring about mutual suffering of untold, unspeakable proportions, and we shall learn which of Slaanesh's concubines truly deserve His agonising embrace.
These Daemons of Slaanesh seek forbidden sensations, always. It would be churlish of us to deny them the indescribable heights of agony that only the Changer's eldritch fire can bring.
Focus, Supplied
Take No Pleasure
Their Thirst Shall Not Be Sated
A Lesser God
Final Sin
The Promise of Putrefaction
Simultaneous Annihilation
Nerves On Fire

Relentless like the desert sands, the massive Ushabti and the ancient dead are driven by the incomprehensible whims of their rulers. Against the might of the Chaos Dwarfs they will be as dust and ash!
The Emperor abhors Necromancy. Return these walking nightmares to their musty graves.
The dead must die! Ride to war, and make these ghouls understand that the Dark Gods do not tolerate Necromancy.
The former mortals suffer delusions of grandeur. Annihilate them! Leave only dust!
In Ursun's name, the unholy dead can walk this earth no longer.
It is a terrible shame that these skeletal ghouls have no flesh left to decay, but we can at least grant them the gift of permanent death.
Slaanesh desires to learn whether or not creatures of bone can feel pain. Send forth the legion of excess to enact this delectable experiment.
Teach these fleshless puppets that their immortality is a dark gift that Tzeentch can take back from them whenever He so chooses.
Dust to Dust
Bring Out Your Dead
Dust to Dust
Back to the Mausoleum
Ancient Enemy
Nurgle vs Necromancy
Revenant Research
Necromancy is an Illusion

The Changer's armies are as predictable as their master – to leave them alone is to invite betrayal or stranger tricks. Better to crush them at the first opportunity, and kill their schemes in the cradle, before they escape and spread Tzeentch's gift of insanity.
Annihilate Chi'an Chi's twisted servants! His wicked scheme must not succeed!
No more schemes! No more games! The legion of Change must know anguish, agony and annihilation.
Hunt down the Raven's trickster spawn! Let our ferocity be without end!
We must cleave open their mutant skulls, and put an end to their twisted schemes.
The inevitability of death is a riddle even the Architect of Fates cannot solve. Let the Raven howl as our Tallybands put his irksome slaves in the ground.

We must outplay the Architect of Fates at the Great Game, or his twisting schemes shall surely disrupt our pursuit of perfection. The unexpected annihilation of this changeling horde shall surely suffice.
Our changeling kin are mere puppets to the Architect's will, as are we. We all must perform for His fleeting entertainment.
The Premised Future
Clipping the Raven's Wings
Ending the Charade
Reaper of Ravens
Assault the Architect
Their Final Riddle
Turning the Tables
Dancing the Endless Dance

What do the Vampires hope for? Acceptance from their own kind? Rule of the Old World? Or mere blood? We will not be cattle for their unnatural hunger – our blood, our toil is pledged to another, the great Father of Darkness.
Put these walking atrocities in the ground. They must spread the disease of Unlife no more!
Send the Ruinous legion against these fool Vampires. Our Daemons shall feast upon their Undead flesh.
Tear their Unlife from them! Rend apart their soulless bodies, and crush their dead hearts!
Unlife is a sin in the eyes of Salyak! We must grant these fiends eternal rest.
How Grandfather weeps and wails to see these twilight souls denied the beauty of death. Please, make it all better for Him.
These Vampires are masters of torment. How heavenly it will be to let their dead fangs tear at our divine flesh. Naturally, we shall destroy them to a one once the novelty has worn off.
The midnight fiends must be eradicated forthwith, for the Well of Eternity reveals that, if left unchecked, they will disrupt our grand design.
Blood, Pledged
Twilight's End
Midnight Sons
Death Becomes Them
Turn Back the Night
Midnight's Children
Throbbing Veins
Rogue Element

When the forest defenders are gathered in one place, mustered for war, that is when we must strike. For when they dissolve, when they melt into the greenwood, we cannot catch them without burning the entire place to the ground.
The forest Elves must become food for worms. There is no alternative now.
Tear the forest Elves apart, and make their coward kind understand that they cannot hide from our Ruinous retribution forever.
Teach the pitiful children of Kurnous what it truly means to be hunted.
The tree-dwellers can hide from us no longer. They must suffer Ursun's divine wrath.

How would you feel about infecting a legion Wood Elves with a gruesome disease or six, and feeding the land with scores of their putrescent corpses? The Urfather cannot think of a better way to spend an afternoon.
Let us beguile these forest Elves, and seduce them into the most appalling transgressions. As they reel, exhausted by agony and ecstasy, we shall claim their mortal souls.
The puppets of Isha stand against the glorious tide of twisted Change. They are a bastion of sickening purity that we must topple without delay.
A Fistful of Kindling
Athel Loren Laid Low
The Corruption of Nature
Hunters Become the Hunted
Fury Unto the Fey Folk
Infect the Children of Isha
Slaughter of Innocence
Resisting the Natural Order
They should know it is better to be by the side of the worshippers of Hashut than in our path.
Long has Cathay known strength in isolation, but the threat is now so dire that an ally is required.
Though our ferocity is beyond compare, for ever greater feats of destruction we must lure another to our Ruinous cause.
Seek accord with one who will aid our glorious cause of destruction.
Mother Kislev has fought and struggled alone for long centuries, but dark times require strong allies.
We find ourselves in need a very special friend to aid the Fly Lord's cankerous cause. Pray welcome another to our festering family.
We require a partner for our dark dance, a willing accomplice to cavort with, someone to hold in our torturous embrace and gleefully join us in our endless pursuit of transgression.
The Architect of Fates has long known which ally you would choose to help bring about His great design. If you wish, you may tell yourself that you are exercising free will.
Daemonic Cronyism
Friends in Low Places
An Abominable Alliance
A Companion in Conquest
Comrades in Arms
Cankerous Embrace
Courtship Dance
The Illusion of Choice

Such wealth in the Bretonnian realm. Untouched hills to be mined, forests to be clear-cut, clean lakes to feed the steam engines and receive the factory outflows... Go there and take all they have. Even the people.
Strip Bretonnia of her wealth, and bring calamity to her pristine lands.
Bring Ruination upon these mortal lands! Our Daemons shall demolish the comforts they have so long enjoyed, and leave only fear.
Bring Ruin upon those who think themselves goodly and pure. Let them know the depths of their folly.
The kingdom of the Lady is wealthy beyond measure. We must seize these riches from them.
Let us spread virulent pox across the fair lands of Bretonnia, for they suffer from a most dismaying degree of purity and order.
We must bring degradation and depravity to these courtly lands. Our Daemonettes shall dance amongst the ruins, and drape their shining flesh in gleaming finery.
Let the proud lands of Bretonnia become twisted by terror and madness. The Changer is coming, and He cannot be stopped.
Perfect Raid
Punish the Prancing Dukes
Green & Pleasant Land
Green & Pleasant Lands
Bretonnian Bounty
Their Crops Shall Fail
Chivalry is Soon to Be Dead
What's Theirs is Ours

The Beastmen are not wealthy in the way of Zharr-Naggrund – they know not the joys of a finely-cut jewel or the fine tattoos on a chosen servant. But they gather wealth at their herdstones and keep others from buried resources. Enter and take it from them.
Destabilise these beasts of Chaos. Let their realm suffer the ruin they have brought upon so many others.
These animals have the temerity to believe the Ruinous Powers favour them. Despoil their lands and they shall learn how wrong they were.
Rampage through their dens, destroying without mercy. They are mere beasts, and they deserve nothing.
We must sow discord among these beasts of Chaos. Only once they are weakened can Kislev hope to prevail.
Let us turn the dark lands of these beasts to bilious Ruin. Perhaps they hide a few worthwhile trinkets too.
As these animals worship Ruin, they will surely be delighted by the degradation of their squalid realm. Not that we intend to give them a choice in this matter.
Send forth the blue-gold legion to strike fathomless fear into these animals' simple minds.
Herdstone Raid
Empty Nests
Entering the Nest
Domain of the Cloven Ones
Beastly Burdens
Filth-Encrusted Nests
Delightful Devastation
Tzeentch Makes Claim Upon the Beasts

We do Chaos underlings a favour by taking from them all that they have. In the name of their Gods they will do nothing with the wealth of the land. Yet in Hashut's service, we will strip it, plunder it, build tributes. Raid them, so it might be used better.
We must lay the Great Enemy's warriors low. Despoil their lands and leave them weak.
Let there be Ruin and destruction beyond compare! Let these fools see what true Chaos looks like!
Servants of Ruin should offer all they have to Khorne. As they will not, we must take it from them.
Bring chaos upon Chaos! Spread ruin across their loathsome lands!
Let us shower these devotees of darkness with the gift of ruination. Though they may protest, at heart they will surely be grateful.
Slaanesh desires that these lands of Chaos experience what their denizens' countless victims have experienced. Only through untold suffering can they push themselves beyond their barbaric limits.
Punish these Chaos-worshipping lands for their faith. How great Tzeentch shall delight as they realise they have been betrayed by one of their own gods.
Stripped Lands
Strike Against Evil
Despoil the Despoilers
An Offering to Their God
Bloodstained Coin
Their Darkest Desire
The Rapture of Torment
The Traitor God

Imagine the plunder the Undead pirates have gathered here, hoarded from pure rapacity, being as they are beyond real need. All it will take is a short moment of victory and that wealth, scraped from the seabed, stolen from razed villages, will be ours – by which I mean, of course, Hashut's.
Today we take from vile criminals what was not theirs to begin with. We must plunder these unholy lands.
Tear down their homes, and seize whatever blood-soaked wealth these Unliving pirates hide within them.
Rip apart their soulless lands! Seize their stolen riches and make even the dead cower!
We must march upon their unholy nests, and seize all we can from these dead lands.
Let us see what plunder these ghoulish pirates guard. No doubt we can also find a disease to stoke fear even in their dead hearts.

Let us discover what treasures these pirate ghouls hide within their lairs. The most exquisite trinkets shall be offered up to Slaanesh in gratitude for the wonderful and terrible sensations He grants us.
Send our changeling horde to plunder these pirate lands. The dark irony, though somewhat obvious, is delicious indeed.
Piratical Plenty
Stealing from Thieves
Realm of the Mad King
Plunder the Pirates
Can't Take It With You
A Plague Upon the Pirates
Draped Across His Divine Flesh
Inevitable Destiny

What laxity these Cathayans show. Why do they not use their land correctly, exploit it for all it has. Do their feeble Dragon overlords weaken their minds I wonder? Fear not, for the Dawi-Zharr have plans for all their wealth and the intent to take it from them.
The traitors must be weakened. Overturn their heretic shrines and seize their undeserved wealth.
Bring Ruin upon the Dragon's lands! Let our Daemons rejoice as they sow despair and destruction.
Let the ruin of his lands be the very least of the destruction we wreak upon the Dragon.
They speak always of their precious 'harmony'. Let us see how they fare when we rip all harmony from them.
The Dragon and his followers are so very proud of their precious 'harmony'. A choice plague and a few well-placed acts of destruction will put paid to all that.
Set back the Dragon's turgid cause! Raze his villages and seduce his proud people into wanton sin! The degradation shall be glorious indeed.
We must enact our disruption of the Dragon's doomed design. Go forth and despoil his laughable "Celestial Empire".
Unused Wealth
Traitor's Tribute
Kingdom of the Dragon
Riches of the Orient
Disharmony
Disharmony & Despair
Disharmony & Disorder
The Great Enemy Strikes Back

Wastrel Daemons, stripping the land of life in their infernal inscrutability and leaving... almost everything else of value. Raid it soon, before they destroy it in their ignorant immortal fancy. Their leavings we can use, for Hashut's glory.
We must reduce the Great Enemy's chokehold upon this land. Despoil their holdings and claim their blood-drenched wealth for the Emperor.
We must make our kin too weak to strike against us. Ravage their lands, and strike terror into their Ruinous hearts.
Teach the pretender that he is entitled to nothing! Lay remorseless waste to his pitiful fiefdom!
Sow disorder across the great betrayer's land! Bring ruin to this faithless fiend!
Let us show this false prince what true Chaos looks like. Raid his lands, and spread disease and despair far and wide.
This prince of Daemons must be made to know his low station. Devastate his lands and despoil his misguided followers, and teach him that none may challenge the majesty of Slaanesh.
Go forth and blight the forsaken lands of these lesser Daemons. Their deluded Prince must learn that Godhood shall never be his.
Daemon's Leavings
Daemons' Despair
To Destabilise a Daemon
Prince of Paupers
Wicked Wealth
Regent of Ruin
On His Knees
Hive of Insects

Look at you, Druchii, thinking you have perfected the helot state. However, you are but mere sadists. Yes, our Bull Centaur Renders indulge in hedonistic pleasures, but it is all to the glory of Hashut, not serving themselves. Would you excuse us if we snatched these morsels from your plate, so we might give them to someone more fitting – to Hashut, for instance?
Let the Druchii experience for themselves the suffering they have inflicted upon so many others. Raid their lands!
Tear apart these Druchii lands, make the fool mortals cower and seize anything of value. How we shall delight in their suffering.
Strike terror into the hearts of these honourless Druchii. Despoil their twisted lands!
Let they who are without mercy finally know what it is to suffer. Seize their riches and strike fear into their black hearts!
The Urfather asks that we make these Druchii irritants suffer. Let our rotted legion sow panic throughout their dark domain.
Suffering! Glorious suffering! This we shall grant to the Elves of Naggaroth. Some will fall to their knees in gratitude, others will beg for mercy. Both will bring rapture to glorious Slaanesh.
There is no richer reward, no crueller twist of fate, than to grant untold suffering to the homes of those who have wrought so much of it themselves.
Sadist State
Stealing from Khaine
Dark Ones Despoiled
The Land of Chill Provides
The Cruellest Coin
Domain of the Druchii
Blissful Punishment
This is How It Feels

What a fate awaits our kin who refuse to accept Hashut's glory and the coming of the End Times! Better by far that our raiding parties snatch them away to Zharr-Naggrund, where their prayers and entreaties will be met with whips and the mercy of death!
Bring ruin upon the Dwarfen realms, and take whatever the Celestial legion requires.
Send our Daemons to run rampant through their ancient halls and musty tunnels. The destruction shall be exquisite.
The squat mortals value gold above all else. Strip it from their lands, and sow terror in their craven hearts.
The Dwarfs treasure their gold above all other things. Rip it from them, and they will be weakened by despair.
The Dawi hide all manner of useful trinkets inside their halls and tunnels. Have our Tallyband help themselves, and ensure every surface is infected as they do.
Seize their gold and earn their grudges! Leave only Ruin and degradation in our wake! All glory to the Dark Prince!
Unleash the sorcerous might of the blue-gold legion upon these Dwarfen lands. Let the fool mortals accrue more of their laughable "grudges" than they can possibly count.
Karaz Raid
Cleanse the Tunnels
Ancient Wealth
Despair of the Dawi
Find the Motherlode
Pandemic in the Halls
An Unforgotten Sin
Give Them Reason to Hate Us

An easy target is the Empire of man. Its cities and counties are rich and sprawling, with dense woods to hide in. We could raid for weeks before the word of our exploits reached the slow burghers huddled behind their walls, and we'd be back in the Dark Lands before they'd even mustered their forces...
We must lay the Empire low before its ambitions grow too great to contain.
Let us prise the wealth from the terrified hands of these weakling Sigmarites, then tear their homes to the ground.
Khorne cares not for wealth, but Men treasure it so. Seize it from them, and lay waste to all that remains.
For too many years have the indolent Sigmarites enjoyed Kislev's protection. Now we take what we are due.
Send the rot legion to sow disease and disorder across the lands of man. How the Urfather will chortle as they pray in vain for Ulric to save them.
Ransack Sigmar's domain! Tear these men and women from their homes! Bring the most beautiful of them to Slaanesh, and let the rest know only terror.
In truth, all lands belong to Tzeentch. Teach the puppets of Empire that He can despoil and pillage them whenever He so chooses.
The Wide Empire
Sigmar's Gold
Faith, Steel & Gunpowder
Ashes of Empire
Sigmar's Bounty
Mankind is the Disease
Supple Trophies
Spoils of the Raven

The Dark Lands might be productive, but they are not... fecund. For fertility and edible goods and Labour we must look elsewhere, to the rich lands of Cathay and the Empire, to the mountains and the fjords. Hashut is a jealous god and he covets what others have!
We must bring disharmony upon these lands. Our foes will tremble even as the Celestial treasury grows fat.
Sow terror and destruction across these lands, and take pride as our Daemons dance amongst the Ruins.
Bring ruin upon their lands! Wade through rivers of blood, and seize endless tribute to great Kharneth!
The Motherland is in need of wealth. Take what we need, and leave our enemies weak.
These lands are ripe for infection. Bestow the gift of disease upon them, and rejoice as the panic spreads.
Slaanesh demands that we celebrate His beauty by showering Him with tribute. Raid these lands, grant glorious suffering to their cowering denizens and seize all that glitters for our Perfect Prince.
These meagre marionettes believe themselves safe in their homes. Send forth a raiding party, and the fools shall learn that security is mere illusion.
Raiding Season
Offerings to the Emperor
Crusade of Carnage
The Blood God Demands Tribute
Tribute to Ursun
Blight the Land
Because He's Worth It
Devastating Change

Mindless beasts, almost useless in their ferocity – though they are mighty, they are too unruly to be given weapons and whipped towards the enemy. No, we shall keep our predictably traitorous Hobgoblins and use these as workers and fodder. Still, they are worth raiding.
Let the vile Greenskins know what ruin feels like. Bring the Emperor's wrath to their blighted lands!
Despoil these Greenskin lands! We shall prove that even these animals are capable of despair.
Even honourless Greenskins can know fear. Khorne demands that you lay waste to their domain.
If we raid their foul domain, perhaps we can defang the Greenskin menace?
Raiding is all these unruly mortals understand. Let us see how they like it, hmm?
Lay the green fiends low, for their constant baying distracts us from our delectable depravities. Sow carnage and chaos throughout their barbarous domain, and perhaps they shall leave us be.
Ravage this blasted land! These Greenskin playthings must at last realise that, for all their barbarity, they are as endangered as any other species in this doomed world.
Raid the Greenskins
Tear Down Their Camps
Punish the Primitives
Greenbacks From Greenskins
Raid the Raiders
Teaching Fear to Monsters
Gagging Order
A Festival of Fear

Oh, familiar arrogance. Yet, we should raid for more workers as these Elves break so very easily – under the whip, pulling the chain, beneath the blows of the Bull Centaurs. Better to employ them as grudging craftsfolk, deep in the furnaces, working up gemstones to masterpieces for Hashut's fanes.
Lay waste to the shining lands of the Asur. Let them at last know what it is to go without.
Bring Ruin to the Asur province, and make these slaves to order beg for a salvation that will never come.
Tear the veil of order from their lands! Bring ruin to purity! Make the Asur beg for a mercy Khorne will never grant!
Kislev must lay these conceited Ulthuani low. Bring disorder to their realm, and fill the Motherland's coffers.
How delicious it is to imagine their gleaming spires ravaged by mould, filth and corrosion. We simply must make it happen.
Lord Slaanesh shall moan in rapture as Elven spires tumble and their ancient treasures are torn from their flayed hands.
Bring purest Chaos to these lands of sickening order! All Ulthuan will tremble before the Changer of Ways!
Pillage the Elves
The Eldest Race Weeps
The Light Fades
Ruin Upon the Eldest Race
Wipe the Smirk Off Their Faces
Ulthuan Unmade
Blight of the Ulthuani
Ulthuan's Twilight Begins

There is a saying "to steal skulls from Khorne", as if it is a foolish thing. Yet in His lust for death the Blood God leaves his towns undefended and ripe for pillaging. And those skulls would look so fine upon the altars of the Plain of Zharr...
Bring the Great Enemy to its knees! Carve a scar into its blasted kingdom!
Even the blood fiends of Kharneth can know anguish. Rain destruction upon their lands, and make them understand that they now face a greater power.
Khorne demands tribute. Seize it from our traitorous kin.
We must tread in the kingdom of blood, and sow disarray amongst the merciless skull-takers.
A little disease and strife across his lands will help ensure the Murder God's bite becomes no worse than his aggravatingly relentless bark. Make it so.
There is little left to blight in the blasted lands of Khorne, but nevertheless we must lay his howling blood-fiends low. Destroy what remains, and seize anything of worth.
Even lands as blasted as those of Kharneth can be made to suffer more. In Tzeeneth's name, unleash despair and Ruin upon them.
Hashut's Skulls
Weaken the Skull Throne
Taking Skulls From the Skull Throne
Khorne Collects
Bounty of Blood
Blood Infection
Fields of Blood
Ruin After Ruin

Little wonder that the plains of Kislev are empty of life – any warband of abject fools could wander across its great borders and spend weeks on their depredations before the fabled Lancers rode out to greet them. 'Tis the perfect place to raid for both workers and wealth.
Though the frigid kingdom of Ursun is but a footnote in history, Kislev's wealth will aid Cathay's cause.
We must despoil the lands of Ursun. Send out our Daemons to slaughter, steal and terrorise without remorse.
Bestow ruin upon the lands of the fool god Ursun!
We must bring justice to these traitors. Deny them wealth and order and they will surely regret their betrayal.
Let us discover how the mortals of the Motherland react once they see that their preposterous 'Great Orthodoxy' cannot spare their lands from disease and Ruin.
Their churches hold great wealth, and conceal great sins. Both of these we shall uncover as our Daemons cavort across their precious Motherland.
Bring Ruin to the Motherland, and teach Ursun's puppets that their age-old stand against Chaos was itself merely the whim of Tzeentch.
Cold Storm
Tzar's Gold
As Barren As the Oblast
A Winter Harvest
The Betrayer's Purse
Panic in the Motherland
Sins of the Motherland
We're Going on a Bear Hunt

In those hoary jungles, in those ancient temples, reside still older treasures, guarded jealously by the Skinks and Sauruses of the Lizardmen. It would take an army of mighty Dawi-Zharr to liberate them and bring them back to Zharr-Naggrund...
Topple their temples and drain their spawning pools! Seize their sun-kissed gold for the Dragon Emperor!
Tear down their temples! Pollute their spawning pools with blood! Seize their sun-kissed gold! Let there be Ruination unbound!
Lay waste to the reptiles' nests. Sow destruction and seize their wealth for the Skull Throne.
Though we cannot understand their reptilian intent, raiding their lands will at least inflict harm upon them.
Send out our Tallybands to despoil these reptilian lands. Make the lizards understand that death comes for all things.
Let suffering come to Slaan, Saurus, Skink and Kroxigor alike! The legion of excess is bound for the land of lizards, spreading deviant delight and joyous despair wherever they tread!
Ravage these reptilian lands without mercy, for we must ensure the Old Ones' preposterous Great Plan never comes to pass.
Lizard Eruption
Ransack the Reptiles
The Ancient Enemy
Lair of the Lizards
Raid the Reptiles
Cold Fear in Cold Hearts
Ravage the Reptilian Realm
To Conquer the Cold Ones

The raiders raided, did they? Let us wreak havoc amongst these savages, burn their villages and take their people in chains back to the Dark Lands. They will soon be begging us for the bite of frost...
Let these barbarians of Chaos taste their own wicked medicine. Ruin it shall be!
Bring Ruination to the Norscan lands, and show these mortal fools the true face of Chaos.
As these mortals behold their wasted lands, they will at last know what true Chaos looks like.
The Motherland must punish the barbaric servants of Chaos for their blasphemy!
The least stupid of Norscans worship the Urfather. How they will delight as their less insightful brethren suffer His putrescent onslaught upon their realm.
The Norscans owe Slaanesh tribute, yet refuse to offer it. We must claim it from them ourselves.
Scorch this Norscan domain with the blue-gold fire of the Great Sorcerer, and claim the mortals' ill-gotten gains in His eternal name.
Norscan Foray
A Fitting Punishment
They Know Not What They Do
The Ruination They So Crave
Tasting Their Own Medicine
A Message from God
For Services Rendered
All For Him

A delicate task is raiding the gardens of Nurgle. Daemonsmith magick must preserve us as we liberate His captives to be our captives, as we steal His foul statuary for rubble or melting down, as we burn His Gnarlmaws for fuel. Even so, many of our chattels will die in the raid – a worthy sacrifice to Hashut.
Let us see what trinkets lurk within the foul buboes and cysts which blight the Great Enemy's lands.
Devastate the Fly Lord's blighted lands, and claim their filth-caked trinkets for our own legion of destruction.
Plunder the Fly Lord's foul kingdom! A show of destruction to make even Nurgleth tremble!
Though it risks infection most foul, we must make an incursion into the filth-strewn lands of these plague-fiends.
These errant children of Nurgle must be disciplined for their wayward ways. Go forth and wreak havoc upon their bubonic lands.
This pestilent province offends Slaanesh's perfect eye. Burst its buboes, lance its boils and devastate its decaying servants.
We must prevent this Maggotkin land from turning to joyless fester, and instead enliven it with the twisted horrors and dancing magefire of Tzeentch.
Pestilent Pillaging
Dirty Gold
The Bubonic Kingdom
A Bubonic Bounty
Poison Coin
Grandfather Knows Best
Correcting an Eyesore
Out of the Doldrums

Greedy and acquisitive as they are, the Ogre Kings are no match for Hashut's greater need. They waste their goods on their endless appetites. Let us go there and simply take their riches from them – aye, and their Gnoblars too.
Punish the mountain Ogres for their transgressions! Tear down their bone-strewn camps and ransack their filthy caves!
Let these natural-born raiders experience for themselves the horror and anguish of having their homes despoiled. Send out our Daemons!
The witless Ogres hoard many trophies. Rip them from them, and leave only Ruination.
We must raid the raiders. A fitting punishment for their monstrous greed.
We must send the Tallyband to raid the Ogre lands. How Grandfather will chuckle as gangrene chews through the bloated bellies of these dullard mortals.
As these brutes stand hypnotised and paralysed by our indescribable beauty, we shall tear down their tents, collapse their caves and help ourselves to their blood-soaked spoils.
Bring Ruin upon these Ogre lands, for the brutes must learn that there are far more magnificent Dark Gods than their meagre Great Maw.
Ogres Ransacked
Mugging the Marauders
Raiding the Larder
Taking From the Tribe
The Motherland Hungers
Poison the Food Supply
Beauty Beyond Compare
Turmoil Amongst the Tribes

The Skaven profess to not exist, to not understand our tongue. But let us send them a clear message. We shall attack them, take all that is theirs, and leaves ashes and pain in the passing. Then they will know us!
Tell your warriors to steel themselves, for we must delve into the rats' unspeakable warrens. Take all of value, and bring destruction to the rest.
Bring Ruin to their pestilent warrens, and make these vermin forever fear the fury of Chaos.
Carve a path of destruction through their filthy warrens, seizing all that has value.
Tear apart their vile warrens, take whatever has value and bring ruin to the rest.
Flood their sewers with pox and fumigate their warrens with choking spores. The Skaven lair must receive the gift of Ruin.
Pity our Daemons, for they must now wade through the filth and disease that taints this rodent lair. Though once the destruction is done, they shall all cleanse each other's perfect bodies.
Bring unspeakable mutation to their warrens, and snatch the filth-encrusted gold from their pestilent lairs.
Skaven Reaving
Ruin Upon the Rodents
Lair of the Horned Rat
Ruin the Rodents
Turmoil in the Tunnels
Driven From the Nest
The Baths Await
Lair of the Horned Rat

We always can tell a Slaaneshi province, as you can hear the screams from the next region along. Let us come down from our Ziggurats, ready our armaments, and go a-raiding. The foolish Daemons will be too distracted by their torments and pleasures to know we were even there...
Tear down the hives of sin! Lay waste to the Great Enemy's depraved lands!
Let the Perfect Prince's fiends experience true suffering at last. Our Daemons shall know euphoria as they lay waste to these Slaaneshi lands.
The Slaaneshi will learn the folly of vice, as we despoil their decadent lands and bring ruin upon them.
We must stamp the sin from these Daemon lands, lest they tempt proud Kislev minds to vile depravity.
A healthy dose of plague and panic will tear the Perfect Prince's servants from their relentless rutting, no?
Our kin have paid inadequate tribute to our dark lord's beauty. We must quell His divine rage by visiting decadent destruction upon their lands.
Let us play a game with these Slaaneshi. Bestow untold turmoil upon their realm, and let us learn if there are limits to their thirst for suffering.
Slaanesh, Ravaged
Burgle the Brothels
Demolish the Pleasure Domes
Plundering the Perfect Prince
The Root of All Evil
A Plague Upon Pleasure
Perfect Penance for Paltry Praise
Ultimate Excess

The desert might look barren, but then so does our Dark Land of Zharr. In the pyramids, as in our ziggurats, wealth is hoarded up. In the sultry sands, yes, life has fled, but scattered are the gold and jewels of the long-dead peoples of the region. If undisturbed, riches are just ours for the taking.
Demolish their unholy mausoleums! Seize their ancient trophies! The dead shall rule over ashes!
Topple their tombs and pulverise their pyramids! Let their dead hearts know unbridled terror as they suffer the wrath of a Daemon horde.
Khorne demands that you raid the musty tombs of these Undying abominations.
Smash open their mausoleums. Raid their dusty tombs. Seize their jealously-guarded finery, and leave only ruin.
A pox upon their pyramids! Make their mausoleums moulder! In great Nurgleth's name, make these dead lands tremble.
Let us indulge ourselves by raiding the tombs of the dead, seizing their ancient treasures to drape across our flesh, and teaching soulless ghouls the meaning of fear.
Lord Tzeentch peers into the Well of Eternity once more, and it reveals to Him that we must now despoil the lands of the dead.
Desert Despoilation
Sack the Sands
Plunder the Pyramids
Raiding the Boneyard
Grave Robber
Dead Reckoning
A Delightful Desecration
Look Upon Their Works, Ye Mighty

There is no way of knowing what lies in the Changer of Ways' wake – riches or torments, defenceless villages of ready chattels or armed champions swooping on their discs from the heavens, magick crackling. Raid carefully and shun the Changer's gifts, my kin.
Let those who have sworn themselves to Chi'an Chi's evil pay the price. Bring ruin to the kingdom of madness!
Despoil these lands of Tzeentch! We must inflict a devastating setback to their ineffable schemes.
Lay waste to the Changer's lands, and disrupt his honourless schemes.
In Ursun's name, let disorder and ruin put an end to their insidious schemes and unspeakable sorceries.
Grandfather asks that we disrupt the Raven's plans by despoiling his lands. A few choice diseases will put the cat amongst the pigeons, so to speak.
Rejoice, for the time has come to visit despair, destruction and degradation upon the Raven God's realm. The sweet suffering of these changeling Daemons will be a thrill to forever savour.
The Raven God's playthings cease to amuse him. He decrees that we must now ravage the realms of our Daemonic kin.
Sack the Changer
Turning the Tables
The Deceiver Pays the Price
Even Tzeentch Didn't See This Coming
Disrupt the Great Game
Their Fate Unseen
A Scheme Undone
A Change of Heart

The wealth of the old Vampire Counts is legendary. Their towns and cities might be tumbledown, their chattels dead, but in their crumbling castles they preserve their ancient riches, their heart-laden silver platters and their blood-filled chalices. Gold and silver, these are pleasing to Hashut. Let us take them.
Punish the undying in the Emperor's name! Lay waste to their twilight realm!
Send our Daemons to tear down their walls and shine the scorching light of the sun upon these ghouls. The anguish will be exquisite.
Tramp across their dead lands, sowing glorious destruction and seizing their ancient treasures.
Let us discover what ancient riches the faithless Vampires hide in their Undead realm.
We really should live up these dead lands. A little rot and Ruin should do the trick. Grandfather will be so very pleased.
Despoil these dead lands! Seduce their denizens into acts that will horrify even the Vampire Counts! Such blissful chaos there shall be.
The dead lords must learn that they too are mere puppets in great Tzeentch's game. Bring despair to their midnight lands!
Unliving Lands
Daylight Raid
