Torn From Cold Fingers
From Cold, Dead Hands
Debt of the Dead
Counting the Cost
Polluting the Bloodline
Cleansed by Sorcerous Fire

It may be satisfying to wander into the Sylvan woods and hack down their ancient trees, but the lands of the Wood Elves lie to you, lead you astray, until your warriors are scattered and easy prey for Dryads and deadly Elven archers. Always be watchful, Dhrath-Zharr, for we are unlovable and unloved.
Tear down their sacred groves and scourge their hallowed copses. Our ancestors ask this of us.
The Dark Gods desire to see untold Ruin inflicted upon these sickeningly pure lands of nature.
Topple their trees! Demolish their homes! Make the spawn of Isha fear Khorne above all others!
We must destabilise the Fey Folk. How they will howl as their precious trees topple!
Let us bless these Elven trees with blight, and their leafy dens with corrosive fungi. How much more much more beautiful it shall become.
Let us ravage these servants of nature, even as we raze their forests to the ground. Their shrieks of rapture and despair will be music to the Dark Prince's ears.
Athel Loren stands only as long as the Raven wishes it to stand. As their forests burn and their long-hoarded wealth is stolen from them, the Elves will at last understand this.
Woodland Raid
Flatten the Forests
Kingdom of Kurnous
Brutal Harvest
Nature's Bounty
How Gangrenous is Their Garden
All Shall Burn
Even the Trees Fear Tzeentch
Savage weapons, brutal sorcery and malevolent engines are the bedrock of Dawi-Zharr power. Send another mighty host into the field!
Our forces are too paltry. For the honour of the Emperor, and the eternal safety of Cathay, the Jade Legion must swell.
We must raise a legion of destruction, a cavalcade of Daemonic fury to bring this pathetic world to its knees.
Khorne demands a legion of blood, great and terrible. An army of rage and destruction, for all the world to fear.
Every man and every woman has a lifelong duty to defend their glorious Motherland. Put out the call!
In order to spread the Urfather's putrescent love far and wide, we shall require a Tallyband of legend. We must obtain many more children of rot.
If all this world is to be seduced by the Perfect Prince, we must raise a horrifyingly beautiful legion to spread ecstasy and agony in His glorious name.
Conjure changelings from the ether! Shape monsters from magefire! Tzeentch demands an army, and whatever He decrees shall always come to pass.
Turn the Cogs of War
Army of Harmony
Bringers of Chaos
All the World Shall Tremble
Not One Step Backwards
Children of Corrosion
A Vision of Monstrous Beauty
The Legion of Change

Oh, this will be a fine day: our armies shall march upon the knightly hypocrites' land; our great cannons tear down the walls. And then our Renders can slake their lusts, whilst our chattels gather all of value and march it back to Zharr-Naggrund in glory!
Lay waste to this city of Bretonnia. Let it never again know splendour.
Bestow oblivion upon these arrogant mortals. As their walls crumble, they will understand that their lives mean nothing.
Bring ruin upon their walls! The mortals of Bretonnia shall never again know glory.
For too long has Bretonnia known wealth and safety. We shall make a mockery of their prosperity.
Let their misguided sense of honour collapse as the corrosion makes their walls crumble.
Ruin and degradation! This is our promise to the naively chivalrous people of this Human city. Once the suffering is done, those who survive will thank us for the enlightenment.
The Lady's puppets believe they are safe behind castle walls. Rid them of this delusion.
Sack the Knights
Privilege Lost Eternally
Bretonnia Besieged
Breaking Bretonnia
Crush the Castle
Knights of the Rotted Table
Tear Down the Walls
A Bastion Falls

Mere beasts live here, gathered round their bloody stones, giving thanks to their uncaring Gods. They do not expect an incursion of the Dhrath-Zharr, not to their sacred places. Seed their paltry forests with fire and powder, and grasp the wealth therein.
The Great Enemy's mutants cannot remain a threat. Shatter their filth-strewn lair.
This nest of worthless animals deserves only Ruin. Make these fool beasts cower!
These low beasts must suffer Khorne's wrath. Lay waste to their home.
We must lay waste to their filthy den, and leave the murderous beasts too weak to strike against us.
The Children of Chaos have become quite the nuisance. Lay glorious waste to their home and perhaps they will learn to respect Grandfather.
Shatter this lair of beasts! It is a blight upon the land, miserably bereft of beauty or artistry.
Reward these slaves of darkness for their devotion by bringing Ruin upon their gore-strewn lair.
Raze the Herdstones
Break Open the Burrows
Slaves to Darkness
Conquer the Cloven Ones
Scatter the Herd
Extinction Event
No Country for Animal Men
Discipline the Children of Chaos

The encampments of Chaos might be peripatetic, but that only makes them easier to burn. Let us send our engines of war to despoil their caravans and lands. Then we shall see what gifts of the Dark Gods and wonders of the Realms of Chaos we can plunder!
Rain destruction upon the Great Enemy's kingdom. The Emperor expects!
Send our fiends to rampage through their homes, and teach these fools that their desperate shrines to Ruin afford them no protection from Daemons.
Despoil their pitiful settlement, and let these followers of ruin see Chaos for what it truly is.
The Motherland must take the fight to the kingdom of Chaos, and stem the tide of horror.
Destruction is their cause, and so destruction shall be their reward. Blight their home in the Fly Lord's name.
Crush this stronghold of Ruin, for only once its threat is neutered can perfection be attained.
These puppets of Ruin must not forget that they serve the most capricious of gods. The Ruination of their stronghold shall be an appropriate reminder.
Burn the Encampment
Ransack the House of Evil
The Consequences of Their Nature
Ask For Chaos, Get Chaos
Evil Never Prospers
Rejoice in Ruination
Bastion of Ruination
They Should Have Expected This

Flamboyant individualism becomes these piratical rogues, though their damned existence drives them to greater and greater infamies. Imagine what this turpitude would look like in the service of something right and true, such as Hashut? Yet instead we must strive to end their profligate Unlives and destroy their footholds.
This hive of Undeath is an abomination! Xen Yang decrees that it must know ruin.
Despoil this nest of pirates. Make these ghouls understand that all their years of avarice have brought them only Ruin.
They must know ruin, for Unlife is an abomination in the eyes of Kharneth.
Shatter their unholy home, for too many of the dead already stalk the land.
This nest of deathless thieves must be dealt with. A pox upon it, if you will.
This dead fortress offends the Dark Prince's eye. Break it, so that He shall weep no more.
Our delicate deceptions shall not be undone by mere brigands. Ravage their worthless stronghold!
Twice-Dead Lands
Into the Pirate's Den
Dead Men's Chests
Demolition of the Dead
Punish the Pirates
No Safe Harbour
The Crow's Nest
Crime Doesn't Pay

The lands of Cathay are ideal for plundering – isolated from their lawful brethren, divided amongst vying Dragons, and with all the trade goods of the Ivory Road within their grasp. Take a force and assault their settlement. Leave not a stone standing!
No walls can protect these betrayers from the Dragon's wrath. Rain down his judgement upon them!
Gut the Dragon's nest! These pathetic slaves to order have had their day.
Devastate this city of Dragons! Be unsparing with blade and claw, for these mortals must fear Khorne always.
The fool Dragons think their empire impregnable. Let the might of Kislev shall put the lie to this.
We must defang the dreary Dragon. Send the Tallymen to do their worst this dour nest of his, won't you?
The denizens of Cathay have too often prevented Lord Slaanesh from feasting upon whichever souls He so desires. Shatter their stronghold, so that He may quench His great thirst.
Despoil this Celestial bulwark. Let every soul in Cathay, be they Dragon or man, tremble, for Chi'an Chi is upon them once more.
Trade Rout
No Refuge for Turncoats
Abandoned By Their Ancestors
Disharmony & Disorder
Disrupt the Dragon
Celestial Corrosion
Conquest of the Celestial
As Was Foretold

Other races would pale at the horrors found in a Daemon city – the unspeakably tormented citizenry, the mutated buildings, the depravity and decadence of Chaos Undivided. But we Chaos Dwarfs are made of stronger stuff than the beardless races. We see the fortune in their damned town and we will tear the place down to take it!
We must smite this home of Daemons, for every fresh fiend it spawns threatens all we hold dear.
Break apart their fortress, and teach these lesser Daemons that they are nothing compared to us. Nothing!
Lay his city of fools low, and teach the false Daemon that he will never rule.
The great betrayer must be punished for his allegiance to darkness. Lay waste to his holdings!
The prince of Daemons must learn that he cannot hope to compete with true Ruinous power. Lay pestilent waste to his ill-deserved stronghold.
This stronghold belongs to one who dares to demand divinity – a transgressive pursuit even Slaanesh forbids. The Daemon Prince's followers must be made to suffer.
The Great Architect decrees that the Daemon Prince shall never attain the divinity he craves. Destroy his stronghold so that he may learn this.
Glittering Grot
Teach Fear to Fiends
Blacken the Ground
The Pretender's Penance
Prince of Nothing
Dethrone the Daemon
Monument to a False Idol
The Dethroning Begins

A pleasure indeed, to march out intent on destroying our rivals of Naggaroth. From them, we will take their wealth, their weapons, the walls of their city and spend freely. But their lives... those we will protect, for we want these most esteemed Labourers to suffer under our whips until their last days.
Bring despair to the Druchii's dark doors. They will learn that the Emperor does not abide their wicked kind.
How these Druchii fools will howl as they witness the unchecked devastation we rain upon their homes.
The honourless Druchii deserve only destruction. Bestow ruin upon their lands.
Bring ruin to their wicked lands. Let no more cruelty spawn from them.
The mortals of Naggaroth believe themselves untouchable. Perhaps they will have rather less attitude once they see their city blighted by the Urfather's putrescent touch.
As our Daemons dance into this Druchii domain, the lust-stricken mortals will hurry into their dark embrace, and lost in their rapture they shall be oblivious as their walls crumble.
Rain destruction upon this Druchii home. Let its people writhe in the sorcerous fire of the Changer.
Ark Enemies
Disable the Druchii
A Lesson in Sadism
Despoil the Despoilers
Despoil the Dark Ones
Home of the Bloody-Handed God
The Darkest Bargain
The Cost of Cruelty

Not many times have we had the opportunity to take such clear revenge on our traitorous cousins. But their hold is ill-defended and the Daemonsmiths' haruspicy indicates good fortune if we strike now. Ancestors be damned, we will make their home a ruin.
Let their ancient halls know only ruin and despair. Let them know that Cathay is an enemy they cannot overcome.
The stunted ones must suffer. Bring Ruination upon their stronghold, and the Dark Gods shall surely rejoice.
Rain ruination upon their mountain halls. Teach them that none can hide from Khorne's fury.
Ransack their halls and collapse their tunnels. The Dwarfs cannot remain a threat to Mother Kislev.
Picture, if you will, these great halls collapsed and mouldering, littered with decomposing Dawi corpses. Then go forth and make it happen.
We waste our seductions on the dour Dawi. They will be aggravatingly resistant until the end. Thus, the simple destruction of their stronghold shall suffice.
Tzeeneth foretells that this home of Dawi puppets is bound for torment. We must be the hand of destiny.
Hold Off
Deck the Halls with Arterial Spray
Pride Counts For Naught
Conquer the Crafters
Halls of the Mountain Kings
End of an Ancient Era
Can't Handle Rejection
Enacting His Will

The Empire's cities are like our own, split between the stone keeps of the powerful and the miserable hovels of the poor. They are slavemasters in all but name. Smash aside their halberdiers and walls, and take all this for ourselves.
Shatter their walls. Strike fear into their hearts. Make this prideful Empire weep.
Ransack this paltry city of men, and teach the slaves of Sigmar that their Empire at last faces its twilight.
They must learn that Sigmar cannot shield their land from the Murder Lord's rage.
Their walls are surely are soft as they are. It is time they knew the might of Kislev.
Sigmar's bastion must stand in Grandfather's way no longer. Please have our Tallymen bestow untold Ruin upon it.
Deep in their dark hearts, every man and woman of Sigmar craves to know a Daemonette's touch. This we shall gladly grant the population of this city, even as we devastate their homes.
Ulric's marionettes cower behind their walls, thinking themselves safe. Calamitous Change must fall upon them.
Imperial Assault
A Declining Empire
Weaken the Old White Wolf
Rise & Fall
Empire's End
Eviction of Empire
One-Night Stand
The Raven's Claw

What would the Dawi-Zharr be without the occasional plunder? Hashut ordained the creation of this settlement for our benefit. Now it is ripe our armies should harvest it, down the very last coin and miserable soul.
This place is an icon of disharmony. It is the Emperor's judgement that it must be brought low.
Our Daemons thirst for destruction. Unleash them upon this settlement, and take pride as they dance among the ashes.
Khorne demands a show of destruction. Lay waste to their wretched lands.
Ransack their lands! Leave them weak! In the name of liberty and purity, they cannot remain a threat.
Any stronghold is vastly improved by blight and Ruination. The Urfather humbly proposes that this location be the next to receive His corrosive gifts.
Send forth the legion of excess! The pain and suffering of those who dwell in this place will slake our perfect lord's hunger, for a time.
This settlement is an impediment to the Changer of Ways' grand design. Its threat must be neutralised so that His ineffable scheme may proceed.
Settlement Attack
Celestial Vengeance
The Seeds of Ruin & Damnation
City of Death
Fist of the Motherland
Let There Be Rot
Perfection Through Devastation
A Thorn in His Side

The Greenskins make war on us at a whim, which was almost purposeless beyond the battle itself. Hashut's wisdom is that we should deal with such unpredictability when it is most weak. This is a such a time, and your order is to take all that you can. Indeed, destroy it if you can.
The Greenskin stronghold can remain a threat no longer. Bring ruin upon it, in Xen Yang's name.
The green animals warrant only Ruin. Our legion must lay waste to their primitive stronghold.
Ravage their homes, and teach the witless Greenskins the true meaning of fear.
Burn their huts and tear down their tents! Make these marauding monsters beg for Ursun's mercy!
Let green skin be replaced by green mould and yellow pus. This mortal fortress must know the blissful touch of decay.
We must blight this Greenskin stronghold, for it is the only language these crudest of mortals understand. Their anguish will bring Slaanesh to the brink of ecstasy.
Our ever-changing lord wishes to see the most savage of creatures turn to panic and despair. Despoil this Greenskin fortress so that great Tzeentch may be fleetingly amused.
Time for the Weak
Scrub Out the Spores
Stomp Der 'Edz
War Upon the Warlords
Orc's Nest
Drain the Green Swamp
Ransack the Raiders
See How They Run

Centuries of wealth and order are contained in such a place, sitting idle for the fey Elves to coo at. In our hands, these precious items could be put to use – or at least smelted for use in our furnaces. Storm the settlement, kill all that resist, and take what you can!
Lay waste to the Asur spires, and at last the arrogance shall drain from them.
Every Daemon is born desirous to bring Ruin to order. Have them lay waste to this shining city of Asur fools.
Lay waste to their gleaming spires, and coat your blades in Asur blood.
Tear down their gleaming spires! Teach humility to the vainglorious Ulthuani!
These gleaming Asur spires are positively begging to be toppled. It is only polite to oblige.
Purity is folly. Order is weakness. Sin, degradation and suffering is inevitable. This, the Asur will at last understand as they see their gleaming walls crumble.
This shrine to Asur order offends the Raven's eye. Inflict brutal Change upon it, and transform it into something dark, twisted and beautiful.
Recycled Glory
No Country for Ancient Elves
Asuryan Cannot Save Them
Slay the Spire
The Price of Hubris
Make Ulthuan Ugly Again
Servants of Order
All Good Things

Blood for the Blood God, eh? He certainly doesn't need all this treasure and finery that now rightfully reverts to the great Hashut. Yet there is no sense in talking to Khorne or his idiot followers – he will appreciate the lives lost in the battle more than he would any tangible good.
Assault this fortress of blood, and let it know destruction. It is the only language the Great Enemy understands.
We must weaken the Skull Throne's legion. Ransack this fortress of blood, and teach them that their endless fury is in vain.
Make them understand that Khorne no longer favours them. Rain devastation upon their lands!
The Murder God will destroy us all without mercy. For the sake of all this world, we must weaken his hell-sent servants.
All those skulls the Khornate bullies adorn their fortress with will look so much better turned to mush, while the gaudy abundance of brass would positively benefit from a patina of corrosive rust.

Let us roleplay as Khornate Daemons ourselves, and bring Ruin upon this stronghold of Skulls. How thrillingly transgressive it shall feel to play the part of simple brutes, instead of the boundlessly refined aesthetes we truly are.
Without intervention, this extension of the Skull Throne will endlessly pump out dull-witted Khornate Daemons. This is a prospect too tiresome to permit.
Surplus Goods
Ransack the Reaper
Leave Only Blood
Kharneth's Judgement
Boneyards
The Great Bloodletting
Fantasy Roleplay
Blood Upon Brass

What joy we take in Kislev's history of suffering. Their land is but a road that brings the glories of Chaos to the Old World. And if our legions can remove this town, it will be one less obstacle on that road, one step closer to our world being the domain of Chaos and of Hashut.
For Kislev's many transgressions against the Celestial Empire, this paltry stronghold must pay the price.
In time, every mortal city will know Ruination. For now, we must ravage this Kislevite domain, and leave Ursun's fool worshippers weak.
The weakling Bear-God cannot spare Kislev's pitiful city from the Axefather's endless wrath.
The heretics must pay a steep price for their unforgivable sedition. Break their walls and break their traitorous spirit.
Bring a little destruction and corrosion to this dour mortal outpost, won't you? The mortals of Kislev are so very joyless.
As we tear down their walls and tear at their flesh, the fool Humans of Kislev will pray in vain to their four gods for aid, but not a one of them will answer.
Let these mortal puppets cry out in vain to their minor gods as we shatter their city. Dazh, Tor, Salyak, Ursun: they too dance to the ever-shifting beat of Tzeentch's drum.
Snow Laid Waste
Frosty Reception
Ravage the Motherland
Blood On Snow
Stain Upon the State
Why So Serious?
The Paltry Orthodoxy
The Great Orthodoxy Dispelled

Alien, these creatures are, both in their appearance and in their perfect subjection to the rule of Order. Would that our armies were numberless, that we might march on all their temples in a single night. Alas, through no fault of our own, we will have to content ourselves with the destruction of just this one...
Bring ruin upon this beggarly nest of lizards. Let them know the wrath of Dragons!
This nest of reptiles warrants destruction. Send out our fiendish legion to desecrate it.
Their spawning pits and temples are fit only for destruction. Bring ruin upon the reptiles.
Their inhuman hearts are surely capable of fear. Lay waste to their lands, and bring these cruel reptiles to their knees.
The Urfather is not easily given to anger, but he really does yearn to the see the spawn of the Old Ones laid low. Please, lay waste to their appalling nest.
Perhaps the glorious degradation of their stronghold will teach these cold-blooded mortals that their precious Old Ones will never, ever return.
Bring devastation to their temples, for the Architect of Fates will not tolerate these little lizards' worship of the hated Old Ones.
Scales, Fallen
The Great Plan Undone
The Great Warding Falters
Disrupting the Great Plan
Cold War
Ancient Relics
Lost Children
They Shall Never Return

This Norscan coast may only house timber houses and encampments, but its shaggy reavers have been a menace to our Dark Lands. We will no longer look away from their depredations merely because they also follow the Chaos Gods. Hashut is a jealous god and demands revenge...
Let deserved retribution fall upon the fools who worship Chaos! Lay waste to their stronghold!
These mortal worshippers of Ruin have become an unwelcome distraction. We must gut their wretched stronghold.
Let these men see the true face of Chaos. Lay waste to their pitiful camp.
The Norscans must pay the price for their worship of ruin. Proud Kislev shall ransack their blood-drenched lands.
It is time these mortal children of Ruin received a visit from their Grandfather. Let the pox take their stronghold!
Pain and suffering! Pleasure and seduction! Death and destruction! All these sensations and more we must grant to this Norscan stronghold.
These mortals have spent their candle-short lives begging for the Ruinous Powers to notice them. Alas for them, we have. Let us pay an unexpected visit to their home…
Burn the Ships
The North Loses Claim
Blessings of the Dark Gods
Capricious Gods
Baleful Domain
Visiting Hours
Testament Of Chaos
He Who Knocks

Of all Hashut's hostile siblings, Nurgle is the warmest. The Poxfather is also the one that we long to topple most heartily – his false humour and stoic whimsy, his profligate curses. He understands our desire, our strength the least. It will be a pleasure to burn out his filthy, pus-ridden keeps.
This squalid nest of disease must be cleansed. Our ancestors demand it!
This oozing bastion of decay disrupts our cataclysmic crusade. Rain destruction upon it!
Bring ruin to blight! Let the lands of Nurgleth suffer unbridled Khornate fury!
Tear down their filth-strewn walls! Strike fear into their foetid hearts! Kislev must stem this pestilent tide!
The Fly Lord is so terribly disappointed by his children's unruly ways. As His favourite sons of rot, it falls upon us to dismantle their playroom.
Wherever the children of Nurgle dwell, only foul decay grows. This ugly blight upon the land must be dealt with, for Slaanesh desires that beauty must flourish.
The Fly Lord's foetid stronghold spreads stagnancy across the land. In order to allow glorious Change to flow freely, it must be neutralised.
Final Joke
Purging the Plague
Ravage the Rotkin
Garden of Death
Ransack the Garden
Sibling Rivalry
Garden Renovation
Cleansed by the Changer

The Ogre Kings do not leave much of use in their settlements. Those few items that they can't eat (and there are very few), they break in their thuggish delight. Yet, still, the military reduction of each of their towns adds security to the borders of Zharr-Naggrund. Get to it.
We must lay waste to this camp and punish the Ogres for their greed, as Xen Yang himself once punished them.
Punish these Ogres for their halt-witted gluttony! Gut their pathetic camp, and strike terror into their bloated hearts.
Rain Khorne's wrath upon their bone-strewn land. Their honourless greed must cost them dearly.
Even Ogres can know fear. Bring ruin to their bone-strewn homes and they will not dare march upon the Motherland.
These Ogres have feasted well. For pudding, we should treat them to a generous helping of unchecked destruction. Go forth and blight their camp.
The children of the Maw sow endless despair and destruction across this world. Slaanesh decrees that they must themselves now suffer these singular sensations. Their home is thus forfeit.
The Great Maw's puppets eat and eat and eat, believing their brute strength makes them untouchable. When their stronghold suffers our devastating assault, they will know this to be a lie.
Secured Borders
Excused From the Dinner Table
Eaters Never Prosper
Tyrannise the Tyrants
Terrorise the Tribe
Just Desserts
Thy Flesh Consumed
An Assault Upon Avarice

That hole, stinking of rat-urine and worse, built of scavenged woods and scrap... a settlement? What squalor the rat-men live in, even their leaders. Better we raze it now, before they become too powerful (and any worse-scented.)
A shattering assault upon their filth-caked warren will teach the vermin that their foul ambitions are doomed.
Send our legion to bring death to the Skaven warrens. This hidden city of filth cannot remain a threat to our Ruinous ambitions.
Vermin are beneath Khorne's notice, but the infestation must nevertheless be stemmed. Lay waste to their nests.
We must ransack their filthy warrens, and put the fear of Mother Kislev into their wicked vermin hearts.
This nest of rodents must be cleansed with pox and plague. The Decay Lord's putrescent touch shall bring them purification.
This lair of rats must be dealt with, for its foul stench appals the Prince of Pleasure. Send forth our Daemons to begin the cleansing.
Rain the Changer's eldritch fire upon this nest of vermin mortals, and make the servants of the Horned Rat understand that they are worth nothing.
Scent of a Rat
Disassemble the Clan
Cleanse the Nest
Stem the Infestation
Pesticide
Cleansed With Disease
Perfume Genius
Sorcerous Disinfection

It is a strange thing for the Chaos Dwarfs to be welcomed to a conquered settlement as liberators. But our cruelties are faithful and predictable, unlike those of the anointed of the Prince of Excess, who inflict upon their citizens impossible horrors. So, let us "liberate" this settlement.
Shine the Moon Dragon's light upon this den of sin. It must be cleansed with whatever force is necessary.
Shatter their foolish dreams of perfection as you tear down their walls. The Slaaneshi must learn the meaning of despair.
Their dens of decadence shall know no more pleasures.
Tear down their dens of sin! Demolish their pleasure hives! They are an affront that all that is good and pure!
Lay waste to this Slaaneshi hive, and let them know that all the sins in the world cannot keep death from their door.
We must reward our kin for their service by granting unspeakable suffering unto them. Despoil their home, torment its denizens and they will know the ecstasy of despair.
The Well of Eternity whispers a prophecy, of brothel walls crumbling, of scented boudoirs collapsing, of sin-drenched cellars caving in. It is our duty to make it so.
Slaaneshi Fate
Perfection Interrupted
Exquisite Destruction
Final Sin
Close the Brothels
Fiddling While Their Home Burns
Pleasure in All Things
Cut Off All Sensation

There is work required in the destruction of a pyramid. A thing like this has stood for generations, outlived its makers, and survived their rebirth at Nagash's hands. With machinery and brute chattels, we must take it apart stone by stone – "unbuild" it. This we will do, once we have killed its makers and taken their wealth.
This empire of the dead must be made to fear Grand Cathay. Bring destruction to their doors.
Purge their preposterous pyramids and maraud through their musty mausoleums. Make these ghouls understand that they are kings only of Ruin.
Shatter their mausoleums and strike untold fear into their dead souls! Kharneth demands it!
Necromancy is a sin that cannot go unpunished. Shatter their tombs and strike fear into their dead souls!
Bring Ruin upon this nest of ghouls, and make these Necromantic nincompoops at last know what death feels like.
We must break apart this Undead stronghold, for those to whom to the pleasures of the flesh are denied are anathema to all that Slaanesh is.
Even Undying kings rule only for as long as the Changer wills it. As their stronghold suffers Ruin, these ghouls will at last understand that their ancient empire is fated to crumble.
Pyramid, Toppled
Topple the Mausoleum
Returned to Slumber
Bonecrusher
Desecrate the Tomb
Sacking the Skeletons
The Never-Sated
Throne of Bone

Where once stood a thriving settlement, giving fearful tribute to the Changing One – the Plotter – soon there will only be rubble and ruins and the lamentation of his faithful. Does the Changer of Ways see this inevitable future, when he considers our forces marching against him? Does he care enough truly to plan? Little difference it makes when our cannon raze his town...
Assault Chi'an Chi's twisted stronghold, and show no mercy. The Trickster God must know despair.
Bring Ruin upon the changelings' domain. They must pay a terrible price for daring to stand against us.
The Skull Throne decrees that the lands of Tzeentch must know Ruin. The Raven must fear the Hunter.
Only by ransacking the Raven God's domain can we hope to put an end to his fiendish games, and keep madness from Kislev's door.
Pluck a few straws from the Raven God's nest, and his tiresome plans shall surely come tumbling down.

The Great Conspirator must be taught that there is more to existence than the pursuit of his serpentine schemes. The screams of his slaves as we ravage their homes will surely rouse him from his musty tomes.
The Raven God decrees that we must despoil this changeling compound, for even our Daemonic kin are not immune to the ravaging touch of Change.
Unwelcome Change
Changer of Their Ways
Snuffing Out the Flame
Weaving a New Fate
Insurrection Against Insanity
Ransack the Raven
Every Scream is a New Flavour
All Things Must Change

The Vampiric castles and settlements are a blight on the landscape, towering so high and so ill-built. Little wonder they are half fallen-down. Let us do them a favour and pull the rest to the ground, being sure to liberate their gold and goblets at the same time.
The Vampires' evil must not spread further. Bring true, lasting death to their twilight stronghold.
Punish these midnight ghouls for their necromancy. Have our Daemon legion rain destruction upon their blood-stained nests.
Rain destruction upon their dead land. Let the blood-drinkers fear the Bloodthirsters above all others.
We must curtail the unholy spread of Unlife. Bring Ursun's justice to their dead homes.
Grandfather Nurgle requests that we introduce disease and despair into this dark stronghold, and bring these appalling Undead down a peg or two.
Let the velvet light of Slaanesh shine upon this dark city! As the Unliving burn, their screams will fuel His rapture.
As their stronghold suffers Ruin, these midnight puppets will understand that their Necromantic half-lives are as meaningless as any other.
Razed Keeps
Slain in Their Musty Coffins
City of the Damned
Staking Claim
Dark Corners of the Earth
At Death's Door
Darkest Night
Merely a Whisper Upon the Breeze

We have found a heart of the Sylvan Realm! Now our warriors can sally forth with burning brands and sharp axes, and take it to pieces. Hashut's furnaces will burn high with magic wood, fed by the body and spirit of Durthu and his kin! Naught shall be left but the echoes of crying gods!
Devastate their verdant stronghold, and the Wood Elf threat shall surely be neutered.
This Elven settlement is a sickening shrine to nature and purity, an unspeakable offence to the Ruinous Powers. Despoil it without delay.
Lay waste to their forest hideout. Fill the air with the glorious stench of burning treetops.
We must ransack the Elven stronghold, and perhaps then they will not dare leave the trees again.
Bring the blight upon this Elven stronghold. Its sickening natural purity makes the Urfather feel really most queasy.
Bring torment to this Elven stronghold! Neither Isha's grace or Kurnous' bow can save them from the suffering we shall bestow upon them.
Let terror and madness claim the minds of these fool Elves, for the Changer's wills it that their verdant home shall know Ruin.
Burned Glade
Clearing the Forest
Sacred Soil Despoiled
Clearcutting
Logging Camp
Scourging the Woodland
Masters of Torture
And Nothing Shall Grow
Left-click an [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] to select it, right-click an enemy to attack.\\n\\nLearn more about battles [[url:script_link_campaign_battles]]here[[/url]].

{{tr:hp_campaign_description_settlements}}\\n\\nRight-click an enemy settlement to order a selected [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] to attack.\\n\\nLearn more about settlements [[url:script_link_campaign_settlements]]here[[/url]].

{{tr:hp_campaign_drawn_to_destruction_add_01}} By [[sl:campaign_razing]]razing[[/sl]] settlements within the same province, Khorne factions will be able to inherit control of them without having to pay [[sl:campaign_skulls]]Skulls[[/sl]] when colonising.\\n\\n{{tr:wh3_main_narrative_addendum_capture_settlement}}

Followers of [[sl:campaign_tzeentch]]Tzeentch[[/sl]] may use [[sl:campaign_changing_of_the_ways]]Changing of the Ways[[/sl]] actions to alter reality so that foreign settlements fall under their control. Alternatively, right-click an enemy settlement to selected [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] to attack.\\n\\n{{tr:hp_campaign_description_settlements}}\\n\\nLearn more about settlements [[url:script_link_campaign_settlements]]here[[/url]].
{{tr:hp_campaign_provinces_add_1}} {{tr:hp_campaign_provinces_add_3}}\\n\\n{{tr:hp_campaign_point_4_provinces}}\\n\\nLearn more about provinces [[url:script_link_campaign_provinces]]here[[/url]].

{{tr:hp_campaign_provinces_add_1}} {{tr:hp_campaign_provinces_add_3}}\\n\\n[[sl:campaign_khorne]]Khornate[[/sl]] factions can gain control of a province in which they have a foothold by [[sl:campaign_razing]]razing[[/sl]] the other settlements.\\n\\nLearn more about provinces [[url:script_link_campaign_provinces]]here[[/url]].

{{tr:hp_campaign_provinces_add_1}} {{tr:hp_campaign_provinces_add_3}}\\n\\n[[sl:campaign_kislev]]Kislev[[/sl]] factions can assign [[sl:campaign_atamans]]Atamans[[/sl]] when they control two full provinces.\\n\\nLearn more about provinces [[url:script_link_campaign_provinces]]here[[/url]].
Move quickly to set up more facilities there, so the benefits they bring you may multiply.\\n\\n{{tr:hp_campaign_chaos_cults_learn_more}}

Additional [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]] may be recruited into an [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] on the [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment_panel]]Unit Recruitment panel[[/sl]].\\n\\nLearn more about unit recruitment [[url:script_link_campaign_unit_recruitment]]here[[/url]].

Additional [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]] may be recruited into an [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] on the [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment_panel]]Unit Recruitment panel[[/sl]]. Unlike with other [[sl:campaign_races]]races[[/sl]], Nurglish units are spawned immediately, albeit at reduced strength.\\n\\nLearn more about Nurgle [[url:script_link_campaign_nurgle]]here[[/url]].
{{tr:hp_campaign_point_4_technology}}\\n\\n{{tr:hp_campaign_technology_learn_more}}

[[sl:campaign_chaos_cults]]Chaos Cults[[/sl]] may spontaneously form in foreign regions where [[sl:campaign_chaos_corruption]]Chaos corruption[[/sl]] is high.\\n\\nLearn more about corruption [[url:script_link_campaign_corruption]]here[[/url]].
Spread enough [[img:icon_corruption_kho]][[/img]]Khorne corruption to unlock an Unholy Manifestation.
Spread enough [[img:icon_corruption_nur]][[/img]]Nurgle corruption to unlock an Unholy Manifestation.
Spread enough [[img:icon_corruption_sla]][[/img]]Slaanesh corruption to unlock an Unholy Manifestation.
Spread enough [[img:icon_corruption_tze]][[/img]]Tzeentch corruption to unlock an Unholy Manifestation.
Upgrade any settlement building to level
Control the speed of the battles with the Speed Control buttons.
[[img:icon_prologue_battle_group]][[/img]] Use this button to group units together.
Controlling hills will yield various advantages for your units, take the high ground!
Spearmen excel against cavalry and large units, use this to your advantage!
Cavalry is fast and good against missile units.
Missile units are great at missile combat, but be wary of enemies with shields! Avoid targeting them from the front and instead aim at their flanks.
To defeat large units such as Mammoths, use units with the “anti-large” description. If you have none, use missile units to wear them down from a distance.
Control points enable various benefits for the defender to use in battle. Cripple the opposition by capturing them!

Units will waver if leadership drops, which can happen for a variety of reasons – attributes, unit abilities, and even the deaths of your units and Lord. Maintain visibility of your engagements and watch for these threats!
Controls
Units
Control Points
Leadership
Khorne demanded I walk out of the shadows and wade into blood.
I am no son of the Plaguefather, but will I take his gifts and spread them far? Yes.
They keep their secrets but I have lived long enough to know them all.
Not another curse but a boon! The capricious Changer has use for me once more.
There is only war, no peace – NEVER PEACE! Feed the furnace of the Machina Daemonium.
Call them! Let battle begin!
I am murder, I am rage… I AM SLAUGHTER!
The gaze of the Blood God is upon them. Their souls burn.
What others take, the Plague God gives back, for Grandfather is always generous!
We are blessed, blessed I say! Thanks be to Nurgleth the benevolent!
Let the buboes rupture; flood this place with Grandfather's love!
He comes, he comes… HE COMES!
Sing your song of agony. Trill it all through the hellscape.
This is the greatest show. Impossible comes true.
They persecute themselves, for that is the cost of perfection.
Pull back the silk curtains. We can no longer keep the secrets, now is the time to rise up.
We are the sanest ones. It is you who are deranged!
The kinetic force of our master never remains still. See for yourself!
We, the servants Tzeeneth are bathed in Khaos!
The loons are always out at night.
The defender will win the battle if the time runs out.
This bar is shown if a unit carries missiles, and indicates the ammunition remaining.
This bar indicates the relative health of each unit. The number displayed upon the bar indicates the number of warriors currently alive.

Once a unit's leadership level gets too low, it will rout from the battle. This means it will flee from combat and you will no longer be able to control it. This is shown by its unit card remaining white.
Special statuses are displayed above a unit card – for example, whether a unit is hidden from the enemy.
A unit's card will flash white if it begins to waver from the fight.
A unit's experience is indicated by chevrons on its unit card. More experienced units perform better in battle.
The Unit Details panel can be toggled on and off with the Unit Details button.

The Unit Details panel shows detailed information about the selected [[sl:battle_units]]unit’s[[/sl]] fighting strength. The key strengths of any unit may be determined here.\\n\\nSpearmen are typically good at fighting large units, making them ideal counters to enemy cavalry.

We have attained complete control of this [[url:script_link_campaign_provinces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_provinces}}]]province[[/tooltip]][[/url]].
We have attained complete control of this [[url:script_link_campaign_provinces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_provinces}}]]province[[/tooltip]][[/url]].
Milk and beef from cows, mutton, pork, and goat are all valuable commodities in a hungry nation.
Milk and beef from cows, mutton, pork, and goat are all valuable commodities in a hungry nation.
Tell the legends of old, inspire the rabble… and give them false hope.
Live by the creed of the Heldenhammer.
Teller of Tales
Devout of Sigmar
In the Old World, there is no need for lies - simply telling the fools the truth will inspire the greatest fear.
Die by the creed of the Heldenhammer.
Communicator
Fervent of Sigmar
This dignitary spreads propaganda far and wide, and they will say he speaks for the gods.
Glory in the creed of the Heldenhammer.
Propagandist
Fanatic of Sigmar
An honest face is an unmemorable one.
A mere trifling glamour is all that is needed to fool the peasants.
Honest Face
Glamour
There is nothing to see here…
A dash of Dark Magic and charm and the mortals will be dazzled.
Unremarkable Face
Trickery
Become part of the crowd and no one will ever suspect.
To deceive mortals is as easy as eating them.
Faceless
Deception
This one likes a drink - be it a fine Bretonnian vintage or the nastiest grog found in the darkest slums - but then, who doesn't?
Dis Orc likes 'iz grog more dan 'iz choppa.
It drinks from the mortals like a sewer fish released into a meadow stream.
Bibulous
Grog-Drinker
Carnal Imbiber
A sober agent is more functional and competent, but is he more fun?
Dat Boy got a mug of Grog on 'im again - daft bugga's always smashed.
This vampire would bathe in rivers of blood, if he could.
Drunkard
Grog-Dependent
Blood-Drunk
Come to me, mead! Bring thy beer! An ale or three! Spirits for thee! Any liquor will do, as long as it's not water.
All boyz like a drink but ee's lost it!
Consumed by the thirst, such sires will forget their true calling.
Intoxicated
Grog-Maniac
Haemoholic
Ranald smiles - give thanks to the God of Thieves and Gamblers!
The fates conspire to aid him.
An invocation against ill-luck, thereby - in Dawi logic - making the Dwarf lucky.
Mork must like 'im.
Lahmians make their own luck, as you do.
Blessed by Ranald
Tzeentch's Luck
Bugrit!
Lucky Git!
Lahmia's Fortune
Regimes cannot be maintained without strict discipline.
Dat's right, boss 'em around.
Strict
Bossy
A wise move, my lord, a severe aspect demands respect.
Got yer bossy 'at on 'ave yer?
Severe
Really Bossy
My word is law!
Right yoo lot, listen up!
Authoritarian
Bossiest
The Burghers control the trade.
The Burghers control the trade.
Burgher
Merchant Councillor
The economy flows and so the treasury's coffers are filled... Well, those earnings that are declared anyway...
The economy flows and so the treasury's coffers are filled... Well, those earnings that are declared anyway...
Merchant Guild Leader
Merchant Guild Leader
The Burgomeisters are a powerful force in the Empire and often a thorn in an emperor's side.
The Burgomeisters are a powerful force in the Empire and often a thorn in an emperor's side.
Burgomeister
Burgomeister
Ahh, a champion of the God of Tricksters, Thieves and Gamblers if ever I saw one!
The Chaos Gods approve of risk, but will their gifts be generous or deliberating?
Dwarfs tend to eschew risk, but not you.
Yoo's a bit 'andy with dem knucklebones.
Ruled by Ranald
The Great Gamble
Dari-Maker
Highrolla'

Secondary trinket slot||Add a trinket here to add an additional effect to the incantation.

You require 500 [[img:forest_health]][[/img]]Forest Health to perform the Ritual of Rebirth here.

Brayherd||Once this army's bestial rage reaches 80 or above, a new brayherd army will emerge to hasten the destruction of man. You can direct the brayherd by placing a brayherd marker.
